column17: Early AM, Jilib district, Middle Jubba: suspected United States (US) fighter jets targeted al Shabaab positions. The resulting causality figures not known.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: United States aircraft carry out a strike on an al Shabaab position at Tortoroow. The result of the strike is not known. During the strike, or soon after, al Shabaab and government forces engaged in battle at the location resulting in 10 dead from both sides.
A tax collector is assassinated in Yaaqshiid. A second official was assassinated in Dharkenley.

Militias from Habargidir and Hawadle clan militia clashed at the border between Matabaan and Mahaas district (c. 76 km North East of Beletweyne) in Hiran region. The armed clash was related to land disputes for grazing during the long and severe drought. Three armed militiamen hailing from Hawadle clan and five militiamen from Habergider clan were injured in the confrontation. Unconfirmed reports indicated that both clans were mobilizing militiamen as there were no efforts for intervention before further escalation.

Two armed militiamen from Hawadle clan erected an illegal check point at Coomaad village (c. 45 km North of Beletweyne town) where they attempted to extort money from civilian road users. Two other militiamen hailing from the same clan arrived at the scene of the incident and protested against extorting civilians. There was an exchange of small arms fire resulting in the death of two militiamen. Elders from their clan intervened and deescalated the tension between the two militias.
11 June, afternoon, Banyaley, Hiiraan: armed clashes between members of Hawadle clans left one person dead and possibly ten others injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a probing attack against AMISOM forces at Taabta (c. 60 km East of Dhobley town). AS fighters used small arms fire and several rounds of RPGs after which they retreated from the scene. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Aid Workers (Somalia)
column17: Jubaland local police officers, manning a relief cash voucher distribution site, shot and injured an off-duty Somali soldier at an INGO office in Bosnia neighbourhood of Dhobley town. The soldier defied instruction of the local police and forcefully attempted to access the INGO office. The victim was rushed to hospital for medical treatment. The perpetrator was arrest.

Unknown armed attackers, using pistols, shot and killed a businessman in his shop at Suuqa Beerta neighbourhood in Waberi district. The victim, who ran a small forex bureau, was a former electoral delegate in Hirshabelle state. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Two suspected al Shabaab assassins shot and killed a traditional elder at Hamarbile village neighbourhood in Wardhigley district. The victim served as an electoral delegate in Galmudug state 2016 elections. He was shot when he exited a Mosque. The perpetrators escaped.

Unknown armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab operators, shot and killed a traditional elder near Dabakayo Madow in Dharkenley district. The motive of the killing was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 11 June, evening, Mogadishu: two Somalis working for AMISOM were kidnapped by suspected al Shabaab in Hawl Wadaag.
An RCIED targeting an SNA technical exploded at Cinema Al Nasri near Banadir junction road in Hodan district. One female bystander was injured by the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces fire mortar rounds against al Shabaab forces. The rounds may have hit civilian areas. Causalities reported, though specific numbers are not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 11 June, early AM, Saakow, Middle Jubba: a suspected United States (US) airstrike targeted an al Shabaab training camp. Reports indicate Mahad Qallow aka ""Karate"" may have been killed in the raid, though no confirmation. Shabelle Media Network reports the camp was ""destroyed."" The Associated Press reported eight dead.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: The United States carried out airstrikes against al Shabaab positions in Lower Shabelle. Location and subsequent casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: KDF fired several mortar rounds against sighted group of al Shabaab fighters, KIA unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack at an government forces' checkpoint in Captain Las vicinity (c. 17 km North West of Merka district). Al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. There were no report of casualties.

AM, Garas Dulan (near Baardheere), Gedo: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) fighter jets targeted al Shabaab positions. Three civilians were injured in the airstrike. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
12 June, evening, Jowhar, Middle Shabelle: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a former 2016 Electoral Delegate.
Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a man after attempting to escape in Misra village (c. 10 km South East of Diinsoor district). The reasons behind the incident are not clear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired four 80mm mortar rounds at AMISOM Djiboutian contingent base in Jalalaqsi district (c. 154 km South of Beletweyne town). AMISOM forces responded with artilleries, towards the direction of the attack. One AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack. He was taken to Beletweyne for further medical treatment.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: An RCIED placed on the road was detonated by al Shabaab members targeting a Dervish technical vehicle at Af-urur area (c. 65 km South West of Bossaso). Two bodyguards of Chief of Dervish Army were wounded. There were no reports of immediate arrests. One report has the event taking place on 13/06.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched two mortar rounds at AMISOM base at Stadium Mogadishu in Wardhigley district. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and further claimed to have killed two soldiers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 14:45EAT, Mogadishu Military Academy: three mortar rounds were fired towards the African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) - Burundi base located in Mogadishu University. No causalities reported. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

Suspected al Shabaab gunmen using pistols shot and severely injured an army general at Nasiib Buundo vicinity in Boondhere district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about five minutes. The victim was taken to hospital for treatment. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland security convoy struck by al Shabaab IED, causalities unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AM, IVO Kismayo, Lower Jubba: a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Resulting causality figures not known. This attack may have occurred on 14/06.
Habargidir/Sacad clansmen attacked Shiqal household, killed a mother and four children. Revenge-motivated
Al Shabaab assassinated a soldier at Bakaara Market. A second solider was assassinated in Heliwa.
Defusal: Security forces intercept an al Shabaab IED in Heliwa.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against a military base in Gambarlawe village (c. 12 km South West of Beletweyne town). There was an exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about 15 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties.
AM, Kaxandho (near Cadaado), Galgaduud: four people were killed during clashes between unnamed rival nomadic clans. The clash was based on the ownership of land.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fired mortar shells into AMISOM base located in the vicinity of Biya-Cadde (c. 30 km East of Mahaday district). AMISOM troops responded with artillery fire. There were no reports of casualties.

An armed clash between Habargedir and Hawadle clans resumed in Baanyaaley Village (c. 76 km North East of Beletweyne town) resulting in the death of 10 armed militias - six from Hawadle clan and four from Habargidir clan. Seventeen others, 10 from Hawadle and seven from Habargidir, were injured. The injured militiamen hailing from Hawadle clan were taken to Beletweyne town for medical treatment. The clash was as a result of a dispute over grazing land. The situation was reported to be tense as both clan militias were mobilizing in anticipation of further clashes.

Armed pastoralists from Sa'ad and Suleiman clans, sub-clan of Habargidir, and Wagardhac clan, sub-clan of Marehan clan, clashed at Saaxo area (c. 40 km South West of Bandiiradlay). The incident was related to pervious clan feuds. Four people were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Early AM, Baardheere, Gedo: al Shabaab attacked an Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) military base located near Baardheere. Causality figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Early AM, Biyo Cadde, Middle Shabelle: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards the Burundian base located near Biyo Cadde. No causalities were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: An IED, suspected to be planted by al Shabaab elements targeting an AMISOM KDF contingent convoy, exploded at Abdi Birole (c. 45 km South West of Kismayo town). Two AMISOM soldiers sustained life threatening injures. The injured were taken to Kismayo and MEDEVAC to Mogadishu for further treatment.
13 June, afternoon, Godinlabe, Galgaduud: a businessman was killed at an illegal checkpoint. Perpetrators not identified.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: An unidentified armed man using a HG attacked Miir Police Station in North Gaalkacyo. The HG was hurled at the backside of the police station. The HG exploded out of the building resulting in no casualties. Police officers retaliated and fired warning shots. The perpetrator managed to escape. Police were reported to be investigating the incident.
Al Shabaab, using pistols shot and killed a soldier near Huriwa livestock market. The perpetrators confiscated the weapon belonging to the victim and escaped.

Two suspected al Shabaab assassins shot and killed a military officer at Bakara Market neighbourhood in Hodan district after exiting the Mosque after prayers. The motive for the assassination was not clear. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Early AM, Hiiraan: al Shabaab attacked a Djiboutian base near Jalalaqsi. The perpetrators were repelled. No reported causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: An IED exploded in Bulo Burte airport after al Shabaab fighters managed to plant the device at the airport parking area. One AMISOM soldier was killed. AMISOM suspended flights inbound to Bulo Burte district. AMISOM EOD team conducted a full search at the airstrip for other IED devices in the area.
Al Shabaab attacks a government military base at Doonsubagle, near Belet Weyne. No causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack, using small arms and RPGs, against AMISOM ENDF contingent position in Qansax-Dheere (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa town). AMISOM forces responded with heavy weapons. A child was reportedly injured by a stray bullet in the incident.

Five people were killed and another was injured by armed clan militiamen hailing from Sa'ad clan at Laan-qawaar vicinity near Qaydarre area (c. 120 km East of Galkayo). The victims hailed from Sheikhaal clan. The motive of the killing was not clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland base in Damase village (c. 90 km North East of Ceelwaaq district). There were no reports of casualties.

There was a complex two day attack at Posh Bar and Restaurant in Hodan District. A VBIED detonated at the entrance gate of the restaurant followed by gunfire inside the hotel. The explosion of the VBIED damaged the Pizza House Restaurant located opposite Posh Restaurant. At least seven al Shabaab fighters stormed into the restaurants, four entered Posh Restaurant while three hid in the Pizza House Restaurant. Security forces responded, cordoned off and cleared the area. Sporadic gunfire was heard from the area overnight. At least 17 people, mainly civilians, and seven al Shabaab fighters were killed (sources on 16/06 reported 31 total dead; civilian/militia breakdown not reported) while over 20 others were injured and rushed to hospitals. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Causality figures vary by source.

Early AM, Qansax Dheere, Bay: Al Shabaab fighters attacked a police station in the early hours. Local sources state that a 12 year old boy was injured prior to the withdrawal of the attackers. A second source claims a civilian was killed in the crossfire.
An al Shabaab IED targeted a Hirshabelle convoy in Balcad, and followed with a small arms attack. Three soldiers killed and seven injured.
Movement of forces: 200 Islamic State fighters arrive in Qandala over two days.
Suspected al-Shabab gunmen shot and killed a Somali elder who was a member of the electoral college on the night of 15/06.

Further clashes were reported between Habargidir and Hawadle clans in Banyaaley village area (c. 76 km North East of Beletweyne town). The armed clash was related to a land ownership dispute. Initial reports indicated that over 25 militias from both clans were killed and 30 others were injured. There were no efforts to stop the armed clash between the two clans.

There was a complex two day attack at Posh Bar and Restaurant in Hodan District. A VBIED detonated at the entrance gate of the restaurant followed by gunfire inside the hotel. The explosion of the VBIED damaged the Pizza House Restaurant located opposite Posh Restaurant. At least seven al Shabaab fighters stormed into the restaurants, four entered Posh Restaurant while three hid in the Pizza House Restaurant. Security forces responded, cordoned off and cleared the area. Sporadic gunfire was heard from the area overnight. At least 17 people, mainly civilians, and seven al Shabaab fighters were killed (sources on 16/06 reported 31 total dead; civilian/militia breakdown not reported) while over 20 others were injured and rushed to hospitals. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Causality figures vary by source.
Al Shabaab attacked a Kenyan army base in Baardheere on the evening of 16/06. The fighting lasted several hours. No known causalities.

On 16 June, al Shabaab fighters launched RPG fire at a military base located in Lanta Towfiq, Yaqshid District. Military Forces base reportedly responded using heavy gunfire. Al Shabaab elements were forced to withdraw. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
A Somali army convoy was hit by a roadside bomb in Qalimow, near Balad. Perpetrators not reported or known. Two dead, three wounded.
Unidentified clans clash at Banyaaley. Between 4 - 15 dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabab fighters have reportedly attacked an AMISOM [African Union Mission in Somalia] base in Howlwadag area west of Beledweyne with rockets. AMISOM forces responded in kind. No reports of causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 17 June, evening, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab attacked the Djiboutian forward operating base of Buulo Burto. Causality figures not known. A second attack occurred on 18/06 as well, details not known.

Early AM, Baardheere, Gedo: Unconfirmed reports state that al Shabaab have conducted a ground attack against a Kenyan Defence Force (KDF) base near Baardheere in Gedo. Al Shabaab media sources claim to have killed two soldiers and wounded another three. An attack also occurred on the evening of 16/06. It is not clear if the 17/06 event is a second attack, or a continuation of the first.

An armed conflict ignited between two militias of the sub clans of Dhulbahante and Warsangele in the vicinity of Biyo Guduud (ca.90 kms east of Erigavo). The fighting was caused by business conflict between Kat vendors from the warring sides. Two persons were killed.

Early AM, El Lahelay, Bakool: al Shabaab attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) base. Two soldiers and seven al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the attack. Three soldiers and nine al Shabaab fighters were also injured in the incident. The attack may have taken place on 18/06.
Al Shabaab cut off the hand of a suspected thief in Tortoroow.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Defusal: AMISOM noticed civilian dropping bag, upon inspection, containing IED. IED destroyed, no arrest made. Al Shabaab suspected.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Early AM, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds against the Djiboutian forward operating base (FOB) of Buulo Burto. No causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 18 June, 20:00EAT, Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) military base. The attack injured civilians. Unconfirmed reports indicate a nearby second, Somali government military base was also attacked.

18 June, evening, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a businessman in Beledweyne's Hawl Wadaag district. Somali forces cordon-searched Hawl Wadaag district in the morning of the 19th.
12:00EAT, Suuq Boocle, Mogadishu: unidentified gunmen assassinated a tax collector and injured another in Dharkenley's Suuq Boocle Market.
Al Shabaab storm a barbershop, killing one and injuring another.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 19 June, c. 0400 hrs. Puntland security forces conducted a drone attack against al Shabaab hideouts in Majiyahan area (c. 25 km South West of Bossaso). 10 al Shabaab fighters were killed. It was later reported the United States, not Puntland forces were behind drone attack. However, Puntland forces operated in a support position.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF received tip from local residents over suspected IED. IED successfully dismantled. Al Shabaab suspected.

Two Kenya Defence Force (KDF) soldiers have been confirmed dead in an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) attack. The attack occurred on Monday, June 19, at Walcadey area near El Wak in Somalia's Gedo region. Al Shabaab was blamed.

Two armed militia groups (hailed from Sa'ad and Leelkase clans) exchange gunfire in Garsoor section located South West of Galkayo town. The motive of the clash was not clear. One person sustained slight injury.
Al Shabaab militants captured an SNA soldier while visiting his family at the outskirt of Mahaday District and beheaded him. The perpetrators escaped.
19 June, KM13, Lower Shabelle: a businessman was killed by a government security officer.
19 June, evening, Bossaso, Bari: unidentified gunmen assassinated an area businessman for unknown reason.
Suspected al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a military checkpoint located near KPP junction road in Hodan District. There were no reports of casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Arrests: 15:00EAT, Bakaara Market, Mogadishu: Somali security forces announced they had captured ""Isse Tarabun"", the head of the Amniyat intelligence and assassination branches in Mogadishu.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against Somali government position at Gabarlaawe in the outskirt of Beletweyne town (c. 7 km South West of Beletweyne city). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire and machine guns that lasted for about 20 minutes. SNA received reinforcements from AMISOM Djiboutian contingent soldiers who manage to repulse Al Shabaab. There were no reports of casualties.

Soldiers conducted a security search operation targeting illegal checkpoints established by renegade soldiers at the Afgoye vegetable market at Xawo Tako neighbourhood. During the operation at least one of the soldiers that had set up the checkpoint was killed while another was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 11:00EAT, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards a Djiboutian military base near Beledweyne. Two civilians reported injured.

A dead body of an unidentified man with multiple stab wounds was found in Calanley neighbourhood in Kismayo town after midnight Ramadan prayers. The perpetrator escaped but police were reported to be prepared to investigate.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED exploded at Jalalaqsi town (c. 180 km South East of Beletweyne town). Two donkeys were killed. It was believed that al Shabaab fighters planted the IED to target AMSIOM forces.
Unidentified air forces conducted an airstrike against an unidentified target in Saylac. Causalities not known.

At least one person was killed and two others wounded in a deadly roadside bomb blast that targeted a government official on the evening of 20/06. Perpetrators al Shabaab. The government official was not reported injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: AM, Galgala Mountains, Puntland: Puntland Security Forces (PSF) shelled an al Shabaab camp on the Galgala heights and announced PSF elements had attacked an al Shabaab camp on the nearby al Madow Mountain. The outcome of the operation(s) are not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: AM, Galgala Mountains, Puntland: Puntland Security Forces (PSF) shelled an al Shabaab camp on the Galgala heights and announced PSF elements had attacked an al Shabaab camp on the nearby al Madow Mountain. The outcome of the operation(s) are not known.

12:42EAT, Wadajir, Mogadishu: an al Shabaab vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) was rammed against the Wadajir District Administration Headquarters. Seventeen people, including a number of government officials, died in the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against an AMISOM base, AMISOM responded with mortars, 2 civilians WIA.
Peace agreement/talks: Galmudug Administration and the government of Puntland sign a peace treaty in Gaalkacyo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM-BNDF base, no reported deaths.

Biyamaal clan militia attacked Habargidir clan militias based in the Beytu - Ras village in Merka district. There was an exchange of gunfire. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Tension was reported to be high in the area.

Two suspected al Shabaab assassins shot and killed a traditional elder at Qoryoley Market neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. The victim served as an electoral delegate in the South West State elections in 2016. He was shot when he stepped out of the Mosque after prayers. The perpetrators escaped.

21 June, 20:30EAT, Industrial Road, Mogadishu: the vehicle of a government official was targeted by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). A civilian bystander was killed in the attack. Perpetrators not known.
An al Shabaab IED targeted SNAF soldiers near a tea shop. Three wounded. Al Shabaab targeted a police post with a grenade the same day.
15:00EAT, Baardheere, Gedo: an al Shabaab fighter hurled a hand grenade towards a Somali National Police Force (SNPF) station. Four, including a civilian bystander were killed in the explosion.

Local police officers, on security patrol, clashed with security guards (official status not known) of a Minister of the South West State in a Toyota Corolla near Ikow garage on the road to Mogadishu. There was an exchange gunfire. Three occupants of the vehicle and a police officer were killed. There is no further explanation about the nature of the incident and the overall factor that trigger the clash at the time of reporting.

AM, Warshiikh, Middle Shabelle: armed clashes erupted between Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) troops and local administration soldiers over a checkpoint. Sides in the fighting were organized along clan lines. Several reported injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds at AMISOM Djiboutian Contingent base in Bulo Burte district. AMISOM forces responded with several artillery rounds. There were no reports of casualties.

Al Shabaab shot and killed a police officer and confiscated his weapon near Dabakayo - Meadow in Dharkenley District. The perpetrators escaped. Security forces arrived at the scene but there were no reports of arrests.

column7: Civilians (Somalia); Government of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Administration
column17: 14:45EAT, Wabeeri, Mogadishu: a suicide bomber rammed a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) against the Wabeeri district police station. Seven people, including a Jubaland minister were killed in the explosion. The station itself also experienced heavy damage.

Al Shabaab militants, on a public minibus, attacked a Livestock Market in Biya Adde village (c. 20 km South of Mahaday District). At least two people, including a soldier and a civilian male bystander were killed while five others, mainly civilians, were injured. It is not known if the attack was directed at military or civilian. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab assassins shot and killed an unidentified civilian at Small bridge village in Afgoye district. The victim was killed after returning from Friday prayers. The motive behind the killing was unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
A soldier kills a civilian in Daynile. Reasons not known.

Habarjeclo militia and Somaliland police clashed at Elafweyn centre. Two people were seriously injured. Tension was reported to be very high between the two main clans, Habar yoonis and Habar jeclo, as the respective clan militias were mobilizing. Heavy deployment of Somaliland Police and Army was reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: ISIS fighters and Dervish soldiers clashed in Gurur Mountain (c. 40 km South West Qandala). Five Dervish soldiers and an Islamic State fighter was killed and three other soldiers were wounded. IS fighters disrupted the telecommunication network in the area. Dervish soldiers retreated from the area. There were no reports of immediate arrests.
An IED carried by an al Shabaab facilitator detonates prematurely while in transport. The courier was killed and two nearby civilians were injured.
Al Shabaab shot and killed a senior army officer in Ceel Waaq. No group claimed responsibility at the time of reporting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 25 June, afternoon, IVO Afmadow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab ambushed a Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) foot patrol. The resulting causality figures are not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM patrol convoy hit by IED outside of Baardheere, APC damaged, 2 serious wounded, 4 minor wounded.

Police, military forces and a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters clashed at Afgoye Police Station located at Haawo Tako, Afgoye. There was an exchange of gunfire including use of RPGs which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the suspected al Shabaab attackers were repelled. At least three SNPF soldiers were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be established at the time of reporting.
Unidentified armed attackers using pistols shot and killed a civilian man at Dhagaxtuur neighbourhood in Afgooye. The motive behind the attack was unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

An SNA soldier seriously injured a civilian man at Buundaweyne neighbourhood located South West of Beletweyne town. Reasons for the attack are not known. The victim was rushed to Hiran Main Hospital for further treatment. It was expected that the victim would be medevacked to Mogadishu.
An RCIED buried near the entrance gate of Radio Jowhar station at Hanti-Wadag village in Jowhar detonated prematurely. There were no reports of casualties. The unidentified perpetrators escaped.
KDF convoy headed to Wajir hit by IED, damages reported, 2 KDF wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF forces discover and dismantle an al Shabaab IED.
On Tuesday [27 June], Somali government forces and al-Shabab clashed on the outskirts of the southern town of Mahaday in Middle Shabelle. Casualties unknown.

Mursade and Hawadle clan militias clashed at Labi seddax (c. 15 km East of Mahas District). The incident was related to a dispute over grazing and ownership of a land. Causalities not known. The security situation in that area was reported to be very tense.

Unknown assailants, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at a government security checkpoint in Siinka-Dheer road in Afgoye District. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A joint AMISOM/Somali military operation (US in supervisory role) attacked and gained control of the al Shabaab positions of Cali Fool Dheere and Afrata (Jowhar District) and retook Miir Taqwo without violence. Resulting causality figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A joint AMISOM/Somali military operation (US in supervisory role) attacked and gained control of the al Shabaab positions of Cali Fool Dheere and Afrata (Jowhar District) and retook Miir Taqwo without violence. Resulting causality figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A joint AMISOM/Somali military operation (US in supervisory role) attacked and gained control of the al Shabaab positions of Cali Fool Dheere and Afrata (Jowhar District) and retook Miir Taqwo without violence. Resulting causality figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Government and AMISOM forces, supported by unidentified anti-al Shabaab troops, carried out a joint operation at Ali Fool dhere and Qurac-Madoobe against al Shabaab bases. Heavy gunfire was heard from the locations. At least three al Shabaab members were killed.

A private house owned by chief of police in Qandala was vandalized and burnt by alleged IS fighters in Gurur area (c. 40 km South West of Qandala). The assailants assaulted the wife of the chief of police station.
A second IED attack occurred at Ceel Waaq on 27/06. Details limited. The first occurred earlier in the day.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 27 June, evening, IVO Qandala, Bari: Puntland Security Forces (PSF) ambushed an Islamic State element. Causalities reported, thought no numbers were provided.
The body of three-year-old girl was found East of Lasanood town. The child was lost during the Eid festivals. Police cited a suspicious death as cuts were observed on her body.

A Kenyan military convoy is hit by a roadside IED at Weray village, 18km east of Ceel Waaq town. Reports say that the Kenyan soldiers briefly clashed with al-Shabab fighters after the blast. Four deaths reported.

Al Shabaab and SNF clashed at Keliido Village (c. 17 km North of Baardheere town). Al Shabaab were reported to have moved into the village prior to the attack. There was an exchange of gunfire. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed. The bodies of the two AS fighters were displayed at the village. SNF recovered a PKM machine gun.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Alleged al Shabaab fighters fired 10 mortar shells towards Puntland Dervish base at Kalabayr (c. 60 km South of Bossaso) which impacted on vacant land. Following the incident, PSF intervened and conducted security operations the area. There were no immediate reports of casualties, damages or arrests.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces shot at a suspected vehicle in the proximity of Lanta Hawada area of Bossaso. The suspected vehicle managed to escape. There were no immediate reports of casualties or arrests. The identity of the target is not known.
Al Shabaab fighters briefly attacked an military outpost in the Livestock Market after which they withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a man at the main market of Wadajir. The victim was a former SNA soldier. The motive of the incident was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.
SNAF raided al Shabaab camp, KIA unknown.
02:45EAT, IVO Baardheere, Gedo: al Shabaab attacked a SNAF checkpoint. Six al Shabab reported killed in the following exchange.
Early AM, Baardheere, Gedo: al Shabaab attacked a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) military base at Baardheere. Al Shabaab claims to have killed 10 soldiers, though that figure has not been confirmed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AM, Cali Fool Dheere, Middle Shabelle: armed clashes opposed al Shabaab to SNAF and African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) troops. At least six al Shabaab deaths reported.

Two suspected al Shabaab assassins shot and killed a traditional elder near Qoryoley Police Station neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. The motive of the assassination was unknown. The victim was shot when he stepped out of the Mosque after prayers. The perpetrators managed to escape.
13:30EAT, KM13, Banadir: a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) vehicle was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Causalities reported, exact numbers not known. Perpetrators not named.

An RCIED targeting a military convoy travelling near Siinka Dheer settlement (c. 15 km North West of Mogadishu) exploded. The explosion damaged a vehicle and at least two soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for this attack.

A UVIED hidden in a luxury vehicle driven by a civilian businessman detonated near Jamacadaha neighbourhood in Hodan district. The vehicle was extensively damaged and the victim suffered serious injuries. The motive of the attack was not clear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF forces discover and dismantle an al Shabaab IED.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali and African Union forces on 30/06 recaptured Janale and Mushani from al-Shabaab during a heavy fighting. Causalities not known. Conflicting, al Shabaab asserts victory, claiming the death of several allied soldiers.
A man from Ogaden clan shot and killed a civilian man in Siinay neighbourhood in Kismayo town over a land dispute. The victim's identity is not known.
30 June, 17:15EAT, Ex-control Afgooye checkpoint, Mogadishu: an under- vehicle improvised explosive device (UVIED) killed a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) major. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 30 June, evening, Galkacyo, Mudug: unidentified gunmen assassinated a Puntland Police officer.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 June, early AM: IED explosion targeted an AMISOM convoy, Industrial Road, Daynile district. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. No human causalities.

A Under-vehicle IED, targeting a Toyota pickup with a senior military officer exploded at Jiirada Mo'alin Nor near Ex. Control Afgoye in Wadajir district. The officer died and another occupant was injured. One civilian bystander was injured by the blast. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the act.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali and African Union forces on 30/06 recaptured Janale and Mushani from al-Shabaab during a heavy fighting. At least six al Shabaab members and two soldiers were killed in Janaale. Conflicting, al Shabaab asserts victory, claiming the death of several allied soldiers.
01 July, evening, Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shabelle: a civilian minibus was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Two killed, five injured. Perpetrators believed to be al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an AMISOM KDF base at Tabato village (c. 60 km East of Dhobley). AMISOM responded with heavy machine guns after which al Shabaab fighters retreated. There were no reports of casualties.
01 July, afternoon, Harardheere, Mudug: al Shabaab kidnapped 90 local clan elders. Conflicting sources claim the incident occurred on 30/06.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A group of Dervish soldiers withdrew from Galgala to Sugure area (c. 35 km South West of Bossaso) due to unpaid salaries. Security officials initiated mediation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 01 July, AM, Galkacyo, Mudug: suspected al Shabaab fighters assassinated a Puntland Security Forces officer.
01 July, evening, Suuq Xoloha, Mogadishu: unidentified gunmen assassinated a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) soldier.

Suspected to be al Shabaab elements shot and killed a NISA soldier and took his gun at Busteejada (bus station) in Livestock market in Huriwa district. Security forces were deployed to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabab claimed responsibility for the incident.
Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed two people among them a police officer in Garsoor. It is not clear if the assailants were targeting the police officer or civilian.
Al Shabaab kidnapped 90 clan elders for preventing recruitment of child soldiers.

20:00EAT, Bakaara Market, Mogadishu: an al Shabaab grenade attack targeted a Mogadishu Stabilisation Forces (MoSF) patrol. Two civilian bystandards killed. The attack may have occurred the previous day.
At least two people were killed and five others injured on 02/07 after a landmine exploded under a minibus in Afgoye. Al Shabaab suspected as the perpetrators.
Sa'ad and Wagardhac clan militia clashed at Saaxo vicinity (c. 40 km West of Galinsoor). The clash was as a result of previous clan feuds. Three people were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Early AM, Tabta, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) military base. Three soldiers and an unknown number of al Shabaab were killed in the 30 minute exchange. A similar attack in the town took place the previous day.
AM, Jilib, Middle Jubba: al Shabaab executed two Indian foreign fighters accused of being spying for foreign intelligence agencies.

Unknown assailants, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at a military check point at Carwo Idko junction road in Howlwadag District. The number of casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A magnetic IED attached to a small luxury vehicle transporting a local businessman detonated in vicinity of Al- Baraka junction road in Hodan District. The victim was seriously injured. The motive behind the attack was not clear. Perpetrators not known.
Clan clashes outside of Baidoa, causalities not known.
UVIED targets businessman car, 1 bystander wounded. Perpetrators, reason for the attack not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US forces conducted an air strike using drones near Kunya-Barow village (c. 75 km West of Barawe district). At least two missiles were fired at an al Shabaab convoy transporting at least two senior al Shabaab cadres. Five al Shabaab fighters, including two senior officers, were killed and seven others were injured.

Locals demonstrated against the rejection of the Somali shilling in Beletweyne. The demonstrators were disgruntled by the decision made by business people and other companies of refraining from trading with the Somali shilling. The chief elder and other community leaders spoke with the protestors and requested them to disperse as they would work on resolving the issue.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Military forces attacked al Shabaab fighters concentrated at Birta-Dheere village (c. 11 km South of Garbaharey town). There was an extended armed clash after which SNA withdrew. Initial reports indicated that six military forces were killed and six others were injured in the attack. Earlier in the morning, armed clashes had erupted between security forces and al Shabaab fighters (Birta Dheer, Gedo) during an operation aimed at removing landmines. 14 al Shabaab and 3 government soldiers had died.

Two armed suspected al Shabaab elements using pistols shot and killed a traditional elder at Dabaqeynka neighbourhood in Dharkenley District. The victim served as an electoral delegate in 2016 elections for Hirshabelle State. He was shot when he stepped out of the Mosque after prayers. The perpetrators managed to escape.
03 July, evening, Daynille, Mogadishu: unidentified gunmen assassinated a private security officer, reasons not known.
Hiirshabelle electoral commissioner assassinated, unidentified assailants escaped.

Habargidir and Hawadle clans clashed at Baanyaaley (c. 76 km North East of Beletweyne) at the border of Matabaan and Mahaas districts in Hiran region. A clan militiaman hailing from Habargidir was injured and transported to Guriceel for medical treatment.

Unknown war planes conducted an airstrike targeting suspected al Shabaab positions at Wade grazing area (c. 10 km East of Badhaadhe town). Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

An RCIED, buried in the middle of the road near Baardheere by al Shabaab, detonated when a donkey cart passed over it. It was confirmed that roads leading to Birta-Dheere and Buurdhuubo village from Garabahrey town were filled with IEDs. Causalities from the blast not known.

Following a clash between Jubaland forces and al Shabaab, air forces from unknown origin conducted an airstrike of al Shabaab locations in Gooib Weyn. Unspecified bodies of unknown number of al Shabaab elements were observed at the location because of the bombardment.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland Security Forces, on security patrol, clashed with al Shabaab at Gobweyn area (c. 15 km North East of Kismayo). There was a brief armed confrontation after which JSF retreated from the area. An airstrike from unknown origin was reported after JSF retreated. Information indicated that unspecified bodies of unknown number of al Shabaab elements were observed at the location because of the bombardment. There were no reports of casualties from JSF. Causalities from the airstrike not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AM, IVO Kismayo, Lower Jubba: suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) soldier.

An RCIED buried beside the road near FPENS Building in Taleh village, targeting the former Director General of Ministry of Information, exploded. The director, who was the target, and two escort soldiers were injured and the vehicle was seriously damaged by the explosion. FGS security forces were deployed at the scene and searched the area but there were no reports of arrests made. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. An attack against the current Immigration Minister occurred the following day.

At least four mortar rounds, fired from an unknown direction, landed in and in the vicinity of Villa Somalia. Two mortars, that did not explode, landed at the Northern perimeter of Villa Somalia and another mortar round impacted the compound near Wardhigley District Office. A soldier serving inside Villa Somalia died while two others were injured. The UXOs were destroyed by the Somali Police EOD via controlled explosion. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Protests in Belet Weyne after rumours or counterfeit currency was being circulated.

Al Shabaab attacked a Somali base outside of Kismayo at Lug-law during the late night hours. Following a the battle, Somali forces retreated and al Shabaab took over the location. According to al Shabaab ""[Somali military forces] suffered heavy causalities.""
A large explosion was reported in southern Diinsoor district. It is believed to be a bomb or air strike. Al Shabaab believed to be either the target or instigator. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacks a Jubaland base, causalities not known. Shortly following the attack US air forces struck the al Shabaab position.
AM, Goof Guduud, Bay: a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) vehicle was struck by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Five soldiers dead from the blast. Al Shabaab believed responsible.
A convoy escorting government officials from Gufgudud Burey (24KMSE Baidoa) hit and ambushed by al Shabaab at Haween. Fatalities unknown.
05 July, 17:00EAT, Afysioni (Waaberi), Mogadishu: an under-vehicle improvised explosive device (UVIED) targeted a Ministry of Immigration official. The driver was injured by the blast.
05 July, 20:30EAT, Hamar Weyne, Mogadishu: a security patrol was targeted by a al Shabaab grenade attack. No causalities reported.

05 July, 19:45EAT, Ministry of Defence, Mogadishu: al Shabaab fighters attacked the Ministry of Defence (MINDEF) Headquarters. Soldiers are the facility repelled the attackers. Causality figures not known.
Protests in Guri-Ceel after counterfeit bank notes are circulated.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Early AM, IVO Kismayo, Lower Jubba: a suspected United States (US) drone strike targeted a group of al Shabaab fighters at or near Luglaaw. Thirteen al Shabaab dead. Before the attack al Shabaab attacked a Jubaland base at Luglaaw. Causalities not known from the Jubaland attack.
A Somali police official has been killed after his car, which was fitted with an explosive device detonated near the airport. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators.

A Somali radio journalist working for the state media was shot and injured while on his way to office by a security guard near Villa Somalia. The victim was rushed to hospital for treatment. The motive of the incident was not clear. The perpetrator was arrested.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: After a road accident between AMISOM and SNG convoys that claimed the lives of two Somali soldiers, area residents throw rocks at AMISOM soldiers in protest.
AM, Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud: violent protests targeted Hawala money transfer companies and food stores following the appearance of fake Somali bank notes. Two shopkeepers were injured in the melee.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Defusal: AMISOM EOD escorting convoy discovered & dismantled 2x al Shabaab IEDs.
An under vehicle IED targets a businessman. Perpetrators not known. Causality not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland Security Forces (PSF) claim to have destroyed two al-Shabab bases near the Galgala mountains following a 6 July military operation in areas between Madarshon and Dindigle villages [in northeast Somalia]. 12 al Shabaab reported dead during the operation. Puntland forces began the offensive with several rounds of mortar fire.
An al Shabaab IED targets SNAF in Bardale, misses target.
07 July, evening, Balcad, Middle Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked a SNAF checkpoint. At least two soldiers and an unconfirmed numbers of al Shabaab killed in the subsequent exchange of gunfire.
07 July, evening, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: unidentified gunmen assassinated a clan elder. Motives of the attack are not known.
IED planted in container near tea shop popular with SNAF detonated, 2x SNAF injured.

Hawadle clan militia and al Shabaab clashed at Cabdi Cagweyne area (c. 9 km West of Halgan). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which Hawadle clan militias were forced to retreat. Four militiamen were shot and killed. Rifles were left behind by Hawadle clan militia.
08 July, afternoon, Halgan, Hiiraan: al Shabaab attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) checkpoint. Local media reports four soldier and an unknown number of al Shabaab died in the battle.

08 July, 19:00EAT, Garowe, Puntland: unverified media reports suggested gunfire was reported inside the Puntland immigration office of Garowe. One death reported. The violence may have been related to a land dispute.
A soldier was shot and killed by an unidentified group, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, at Elasha Biyaha settlement in Afgoye corridor. The motive was unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed three civilians and injured another from Hawadle clan at Ganuribad (c. 9 km West of Maxaas district) after al Shabaab fighters shot at their vehicles that was headed to Maxaas. One death reported.
AM, Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shabelle: Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) opened fire against a civilian vehicle, killing eight. The motive for the attack is not known.

Suspected al Shabaab elements detonated an IED at a vehicle screening point in the outskirts of Berdale (c. 60 km North West of Baidoa town). The blast occurred at a location where vehicles accessing the town were screened by security forces. There were no reports of casualties or arrests made. It is not clear if al Shabaab figures were present at the time of attack.

Six brothers, in a luxury vehicle, and a female bystander were shot and killed by an unidentified group at KM 13 settlement at Afgoye corridor in Dayniile district. Two of the six deceased brothers worked for Dahab-shiil money Transfer Company and another was a land broker. The motive behind the incident was not clear. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11:40EAT: IED targets AMISOM convoy, Ceelasha Biyaha. Perpetrators suspected be al Shabaab, outcome of the attack not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: A civilian was killed and three others were injured by AMISOM Djiboutians in Jalalaqsi (c. 180kms South East of Beledweyne town), in a security operation targeting SNA soldiers that injured an AMISOM soldier. The incident that resulted in the injured AMISOM soldier occurred after the Djiboutian soldier attempted to intervene two SNA soldiers. The SNA soldiers exchange gunfire with the AMISOM soldier and the AMISOM soldier was injured in the incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces announced they have ""intensified anti-al Shabaab operations"" in the al Madow and Galgala Mountains. So far, Puntland has reported raids in Madarshoon, Diindigle, Biyo Maddow and Mariidle. At least 20 al Shabaab fatalities. Puntland leadership reported they have ""taken key positions"" during the operation. Date(s) of the operations not known - source dated 09/07.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces announced they have ""intensified anti-al Shabaab operations"" in the al Madow and Galgala Mountains. So far, Puntland has reported raids in Madarshoon, Diindigle, Biyo Maddow and Mariidle. At least 20 al Shabaab fatalities. Puntland leadership reported they have ""taken key positions"" during the operation. Date(s) of the operations not known - source dated 09/07.
09 July, evening, Belet Xaawo, Gedo: unidentified gunmen assassinated an official of a local women's association, reasons not known.

Two armed al Shabaab using pistols shot and killed a senior government official at the Office of the Ministry of Finance at Ali-Kamin vicinity in Wardhigley district. The victim was in a coffee restaurant when he was shot. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
09 July, 20:30EAT: grenade attack targets military patrol, Taleex, Hodan district. Al Shabaab responsible. Causalities not known.

09 July, evening, Mogadishu: al Shabaab conducted two grenade attacks against Yaaqshiid district administration headquarters and a security checkpoint at Taleex Junction. One soldier guarding the building died in the blast.
Suspected al-Shabab gunmen have killed six Somali soldiers in an attack in Halgan. The soldiers were killed in an ambush while escorting Halgan district commissioner in an area not far from the town.
Former Galmudug Electoral Delegate Ahmed Mohamed Ali killed by two gunmen armed with pistols. Assailants escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab IED struck an AMISOM convoy. One civilian injured.
Al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier in Hodan district on 10/07.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: AM, Galgala Mountains, Puntland: a Puntland Security Forces (PSF) convoy was hit by a al Shabaab roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Causalities reported, figures not known.
AM, Gendershe, Lower Shabelle: unidentified gunmen killed three civilians. The attack is likely related to clan based conflict.

Al Shabaab attackers using pistols shot and killed a municipal tax collector at Seybiano neighbourhood in Hodan district. The assailants were using a motorcycle when they attacked the officer and took his gun. The attacks were suspected to be al Shabaab elements. The motive of the attack was unclear.
Sa'ad and Majerten clashed at Xafoodle vicinity (c. 70 km East of Galkayo). Two pastoralists were killed. The incident was related to previous revenge between the local clans.

Two groups government forces clashed at Buundo Carbis at Afgoye corridor in Afgoye district. The clash was a result of land disputes between the two groups. There was an exchange of gunfire. One soldier was killed while another was wounded. AMISOM troops based near the area intervened and neutralized the situation.
AM, Maxaas, Hiiraan: Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) soldiers opened fire against a civilian minibus. Causalities reported. Numbers not known.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack at a government troop position at Waxara Cadde neighbourhood in Heliwa district. There was an exchange of gunfire that lasted for about 15 minutes after which suspected al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A suspected roadside IED struck an AMISOM convoy travelling between Mogadishu and Afgooye at Abiikarow. There was no immediate confirmation of the casualties as result of the land mine blast, but reports indicated that AU soldiers fired randomly at a nearby crowd, killing at least one pedestrian.
Bossaso market was shut down as there were protests due to the new taxation levied by government of Puntland took place.

Residents at Sh Osman neighbourhood and municipal police briefly clashed as a result of a municipal operation that cleared a road that was partially blocked by temporary structures. There were no reports of casualties during the incident.

Militiamen of Hayaag sub clan of Dulbahante briefly clashed among themselves at Qocondaale, Togdheer. Two militiamen were seriously injured. The clash was due to attempted revenge killings at the sub clan level. Elders from Dulbahante rushed to the scene and managed to stabilize the situation.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against an military check point at KM 50 area. SNA troops responded forcing al Shabaab attackers to withdraw. There were no reports of fatalities.

Hawadle clan militias shot and killed a civilian from Habargidir of Saleban sub-clan and injured another using a knife at Oratan grazing land (c. 40 km East of Beletweyne town). The perpetrator accused the victims of raping one of his daughters to Hawadle clan elders in the area. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland and KDF forces launch an offensive against al Shabaab in Baardheere district. Further details not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 July, 16:45EAT, Industrial Road, Mogadishu: an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) near Mogadishu's former perfume factory. One injury reported. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Burundian soldiers who are part of the AU Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) vacated a large military base in Mogadishu. The forces had occupied the base for 10 years. The forces were moved to Jowhar. The handover to Somali forces comes after ""extensive reconstruction, logistical and engineering works, spearheaded by the United Nations Support Office in Somalia (UNSOS).""
Al Shabaab ground attack and shell KDF base of El Ram, causality unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab IED targets a AMISOM convoy. One person was severely wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12 July, 17:45EAT, KM13, Lower Shabelle: a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) intercepted at Sinka Dheer's security checkpoint (AMISOM) detonated, killing five and injuring eight. The perpetrator's identity was not provided by the source, though al Shabaab claimed responsibility in the following days. It is not clear if the driver of the car was counted among the dead.

Two militia groups, known as ""Celi cumar"" and ""Cabdalle Caroone"" both hailing from sub clan of Abgal-Hawiye, clashed at Buurdhere village (c. 40 km North West of Cadale district). There was an exchange of gunfire. The clash was as a result of disputes over a local well. At least 12 people from the two militia groups were killed and four others were wounded.
12 July, evening, Garbahaarey, Gedo: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards Garbahaarey town. Civilian causalities reported, numbers not known.

A man from Dishiishe sub-clan was shot and killed by an unknown assailant in Al-Ridwan area located North East of Bossaso. The motive was not clear. The assailant escaped and police were reported to be investigating.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: AM, Xerale, Galgaduud: armed clashes erupted between elements of Ahlu Sunna Waljama'a and Galmudug forces. Causality figures not known.
12 July, evening, Mogadishu: three grenade attacks targeted Somali security forces in Hawl Wadaag, Bakaara Market and Aymiska (Heliwa). Two civilians were injured in Hawl Wadaag.
12 July, evening, Mogadishu: three grenade attacks targeted Somali security forces in Hawl Wadaag, Bakaara Market and Aymiska (Heliwa). Two civilians were injured in Hawl Wadaag.

Unidentified attackers driving a vehicle hurled a hand grenade at a military checkpoint in Waberi district. There were no reports of casualties. The perpetrators escaped. The motive of the attack was unknown.
12 July, evening, Mogadishu: three grenade attacks targeted a police post in Hawl Wadaag, Bakaara Market and Aymiska (Heliwa). Two civilians were injured in Hawl Wadaag.

Unidentified armed attackers using pistols attacked and slightly injured a government soldier at Beerta Jaadka in Hodan district. Stray bullets allegedly killed a civilian bystander. The perpetrators escaped. The motive of the attack was unknown.
12:00EAT, Fagaax, Mogadishu: al Shabaab killed a Somali soldier and a student in Yaaqshiid. A bystander third was injured.
12 July, 17:00EAT, KM6/Sey Biano, Mogadishu: suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinated an official of the Ministry of Education.
Al Shabaab fighters kill a fellow member ""[somewhere] in southern Somalia"" (speculated in Shabeelaha Hoose) after a falling out with top commanders ""last week."" Source dated 15/07.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired about eight mortar rounds at AMISOM base in Garbaharey town. AMISOM forces did not respond. The mortar rounds did not land in the AMISOM base but landed in the town. One civilian was injured.
Afternoon, IVO Xudur, Bakool: a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) convoy was ambushed by al Shabaab. Two military commanders were killed in the skirmish.

Armed militiamen hailing from Sa'ad clan ambushed a mini-bus at Dusmada (c. 18 km North of Galkayo) on the main road which links Galkayo to Bacadwayn. The targets were unidentified. The incident was related to previous clan feuds. Two people were killed. The perpetrators managed to escape from scene.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a motorcycle near Laameyti (c. 20 km North East of Xudur town). Two people riding the motorcycle were killed in the attack. Al Shabaab fighters burnt the motor cycle and escaped from the scene before SNA forces arrived. The bodies were transported to Xudur.

Armed clansmen from Marihan clan shot and killed a fellow clan member after attacking his residence at Harak Koowad village in Luuq town. There was a dispute over farm land between the victim and the perpetrators. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Early AM, Kunya Barow, Middle Jubba: 'Danab' (Somali special forces) and United States (US) commandos raided al Shabaab positions. The al Shabaab spokesman, Sheikh Ali Dheere, may have been killed during the raid. Several prisoners held by al Shabaab were freed during the operation. The base was reported destroyed.
Unidentified clan clashes killed 2 militiamen, motives unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Defusal: An AMISOM patrol discover and dismantle a al Shabaab IED.
AM, IVO Qansax Dheere, Bay: al Shabaab fighters ambushed a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) convoy. Two military officers reported killed in the attack.
Afternoon, Baidoa, Bay: unverified social media reports indicated al Shabaab may have kidnapped seven non-governmental organisation (NGO) local workers in Baidoa.
15 July, evening, Wadajir, Mogadishu: suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinated two government tax collectors.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 16 July, evening, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab attacked a Djiboutian military base. The attackers were repelled. Two al Shabaab deaths reported. A secondary report (Calamada in Somali 17 Jul 17) indicated that Djibouti suffered ""heavy causalities.""

16 July, 21:00EAT, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a Somali National Police Force (SNPF) officer. Security forces arrested several suspects in possible connection with the incident in the morning of 17 July.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 16 July, evening, KM50, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked the African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) base located near KM50 settlement. The assailants were repelled. Causality figures not known.
16 July, evening, IVO Baidoa, Bay: a group of al Shabaab fighters returning to Baidoa clashed with Southwest Police officers. At least one police officer fatality reported.
Afternoon, Buulo Yarey (15km north of Afgooye), Lower Shabelle: four people were killed during inter-clan fighting. The identities of the clans are not known.
16 July, evening Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle: an al Shabaab attack against a police checkpoint was repelled. A local government official, five al Shabaab and one solider were killed in the ambush.
Al Shabaab kidnapped a NGO worker in Badhaadhe.
16 July, afternoon, Kabis, Gedo: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) fighter jets conducted an airstrike against a high value target (HVT) meeting. 40 al Shabaab reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AM, Yoontoy, Lower Jubba: an IED targeted a convoy of allied security forces of AMISOM and Jubaland forces. There were rumours US forces were also present. Causality figures not known.

""Seven humanitarian workers kidnapped by al-Shabaab on July 16th near Baidoa, southwest of the capital Mogadishu, were released after being held for 8 days. According to early local media reports, a ransom was paid although the type (monetary, resource or other) cannot be currently verified.""
Al Shabaab assassinates one of their members after a disagreement on policy.
Protests outside of Gaalkacyo following a currency devaluation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Defusal: Joint AMISOM/Jubaland/US convoy discovered and dismantled two al Shabaab roadside IEDs before Goobweyn. Devices safely dismantled.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling on the road between Buurane settlement and Mahaday district exploded. The explosion damaged one of the AMISOM trucks. AMISOM reacted with gunfire after the explosion. It is not clear if the attackers were present at the time of the explosion. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility of the attack.

Two groups of unidentified armed clan militia clashed at Maalimey village (c. 15 km West of Balcad district). There was an exchange of gunfire. The clash was initiated due to a land dispute in the area. At least six clan militiamen were killed and three others were wounded.

Armed men driving a small vehicle attacked three soldiers travelling along the road between Mogadishu and Afgoye at Hawa Abdi in Afgoye district. The attackers shot at the vehicle carrying the officers killing two and severely injuring the other. The attackers escaped.
17 July, evening, Baardheere, Gedo: a civilian was killed by an al Shabaab mortar shelling. A similar attack took place the following day,
Al Shabaab fighters attempted to ambush a civilian minibus from Dhobley to Afmadow transporting khat between Qooqan at Taabta (c. 75 km North East of Dhobley). There were no reports of casualties.

Unknown war planes conducted airstrike at suspected al Shabaab location at Qabri shariif area (c. 70 km North East of Kismayo). Three people were killed and six others were injured as the result of the attack. The injured victims were taken to Kismayo hospital for medical treatment. All victims were reported to be local civilians.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab assassins, shot and killed a police officer at Labadhax neighbourhood in Wardhigley district. The policeman was securing an ongoing road construction at the 30th street when the armed men shot him. The attackers stole the gun of the policeman and escaped.
Jubaland forces report hearing a large explosion. Possible premature IED detonation. 4 suspected AS arrested in the aftermath of the explosion. The intended target of the blast is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya); Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Defusal: Joint AMISOM/Jubaland/US convoy advancing between Buula Gaduud and Yoontoy discovered IED. Device safely dismantled.

Two SNA groups clashed at perfume factory located in Heliwa district. The clash occurred after disputes developed between the armed forces for unknown reasons. One soldier was killed and two bystanders were wounded.
An al Shabaab IED targeting a government official discovered and dismantled.

Unspecified armed men, hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Ahmed-Farah sub clan on a vehicle, shot at police in Gumbur-Libah village (c. 54 km South East of Burco). No causalities. The incident was linked to recent clan conflict between Ahmed-Farah and Cimraan Habarjeco sub clans. Police pursued the attackers and managed to arrest them and confiscate their vehicle.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 18 July, evening, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards a Djiboutian military base. No causalities reported.

military forces, in a security operation, clashed with al Shabaab fighters at a residence in Goobate village (c. 30 km North West of Wajid). There was an exchange of gunfire. A soldier was killed in the attack. The soldiers returned to their base at Wajid leaving the dead soldier at the location of the incident.

Supporters of Wadani political party held a demonstration against local authorities at Sheikh in protest of the arrest of their fellow party supporters in Sheikh during an anti-Kulmiye political party demonstration (unknown date; details not known). The protestors appealed to the authorities for the release of the arrested.

Two men who hailed from Saleban clan, sub clan of Habargidir, were killed by militia men hailing from Wagardhac clan, sub clan of Marehan, at Balicad vicinity (c. 20 km West of Galinsoor). The incident was related to clan feuds.
A man was stabbed and wounded by three assailants in Raf/Raho area located at the south of Bossaso. Police arrested the assailants and the victim was taken to hospital for treatment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: AM, Buraane, Middle Shabelle: a Burundian National Defence Force (BNDF) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). No casualties reported. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Early AM, Golosha Matrooba, Lower Jubba: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) fighter jets conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab positions in the Golosha Mountains. Reports indicate the jets missed their targets, hitting a nearby settlement. At least four civilian deaths.
Al Shabaab fighters fired six mortar rounds at Kurmaan neighbourhood located in Baardheere town. The mortar rounds landed at a residential area. Five people were injured as a result of the attack.

A mother was killed and her daughter was wounded by armed men at Taaroge area (c. 10 km West of Galkayo). The incident occurred after the armed men shot at the house of the victims. The victims hailed from Sa'ad clan while the perpetrators hailed from Leellkase clan. The motive of killing was not clear.
AM, Bardaale, Bay: Southwest forces attacked al Shabaab positions between Baidoa and Bardaale. Causalities not known.

Armed men from Galjecel clan injured two civilians at Hawlwadag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne town. The victims hailed from Hawadle and Rahawein clans. The motive behind the attack was unclear. The victim hailing from Hawadle clan is head of Education in Hiiraan region. The two victims were taken to Beletweyne Hospital for treatment. Police arrived at the scene and managed to arrest the perpetrator.
19 July, evening, Mosh Mosh Mosque, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: a Somali policeman opened fire against civilians, injuring three. The motive behind the incident is not known.

An armed militiaman hailing from Hawadle clan shot and killed a 19-year-old youth driving a rickshaw (tuktuk) at Xaawo Taako neighbourhood located East of Beletweyne town. The motive behind the incident was unknown. Police arrived at the scene and managed to arrest the perpetrator for further investigation.
19 July, 21:00EAT, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: a Ministry of Education official survived an assassination attempt. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland security forces conducted a security operation against al Shabaab location at Gelef area (c. 75 km South East of Dhobley). An al Shabaab fighter and JSF officer were killed in the security operation. The two bodies were transported to Dhobley.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 15:25EAT, Ministry of Sport, Mogadishu: an under-vehicle improvised explosive device (UVIED) targeted senior Somali Intelligence officer Abdullahu Nur Samatar. The victim sustained injuries. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: PSF Colonel Hassan Ali Geelle KIA by an unknown perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Early AM, IVO Dhobley, Lower Jubba: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) elements and Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) soldiers killed an al Shabaab leader allegedly behind some of the attacks recently recorded along the Kenyan border. The leader, Hassan Issaq Ibrahim 'Beila', is the alleged ring leader of the al Shabaab cell responsible for several improvised explosive device (IED) attacks against Kenyan forces between Liboi and Dhobley. Two body guards were also killed.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: ASWJ and Galmudug forces clash over two days in Herale town, near Dhuusamarreeb. The war broke out as Galmudug forces and Ahlu Sunnah militia disputed over the control of the town. The two-day armed conflict left at least 20 dead and more than 40 others injured.
Defusal: Large truck bomb intercepted at Sinka Dheer checkpoint.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM convoy protecting logistics hit by IED while en route from Buur Hakaba to Baidoa. One civilian truck damaged, one civilian injured.
AM, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: armed clashes erupted between Somali military and police forces after a dispute over the appointment of the new Police Chief of the city. Causalities not known.
AM, Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shabelle: unidentified gunmen assassinated a school teacher.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab fired at least 3x 82mm rounds towards BNDF base, missed target, no KIA.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Al Shabaab hurled grenade and hit-and-run PSF Darawish camp in Galkacyo, KIA unknown.

Several NGO workers are kidnapped on 21 July in Farlibaax, north of Beledweyne. The abduction may be related to the counterfeiting of Somali currency. The abduction comes after al Shabaab gained control of the city following a firefight with Ethiopian forces. The perpetrators were believed to be al Shabaab.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: ASWJ and Galmudug forces clash over two days in Herale town, near Dhuusamarreeb. The war broke out as Galmudug forces and Ahlu Sunnah militia disputed over the control of the town. The two-day armed conflict left at least 20 dead and more than 40 others injured.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya); Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 21 July, afternoon, Buula Gaduud, Lower Jubba: joint security forces including the US temporarily took control of Buula Gaduud before withdrawing back to Yoontoy, approximately 30km north of Kismayo. A second source claims the joint forces 'attacked' the village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM foot patrol targeted by IED. No injuries. One triggerman arrested and handed over to SNPF Afgooye.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab overtakes Farlibaax following a firefight with Ethiopian forces. ""Deaths and injuries"" reported.
21 July, Lasanod, Sool Region: Two people were killed and nearly 20 others injured in an anti-tank land mine explosion at a recently established IDP camp. Perpetrators not known.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Early AM, Tortoorow, Lower Shabelle: Somali 'Danab' commandos, allegedly supported by United States (US) mentors raided an al Shabaab target. It is believed air strikes were conducted to support the Somali forces. Outcome of the raid not known; no Somali troops were killed or injured, according to military sources.

A child died and 17 people were injured when a grenade detonated among a group of people at an IDP camp in Somalia's Sool region. The child had picked up the unexploded ordnance and brought it into a group of people when it detonated. The camp is located at Ari Adeye village, North of Lasanod.
Defusal: Security forces discover and dismantle a al Shabaab IED 4km north of Jowhar airfield.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Early AM, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab militants attacked a Djiboutian military base. The assailants were repelled. Causality figures not known. However, later in the afternoon three Djibouti forces were killed by an IED.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Afternoon, Buulo Burto airfield, Hiiraan: unverified reports suggested three Djiboutian explosive ordnance disposal (EOD) technicians were killed by the explosion of a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) they were attempting to defuse on Buulo Burto airfield. The device was believed to have been planted by al Shabaab.
A civilian vehicle is hit by a roadside IED in Adhicadeeye. One dead, seventeen injured. Perpetrators not known.
An incident only described as a ""murder"" occurred in Heliwa during the evening hours.
13:30EAT, Daynuunay, Bay: a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). One death, six injuries. Perpetrators believed to be al Shabaab.
At least four soldiers were killed and several others wounded when a roadside blast targeted a security convoy in Baidoa. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 23 July, 23:00EAT, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fighters attacked a Djiboutian military base. The assailants were repelled. Causality figures not known.
Defusal: 23 July, evening, KM13, Mogadishu: a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) unit dismantled a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). The identities of the perpetrators not known.
