AM, Wanlaweyn, Lower Shabelle: SNAF announced they had captured a high profile al Shabaab leader after a small skirmish. Casualties were reported, no numbers provided. The name of the captured individual is not known.
Armed clashes reported between two unidentified clans, casualties and motives unknown.

Joint Somali/KDF convoy notices IED, safely dismantled. Another IED detonates prematurely 1km later, followed by small arms fire. One soldier injured. It is not known if the perpetrators were present following the explosion, despite the reaction of gunfire.
AM, Taraka, Gedo: al Shabaab ambushed a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) convoy. Al Shabaab claims six dead, including officers, however Kenyan forces deny causalities.
23 July, 22:00EAT, Mogadishu: a green-on-green incident left two civilians injured. The motives leading to the violence are not known.

Jijeele clan militias clashed with government soldiers manning Torabora CP at the busy market in Hawlwadag neighbourhood located on the western side of Beletweyne town. There was an exchange of small arms fire after which Jijeele clan militias withdrew from the area. A civilian was injured. The injured civilian was rushed to AMISOM level 2 hospital where he succumbed to his injuries. Other reports claim two civilians died in the clash.
Residents peacefully demonstrated against Kulmiye party in Gebiley.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF convoy escorting logistics convoy to Waji enters Rab Dhuure, al Shabaab had vacated the area prior to the arrival of the convoy.
Arrests: The regional chairman of Wadani party was arrested and detained at Burao Central Police Station, reasons not known.
Two groups of unidentified clan militia clashed in Marka district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. There were no reports of casualties.

Armed men, alleged to be al Shabaab fighters, murdered a herdsman near KM 50 settlement in Afgoye district. The armed attackers stole the livestock of the deceased man. Other militiamen, alleged to be associated with the victim, recovered the livestock. The motive behind the attack could not be established at the time of reporting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Early AM, IVO Belet Xaawo, Gedo: four bodies of suspected al Shabaab fighters were discovered by residents. Jubaland authorities reported the four were killed during a ""recent"" skirmish, date not provided. The Shabelle Media Network claims the four were executed by Jubaland forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 24 July, late evening, Galkacyo, Mudug: a joint Puntland/Galmudug operation led to the arrest of the al Shabaab head of operations and four others in Galkacyo.

Residents violently demonstrated against the regional authority on their decision to move the tax office from Wadaamo Goo to Ainabo. The office is meant to tax all things coming from Somalia and Puntland. The vehicle of regional governor was also stoned.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AM, Baardheere, Gedo: al Shabaab claimed to have conducted a mortar attack against an Ethiopian military base. The incident remains unconfirmed.
IED detonates near water point near a military base of Mahaday, no casualties. Possible premature detonation of the device.
09:30EAT, De Martino Hospital, Mogadishu: unidentified gunmen assassinated a Somali National Police Force (SNPF) officer.
Afternoon, Wadajir, Mogadishu: al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) soldier.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Non-violent activity: AM, Galgodob Galkacyo road, Mudug: media reports suggested the Ethiopian paramilitary group Liyu Police had blockaded the road linking Galgodob to Galkacyo. This event may have happened the previous day.

A vehicle reportedly carrying local businessmen (khat dealers) was taken by al Shabaab fighters in the outskirts of War-Ciise neighbourhood, Jowhar District. Al Shabaab elements took the victims to an unknown location, in their controlled areas. The motive behind the abduction remains unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 26 July, Aleemow: al Shabaab fighters detonated an IED targeting ENDF EOD team screening the road ahead of the convoy near Aleemow village (c.30kms North of Wajid) One ENDF soldier was reportedly killed in the blast. The convoy proceeded and no further casualty was reported from the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Early AM, Hosingow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) base. The assailants were repelled. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 26 July, evening, IVO Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: unverified social media reporting suggested an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy had been targeted by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Early AM, Lagta, Lower Jubba: KDF fighter jets attacked an al Shabaab camp at Lagta, near Kolbiyow. The resulting causality figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: AM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards the Djiboutian forward operating base located near Jalalaqsi town. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 26 July, Galkayo: Armed men attacked the Najax refugee camp in periphery of Garsoor section NW of Galkayo and exchanged gun fire with the refugee camp guards. Two people including one of perpetrators were killed in the fighting. The motive of the attack is not yet clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AM, Gaduud, Lower Jubba: an al Shabaab improvised explosive device (IED) targeted a Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) convoy headed to Gaduud. No causalities reported.
Wadajir/Hamar Weyne, Mogadishu: two green-on-green skirmishesbetween Somali security forces. Six killed in Haram Weyne, 11 in Wadajir. The motive behind each instance are not known.
Wadajir/Hamar Weyne, Mogadishu: two green-on-green skirmishesbetween Somali security forces. Six killed in Haram Weyne, 11 in Wadajir. The motive behind each instance are not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Jubaland/AMISOM/US convoy targeted by IED near Yoontoy. No casualties reported. Convoy returned from an anti-al Shabaab raid IVO Yoontoy, the results of which are not known.
Gunshots fired at Fartun Birimo concert, 1 killed 6 injured, as a group of preachers clash with the singer's guards. The cause of the clash is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Early AM, Kolbiyow, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab attacked the Kenya Defence Force (KDF) base located near Kolbiyow. KDF forces conducted several sweep operations later this morning as a response to the attack. No causalities reported. The similar attack in the area occurred the previous day.
Al Shabaab attacked military base near Teed, assailants repelled. Casualties unknown.
Al Shabaab launched hit-and-run attack against a military base in vicinity of Afgooye. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
Protests in Gaalkacyo against illegally established checkpoints.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A KDF convoy en route from Sariile to Kolbiyow hit by an al Shabaab IED. One vehicle destroyed, 2 KDF killed.
An al Shabaab IED targets convoy transporting Somali regional officials including Southwest Minister of Security Abdirashid Janaan, no casualties. The attack took place outside of Luuq.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards a Djiboutian forward operating base. Several rounds landed inside the base. No casualties reported.
14:30EAT, KM3 - Villa Somalia, Mogadishu: 100-150 protesters marched to denounce green-on-green skirmishes on 26/07 involving Somali soldiers.
Detonation: As al Shabaab attempted to plant an IED at Bulo Mareer. However, it detonated prematurely, killing two. The prospective target of the blast is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 28th July, afternoon, IVO Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: a Djiboutian convoy was targeted by a roadside IED. The device detonated early and caused no causalities. The perpetrators were not listed by the source, though AMISOM have recently been fighting al Shabaab in the area.
11:45EAT, Ex-control Balcad, Mogadishu: an improvised explosive device (IED) detonated, injuring two civilians. Al Shabaab suspected perpetrators.
Early AM, Kabis, Gedo: a KDF airstrike targeted an al Shabaab training camp. The outcome of the attack is not known. This event may have occurred on 30/07.

29 July, c. 1715 hrs. Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked an government military position at Bacaacow village located in Afgoye District. The government forces withdrew from that position. Suspected al Shabaab took a three-wheeled motor vehicle and an unspecified amount of money. There were no reports of casualties.
29th July, 21:15EAT, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab fighters attacked a Somali National Police Force (SNPF) checkpoint. The attackers were repelled. Causalities not known.

29 July, c. 1620 hrs. A pastoralist who hailed from Shiekhaal clan was killed by armed men from Sa'ad clan at Kaalmoone vicinity (c. 170 km east of Galkayo) between Golol and Jariiban villages. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive was unknown.

ELAFWEYN, CRIME: A vehicle belonging to Sacad Yonis of Habar Yonis was ambushed and shot by militiamen from Biciido of Habar Jeclo at the vicinity of Elafweyn. The vehicle was travelling to Erigabo and was located a few kilometres away from Elafweyn. Two people were seriously injured.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: AM, IVO Tortoorow, Lower Shabelle: the United States (US) Pentagon confirmed its fighter jets had conducted an airstrike against Ali Mohamed Hussein aka 'Ali Jabal/Ali Jesto', the al Shabaab shadow governor of Mogadishu, in the evening of 29th July. Subsequent reports indiciate the strike occurred on 30/08. The US military later announced the strike was successful. Al Shabaab later confirmed this in late August 2017. It is not clear if other al Shabaab figures were present.

30 July. Youth in Erigabo demonstrated against the electoral commission of Somaliland. The demonstration was prompted after personnel from the electoral commission conducted voter card distribution from Burao. The demonstrators burnt tires and announced that voter card distribution would not take place unless the personnel were hired from among the locals.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 30 July, c. 2145 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM Djiboutian contingent base located at the West of Bulo Burte district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about five minutes after which AS withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 10:00EAT, Marka - Buulo Mareer road, Lower Shabelle: an al Shabaab ambush of an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy escalated into wider skirmishes. Al Shabaab claims 51 Ugandan forces killed in the battle, though some believe this figure is exaggerated. They further claim ""top"" commanders were killed in the battle. Ugandan forces claim 12 dead. Wider reports suggest the number is between 20-25.
Early AM, IVO Janaale, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab fighters attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) outpost. The assailants were repelled. Causality figures not known.

30 July. A huge demonstration was held in Buhodle against Khatumo political party. The residents protested of the involvement of Khatumo top officials in talks with Somaliland. Clan elders addressed the protestors to defuse tension. The demonstration ended peacefully.

30 July, c. 1130 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters abducted five young children in the outskirts of Qoryoley district. The abducted children were said to be in same family. Al Shabaab elements took the victims into AS controlled areas. The motive behind the incident remains unknown.

30 July, c. 1620 hrs. Two men from Ugaar Saleeban sub-clan were shot and killed by an armed perpetrator, said to be hailing from Osman Mohamud Bahyaaquub sub clan, in Qardho. Police arrested the perpetrator. The motive was not clear.

Al Shabaab intercepted and opened fire towards 4 local RAS NGO workers transporting child nutrition packages on 4 donkeys. One NGO worker & cargo kidnapped. $1.500 demanded to family relatives. Authorities believe al Shabaab kidnappings are an indication of the group's financial problems.
30th July, 22:20EAT, Warta Nabada, Mogadishu: an al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade towards a security checkpoint, injuring two civilians

11:05EAT, Makka al Mukarama road, Mogadishu: a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) detonated between Makka al Mukarama Hotel and the Wabeeri Police Station after being chased by security forces. Fifteen killed, plus injuries. Al Shabaab are suspected as perpetrators.

30 July, c. 2030 hrs. A mortar round, fired from an unknown direction, landed at the Bar and Restaurant neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. Initial reports indicated that at least one civilian bystander was seriously injured and rushed to a hospital nearby the scene. NISA and police forces cordoned off the area and carried out search operations.
Angered by recent army infighting, Mogadishu residents protest recent acts and throwing stones at passing cars, lighting fires and blocking roads.
Violent protest against a court ruling in Hodan on 31/07. The demonstrators burnt tyres in parts of Wadada Warshadaha road.

31 July, c. 1830 hrs. Government forces ambushed al Shabaab fighters near Doondardiir village (c. 23 km South West of Xudur). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the scene. One AS fighter was killed and two others were injured. SNA forces safely returned to their base in Xudur town.

Two clan militias reportedly (Biyo Maal and Habar-Gidir) exchanged heavy gun fire in Marka's Bulla Jaan Vicinity, Marka District. At least four combatants from both sides were allegedly killed while seven others were injured in the clan based skirmish. The clash continued into the next day. The fighting seized without third party intervention.
AM, Labaatan Jirow, Bay: a shootout between al Shabaab fighters over the repartition of taxes. Four killed, including the local al Shabaab Emir.

31st July, evening, Sinka Dheer Checkpoint, Mogadishu: a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) convoy was targeted by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Unknown causalities. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy along Hawa tako neighbourhood of Afgoye district exploded. The explosion damaged one vehicle and destroyed several shops at the roadside. There were no reports of casualties.
17:45EAT, Wabeeri, Mogadishu: an under-vehicle improvised explosive device (UVIED) planted under the car of an unidentified government official detonated. The official and two others were injured.
Defusal: KDF elements patrolling between Taraka and Faafax Dhun noticed IED. Device safely dismantled and brought to FOB Taraka.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Government officials marked 19 years of governance with an evening ceremony at the government municipality of Bossaso. A local resident was accidentally shot and injured when police fired warning shots in the air to disperse the crowds.

Al Shabaab attackers reportedly driving three-wheeled motor vehicle locally known as 'Bajaj' hurled a hand grenade at military checkpoint in Tarabunka junction, Hodan District. The police forces in the district said that at least five persons, two of them NISA soldiers were wounded in the blast. Reports added that suspected attackers believed to be behind the attack were arrested by security forces. The motive of the attack remains unknown.

A vehicle full of explosives was left parked at a carwash located in Kumade area in Farjano neighbourhood for washing purpose and was remotely detonated by suspected al Shabaab. More than 10 civilians were reportedly injured as the result of the explosion. The Shabelle Media Network later reported 11 had died in the blast. Jubaland Security forces carried out search operation in Kismayo town in order to apprehend the perpetrators. The injured victims were taken to Kismayo hospital for treatment.
Two militias hailing from rival Leeka-Caase/Darod clan confront near Galdogob over land control. One militiaman killed and 4 injured. Elders mediation started.

Two clan militias reportedly (Biyo Maal and Habar-Gidir) exchanged heavy gun fire in Marka's Bulla Jaan Vicinity, Marka District. At least four combatants from both sides were allegedly killed while seven others were injured in the clan based skirmish. The clash began the previous day on 31/07. The fighting seized without third party intervention.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 01st August, afternoon, Cabdow Dibile, Lower Shabelle: an AMISOM vehicle was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Four Ugandan soldiers were injured by the blast. Perpetrators not known.
15:30EAT, Jowhar, Middle Shabelle: unidentified gunmen opened fire against a civilian minibus. Three killed, four injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an unspecified number of mortar rounds against AMISOM position in Qoryole district. Reports are that one of the mortar shells landed a residential area in the city. At least one person was reportedly injured in the attack. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility of the attack.

Makane gunmen shot and injured a civilian man hailing from Makane clan at Buundo-Weyne neighbourhood in Beletweyne town. The motive behind the attack was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The victim was taken to Beletewyne hospital for treatment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: IED targets AMISOM convoy travelling between Leego and Wanlaweyn. One vehicle damaged. Driver injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF forces discover and dismantle an al Shabaab IED 4km from Qansax Dheere.

Two groups of al Shabaab elements clashed for unknown reasons in Haaway settlement at Sablaale district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire. At least one al Shabaab fighter was injured. The reason behind the attack could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an unspecified number of mortar rounds against AMISOM position in Qoryole district. Reports are that one of the mortar shells landed a residential area in the city. At least one person was reportedly injured in the attack. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility of the attack. The attack either occurred on 01/08 or 02/08.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Thousands of local residents conducted a violent demonstration at the main market of Bossaso, in protest to the high inflation and price hike. Protesters stoned the police and blocked the road in the area. Police fired warning shots in the air to disperse the crowds. 15 people were reportedly injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Puntland security forces and Dervish soldiers conducted security operations in Ceeldahir and Galgoxle areas (c. 90 km and 55 km South and South West of Bossaso) where they detained an unspecified prominent al Shabaab member (name not provided) and two other al Shabaab members. It is not known in which town the commander was apprehended. The detained were taken to PSF base for investigation.
10:00EAT, IVO Digfer Hospital, Mogadishu: al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a military officer in Hodan. A bystander was also killed in the incident.

Suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed a policeman at Gawo-Godey neighbourhood in Wadajir district. The perpetrators escaped. The body of the deceased was brought to the CID for further investigations. The motive of the attack was unknown.
An Oromo refugee from Ethiopia was shot on his leg by Somaliland Police in Hargeyssa. He is currently in Hargeyssa Hospital. The reason for the shooting is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AM, IVO near Kismayo, Lower Jubba: a Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) convoy was targeted by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). The resulting causality figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: RCIED explosion misses ENDF convoy. No injuries or damages reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM base of Arbacow. Mortars used as trigger of the attack, followed by small arms fire. Causality numbers not known.
Disishe and Ismail Saleban sub-clans clashed at Fuluja and Kalabeyr areas (c. 65 km South of Bossaso) due to a land dispute. There were an unspecified number of casualties at the time of reporting.
Disishe and Ismail Saleban sub-clans clashed at Fuluja and Kalabeyr areas (c. 65 km South of Bossaso) due to a land dispute. There were an unspecified number of casualties at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: An al Shabaab IED explodes near Djiboutian checkpoint at entrance of Jalalaqsi. No casualties reported.

Government troops attacked Cali Fooldheere settlement (c. 10 km North East of Mahaday district). Information suggested that al Shabaab fighters planted an IED at a local well in the area and withdrew. The IED exploded prematurely. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab claim IED attack against ENDF convoy between Wajid and Baidoa. Al Shabaab claim 4 ENDF killed 2 injured. Claims unverified.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland convoy is struck by an al Shabaab IED, casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 03 Aug, c. 1245 hrs. GURA-ARBA: Jubbaland police forces at Diif village (c. 75 km North East of Dhobley) intercepted two al Shabaab suspects near Gur-Arba village (c. 22 km East of the Somali-Kenya border). There was a brief armed clash. An al Shabaab fighter, suspected to be from Tanzania, and a Jubbaland forces officer were reportedly killed. Jubbaland forces managed to apprehend the second AS fighter. Jubbaland forces recovered the body of the AS fighter, some Kenya Shilling and a number of pistols. The dead bodies and the detained AS fighter were taken to Dif village. Information indicated that the AS fighters were destined to cross the border into Kenyan territory.

An RCIED buried at a restaurant frequented by government forces exploded at Siisii village neighbourhood in Karan district. Several soldiers chewing khat were present at the tea shop when the explosion occurred. At least five soldiers were killed three others were wounded in the blast. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Defusal: BNDF foot patrol notices an al Shabaab IED. Device safely dismantled.
Civilians took the streets to protest against high inflation rate and appearance of fake bank notes. Protests remained peaceful.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: IED targets ENDF convoy travelling between Wajid and Baidoa. Device detonates prematurely, no casualties nor injuries.
04th August, 18:45EAT, IVO Ambassador Hotel, Mogadishu: a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) detonated, killing two and injuring eight. Al Shabaab suspected.
UPDF troops vacate a base in Leego. Al Shabaab fighters seen moving towards the base. It was later reported al Shabaab had indeed taken control of the city.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An RCIED detonated against an ENDF convoy headed to Baidoa near Dhay-Dhayki (c. 50 km North West of Baidoa). An ENDF soldier was injured and a vehicle was damaged. The convoy proceeded to Baidoa. Perpetrators not known.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 04th August, evening, Xerale, Galgaduud: armed clashes erupted between Ahlu Sunna Waljama'a fighters and Galmudug soldiers. The reason for the violence and the causality figures unknown.

At least two people were killed in an apparent car bomb blast on a major street in Mogadishu on the evening of 04/08. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators. It is not known if the protractors were present at the time of attack, or had simply wired the bomb to a timer.

Residents, who opposed the ruling of the Somali Military Court to execute a soldier for murder of the Minister of Public works and Reconstruction, protested after Friday prayers at Tarabunka, Hodan area. The demonstrators chanted slogans against the military court claiming that the ruling was unfair and demanded FGS to intervene. Police and NISA blocked the roads in the area. There were no reports of casualties.
04th August, 21:30EAT, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: unidentified gunmen assassinated a clan elder.

04th August, 22:30EAT, Arafat, Mogadishu: al Shabaab militants assassinated the Somali governor of Galgaduud region and his brother. The group claimed responsibility. The Islamic State also claimed responsibility for the incident, however claimed the victim was a senior Somali intelligence officer.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF convoy from Wajid to Baidoa notices IED at Lafaale. Device safely dismantled. No casualties nor injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al-Shabab mujahedeen movement fighters have attacked Djibouti troops' base in Bulo-berde district the night of 05/08. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: At least seven soldiers (ENDF and Somali) were reported to have been killed and several others wounded after two al Shabaab IEDs targeted convoys in Waajid (four deaths) and Goof Guduud (three deaths).

An RCIED planted on the road side c. 03 km North of Jowhar exploded outside of Jowhar district. It was reported that two government battle wagons were travelling on the road but the IED detonated at a distance between the two vehicles resulting no fatalities. Perpetrators not known.
05 July, c. 0920 hrs. : One person was killed and two others were injured at Galo vicinity (c. 40 km East of Dhusamaereb) over clan feuds between Duduble and Ayr, sub clans of Habrgidir.

An RCIED exploded on a rickshaw headed to Baidoa near Haween village (c. 20 km North West of Baidoa). The rickshaw was destroyed. Two civilians were killed and three others were critically injured. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: At least seven soldiers (ENDF and Somali) were reported to have been killed and several others wounded after two al Shabaab IEDs targeted convoys in Waajid (four deaths) and Goof Guduud (three deaths).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF convoy from Wajid to Baidoa targeted by IED. Device detonated prematurely. No casualties nor injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: IED targets BNDF foot patrol 2.5km SW of FOB Cali Fool Dheere. Device detonates 30m in front of the patrol. No casualties nor injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: IED targets BNDF foot patrol 4.5 km SW of Cali Fool Dhere. Device detonated prematurely. No casualties nor injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Defusal: UPDF foot patrol conducting C-IED sweep before logistics convoy destroyed IED. No casualties.

06 Aug, c. 1100 hrs. Hundreds of people, hailing from Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan, staged a demonstrating on the main road of Beergadiid village (c. 50 km North of Beletweyne). The protesters were demonstrating against the three declared districts by the President of Hirshabelle. The demonstration impacted vehicles that use the road from Beletweyne to other parts of Somalia. Some local elders held a press conference at the village and stated that they had no confidence with the administration of Hirshabelle.
Early AM, Marka, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab fighters attacked two Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) defensive positions. The assailants were repelled. The causality figures are not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Joint AMISOM Burundi/SNAF combat patrol hit by RCIED. 1 BNDF soldier killed, 4 injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: About 300 local residents conducted a violent demonstration at the main market in Bossaso in protest to high inflation of the Somali shilling. Security forces intervened and dispersed the crowds at c. 0950 hrs. 40 protesters, including 16 forex trade dealers, were arrested and taken to the central police station for further investigation. There were no reports of immediate casualties.
A government soldier shot and killed a driver of a mini-bus at Ex-Control Afgoye in Dharkenley district. The soldier and the driver disputed over extortion money. The perpetrator escaped.
AM, Karan, Mogadishu: a body was discovered along the coastline of Karan district. The identity of the perpetrator and the cause of death not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: An al Shabaab IED attempts to strike a BNDF convoy 600m SE of FOB Cali Fool Dheere. The device misses, hitting a herd of goats.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Ethiopian troops entered Leego. Al Shabaab had withdrawn prior to the arrival of ENDF elements. FOB had been ransacked by civilians.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 Aug, c. 1230 hrs. An RCIED planted at Cali Fooldheere settlement (c. 10 km North East of Mahaday district) exploded. The explosion occurred when AMISOM troops were establishing a forward base at the location. At least four soldiers died and nine others were injured. Al Shabaab fighters claimed responsibility of the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 07th August, afternoon, IVO Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: a Burundi joint security forces convoy was ambushed by al Shabaab. An improvised explosive device (IED) was used to trigger the ambush. No casualties reported.
AM, Cali Fool Dheere, Middle Shabelle: Hiirshabelle security forces announced they had killed a unnamed al Shabaab leader on 07/08. The date of the operation is not known.
07th August, evening, Ceelasha Biyaha, Banadir: unidentified gunmen assassinated two civilians. The motives of the attack are not known.
Afternoon, Bossaso, Bari: suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinated the former Deputy Governor of Bari region. A suspect was arrested the following day.

12:45EAT, KM4, Mogadishu: the protection detail of a Member of Parliament (MP) opened fire towards protesters, killing two and injuring three. Two civilians were killed and three injured. The reason for the protest is not known. Following the shooting a larger, violent protest occurred. Demonstrators stopped and seized a AMISOM soldier during second protest.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12:45EAT, KM4, Mogadishu: the protection detail of a Member of Parliament (MP) opened fire towards protesters, killing two and injuring three. Two civilians were killed and three injured. The reason for the protest is not known. Following the shooting a larger, violent protest occurred. Demonstrators stopped and seized a AMISOM soldier during second protest.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Early AM, Furuqley, Lower Shabelle: elements of the Danab Special Forces Battalion and an American support team raided an al Shabaab outpost. The outcome of the raid is not known.

AM, Hargeysa, Somaliland: several Members of Parliament (MP) were arrested by Somaliland forces after allegedly disrupting the Parliament's session following the election of a new Speaker. Reports indicate fist fights broke out among several MPs.
Afternoon, Wajid - Baidoa road, Bay: unidentified gunmen assassinated two civilians travelling on a motorbike.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: After a joint government/AMISOM convoy is attacked by al Shabaab, the forces respond and overtake Cali Fool Dheere. Causality numbers not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 08th August, evening, Gaduud, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards the newly installed Jubaland forward operating base (FOB). AMISOM-Kenya forces were also present. Six reported deaths.

Early AM, IVO Abal, southern Bakool: al Shabaab attacked positions held by fighters loyal to former Shabaab leader Sheikh Mukhtar Ali Robow 'Abu Mansoor'. Two successive attacks were repelled. 27 reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 09th August, afternoon, Baidoa - Qansax Dheere, Bay: an Ethiopian convoy was targeted by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). No reported causalities.
An al Shabaab laid IED detonates at personal residence of SNAF officer. The target was injured.
Al Shabaab assassinates a Puntland intelligence officer in Bossaso. It is not known if the victim was a member of the military.

Defusal: 15:30EAT, Daynile, Mogadishu: Mogadishu Stabilisation Forces (MoSF) intercepted a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) at a security checkpoint in Daynile. The driver, who is believed to be al Shabaab, was taken into custody.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked the Burundi forward operating base of Cali Fool Dheere. RPG and small arms fire recorded. No casualties reported.
An al Shabaab IED targets a civilian vehicle. Four passengers killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Afternoon, north of Kismayo, Lower Jubba: a Jubaland Security Forces (JSF) convoy was targeted by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Two civilians bystanders were killed in the blast.

AM, Abal, Bakool: Southwest forces, supported by fighters loyal to former militant leader Sheikh Mukhtar Ali Robow, recaptured Abal. Al Shabaab forces had fled the settlement before the Robow forces gained access. No causalities.

Armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, shot and killed two SNA soldiers hailing from Jijeele clan at Maroodile area (c. 22 km West of Beletweyne). The soldiers were traveling from Beletweyne to Farlibaax during the incident. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

10 Aug, c. 1520 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters attacked clan militia base (not named) at KM 50 villages in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire that lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least two people were killed.
Clashes between Biyomaal and Habargidir resumed. Casualties unknown. Calm returned on 11 August.
Two groups of SNA forces clashed for unknown reasons in Wanleweyn district. There was an exchange of gunfire in the city. A male bystander was killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds into Cali Fooldhere village (c. 10 Km North East of Mahaday district) where joint forces had taken control of the village. There were no reports of fatalities.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab's Somali Memo claimed fighters ambushed Jubaland convoy near Afmadow. Al Shabaab claimed 10 Jubaland soldiers killed. No independent verification.
Men armed with knives stabbed civilian. Assailants escaped the scene. Motives, outcome of the victim unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked a troop position at the Livestock Market in Heliwa district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: IED targets a AMISOM-Uganda convoy in Marka District near KM67. Resulting casualty figures unknown.

A soldier manning a CP at Ifka Xalane's neighbourhood shot and killed a civilian man driving a vehicle. It was alleged that the victim was approaching the CP in ignorance of the instructions of the soldiers.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: U.S. military announced two new airstrikes against al-Shabab near Mogadishu. The operation killed a ""high level leader."" Other causalities not known. The airstrike took place on 10/08.
A vehicle packed with explosives detonates along Makka Al-Mukarama Road in Mogadishu. Nearby soldiers respond with gunfire. Three injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Early AM, Welmaro, Lower Jubba: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) aircraft conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab positions. Al Shabaab causality figures not known. Local residents suggested the airstrike killed livestock and injured civilians.
Men armed with knives stabbed civilian. Assailants escaped the scene. Motives, outcome of the victim unknown.

11th August, afternoon, Abal, southern Bakool: al Shabaab launched another attack against Sheikh Mukhtar Ali Robow's positions. The attackers were repelled. The battle wounded al-Shabab's deputy commander, Mahad Warsame Qalay alias Mahad Karataay. Other causalities not known.
Clashes between Biyomaal and Habargidir resumed. Casualties unknown. Calm returned on 11 August.
Two people killed and over 12 injured during shelling of Burane. Unknown if perpetrators were AMISOM or al Shabaab.
An RCIED allegedly planted (likely placed by al Shabaab before their exit from the town) at Cali Fooldhere settlement in Mahaday District exploded. A young female bystander died.

Militia from Suleiman clan, sub clan of Habargidir, shot at a car traveling on the road between Dhabad and Abudwak. Three people from Marehan clan were injured. All the victims were among the passengers. The incident was related to previous clan feuds.
11th August, afternoon, Jamaame, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab executed two suspected Jubaland spies.

A pastoralist who hailed from Sa'ad clan was shot and killed by another pastoralist hailing from Omar Mohamud clan near Xanan-god area (c. 40 km east of Galkayo). It was believed that the incident was in connection to previous clan revenges between the two clans.
Gunman assassinate elder in Hawl Wadaag. Perpetrator escaped. Motives unknown.
SNAF foot patrol hit by IED. 1 SNAF injured.
At least two people were killed and several others injured on 11/08 in a suicide bomb attack at a mosque in Somali capital Mogadishu. Perpetrators not identified by source.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Arrests: Djiboutian troops, tipped-off by locals, raid safe house hosting IED factory. One al Shabaab IED expert, likely a commander, arrested.

column6: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Prison Guards
column17: An al Shabaab suicide bomber and a guard at Mogadishu's central prison have been killed in an attack targeting the commander of Somalia's custodial corps. Others reports claim four dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF convoy from Baidoa to Qansax Dheere targeted by IED 25km east of Qansax Dheere at Birigay. Device detonated prematurely, no casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for attack on ENDF base in Halgan. Casualty figures and incident unverified.

12 Aug. Armed men, believed to be Dulbahante Liberation Front members, attacked a convoy transporting Somaliland voter cards near Holhol (near Las Anod). There was heavy exchange of gunfire between Somaliland security forces escorting the convoy and Dhulbahante Liberation Front after which the militia was repulsed. A Somaliland soldier was killed.
AM, IVO Garbahaarey, Gedo: al Shabaab attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) checkpoint. The assailants were repelled. Resulting causality figures not known.

Unidentified men shot and killed an South-West administration special police officer at Berdale neighbourhood in Baidoa. The perpetrators took the rifle of the victim. The motive behind the killing was unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. There were no reports of arrests in connection to the incident.

12 Aug. Two individuals from Samokaaab-Ali sub clan of Dulbahante exchanged gunfire near Taleh. They misunderstood each other as adversaries from the rival Farah Ali sub clan. One died and the other was arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters carjacked a civilian vehicle and killed the owner of the vehicles at Burmadoobe area (c. 12 km West of Beletweyne town). The victim hailed from Habargidir clan. The motive behind the killing was unknown. Al Shabaab fighters managed to escape from the scene with the vehicles.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AM, IVO Diinsoor, Bay: an Ethiopian explosive ordnance disposal (EOD) technician was reportedly killed while attempting to defuse a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Perpetrators not known.

12 Aug. Armed Pro-Puntland militiamen (not identified) attacked a Somaliland polling station near Halin village in order to disrupt voter card distribution. Somaliland armed forces guarding the station repulsed the attack. Three civilian bystanders sustained injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Afternoon, Godod, Mudug: unverified reports suggested Puntland forces killed one civilian and injured two others, reasons unknown.
AM, Suuqa Xoloha, Mogadishu: suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a Somali policeman. The assailants escaped with the officer's weapon.

Government troops based at Bakara market shot and killed a civilian man at the market in Howlwadag district. The troops suspected the deceased man after he failed to follow instructions. There were no reports of arrests.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 12th August, afternoon, IVO Luuq, Gedo: al Shabaab ambushed an Ethiopian convoy. The assailants were repelled, no reported causalities. This event may have occurred on 11/08.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab news propaganda reports Ethiopian forces killed four civilians at a watering hole in Maykaareebi on or before 12/08.
AM, IVO Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud: a unidentified gunmen opened fire against a civilian bus. The gunman was later killed by security services. Causalities from the initial bus attack not known.
An al Shabaab fighter hurled hand grenade against military checkpoint. No casualties, assailant escaped.
AM, Muuri, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab recaptured Muuri after Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) vacated their positions.
AM, Farlibaax, Hiiraan: al Shabaab executed an alleged Ethiopian spy. (*not clear if the victim was an Ethiopian spy or a spy for Ethiopia.)
AM, IVO Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud: a unidentified gunmen opened fire against a civilian bus. The gunman was later killed by security services. Causalities from the initial bus attack not known.
A man from Habar-Ciise clan, sub-clan of Marehan, was shot and killed by an armed man from Celi clan, sub-clan of Marehan, at Abudwak town. The motive of the killing was unknown.

Agreement: Mukhtar Robow, a former al Shabaab commander, who had a split with the group and who's militia has recently fought with al Shabaab in Abal, is flown to Mogadishu where he ""defected"" to the Somali government.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 Aug, c. 1600 hrs. Suspected anti-al Shabaab forces (possibly American) conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab hideout at Koban village area (c. 40 km North of Kismayo district). An al Shabaab Toyota pick- up with an unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters on board was destroyed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: AM, Buur Hakaba district, Bay: suspected US fighter jets conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab high-value target (HVT) convoy. The outcome of the operation is not known.

14 Aug, c. 2100 hrs. A man sitting in a coffee shop in Guriel town was shot and injured after two armed men attacked him. Both the victim and perpetrators hailed from Ceyr, sub-clan of Habargidir. It was believed that the incident was in connection to clan feuds between the two sub- clans. The victim was rushed to hospital for treatment. The perpetrators escaped from the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF convoy travelling to Buurdhuubo noticed 2 IEDs. Devices safely dismantled. Believing them responsible, three camel elders were tortured and assassinated by soldiers in the aftermath.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AM, IVO Gaduud (near Yoontoy Yarey), Lower Jubba: al Shabaab ambushed a joint security forces convoy, including Jubaland, AMISOM and possible US forces. No casualties reported.

10:52EAT, IVO Jazeera Palace Hotel, Mogadishu: an under-vehicle improvised explosive device (UVIED) planted under a taxi detonated, killing the vehicle's driver. The vehicle may have been targeted as it frequently transports government officials. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF EOD team dismantle IED 20km east of Garbahaarey. No casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF EOD team dismantle IED 12km from Garbahaarey. No casualties.

Residents in Lasanod demonstrated to protest of the introduction of new Somali currency in town as local businesses refused to trade using the old currency. Lasanod residents transact in both Somaliland and Somali shilling.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM base in Mashalay settlement (c. 07 km South East of Qoryoley district). There was an exchange of gunfire that lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

Dulbahante Liberation Front militiamen attacked a voter card distribution centre at Gorofle in Taleh district. It was unconfirmed that the assailants took all equipment and cards at the centre. Several militiamen were wounded and a battle wagon was captured by Somaliland army. It is not known if the Somaliland forces were guarding to centre, or arrived following the attack.
Cali Geri and Reer Hagar sub clans of Dulbahante clan clash in or near Buuhoodle ""recently"". Date, outcome of the clash not known. The clash led to a protest on 23/08.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Armed al Shabaab attackers ambushed an AMISOM convoy travelling between Golweyn and Buulo Mareer areas. An explosion was reported. Causality number not known.
Khatumo and forces loyal to Somaliland (not named) clash in Sool, Sanaag and Ceyn over the distribution of voter cards. Exact locations of fighting and causality information not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM/government case at Bulo Mareer. The attackers were repelled. There was not a causality report.
At least one person was confirmed dead, several injured after unknown gunmen have opened fire on a vehicle in Hodan on the morning of 15/08. Hiiraan reports three dead, plus injuries.
Unknown gunmen have shot and killed a civilian in Garasbaley area, Dharkenley on 15/08.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM base near Qoryoley. Assailants repelled, no casualties.
Khatumo and forces loyal to Somaliland (not named) clash in Sool, Sanaag and Ceyn over the distribution of voter cards. Exact locations of fighting and causality information not known.
Khatumo and forces loyal to Somaliland (not named) clash in Sool, Sanaag and Ceyn over the distribution of voter cards. Exact locations of fighting and causality information not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Non-violent activity: A US aerial drone crashes near Ceelasha Biyaha.
Detonation: 16th August, evening, Bossaso, Bari: a suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade towards the SOMNET Telecommunications services company offices. No causalities reported.
AM, Garasbaley, Mogadishu: unidentified gunmen assassinated a civilian. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED buried beside the road along Qurac Madoobe neighbourhood exploded on an AMISOM convoy between Cali Fooldhere and Mahaday areas in Mahaday district. The explosion damaged an AMISOM truck. AMISOM troops and al Shabaab fighters at the location allegedly exchanged gunfire. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

1630 hrs. A pastoralist from Sa'ad clan was shot and killed by another pastoralist from Omar Mohamud clan near Sarjimale area (c. 60 km east of Galkayo). It was believed that the incident was in connection to previous clan retaliations between the two clans.
Early AM, Wabeeri, Mogadishu: suspected al Shabaab assassinated a Mogadishu Stabilisation Force (MoSF) soldier.

Unknown armed assailants using pistols shot and killed a prominent Somali football referee at Hamar Bile neighbourhood in Wardhigley district. The referee left the Mosque and was headed to his residence when the attackers shot him. The culprits escaped. The motive of the incident was unknown.

10 people are known to have been killed and up to 20 others wounded in fighting between rival militia in Herale. The fighting which took place [17th of August] was between a local militia and rivals that are in support of Ahlu Sunna Wal Jama (though not necessarily Ahlu Sunna Wal Jama).

At least six people were injured following a roadside landmine explosion outside a restaurant in Somali capital Mogadishu's Wardhigley district during the evening hours. The motive of the attack was not immediately clear and no group has claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Early AM, Sheikh Ahmed Yare settlement (near Jilib), Middle Jubba: unverified social media reports suggested a suspected United States (US) drone strike had targeted a high- profile al Shabaab leader. The Somali government claims seven al Shabaab dead in the strike; others claim seven civilians dead.

Clashes opposed rival clan militias. 2 killed 5 injured. Motives unknown. At least 16 people were killed and 37 others were wounded throughout the three day affair. (Divided among days - It is known that two of the 16 were killed on the first day, 17/08.)
Unidentified gunmen assassinated a FGS tax collection officer. Assailants escaped.
Defusal: IED noticed on land belonging to Mahaday District Commissioner. IED safely dismantled by SNAF (Hiirshabelle) EOD team.

Armed clashes resumed near Herale. At least 16 people were killed and 37 others were wounded throughout the three day affair. (Divided among days - It is known that two of the 16 were killed on the first day, 17/08.)

Unidentified attackers, believed to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at a government force position at Mahadey Bridge in Mahaday district. Two soldiers were allegedly injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
18 Aug. Two Somaliland soldiers were shot and killed by armed masked men in Lasanod. The Ministry of Interior of Somaliland attributed the perpetrators to be al Shabaab.

Unknown armed men shot and killed a civilian man at Horseed village in Jowhar district over an unknown dispute. The culprits escaped. Suspected perpetrators were arrested and detained at Jowhar Police Station.

Unidentified armed men, suspected to be military forces, shot and injured a 16-year-old boy at Radaar area of Koshing neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The incident occurred after the victim refused to surrender his smartphone and attempted to escape. The victim was rushed to Beletweyne Main Hospital for further treatment. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene but were later arrested after a joint search operation was conducted by security forces. The arrested were taken to the police station for further investigation.

Suspected Anti-al Shabaab forces (unknown identity) conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab hideout location at Wayaamo-Lo'aad grazing area (c. 90 km South West of Kismayo town). Casualties from attack remain unknown.

An armed civilian man from Gaaljecel clan was shot and killed by a civilian from Marehan clan over a land dispute at Saca moja vicinity via Afmadow section in Kismayo town. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene before arrival of the security forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired around two mortar rounds against Jubbaland forces based at Buulo-gudud village (c.30 km North of Kismayo town). The mortar shells landed at locations in the village. There were no reports of casualties.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a civilian watchman at Tabelaha market in Tabelah Shiekh Ibrahim suburb of Dayniile district. The perpetrators managed to escape. Security forces arrested suspected people.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against PSF base near the Galgala Mountains, 1 PSF killed 2 injured. Al Shabaab claimed 12 PSF killed.
IED detonated near KDF foot patrol. Detonated prematurely, no casualties nor injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab were reported to have launched an attack against base manned by Djibouti peacekeepers in Bulo Burto. There was no immediate confirmation of the casualties from both sides. However, Somali military officials reported attack repulsed by the African Union forces.

19th August, evening, Jowhar, Middle Shabelle: a suspected al Shabaab fighter hurled a hand grenade towards the personal residence of a Hiirshabelle official. No causalities reported. The attack escaped the scene.

Armed clashes continued for the third day at Xeraale. At least 16 people were killed and 37 others were wounded throughout the three day affair. (Divided among days - It is known that two of the 16 were killed on the first day, 17/08.)
13:00EAT, Buuhoodle, Togdheer: armed clashes erupted between Khatumo and Somaliland forces. At least three killed. The violence is linked to the distribution of ballot boxes in the area.

Cali Geri and Reer Hagar sub clans of Dulbahante clan clashed at Buhodle on 19/08. One of the clans failed to surrender a clansman who was responsible for a murder incident in the past. Eight fatalities and unspecified number of causalities were reported.
AM, Horseed neighbourhood, Jowhar, Middle Shabelle: unidentified gunmen assassinated a civilian, motives not known.

A civilian is assassinated in Ceelasha Biyaha by two gunmen armed with pistols suspected to be al Shabaab. Later reports suggest the victim may have been a government soldier. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: AM, Bariire, Lower Shabelle: joint security forces (AMISOM, SNG, and USA) captured Bariire from al Shabaab. The resulting causality figures not known.
12:00EAT, IVO Bariire, Lower Shabelle: a civilian vehicle was hit by a roadside IED. Seven occupants were killed by they blast. Perpetrator identity believed to be al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AM, Tortoorow, Lower Shabelle: African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) forces shelled al Shabaab positions. The resulting causality figures are not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Afternoon, Sugure, Bari: a Puntland Security Forces (PSF) patrol was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). One Puntland soldier was injured by the blast. Perpetrators not named by the source, however al Shabaab forces launched an attack on a military base on the same day elsewhere in Bossaso region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab was reported to have launched a mortar attack against Somali and AMISOM forces bases in Bariire area. According to the sources, some of the mortar shells landed inside the army barracks, and caused unidentified number of the casualties on the SNA and AMISOM forces.
Al Shabaab attacked government army outposts in Afgooye on 20/08. There was no immediate confirmation of the casualties as result of the fighting.

Al Shabaab combatants attacked an military defensive base at Mahadey district near the bridge (c. 23 km North East of Jowhar town) and briefly took control of the location. Military forces launched a counter attack and regained control of the location. The police station was burnt by al Shabaab. Two SNA soldiers were killed and another was injured between the location's capture and subsequent liberation.

Al Shabaab combatants attacked an military defensive base at Mahadey district near the bridge (c. 23 km North East of Jowhar town) and briefly took control of the location. SNA launched a counter attack and regained control of the location. The police station was burnt by al Shabaab. Two SNA soldiers were killed and another was injured.

Al Shabaab fighters and ISWA (Southwest Administration) forces clashed at Siji village (c. 30 km North East of Wajid district). Al Shabaab fighters pursued the state forces escorting a truck they intercepted near Buurdhuxunle village. The truck was headed to Burdhuxunle village which was under the control of al Shabaab fighters. ISWA forces managed to defend against AS fighters to recover the truck. The soldiers and the track arrived in Wajid district. Causalities not known.

20 Aug, c. 1310 hrs. A tax collector working for the Hiiraan Administration was shot and injured by an armed man hailing from Gaaljecel clan in Hawlwadag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne. Motive of the attack is not known.

AM, Xerale, Galgaduud: unverified media reports suggested fighters of the Sufi group Ahlu Sunna Waljama'a may have fired mortar rounds towards Xerale. The heavy fire were followed by a general attack. Two deaths reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 20th August, evening, IVO Balcad, Middle Shabelle: a Burundian convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). The vehicle was damaged. The resulting causality figures not known, however Calamada on 21 August reported seven soldier deaths.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 20th August, afternoon, IVO Cadaado, Galgaduud: armed clashes erupted between Galmudug forces and unidentified clan militias. The clash began over rights to a checkpoint. Between two - six deaths reported.
Non-violent activity: Early AM, Caanoole Bariire, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab blockaded the roads leading to Bariire and Caanoole by setting up checkpoints and defensive positions.

21 Aug c. 2130 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters attacked the military base at Barrire area (c. 22 km South West of Afgoye town). There was an armed confrontation after which al Shabaab elements were forced to retreat. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting.
Al Shabaab attacked an army troop position in Qoryoley town. SNA responded strongly forcing al Shabaab elements to retreat. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting.
Early AM, IVO Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab fighters attacked a SNAF military base. SNAF subsequently conducted several large security sweeps. No reported causalities.

Early AM, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked a military base. Unconfirmed reports indicate al Shabaab may have temporarily entered the city proper. Two soldiers reported killed and an officer injured.
Arrests: Somaliland police arrested a senior member of Waddani political party in Hargeisa for an undisclosed reason. He was detained at 150 Road Police station.

Two armed men using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a civilian man near KPP junction in Hodan district. The victim was attacked shortly after he came out of Bakara market. The perpetrators escaped. Police forces arrived at the scene but no arrests were made. The motive of the killing was unknown.
Early AM, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab attacked a SNAF military base in Afgooye. One soldier, two al Shabaab killed.

22 Aug, c. 1100 hrs. ASWJ forces and clan militias loyal to ASWJ clashed with local militias that previously clashed at Herale village (c. 65 km North West of Dhusamareb). The recurrent fighting was related to previous clashes. Six people were killed and 11 others were wounded. The situation was reported to be calm but tension was high.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an AMISOM Djiboutian contingent base at the bridge located at the centre of Jalalaqsi town. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about five minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

22 Aug. Dulbahante and Warsangeli clans briefly clashed at Biyo Gudud (c. 50 km East of Erigabo). Two fatalities and an unspecified number of casualties were reported. The clash was as a result of clan territorial control.

22 Aug, c. 1930 hrs. Suspected al Shabaab elements ambushed a convoy of government security forces between Leego and Balidogle settlements in Wanla Weyn. There was an exchange of gunfire. At least three government soldiers were allegedly killed in the attack while more than two others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabab fighters reportedly attacked AMISOM base in Shalambood village 9 kms West of Marka District. AMISOM forces repelled the attack forcing al Shabaab to withdraw from the area. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Hundreds of people peacefully demonstrated against the recent (date not known) clan clashes between Cali Geri and Reer Hagar sub clans of Dulbahante clan. The demonstrators demanded for immediate reconciliation between the two clans.
22nd August, evening, IVO Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: suspected al Shabaab militants opened fire against a civilian minibus, killing three.

22 Aug, c. 1200 hrs. Three armed men hailing from Madhiban clan shot and killed a man from Reer Biciidyahan clan near Guure Hotel at Garsoor village in North Galkayo. The motive of the incident was believed be clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped from the area. Puntland police were reported to be investigating the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Early AM, Bariire, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab fired mortar rounds towards a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) military base. Several rounds landed within the bases' perimeter. Causality figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11:40EAT, Heliwa, Mogadishu: an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Two AMISOM soldiers injured, one civilian reported dead. Perpetrators believed to be al Shabaab.
Agreement: A senior Al-Shabaab fighter - Nur Ibrahim Abdulahi, head of health for the group in Galgudud region - on 23/08 surrendered to Somali National Army (SNA) in Mahas town.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly curried out a hit and run attack against Jajeele clan militias in Maroodile (c. 20kms West of Beletweyne town). Both sides briefly exchanged small arms gunfire. After five minutes of gun battle al Shabaab fighters retreated from the incident location carjacking a civilian transportation truck that was loaded with goods to Farlibaax Village. The clan Militias went after them and recovered the vehicle from the militias. No casualty was reported from the incident.
Green-on-green fighting reported in Belet Weyne. One injury reported.
AM, Yaaq Biri Weyne, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab fighters assassinated two Somali soldiers. The assailants escaped the scene.

Hundreds of demonstrators protested to show discontent at fake Somalia currency circulating in the region and burned unspecified amount of the currency. They requested Somali Federal Government to end this phenomenon and tackle those making the currency in Galkacyo and Adaado.
A clan elder is shot and killed on the evening of 23/08. Perpetrators not known. The following day security forces conducted a security operation. The outcome of the operation is not known.

Al Shabaab fighters opened fire at a rickshaw near Towsiile village (c. 15kms South East of Wajid district). A civilian riding the rickshaw was reportedly killed in the attack. The security forces of Wajid district went to the incident location and recovered the rickshaw and the victim's body. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly left the incident before the security forces arrive.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: Early AM, Xerale, Galgaduud: two people were killed during renewed clashes between Ahlu Sunna Waljama'a troops and militias (Galmudug) supporting the Interim Galmudug Administration.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: ASWJ forces recaptured Mareer-Gur village after Galmudug and ASWJ forces clashed at Mareer-Gur village (c. 28 Km North of Dhusamareb). There was exchange of sporadic gunfire between Galmudug and ASWJ forces, which lasted about 20 minutes, no casualties have been reported.

IED placed near Raadeerka village, Deynile District targeted Government officials travelling using the road. No vehicle was hit by the explosion and the officials narrowly escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Government forces and al Shabaab clash in Morodiile on or before 24/08. Three civilians reported dead.
Al Shabaab attacked government military base in Balcad district. Three SNAF soldiers killed.
Al Shabaab attacked government military base near Afgooye. Casualties unknown.
Al Shabaab attacked government military base near K50. Casualties unknown.

Local security forces on patrol shot and injured an al Shabaab member at Kaboley neighbourhood in Beled Hawa town. The al Shabaab member is believed to be visiting his family during the night. The local were informed of his arrival and followed him at his residence. Information indicates that he was instructed to surrender, but defied the order of the security forces. He was taken to Beled Hawa Police Station after the incident.

Unidentified men reportedly armed with pistols shot and killed district section head in Karan District. Suspected al Shabaab militants allegedly attacked the victim in a tea shop near Sanca Junction. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibly for the attack.
09:50EAT, Sana'a junction, Mogadishu: suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a businessman and district official in Yaaqshiid.
Defusal: SNPF EOD team dismantles UVIED planted under vehicle of NISA officer.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: A US drone strike targets a al Shabaab location 20km NW Bariire. Social media reports the strike killed between 9-10 civilians, though US AFRICOM denies this. The strike was in conjunction with a raid by Somali forces, which later reports indicate the civilians deaths occurred during the raid. Witnesses claim the civilian victims were ""shot one by one."" It is not known if the attack against civilian was intentional, or they were mistaken for combatants. The following day residents protested the violence. The US military has opened an investigation into the matter.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: A US drone strike targets a al Shabaab location 20km NW Bariire. Social media reports the strike killed between 9-10 civilians, though US AFRICOM denies this. The strike was in conjunction with a raid by Somali forces, which later reports indicate the civilians deaths occurred during the raid. Witnesses claim the civilian victims were ""shot one by one."" It is not known if the attack against civilian was intentional, or they were mistaken for combatants. The following day residents protested the violence. The US military has opened an investigation into the matter.
Habar Jeclo militias engage in a land dispute. Casualities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Al Shabaab gunmen assassination of NISA officer Abdikadir Iftiin.
Al Shabaab assassinated a security official in Faafax Dhuun. Some reports indicate the victim may have been a military officer. The attack may have occurred on 25/08.
AM, Bariire, Lower Shabelle: civilians protested against the 25 August killing of civilians by joint security forces.

Gunmen opened fire at residents and later confronted the police at Ali Saleeban neighbourhood in Burao over land ownership. Attackers claimed they acted because government failed to intervene. They were all arrested. No reported causality.
Deputy Commissioner of Gedo region Osman Nuur announced mid-ranking al Shabaab leader Ali Hussein surrendered to security forces in Baardheere. Date of surrender not provided.
26th August, afternoon, Galkacyo, Mudug: two women were killed by security forces during a shootout with an unknown actor at an internally-displaced person (IDP) camp.

Gunmen opened fire at residents and later confronted the police at Ali Saleeban neighbourhood in Burao over land ownership. Attackers claimed they acted because government failed to intervene. They were all arrested. No reported causality.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AM, Golweyn, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab claimed to have captured Golweyn from AMISOM after several rounds of attacks against security bases. Causalities from the operations not known.

16:20EAT, IVO Immigration headquarters building, Mogadishu: a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) cordoned-off by security forces exploded. Four people, including two police officers were injured by the blast. Perpetrators not known.
VBIED cordoned-off by MoSF detonates near Immigration HQ. 4 injured. VBIED green Toyota Surf AC1015. No reported causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab backed news sources reports the group attacked Djibouti forces at Jalalaqsi the night of 28/08. Members of the Djibouti forces ""may"" have suffered fatalities (coded as 10).
Local militiamen hailing from Hawadle clan clashed with local militiamen from Habargidir clan at Bukurre village in Teedaan grazing area (c. 60 km North of Maxaas district). Two injuries reported.
Afternoon, IVO Dhamaso, Gedo: al Shabaab fighters ambushed a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) convoy. Al Shabaab claimed to have killed five soldiers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNA base at Halane vicinity in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab militants withdrew. At least two civilians were injured by stray bullets.
Marehan/Darod militia killed three Sacad businessmen and injured two others. Clan motivated.
28th August, Doola Oomane, Mudug, near Gaalkacyo: two children were killed by the explosion of unexploded ordnance (UXO).
Early AM, Caluula, Bari: foreign fighter jets (identity not known) conducted an airstrike against suspected Islamic State positions.
Defusal: Security forces discover and dismantle a al Shabaab IED.

Kenyan forces clash with al Shabaab at Dhamase, along the Kenyan border near Ceel Waaq. Al Shabaab burnt a battle wagon belonging to KDF while seizing another lorry during the combat. Al Shabaab claimed ""many"" Kenyan soldiers dead (coded as 10).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 29 Aug, c. 1530 hrs. An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated near Buulo Marer town. An AMISOM lorry was damaged by the blast. AMISOM soldiers shot towards suspected directions of the attack. Two civilians killed in the crossfire. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
29th August, afternoon, Daynuunay, Bay: al Shabaab ambushed a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) patrol. At least two soldiers and an unconfirmed number of al Shabaab killed.
Agreement: AM, Tuula Gaduud, Gedo: a senior al Shabaab regional official known as Aden ""Abu Mujahid"" defected to Somali government forces in Tuula Gaduua, near Garbahaarey.
Two alleged Ethiopian migrants were shot and wounded by a human trafficker at Biyakulule area of South Bossaso. The motive was not clear. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AM, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) soldier shot dead a child.
Three children are killed when they play with a found explosive in Do'olo-Omane area, Mudug.
29th August, evening, Ceelasha Biyaha, Banadir: unidentified gunmen assassinated a businesswoman, reasons unknown.

29 Aug, c. 1730 hrs. Unidentified armed attackers using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a businesswoman at Bakara Market near Abbu- hureyre Mosque in Howlwadag District. The perpetrators escaped. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at Boondhere Police station in Boondhere district. The grenade landed on an empty place close to the station causing no harm or damage. Police shot at the general direction of the attack. The assailants allegedly escaped.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a civilian female at Tabeelaha Weydow neighbourhood. The civilian was killed as she left her teashop headed home. The motive for this assassination was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Southwest soldier kill civilian in Wajid IDP during food distribution. Perpetrator later arrested. Motives unknown.
A roadside blast targeted Kenyan forces travelling in Baardheere. One death and one injury from the explosion.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AM, Golweyn - Buulo Mareer road, Lower Shabelle: a Uganda African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). The convoy was subsequently engaged in small arms fire. Overall causality figures are not known, though it is believed that at least two civilians were killed in the crossfire. Shabelle Radio Network reports the attack took place on 29/08.
Habargidir militias assassinated a Biyomaal Madrasa teacher. Assailants escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM convoy struck by IED, one vehicle damaged, one injured.

Armed men from the same clan (unknown identity) clashed at Mirig Village (c. 15 km North of Dhusamareb) over a land dispute. There was an exchange of gunfire. Four people were killed and three others were injured. Local clan elders intervened and stopped the clashes.
AM, Godod, Mudug: armed clashes opposing rival unidentified clans left at least nine people killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol allegedly shot and killed two nomadic civilians, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, at the outskirts of Buulo-Mareer town in Kurtunwarey District.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Armed militias from Sa'ad clan attacked Puntland force army base at Jeexdin vicinity (c. 15 km East of Galkayo). One Sa'ad militiaman was killed and three Sa'ad militias and eight Puntland soldiers were wounded. It was believed that the incident was related to clan revenge.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 30 Aug, c. 0930 hrs. Jubaland security forces in Afmadow town clashed with al Shabaab fighters at Dodowajo IDP settlement (c. 05 km South East of Afmadow town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the scene. Initial reports from the area suggested that two al Shabaab fighters were killed and one AK47 was recovered from the scene.
30th August, 19:00EAT, Hawl Wadaag Junction, Mogadishu: al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade towards a Somali National Police Force (SNPF) patrol. The assailant escaped the scene. No injuries reported.
Al Shabaab fighter hurled hand grenade towards a police patrol. No casualties. Assailant escaped.

13:00EAT, Airport Road, Mogadishu: elements of the Mogadishu Stabilisation Force (MoSF) blockaded airport road to civilian traffic users. This was established in preparation of a VIP visit to an area hotel. During the blockade a solider shot and killed a civilian for unknown reason. The soldier was later apprehended.
Al Shabaab kidnap and behead Rahanweyn/Reer-Dumaal man. Victim allegedly involved in Southwest Parliament Elections in 2016.

A woman was shot and wounded after armed militiamen hailing from Sa'ad clan ambushed a residential house in Ballibusle town (c. 90 km East of Galkayo). It was believed that the incident was related to previous clan feuds. The clan identity of the victim is not known. The perpetrators managed to escape from the area.
A remote controlled IED targeting soldiers kills two civilians on 01/09.
