Protests erupted after Eid al Adha prayers against the extradition of ONLF official Qalbi Dagax. Five female organisers arrested by JSF Police. No reported violence from the protesters.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 01st September, early AM, Jilib, Middle Jubba: a suspected United States (US) airstrike killed an al Shabaab leader. The target, Abdirrahman Jarat, was killed. Further damages not reported by source.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: An airstrike was conducted by suspected American drones at Kunya-Barow village (c. 75 Km West of Barawe district). Purportedly, at least three missiles were fired against an al Shabaab convoy transporting at least two senior al Shabaab officers. Five al Shabaab fighters, including a top official and ex-AS Governor of Jubba regions, were killed and three others injured.
01st September, evening, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: unidentified gunmen assassinated a clan elder.
01st September, evening, Ceel Waaq, Gedo: suspected al Shabaab militants kidnapped two clan elders. The victims' bodies were discovered during the early hours of 02nd September.

Four nomads who belonged to Omar Mohamud sub clan of Majeerteen were killed by armed militia men hailing from Bahararsame sub clan of Dhulbahante clan at Gumburka Cagarweyne (c. 60 km North of Burtinle town) located at the border between Sool and Nugal regions and close to the Ethiopian border. The incident was attributed to previous clan feuds. A peace deal was agreed between the two clans and the situation returned to normal.

An RCIED targeting military vehicles detonated near the khat market neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. The device missed its target. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not known. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 1st September, Af Urur, Puntland: a coordinated improvised explosive device (IED) and mortar attack targeted a group of Puntland Security Forces (PSF) soldiers. Al Shaaab suspected as perpetrators. Several mortars were fired by al Shabaab fighters in the area after the VBIED attack. Four Dervish soldiers and three civilians were killed and 33 other soldiers and civilians were wounded.

2nd September, evening, Cagaare, Sool: suspected clan militiamen killed four civilians in Cagaare, near Lascanood in Sool region. The attack is likely related to clan revenge. The identities of the clans involved are not known. This evenT may have happened on 01/09.

Dulbahante and Majeerteen herders clashed at Gumbur Cagaare pasturelands. Three fatalities and an unspecified number of casualties were reported. Tension was reported to be high around the area as the respective clans mobilized militiamen from their respective clans.
Two auto-rickshaw drivers from Isse Mohamud clash for an undetermined reason. One death reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked an military base at Main bridge vicinity of Qoryoley district. SNA forces responded and forced al Shabaab militants to withdraw. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting.
Al Shabaab militants fired a mortar round towards an unidentified target in Bossaso. A round landed near a petrol station. No casualties reported.
A prominent clan elder is assassinated in Kismayo. Perpetrators not known.

Al Shabaab fighters stormed into the homes of two prominent elders from Gare sub-clan and killed them in Ceel Waaq district. Al Shabaab displayed the body of the two prominent elders at Cel Waaq town. The two elders were allegedly affiliated with the government.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 02nd September, evening, Bossaso, Bari: a suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade at a Puntland Police patrol. No causalities.

02nd September, evening, Boondheere, Mogadishu: al Shabaab claimed one of the group's fighters hurled several hand grenades against the Somali National Police Force (SNPF) station of Boondheere. Resulting causalities not known.

Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at military forces manning a checkpoint at Hawa-Taako neighbourhood in Beletweyne town. There were no reports of injuries. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.
Somali military forces shot and killed a woman at Moorgabey village (c. 30 km West of Xudur). The woman was affiliated to al Shabaab but the circumstances surrounding the incident were unknown.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped boy from Biyomaal. Victim later assassinated.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Early AM, Gaduud, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab fighters conducted a complex attack against the Jubaland Security Force (JSF) base located near Gaduud, 30km north of Kismayo. The attack began with a large explosion, which was followed by a small arms attack. Al Shabaab claims 26 Jubaland force dead. Some numbers have varied from other sources. The attackers were eventually repulsed.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at an military checkpoint near Nacnac Factory in Heliwa district. The grenade landed on an empty place close to the checkpoint. SNA shot at the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of casualties. The assailants escaped.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and severely injured a civilian man at Daryeel IDP camp in Kahda district. The victim was attacked on his way home after he came out from the IDP camp. The motive was not clear. The attackers managed to escape.

Kaxda, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: a suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade towards a group of civilians near a Mosque. Injuries reported. The perpetrator escaped the scene. The attack may have occurred on the previous day.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: JSF convoy travelling to Yoontoy hit by two IEDs. 3 JSF injured.

Biyamaal clan militia attacked Habargidir militia at Bullo - Jaan village in Merka district. There was an exchange of gunfire. At least two armed men were killed while three others were injured. Tension was reported to be high.
Al Shabaab claim IED attack on KDF vehicle near Baardheere, al Shabaab claimed 4 injured and ""several"" killed. Exact numbers not known.
Ceelasha Biyaha, Daynile district: a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) missed a Somali military convoy and struck a civilian vehicle. Two civilians were killed in the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab ""Somalimemo"" website claimed responsibility for an alleged IED attack against a KDF convoy at Hosingow. Al Shabaab claimed one vehicle destroyed and ""several"" casualties.

Men in military uniform raped a mother and her three daughters at Farxano village (c. 05 km South West of Qoryoley). The armed men, who arrived at the home of the victims while conducting security operations, abducted the son accusing him of being a member of al Shabaab. The criminals looted money from the home of the victims. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Civilians stage protest against extradition of Qalbi Dagax. Protests remained peaceful.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for an alleged IED attack against a KDF convoy. Al Shabaab claimed one vehicle destroyed and ""several"" casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 5th September, 09:00LT, Tor Toorow, Lower Shabelle region: a United States drone strike targeted a convoy of al Shabaab. Three deaths reported, identities not known. Conflicting reports claim the strike occurred in Bay Region.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Early AM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan region: al Shabaab attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) military base. Government forces, along with AMISOM, repelled the attack, incurring ""losses and injuries"" to al Shabaab. Government/AMISOM causality figures not known.

Somaliland Police clashed with seven Al Shabaab suspects in an attempt to arrest a prominent pro-al Shabaab Sheikh. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for 30 minutes. The pro-al Shabaab Sheikh (Adan Nunne) was arrested along with the armed members protecting him. The Sheikh was arrested for inciting youth to fight against the government after admitting that 13 al Shabaab suspects who were arrested in the previous week were his students.
Al Shabaab kills three Kenyan construction engineers in Dhobley on the evening of 05/09. Security forces conducted a security sweep soon after.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired three mortar rounds against Jubbaland force base at Abdi-birole village (c. 45 km West of Kismayo town). The mortar shells landed near the base and injured a Jubbaland soldier.

Armed men driving a Toyota Salon vehicle attacked an Upper House senator in his private car at Tarabuunka neighbourhood in Hodan district. The senator survived the assassination attempt but his daughter and driver were injured. The assailants escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated Digil/Garre civilian. Assailants escaped.
Group of SNAF soldiers gang-raped civilian, and arrested her son. Son taken to AMISOM base, under alleged links to al Shabaab.
Suspected Habargidir gunmen open fire against Biyomaal household, killing one. Assailants escaped.
IED targets SNAF convoy at entrance of SNAF base. 2 SNAF killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: IED targets AMISOM convoy. No casualties.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked an military position at Imbareeso village (c. 05 km North of Barawe district). AS was forced to retreat. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
Arrests: Hargeysa, Wooqoyi Galbeed region, Somaliland: security forces arrested a high-profile cleric who had recently criticised the arrest of suspected insurgents.

An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy in Elasha neighbourhood at Hawo-taako/Afgooye village near Orphanage camp (Xero Agoon) exploded. The explosion damaged an military Toyota 4WD vehicle. At least two SNA soldiers were killed while three others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: All markets in Qardho were closed in protest to the increasing rate of Somali Shilling to the US dollar. Police conducted security operations where they detained 10 forex dealers. The forex dealers were taken to Qardho Police Station.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Kismayo: an explosion was reported in a restaurant owned by a Jubaland Member of Parliament. The target is believed to have been Jubaland soldiers. At least one injury reported. Other causality figures are not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Local Security forces and ENDF attacked an al Shabaab position in a village (not named) outside Buurhakaba town (c. 60 km South East of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabab managed to escape. After a short stay at the location, the security forces returned to their base in Buurhakaba town. There were no reports of casualties. The government is said to be in control of the town.

Hundreds of protesters conducted a violent demonstration in Qardho in protest to the inflated exchange rate of Somali Shilling to the US dollar. All markets were closed. There were no immediate reports of casualties or arrests.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US AFRICOM announces airstrike in support of Somali forces near Baraawe. At least one death. Intended target unknown.

Non-violent activity: Armed men stole 50 camels from a prominent Habar-Jeclo elder near Damala Xagare village (c. 99 km South East of Erigavo). The raiders were believed to be from Darod (Warsangeli and Dulbahante clans). The incident was as a result of previous cases of raiding between the clans (darod-Isaq).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy at Buurane village neighbourhood exploded (c. 03 km West of Mahaday district). Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
7th September, AM, Bakool: Somali soldiers killed an al Shabaab sympathizer in Mora Gabey. The District Commissioner criticised the move, describing the action as an 'assassination.'

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab claimed to have killed two AMISOM soldiers during an ambush near Ceel Waregow. No independent verification. Calamada reports the attack occurred on 06/09.
A police officer is killed by unidentified gunmen. Assailants escaped. Motives understood to be related to land-grabbing/clan tensions in Dharkenley.

Two armed men using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a civilian man near Dabakayo Madow vicinity in Dharkenley district. The victim was attacked shortly after exiting his shop. The perpetrators escaped. The District Police arrived at the scene but there were no reports of arrests. The motive of the killing remains unknown.
Gunmen attack house near Korontada Junction. One woman killed, one injured. Gunmen later arrested by security forces. Incident related to clan/family tensions/land grabbing.

Al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a well-known traditional elder at Zone K village in Hodan district. The victim was exiting a mosque after-evening prayers when he was attacked. The victim was an electoral member of Galmudug state elections in 2016. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: IED detonates as BNDF foot patrol in Burane. No casualties. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

Agreement: Bishar Adan, a reportedly high-ranking al Shabaab leader in Gedo, defected this morning (07/09) to the Federal Government of Somalia in Baardheere. Secondary sources claim the event took place on the previous day.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF EOD team notices IED. Devices safely destroyed, no casualties. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: IED targets AMISOM convoy. No casualties reported.

Approximately 100 locals conducted a peaceful demonstration on the road linking the Airport and Botan in protest to the inflated exchange rate of Somali Shilling to the US dollar. The demonstration ended peacefully without any incident.
8th September, 18:00LT, Baidoa, Bay region: a suicide bomber detonated his vest inside a popular restaurant. At least six dead and others injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: A roadside bomb struck an armoured vehicle outside the town of Mahaday, Middle Shabeelle Region. The vehicle was part of a convoy travelling from the town. The blast killed at least 11 Burundian soldiers and destroyed the vehicle. Burundian military commanders have yet to speak on the attack.

A civilian man hailing from Hawadle clan was shot and killed by militiamen from Murusade clan at the border between Maxaas and Ceelbur (c. 100 km North East of Beletweyne town). The motive of the killing was related to disputes over grazing land. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Tension between the two clans was high as clan militias were reported to be mobilizing at their respective settlements.

A local business man hailing from Hawadle clan was shot and killed by an armed militiaman from Jajeele clan at Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Beletweyne town. The motive behind the shooting was related to clan retaliation. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene. Security forces were deployed to the scene where they conducted search operation but there were no reports of arrests.

Two armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, using pistols shot and killed a military officer at Tabeelaha Weydow neighbourhood in Dayniile district. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the assassination
8th September, evening, Mogadishu: a Somali National Police Force (SNPF) officer was assassinated by al Shabaab gunmen. The district within the city is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: JSF soldiers killed a young civilian after he failed to stop when ordered.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab claimed its fighters attacked a Djiboutian base near Buulo Burto. Causalities not known.

Fighting between rival clans left at least two people killed and three injured. Their identities of the clans are not known. Ahmed Abdi Yusuf, FGS representative in Gadoon, announced tensions remain high despite clan elder mediation.
Protests in Ceelasha Biyaha and Afgooye after AMISOM forces shot and killed a farmer.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM soldiers shot dead farmer after he threw stones at a patrol. AMISOM dogs had eaten the farmer's chickens.
Protests in Ceelasha Biyaha and Afgooye after AMISOM forces shot and killed a farmer.
Duduble gunmen assassinated two Habargidir/Ceyr. Linked to previous clan fighting.

Employees of Berbera port boycotted from work in protest of the new safety measures imposed by a commercial company on all staff, contractors and agents when accessing the port. The safety measures included possession of a metal helmet, a safety vest and safety shoes.

A civilian man hailing from Abgaal clan was shot and killed by Hawadle clan militias at the border between Maxaas and Ceel bur (c. 100 km North East of Beletweyne). The motive of the killing was revenge of the man who hailed from Hawadle who was killed by Murusade clan militias on the previous day. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. The situation was reported to be tense between the clans. Clan militias were reported to be mobilizing for possible attacks.
Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a local businessman at Siigale neighbourhood in Hodan district for unknown reasons. The perpetrators managed to escape.

9th September, Mogadishu: a local government official and a Somali soldier were assassinated by al Shabaab in Hodan and Boondheere districts respectively. The military claims the soldier survived, however al Shabaab claims the target died in the attack.
9th September, 11:00LT, Mogadishu: the Dharkenley District Commissioner survived an assassination attempt by al Shabaab in Wadijir District.

9th September, Mogadishu: a local government official and a Somali soldier were assassinated by al Shabaab in Hodan and Boondheere districts respectively. The military claims the soldier survived, however al Shabaab claims the target died in the attack.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a civilian man at Cagadhiig vicinity in Wardhigley district. The victim was in his barber shop when he was attacked. The motive of the killing was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab ambush UPDF convoy, no casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al-Shabaab fighters stormed the village of Burane, situated outside Mahaday, attacking a Burundian military base there. Al-Shabaab technical [pickup trucks mounted with machine-guns] participated in the attack, which lasted nearly two hours. Damage reported to some fortifications of Burundian troops, and it is believed that they suffered fatalities and injuries. The attack occurred on either 08/09 or 09/09. A third source claims 08/09.

Beledweyne, Hiiraan region: a suicide bomber detonated near the Beledweyne Administration Headquarters Building. Six deaths reported, four injuries. The fatality counted was raised to 7 in the following days, per Shabelle Radio Network.

Non-violent activity: Al Shabaab fighters detained a local business woman in Hagar town (c. 160 km North West of Kismayo) and was taken to unknown destination. The woman was a resident of Dhobley and was alleged to have connections with Jubbland forces.

Soldiers on security patrol shot and killed a suspected al Shabaab militant armed with hand grenade and pistol at Ali Boolay village neighbourhood. NISA conducted security search operation in the area and arrested number of suspects.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Mogadishu Stadium: al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against the African Union base in Mogadishu Stadium, Wardhigley district. Several rounds landed within the base. No causalities reported.
Dharkenley district: a Member of Parliament (MP) survived an assassination attempt. Another traveller in the vehicle was killed and a second injured. Perpetrators not known.
Bakaara Market: unknown gunmen assassinated a businesswoman in Bakaara Market.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills a government soldier.
Suspected al Shabaab militants kidnapped several local NGO employees west of Baidoa near Aawdiinle.
11 September, PM, Daarsoor, Galkacyo, Mudug region: unidentified gunmen assassinated a youth activist.

A civilian man hailing from Leelkase sub-clan of Daarood was shot and killed by unknown armed men near Kulmiye Hotel at Garsoor village in North Galkayo. Puntland police arrived at the scene of the incident. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive of the killing was unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab temporarily captured the border town of Belet Xaawo after launching a large-scale complex attack. The attack began with an IED detonated at a police station. The source suggests 30 Somali soldiers may have been killed. Xinhua reported 26 government soldier dead. Police and military forces re-gained control of the town in the evening hours, causalities not known. Al Shabaab destroyed much of the town upon their exit. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab temporarily captured the border town of Belet Xaawo after launching a large-scale complex attack. The attack began with an IED detonated at a police station. The source suggests 30 Somali soldiers may have been killed. Xinhua reported 26 government soldiers dead. Police and military forces re-gained control of the town in the evening hours. Al Shabaab destroyed much of the town upon their exit. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

Wehliye Hotel, Mogadishu: a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) parked along Makka al Mukarama road detonated, killing one and injuring six others. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility, stating the intended target was government officials.

SNA soldiers, in an escort vehicle, shot at a crowd of civilians at Lamiyaraha Zobe in Wadajir District to clear road traffic. At least three civilians were injured and rushed to Madina Hospital for treatment. The SNA vehicle did not stop after the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Jajeele clan militias in Maroodile (c. 20 km West of Beletweyne town). There was an exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Two al Shabaab fighters and a militiaman were killed while three clan militias were injured. The injured were taken to hospital at Hawlwadag neighbourhood, West of Beletweyne for further treatment. Contradicting this report, a second source reports Ethiopian Liyu Police were involved.

Hundreds of protesters demonstrated on the streets of Cel-Buh village (c. 111 km South East of Cerigabo) in protest against the denial of the Somali shillings by local traders. The demonstration ended peacefully.
Al Shabaab attacked military checkpoint at Arabiiska near Afgooye. Two al Shabaab killed.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a military technical vehicle carrying nine SNA soldiers at Haansheekh neighbourhood (c. 09 km East of Balcad district). At least five soldiers were killed and the SNA technical vehicle was burnt.

Abgaal clan militias attacked Biyomal sub-clan militias based at Muri village (c. 18 km West of Afgoye district). At least two militias from Biyomal sub-clan were killed while two others were injured. The motive of the attack was related to clan retaliation.

Unidentified men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, hurled a hand grenade at the residence of the Police Commissioner of Baidoa in Hawlwadag neighbourhood. The grenade landed on the street near the house. A female bystander was slightly injured. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. There were no reports of arrests.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AM, Dhobley, Lower Jubba region: a Kenyan military convoy was hit by an improvised explosive device (IED). No causalities. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM soldiers on security patrol at Libaanta channel near the main bridge in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers were repelled. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
Two al Shabaab gunmen armed with pistols assassinated suspected defector outside of Marka. Assailants escaped.

Alleged armed Warsaageli sub-clan militia established an illegal CP at Ceeldahir area (c. 90 km South of Bossaso). The militia shot and killed a khat dealer and stole the khat. Police arrested the perpetrators.

A civilian truck driver hailing from Majeerten clan was abducted by Farah Cagaweyne militiamen of Hawadle clan in Kooshin neighbourhood, East of Beletweyne town. The militiamen took the man to an unknown location.
A man from Isse Mohamud sub-clan was shot and wounded by an armed perpetrator from Osman Mohamud sub-clan due to a dispute over khat. Police were reported to be investigating.

A truck owned by Osman Mohamud sub-clan militiaman was hijacked by armed Warsangeli sub-clan militiamen in Sheerbi area (c. 40 km North West of Qardho) and was taken to Dhahar village of Sanaag. Following the incident, Paramilitary police and the armed perpetrators clashed at Dhahar (coded separately). There was an exchange of gunfire. One police officer and a militiaman were injured. Police recovered the truck and captured one militiaman who was injured. The other militiamen managed to escape.

An IED, planted near the Somali immigration office at the border of Belethawa town and the Kenyan border, exploded. There were no reports of casualties. There were no reports of arrests. Perpetrators not identified.
Belet Xawo, Gedo region: Kenyan aircraft carried out two airstrikes against al Shabaab at Buursagar and Habar near Belet Xawo. 16 al Shabaab killed and 10 injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an IED attack against AMISOM KDF supply convoy from Tabta at Jaldesa area (c. 42 km East of Dhobley). There were no reports of casualties or damages.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: A mob opens fire on convoy transporting Khat in El Dahir neighbourhood. One Puntland soldier escorting the convoy killed. It is not clear if the perpetrators were rioters or organized.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: A truck owned by Osman Mohamud sub-clan militiaman was hijacked by armed Warsangeli sub-clan militiamen in Sheerbi area (c. 40 km North West of Qardho) and was taken to Dhahar village of Sanaag. Following the incident, Paramilitary police and the armed perpetrators clashed at Dhahar. There was an exchange of gunfire. One police officer and a militiaman were injured. Police recovered the truck and captured one militiaman who was injured. The other militiamen managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A hand grenade was hurled at AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol at the Livestock Market vicinity in Heliwa district. The soldiers reacted with gunfire. One bystander was killed while three others, including one child, were injured. The perpetrator managed to escape unidentified. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade against an AMISOM patrol. A civilian bystander killed and two injured.

An SNA soldier shot and killed another government soldier employed by NISA at Albarako junction road neighbourhood in Hodan district. The incident generated an argument between the two parties for unknown reasons. The perpetrator attempted to escape but was eventually apprehended by other SNA soldiers.
Two unidentified gunmen armed with pistols assassinated business woman Duniyo Hussein. Assailants escaped. The motive for the attack is not known.
Non-violent activity: Small surveillance drone crashed near former Coca Cola factory. Origin yet unconfirmed.
Civilians burnt several houses belonging to Ethiopian nationals from Oromo ethnicity following the killing of several Somali nationals by Ethiopian forces in Oromo region.
Al Shabaab attacked military base. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabab has launched attacks on a base belonging to government forces and AMISOM troops in the locality of Jalalaqsi in Hiiraan Region [central Somalia]. Reports indicate that the sound of both heavy and light firearms being exchanged by the warring sides could be heard in the area. Reports indicate there were causalities on the al Shabaab side, numbers not known (divided among the two days). The attack began late on 13/09 and ended the following morning.
Arrests: Unverified local source reporting suggested Iterim South West (government) forces may have arrested dissidents and MPs planning a motion of non-confidence against President Sharif Hassan.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Early AM, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle region: al Shabaab attacked a Burundian National Defence Force (BNDF) military base. Several soldiers were reported injured.
A man was stabbed and wounded by an unidentified assailant in the proximity of Lanta Hawada in Bossaso.
Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab assassins killed a civilian suspected of spying for the Somali government.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Two Jubaland soldiers escaping from Belet Xaawo complex attack attempted to stop a NGO-rented vehicle 18km from Luuq. The soldiers opened fire. Two occupants injured.
Afternoon, Makka al Mukarama road, Mogadishu: peaceful pro-government protests were witnessed. The nature of the protest is not known.
Unidentified gunmen with pistols assassinated a civilian near Hormud building in Bakaara Market. Assailants escaped.
There was a pro-government demonstration between KM1-KM3 is Mogadishu. Disruption was minimal.
Hamar Weyne, Mogadishu: a civilian driver was killed by a Somali soldier at a security checkpoint. The reason for the shooting is not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Kunya-Barow, Baraawe Lower Shabelle region: US forces launched three drone strikes against al Shabaab camps. Six deaths reported.
Convoy transporting Balcad district commissioner ambushed. Action initiated by IED + 30min gunfight. No casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabab has launched attacks on a base belonging to government forces and AMISOM troops in the locality of Jalalaqsi in Hiiraan Region [central Somalia]. Reports indicate that the sound of both heavy and light firearms being exchanged by the warring sides could be heard in the area. Reports indicate there were causalities on the al Shabaab side, numbers not known (divided among the two days). The attack began late on 13/09 and ended the following morning.
Agreement: Al Shabaab Somali Memo claimed SNAF Ceel Buur Commander Mahmud Ali defected to the group.
Two al Shabaab assassins kill a defector. Assailants escaped.
Civilians protest at Ethiopian consulate following killing of Somali nationals in the Ethiopian Oromo region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 14th September, AM, IVO, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: Reports that AMISOM have carried out a mortar offensive against Al Shabaab in areas around Mahaday District. Causalities not known. Al Shabaab launched an attack against government forces after the incident.
14th September, PM Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: SNA soldiers injured after Al Shabaab launch an attack in the Mahaday District.
Two Ethiopian nationals are killed by Somaliland police after the officers had family members killed during Oromo/Liyu clashes in the Ogaden region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 14th September, PM, IVO Al Shabaab Claims IED attack on AMISOM convoy. Causality figures not known.
14th September, PM, Dharkenly, Mogadishu: Suspected Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a SNA soldier in Dharkenley.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated businessman in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped.

15 September, AM, Mogadishu: a SNA convoy was reportedly hit by an IED between Ex-control Afgooye checkpoint & Siinka-Dheer junctions in Daynile District. No Casualties reported. Perpetrators al Shabaab.
An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy at Elasha neighbourhood exploded. An SNA truck was damaged. At least two civilian bystanders were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Al Shabaab fighters opened fire against group of soldiers. Two soldiers killed. Assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab raid several houses in Muuri. Four civilians subsequently executed.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a well-known Government staff member who worked with the Ministry of Labour and public work at Zone K village in Hodan district. The victim was exiting the Mosque after prayers when he was attacked. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: September, month of. US forces conduct an air strike against al Shabaab in Bay Region, location not known. Three reported fatalities.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab launched an attack on Garbahaarey on the evening of 15/09. The attack started with a [suicide] car bomb hitting the main entrance of a Somali army base in south Garbahaarrey. Al-Shabab fighters, who had been waiting outside, then launched a large-scale attack on the base. A fierce fighting is currently underway at the base, with the two sides battling each other with heavy weapons. Ethiopian forces, aiding the government launched mortar fire on al Shabaab positions outside the city. Causality figures not known at this time.

Al Shabaab forces overtake Bula Hache (near Ceel Waaq) following a fight lasting between the evening of 15/09 - the morning of 16/09. Causality numbers not yet confirmed. Following the government defeat at Bula Hache, Kenyan forces at Ceel Waaq fled their positions.

Fighting after Mogadishu stabilisation force tried to disarm some members of the military who were in Digfer Hospital area. Six reported combatant deaths. Three civilians were reported dead from stray gunfire.

Students damaged the Ministry of Education building and public transport in the vicinity of the area after the Ministry of Education announced that more than 3,517 students failed the 2016-2017 examination in Somaliland. The results were published by the Somaliland national examination board.

Al Shabaab gains control of Ceel Waaq after the Kenyan forces who were guarding the town fled. The retreat comes after al Shabaab and government forces clashed in nearby Bula Hache through the overnight hours.

An unspecified number of people demonstrated on the streets of Erigabo in protest of the quality of services provided by the electricity company and the cost of electricity. Demonstrators blocked traffic on the main road and burnt tires. The demonstrators later dispersed after police were deployed in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 16 September, PM, Bari, Bosasso: Police Commissioner Mohamed Ali shot and injured by suspected al Shabaab gunmen. Assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab fighter hurled a hand grenade towards a passing Mogadishu Stabilisation Force military patrol. No casualties, assailant escaped.

Two people, including a senior municipal police officer and civilian businessman, were shot and killed near Kawo-Godey market vicinity by two armed men using pistols. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the assassination.
Civilians spontaneously organised protests against the green-on-green skirmish that opposed Mogadishu Stabilization Force to Army in Hodan. Protests remained peaceful.

Mogadishu Stabilization forces attacked SNA soldiers, who were organized in clan militias, based at Haanta Dheer and 77 Military camp on Industrial road in Dayniile district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about three hours. Five civilians were killed while 11 others were injured and taken to hospital. It was further reported that residents started to vacate their home to seek safer shelter.
16 September, PM, Mogadishu, Wadajir: A senior SNAF officer and his bodyguard are assassinated. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

Al Shabaab forces overtake Bula Hache (near Ceel Waaq) following a fight lasting between the evening of 15/09 - the morning of 16/09. Causality numbers not yet confirmed. Following the government defeat at Bula Hache, Kenyan forces at Ceel Waaq fled their positions.

Khat dealers in Lascanod protested as a result of a decision made by the government to increase the tax on khat coming from Kenya to Lascanod. SLP in Lacanod denied for the entry of khat into the town. Community elders at Lacanod intervened and managed the situation. Transportation of khat proceeded to the town.
17th September, AM, Hiiran, Beledweyne: Al Shabaab attacked and seized an SNAF checkpoint at Kalabeyr near Jawill village. Five SNAF killed.
Troops loyal to Sheikh Mukhtar Robow ambushed al Shabaab fighters at IVO Korkor/El Big. Four al Shabaab killed and three injured. One al Shabaab vehicle destroyed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked BNDF base near Burane. Casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: UPDF convoy returning from Buulo Mareer struck by IED at Golweyn. One Caspir damaged & immobilised, 5 UPDF injured. Al Shabaab believed to be responsible.
Unknown gunmen have shot and killed a youth activist in Galkayo on 17/09. A second article from the same source claims the victim was Former Ministry of Finances official Liiban Hassan Abdulle.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Ahmed Kheyr (Aulihan) clan militia clashed with police forces over a disputed piece of land behind a UN compound. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. The clan militia spent the night guarding the land after government soldiers left the area. The militia were reported to be on standby and alert. It was reported that the previous land owners were engaging in a construction at the disputed land.
Al Shabaab threw a hand grenade at government forces in Wardhigley District. The latest reports say that there are several casualties and destruction of property, numbers of causalities not known.
Al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a police officer in Yaaqshiid. Assailants fled with confiscated weaponry.
Protests erupted at the entrance of Mogadishu seaport. SNPF blockaded the road for one hour. Protests were against bad working conditions at Seaport.
Unverified local source reporting suggested al Shabaab gunmen assassinated two SNAF soldiers patrolling in Dharkenley. Assailants reportedly escaped.
17th September, 1305, Mogadishu, Dharkenley: Kaxda district intelligence Chief identified as Mohammed Qooley killed in a drive by shooting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

18th AM, Mogadishu, Xamar Jabjab: Foos Mohamed Hussein, Xamar-Jajab District Official shot dead in an assassination. A four-year-old girl was also killed. Assailants escaped the scene. Perpetrators not known. Shabelle Media Network reports the attack occurred on 16/09.

Residents in Ainabo staged a peaceful demonstration against the local administration whom they accused of diverting humanitarian assistance received from humanitarian agencies and the Government of Somaliland. Residents, mainly those who became IDPs during the recent droughts, walked through the main roads of Ainabo and disrupted traffic movements. There were two main temporary IDPs camps in Ainabo which host about 2000 people that depend on humanitarian assistance from agencies. There were no reports of casualties.

A youth group burnt shanty houses belonging to the Oromo community at Xamarta and Togdheer school neighbourhoods in Burco town. The motive of the attack was linked to the recent killing of the Somaliland khat dealers in Oromiya region. SLP arrived at the scene and dispersed the youths.

South-West Administration soldiers clashed at Diinsoor town (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. The ISWA soldiers belong to Geelid and Dabare clans who disputed over the killing of ISWA soldier from Geelidle clan by ISWA soldier from Dabare clan on 18/09. ISWA soldiers from Geelidle clan were isolated from the rest of the ISWA forces and amassed at area in the town in protest of the incident.

A few school teachers in Cerigabo demonstrated in front of the Office of the Ministry of Education in Cerigabo in protest over the teacher's examination results. This came after the Ministry of Education demoted several tutors after failing to achieve the pass scores for the examination. The demonstration ended peacefully.
18th PM, Bari, Puntland, Bosasso: Puntland security forces discover an IED planted on a busy junction, the area was cleared before detonation. No casualties reported.
A military convoy is targeted by a roadside IED near Bar Ismail CP, south of Afgooye. Device detonated prematurely. Two civilians killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: A Puntland police officer shoots a civilian after a unknown dispute.
Property destruction: Unverified local media reports suggested KDF troops set on fire Hormud HQ in Belet Xaawo. Motives unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a standoff attack against Biimaal clan militia based at KM 50 vicinity (c. 20 km South West of Afgoye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Two militants from both groups were injured.
19th September, PM, Belet Xaawo, Gedo: Unconfirmed reports of fighting near the town of Belet Xaawo between SNA and al Shabaab, 8 al Shabaab members reportedly killed.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen attempted to assassinate a Southwest Police officer. Exchange of gunfire ensued. Target survived the attempt, but was injured.

Residents in Faluja neighbourhood peacefully demonstrated against Somaliland Army whom they accused of grabbing land adjacent to SLA headquarters that was given to residents by the local government. Somaliland police dispersed the demonstrators. There were no reports of arrests.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Armed clashes reported between Jubaland forces and al Shabaab militants in Maracade, near Belet Xaawo. At least five al Shabaab killed, one al Shabaab vehicle destroyed.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: Unpaid Galmudug soldiers blockaded roads around Galmudug Administration HQ. Events remained peaceful.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated local section district chief in Hodan. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two nomad girls are raped in the area of Gaalkacyo. The attack is believed to be related to clan-based fighting.
Al Shabaab attacked a Southwest Special Police camp. No casualties or fatalities; assailants repelled. Pro-al Shabaab media also reported the attack, claiming fatalities.

Movement of forces: 20th September, AM, Bardheere, Gedo: KDF troops pull out of Bardheere and moved back to the town of Belet Xaawo on the Kenyan Somali border. At present, no clear reason has been given for the move.

A civilian businessman hailing from Majeerteen clan was abducted by Derasame militiamen of Gaaljecel clan at Nur Xawaad area in Xawa Taako neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The militiamen took the man to an unknown location. Reports indicated that the abduction was related to the arrest of a civilian man from Beletweyne who was detained in Garowe by the administration of Puntland state eight months ago.
Four members of the same family (Darod) assassinated by unidentified gunmen from Sacad/Habargidir who opened fire on minibus.
Al Shabaab assassinated cleric Sheikh Abdiweli Afyare in Gaalkacyo. Execution announced on al Andalus.

20th September, PM, Galkacyo, Mudug: A number of unverified reports have claimed gunmen open fire on a civilian bus killing 3, at present no one has taken responsibility for the shooting. The attack occurred outside Gaalkacyo.

20th September, AM, Shibis District, Mogadishu: NISA officer Omar Abu Shiine is killed after an IED, planted on his car, exploded while he was reportedly on route to work at the Aden Adde international airport. Al Shabaab have claimed responsibility for the attack.

A magnetic IED attached under a small luxury vehicles exploded at Mana-bolyo junction road in Bondheere district. The driver was killed in the explosion while the owner of the vehicle sustained injuries. The injured was taken to a nearby hospital for treatment. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Detonation: IED targets AMISOM convoy. Device detonates prematurely, no casualties.
Detonation: IED targets SNPF convoy. Device detonates prematurely, no casualties.
Al Shabaab executed Zakat collector Hussein Moalim.

A young boy was shot dead by police in Dilla after two youngsters supporting Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed at Dilla town. The clash erupted after Kulmiye supporter waved a Kulmiye flag among supporters of Wadani opposition party, led by the leader of Wadani Party, that arrived the town.

Movement of forces: 21st September, AM Ceel Waaq, Gedo: KDF forces pull out Ceel Waaq one day after pulling out of Bardheere in Gedo. The move may be tactical. Conflicting report: The Somali Memo (al Shabaab media outlet) claims al Shabaab gained control of the city on 16/09.

South-West Administration soldiers clashed at Diinsoor town (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. The ISWA soldiers belong to Geelid and Dabare clans who disputed over the killing of ISWA soldier from Geelidle clan by ISWA soldier from Dabare clan on 18/09. ISWA soldiers from Geelidle clan were isolated from the rest of the ISWA forces and amassed at area in the town in protest of the incident.

A young boy was shot dead by police in Dilla after two youngsters supporting Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed at Dilla town. The clash erupted after Kulmiye supporter waved a Kulmiye flag among supporters of Wadani opposition party, led by the leader of Wadani Party, that arrived the town (2nd event)

South-West Administration soldiers clashed at Diinsoor town (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. The ISWA soldiers belong to Geelid and Dabare clans who disputed over the killing of ISWA soldier from Geelidle clan by ISWA soldier from Dabare clan on 18/09. ISWA soldiers from Geelidle clan were isolated from the rest of the ISWA forces and amassed at area in the town in protest of the incident.

21 Sept, c. 1630 hrs. JALDESO, CRIME: An armed man, believed to have defected with his government issued AK47 rifle at Buulo-guduud base on 19 September 2017, briefly exchanged small arms fire with a group of al Shabaab fighters at Jaldeso area (c. 45 km East of Dhobley town). The armed man managed to escape unharmed.
Al Shabaab executed Zakat collector Hussein Moalim in Buula Fuulay, near Diinsoor.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 21st September, 0930L, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: Road side bomb targets BNDF convoy. Injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired about seven mortar shells which impacted on vacant land in front of Puntland front line base at Afurur village of Galgala Mountain (c. 65 km South West of Bossaso). One Dervish soldier was wounded. There were no reports of immediate damages and arrests.
Gunmen from Darod/Leykaase open fire to stop a vehicle. One death reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacked PSF base of Af Urur. Casualties unknown. Mortars and heavy machine gun fire used.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: Heavy fighting erupted between al Shabaab militants and Galmudug forces. Casualties and chain of events that led to the fighting unconfirmed.
Clan militia (not identified) intercepted and hijacked three trucks. One driver injured as he tried to escape. Incident motivated by ongoing clan clashes in the area.

A Hawadle clan militiaman shot and killed a fellow clan member at Hoolmooge village (c. 18 km South of Beletweyne town). The perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene but other clan militiamen managed to capture him. After the incident, al Shabaab fighters arrived at the scene and arrested the perpetrator who was taken to Booca village (c. 25 km South of Beletweyne). The motive of the killing was not clear. It was reported that the victim verbally argued with the perpetrator during a cultural play.
Hawadle clansman shot and killed fellow clansman. Al Shabaab arrested perpetrator.
Armed clashes erupted between al Shabaab fighters and local militiamen near Ceel Cali. Three militiamen killed.

Hundreds of protesters took to the streets of Galkayo to show their support for Galmudug's president Ahmed Duale Gelle (Haf) over his decision on the Gulf crisis. The protesters waved placards showing support for the Galmudug leader, and condemning the decision by his deputy and the regional parliament to oppose his stance.

Somali government troops and al-Shabab fighters clashed near the village of el-Ade, Hiiraan region, 70km from Belet Weyne. The fighting, which el-Ade residents described to the media as ""intense"", resulted in fatalities and injury. At least three combatants were killed and many others were wounded on the warring sides.

On 23 September 2017, a peaceful demonstration was conducted by supporters of the President of Galmudug Interim Administration (GIA) and Vice President of GIA in Cadado town. The protest may have occurred the previous day.
23rd September, PM, Faafax Dhuun, Gedo: Road side IED strikes KDF (Kenyan Defence Force) convoy. One KDF vehicle was reportedly destroyed. Causalities not known.

Pastoralists from Omar Mohamud clan, sub-clan of Majeerteen, and Sa'ad clan, sub-clan of Habargidir, clashed at Qod Gaashaan area (c. 50 km East of Galkayo). Three people were killed and seven others were injured. The situation was reported to be calm but unpredictable.

Armed men, believed to be part of Khatumo armed militia, attacked a hotel located in Buhodle town where the President of Khatumo was accommodated. The armed men clashed with the guards of the President of Khatumo at the hotel and stole the vehicle belonging to the President of Khatumo. It was later revealed that the armed men were disgruntled due to non-payment of salaries for the last eight months.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 23rd September, PM, IVO Belet Xaawo, Gedo: Reports of fighting between AMISOM and al Shabaab, 6km from Kenya's Mandera town. Casualties unknown.
Al Shabaab ambushed SNAF convoy patrolling outskirts of Kabtan Laas. Casualties unknown.
23rd September, AM, IVO Bardheere, Gedo: Al Shabaab attacks a KDF convoy between Baardheere and Garbaharey towns in Gedo region. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab attacked a government troop position at Caymiska neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
Clan militiaman opened fire and killed civilian. Clans unidentified. Incident motivated by ongoing clan clashes in eastern Galkacyo.
Six are killed in clan-related fighting in Godod. Actors Habar Gedir-Sacad and Darod clans.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Defusal: AMISOM foot patrol notices IED. Device safely dismantled. No casualties.
SNAF troops destroy al Shabaab camp near Mushaani. Casualties reported, figures unknown.
Militiamen loyal to the Sharif Sakin regional administration killed two traditional elders belonging to the Geladle sub clan.
24th September, PM, Waaberi, Mogadishu: Reports that hand grenades were thrown at Mogadishu security forces, four reported as wounded. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Defusal: An AMISOM convoy travelling between Biyo-Cadde and Cali Fool dheere areas discovered an IED hidden alongside the road. They defused the IED safely and proceeded with their movement.
24th September, AM, Ceel Adde, Gedo: KDF airstrike carried out against al Shabaab camp allegedly used to train child soldiers. Four munitions reportedly hit the camp, casualties currently unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy en route to Yoontoy. Casualties unknown. An IED possibly initiated the ambush.

SNA forces based in Daynuunay village launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters at Lowi-Gadud village (c. 08 km North East of Daynuunay and c. 20 km East of Baidoa town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab retreated. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were injured. SNA forces departed from the location but al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces on the way back to their base. An SNA soldier was injured in the attack.
SNAF raided an al Shabaab camp near Qoryoley. Casualty figures unknown.

A former senior figure called Gaddafi, who defected from al Shabaab, was targeted by al Shabaab on the tarmac road at Sugure village (c. 35 km South of Bossaso). Initial reports indicated that at least five clan militiamen were killed and three others were injured. The injured were taken to hospital for treatment.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 24th September, PM, Galgala mountains, Bari: Reports of fighting between al Shabaab and Puntland security forces (PFJ). Al-Shabab claim they killed four soldiers including the commander of the unit it attacked. It also claims to have wounded five others when the fighting erupted in Galgala Mountains.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 24th September, AM, Gaduud, Lower Jubba: Al Shabaab have reportedly attacked a base used by combined SNA (Somali National Army) and IJA (Interim Jubbaland Administration) troops. Al Shabaab also claim to have killed American personnel although this is highly likely al Shabaab propaganda. As there are no known US military units operating from this base. Other causalities not known.

A civilian man was shot and killed by a traffic police officer at Geed Jacayl area in Wardhigley district. The man and the police officer had a verbal altercation over tax issues before the police officer killed him. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. Residents in the area protested against the killing of the civilian man. Government security forces in the area dispersed the crowd.

Somali National Army [SNA] forces in Lower Shabelle region [southern Somalia] have attacked an al-Shabab position in an area under Janale district on 24 September. The forces raided Mushaari area near Janale, then fighting ensued between them and al-Shabab fighters in the area. The al Shabaab positions were destroyed. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a moving SNA vehicle passing through Fagah junction in Yaqshid district. The grenade landed and exploded onto an empty place causing no damages or fatalities. The perpetrators escaped.
24th September, PM, Dharkeynley, Mogadishu: SNA General Abdullahi Mohamed Sheikh Qururuh former deputy head of logistics and his bodyguard were assassinated, al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

24 Sept, Two groups of government soldiers clashed at SiiSii village in Yaqshid district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. At least two civilian bystanders were injured.

A civilian man was shot and killed by a traffic police officer at Geed Jacayl area in Wardhigley district. The man and the police officer had a verbal altercation over tax issues before the police officer killed him. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. Residents in the area protested against the killing of the civilian man. Government security forces in the area dispersed the crowd.
IED strikes SNAF convoy. One SNAF injured.
Unidentified gunman kill two civilians at coffee shop. Assailant escaped, motives unknown.
Supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed over unknown motives. One youth killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: Arrests: Galmudug troops seen moving around and establishing checkpoints around Cadaado. The forces put the Parliament Speaker house arrest.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Defusal: Djiboutian EOD team successfully dismantled IED on road leading to water point. No casualties.
Infighting between two SNAF units left one SNAF soldier killed and two injured.

An unknown man shot and injured two men at a tea-shop in Elafweyn town. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. Police were reported to be in pursuit of the perpetrator. The victims were taken to Burao Hospital for further medication.

An RCIED buried alongside the road near Cali-Kamin junction neighbourhood in Wardhigley district, targeting a mobile NISA technical, exploded. At least one soldier and two civilian bystanders were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
25th September, 2000L, Wardhiigley, Mogadishu: Grenades thrown at a Security checkpoint in Wardghiigley. One NISA two civilian bystanders killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

Al Shabaab elements hurled a hand grenade at an FGS troop position at Towfiq neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. The governmental forces responded with gunfire but the perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of fatalities.

Two armed men using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and injured a civilian female at Ahmed Gurey ward in Hodan district. Bodyguards of the Presidential state minister, who were nearby the location of the incident, responded and captured the suspects. Banadir Regional Administration officials arrived at the scene of the incident and surrendered the perpetrators to the security agencies for further investigations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Defusal: IED discovered and safely dismantled near Beldage Hospital. No casualties.

26th September, PM, Taraka, Gedo: Kenyan defence Force (KDF) airstrikes target the forward operating base at Taraka which Kenyan ground troops withdrew from on the PM of 25th September. Six civilians killed. It is believed KDF was attempting to destroy the base so it could not be utilised by al Shabaab.

26 Sept, c. 1130 hrs. Two groups of SNA soldiers clashed at Jowhar market in Hanti-Wadag district. The SNA soldiers disputed over the tax collection process. A civilian bystander was killed and two others were injured. Local police forces arrested the perpetrators.
25th September, PM, Taraka, Gedo: KDF (Kenyan Defence Force) withdrawal from AMISOM position in Taraka. Al Shabaab gained control of the village the following day.
26th September, AM, Johwar, Middle Shabelle: One elder killed and two others wounded by Somali National Army (SNA). The reasons for the killing are not known.
26th September, PM, IVO Luuq, Gedo: Elder, Hussein Mohamed Abdullahi ""Dhofar"" Beheaded by al Shabaab. The execution comes after the elder met with the Jubaland President.

Unidentified armed attackers using pistols, believed to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a police officer at Jiirada Macalin Nuur village in Dharkenley district. The body of the victim was taken to CID for examination and further investigations. The assailants managed to escape. Police forces arrived at the scene and conducted search operations. There were no reports of arrests.

26 Sept, Xerta (a religious group) and combined clan militias (not named) clashed at Balley village (c. 22 km East of Garowe town) after a land dispute. One person was killed and four others were seriously injured. Investigations were reported to be ongoing. The clash may have occurred on the 27th.
Detonation: Assailant hurled a hand grenade towards an unidentified target. Grenade exploded in an empty house. No casualties. Assailant escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM vehicle drives over a civilian car and drags it over 100m near KM4. Father and son injured. Mogadishu Mayor appealed for legal prosecution of the driver.
A protest took place in Borama on 27/09. The protest is related to a land-based clash in the area. Police reportedly made arrests in the days that followed.

Government forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters at Yabyab village (c. 20 km East of Xudur). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. An al Shabaab fighter was killed and two others were injured. SNA forces returned to their base in Xudur.

Somaliland police in Borama conducted a security operation where they clashed with an armed group claiming ownership of a plot of land located at Borama town centre. A police officer and two armed men were seriously injured. A violent demonstration occurred in Borama by the relatives of the armed group against police in Borama town.
A 15-year old boy was shot and killed at Hubal area located South of Bossaso. The perpetrator was arrested by police and taken to the central police station for further investigation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED placed by the roadside and targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling at the outskirts of Bulo Marer district exploded. One soldier was injured and one Casspir was damaged. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unverified local reporting suggested 5 civilians were killed and six others injured during KDF airstrike on suspected al Shabaab positions on 27/09.
UPDF convoy struck by an al Shabaab IED in Marka District. Casualties unknown.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Howlwadaag Police Station in Howlwadag district. Police forces shot at the perpetrators but the perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at UAE-trained forces (it is assumed the soldier's country of origin is Somalia) at Tarabunka Junction in Hodan district. Two soldiers were wounded. The targeted troops shot towards the general direction of the attack but the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Skirmish erupted between two groups of SNAF soldiers. Casualties and motives unknown.

27th September, AM, Xamar Weyne, Mogadishu: Ahmed Jamac Hirsi the son of Battulo Sheikh Ahmed, the chair of the Somali National Women's Organisation (SNWO) and the organisations secretary general Anab Abdullahi Hashi, have been killed in a targeted drive by shooting. Al Shabaab believed responsible.
Non-violent activity: The Ethiopian government accused the Somaliland government of expelling 3,000 ethnic Oromos. Date(s) not known.

A man has shot and killed by another man in Ceelal village. The motive of the incident was related to a revenge killing (reasons not articulated). Security forces managed to arrest the perpetrator and was reported to be under police custody in Caynabo.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at government soldiers in a tea shop at Hamar Jadid village in Wardhigley district. The hand grenade landed on an empty place resulting in no fatalities. The assailants escaped. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: PSF launched operation against AS in El Dibir, Galgala Mountains. Outcome unknown.

Recruitment:Al Shabaab established forced recruitment drives in Bay and Bakool regions, exact locations not known. The drives caused civilians to flee these areas. The exact date of the beginnings of the recruitments are not mentioned by the source.

Recruitment: Al Shabaab established forced recruitment drives in Bay and Bakool regions, exact locations not known. The drives caused civilians to flee these areas. The exact date of the beginnings of the recruitments are not mentioned by the source.

At least seven people were killed and several others wounded after a car bomb exploded in Xamae Weyne near the London Gate restaurant. Seven or eight dead. The car was moving at the time of explosion. It is not known if the perpetrators were in the car or if the bomb was remotely detonated. Al Shabaab suspected.

column6: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
column17: Non-violent activity: SNAF soldiers stage mutiny over mistreatment and non-payment of wages by SNAF HQ. Mutineers vacate garrison, subsequently occupied by other SNAF contingent. Mutineers occupied stadium in Ceel Jaale.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM fire artillery shells on Bariire from KM50.
A military convoy is hit by an al Shabaab IED in Afgooye. Causalities not known.

An IED buried along the road side, targeting an SNA reinforcement convoy en route to Bariire detonated. The explosion hit an SNA battle wagon destroying the vehicle. Nine soldiers were killed and two others were wounded.

Al Shabaab orchestrate complex attack against FOB Bariire, possibly two VBIEDs used. 17 SNAF Killed, base captured. The Somali Memo reports 23 dead. Following a supply of reinforcements, government forces recaptured the base.
Al Shabaab firing mortar rounds against base of Lanta Buuro. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted an AMISOM supply convoy travelling in the outskirts of Haawey area in Baraawe district exploded. There were no reports of injuries. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

An armed man from Dhulbahante/Hayaag clansman shot and killed a truck driver from Dhulbahante/Reer-Hagar sub clan near Cegag. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. Dhulbahante/Reer-Hagar sub clan militia were deployed to the outskirt of Ceegaag village. The area was reported to be tense.
Peaceful anti-government protest occur in Hodan. The reason for the protest is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against PSF base of Af Urur. Outcome and resulting casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: KDF shot a civilian driving Tabliq preachers. One civilian injured.

Government forces recapture Bariire following a supply of reinforcements. Military leadership claims 20 dead in the raid, including senior commanders. VOA claims 30 dead. The al Shabaab backed Somali Memo claims 95 dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Defusal: KDF dismantled roadside IED. No casualties.

An SNA soldier was shot and killed by another SNA soldier at Kalabeyr check point (c. 20 km North of Beletweyne town). The perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene but other SNA soldiers managed to capture and arrest him. The motive of the killing was not clear. Some reports suggested that there was a verbal argument.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade against South-West State forces positioned at the animal market in Isha neighbourhood of Baidoa. The grenade landed on an empty space near the special police forces position. SWSPF opened fire after the explosion. There were no reports of casualties. Security forces arrived at the scene and arrested several people in connection to the incident.

A civilian man hailing from Dhulbahante was stabbed to death by another civilian male hailing from Ogaden clan over a land dispute at Kham Kham village (c. 18 km North East of Kismayo town). The perpetrator managed to escape from the location before the arrival of security forces.

A man, hailing from Warsan Geli sub clan Ugas labe, was abducted by men hailing from Isse Mohamoud Sub clan Reer Samakaab in Garowe town. The motive was believed to be clan revenge. Clan elders were reported to be in negotiations to diffuse tensions. The matter was reported to the police and investigations were reported to be ongoing.

Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade at police on patrol near Karan Police Station in Karan district. At least two soldiers were wounded in the blast. The assailants escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

On the night of 30 September, several bomb attacks occurred across the capital, Mogadishu, targeting government militias based in Weydow area, Hodan district. Outcome of the Hodan blast is not known. Perpetrators not known.
IED detonates on MSR IVO Arabiiska. Three children WIA.
Movement of forces: Over 100 al Shabaab fighters seen crossing the Shabelle River from west to east. Motive unknown. Wider al Shabaab movements reported in the area.
Suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade in the old livestock market. No casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNA base at Bariire in Afgoye district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack by firing mortar shells into the base followed by an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked local armed men at Gubud-Galool village (c. 35 km North East of Xudur). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for a few minutes after which the local militias retreated from the village. Three local militias were killed and two others were injured in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against government forces base at Teed village (c. 30 km North of Xudur town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which SNA retreated from the base. Al Shabaab took control of the base. Al Shabaab later withdrew from the base without further clashes. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and four others were injured. SNA forces were reported to have taken control of the base without violence.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against government forces base at Teed village (c. 30 km North of Xudur town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which SNA retreated from the base. Al Shabaab took control of the base. Al Shabaab later withdrew from the base without further clashes. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and four others were injured. SNA forces were reported to have taken control of the base without violence.

Al Shabaab fighters fired about five mortars rounds targeting Baidoa Airport from Daauudow (c. 15 km South East of Baidoa town). Confirmed reports indicated that none of the mortar rounds landed inside the airport. There were no reports of casualties or damages.

Somaliland army officers shot and killed a truck driver who hailed from Dhulbahante/Baharsame clansman near Gambadhe base. The motive was not clear but it was believed that the driver failed to stop at the military checkpoint. Police in Sool were reported to be investigating the matter.

An SNA convoy travelling at the outskirts of Wanlweyn district was hit by an RCIED. The explosion impacted a battle wagon carrying soldiers from an army base in Balidogle airstrip. Three soldiers were killed and three others were seriously injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unknown armed assailants using pistols shot and killed a watchman at Weydow village in Dharkenley district. The man was at the market area when the armed criminals shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
An explosion targets government soldiers in Hodan district on 01/10. 15 reported dead or wounded, fatalities estimated at 5. Perpetrators not known.

An SNA convoy travelling on the road between KM 13 - KM 15 neighbourhoods was hit by a roadside IED near Siinka Dheer area in Dharkenley district. The convoy was carrying a military commander who was travelling to Mogadishu. The commander narrowly survived the attack. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated SNAF soldier.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate FGS tax collector. Assailants escaped. Victim identified as Yusuf Abdi.

SLP conducted a security operation at Sheedaha neighbourhood where they clashed with youngsters who were fighting each other. The reason for the unrest is not known. SLP fired warning shots to disperse the youngsters. Five youngsters were arrested.
Al Shabaab fire Mortars at SNA FOB at Bariire followed by a low level attack. Causalities not known.
Sa'ad sub-clan of Habargidir and Omar Mohamud sub clan of Majeerteen clash east of Gaalkacyo on or before 02/10. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a government troop position at Buulo Foolyo SNA base in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab stole a motorcycle and an unspecified amount of money from the check point. A civilian bystander was injured. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Joint SNA/ENDF strike operation carried out at Baardheere, 25 al Shabaab reported killed including members of the al Shabaab leadership.

Al Shabaab fighters detained two businessmen hailing from Hawadle clan at Booco Village (c. 45 km South of Beletweyne town) after al Shabaab fighters summoned businessmen to Booco village for discussions. Businessmen who honoured the call arrived at Booco village and were detained by al Shabaab fighters. The motive behind the detention was not clear.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at government soldiers guarding Towfiq ward in Yaqshid district. The grenade landed on an empty place resulting in no casualties. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: A powerful bomb blast struck Ugandan Amisom troops on the road connecting the town of Buulo Mareer and the village of Golweyn, Lower Shabeelle Region. The blast is said to have killed and wounded at least three soldiers. The soldiers were walking when they were struck by the blast. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland soldier opens fire and kills head of AY Airport Security Abdisalam Sanyare ""Awke"" and his bodyguard. One youth bystander killed.
Students march for the reunification of Gaalkacyo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A roadside bomb targeted an AMISOM convoy at SOS intersection in Mogadishu. No reports of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: A Puntland police officer shot dead on 02/10 the chief of security at an airport, reasons unknown. A secondary report from Shabelle Media Network claims that attack occurred on 03/10.
Suspected al Shabaab operative hurled two hand grenades against Yaaqshiid DC HQ. No casualties, assailant escaped.

An IED planted alongside the road between KM 50 and Bariire settlement detonated. The blast destroyed a Toyota carib carrying SNA soldiers. At least two soldiers were killed and four others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Residents of New Hargeisa conducted a violent demonstration against the Somaliland government for selling Riis Intermediate School to a businessman. The demonstrators burnt tires in front of the school and disrupted movement of vehicles in the area. SLP dispersed the demonstrators. There was no report of arrests.

Two people, hailing from Jidle and Hawadle clan, were killed and burnt by Makane clan militiamen at Leego (c. 8 km North of Beletweyne town). The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The security situation in the area was reported to be tense.

A worker of a not-for-profit organization, hailing from Hawadle clan, was abducted by clan militias (not identified) hailing from Mohamud Gacal area (c. 37 km North of Beletweyne town) and was taken to an unknown location. The motive of the abduction was related to the dismissal on one of the militiamen hailing from Mohamud Gacal by the worker. Influential clan elders from Hawadle clan attempted to negotiate for the release of the abducted worker. The situation was reported to be tense.

A man was found dead at a teashop at Dalxiska neighbourhood in Kismayo town. The body was identified as an off-duty Jubaland state house special security guard officer. JSF arrived at the scene and took the body for tests and burial.

Unidentified armed attackers using pistols shot and killed a civilian man at Black Sea area in Hodan district for unknown reasons. Security forces conducted a search operation at the location but the assailants were not apprehended. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unknown armed assailants using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab assassins, shot and killed an SNA officer at a tea shop at Siliga neighbourhood in Wadajir district. One civilian bystander was injured during the exchange of gunfire. Security forces arrived at the scene and conducted searches but there were no reports of arrests. The attackers escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the assassination.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
