column17: Al Shabaab fighters have attacked Southwest state forces and African Union troops at military bases at Goof Guduud. Causalities not known. The attack may have occurred the previous day.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Possible US drone strike against al Shabaab position at Turgarey, near Mubarak. Causalities not known.
Army forces kill three al Shabaab commanders outside of Buurdhuubo.

Reports from Afgoye say that al-Shabaab fighters have attacked a security checkpoint manned by government forces. Fierce fighting, which lasted several hours, ensued between government forces at the checkpoint and al-Shabab militants who launched the attack. Area residents said that both sides suffered loss of life and injury in the fighting although the extent of loss remains unknown.
Members of the Islamic State attack a coffee shop in Bossaso, killing one and inuring two, including a police officer. Islamic State later claimed responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab launched mortar shells against Diinsoor airstrip. Ethiopian forces, stationed at the airfield responded in kind against the al Shabaab position. Causalities not known. A secondary source claims the attack took place on the previous day.

column9: Hawadle Ethnic Group (Somalia); Habar Gedir Clan Group (Somalia)
column17: Jajeele clan militiamen shot and seriously injured a father and his son at Buurfiiq village (c. 10 km west of Beletweyne town). It was reported that Jajeele clan militias attempted to retaliate from Hawadle clan but shot at the two individuals who hailed from Habargidir clan. The victims were taken to a private hospital in Hawlwadaag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne for further treatment by the perpetrators.
A district admin official shot and killed in Wadjir. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

At least two civilians were killed, and several others wounded in a remote-controlled landmine blast near Jowhar town. The explosion has resulted from an explosive device hidden in a water container left on the banks of a river at Munkay area. Perpetrators remain unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A roadside IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy between Qurac Madobe and Cali Fooldheere settlements in Mahaday district, exploded. The explosion destroyed an AMISOM caspir. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

An IED targeted government soldiers in Bariirre, killing one and wounding two. Following the attack, soldiers attempted to arrest a suspect, but was shot during an attempt to flee. Al Shabaab probable suspects, as they have been operating in the area.
Al Shabaab assassinates a police officer in Yaaqshiid.
A tax collector is targeted and killed in Suuq Ba'ad market by armed gunmen. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. This event may have occurred the previous day.
Civilians from two rival power companies clash over unfair business practices. SL Police fired upon when attempting to disperse crowds. Several injured.

An IED targeted government soldiers in Bariirre, killing one and wounding two. Following the attack, soldiers attempted to a suspect, but was shot during an attempt to flee. Al Shabaab probable suspects, as they have been operating in the area.
Clan violence reported near Maxaas. Causality figures not known.
Non-violent activity: Unspecified clan militia ambushed a Toyota Noah carrying khat on the tarmac road in Fuluja village (c. 70 km South of Bossaso). There were no reports of casualties.

An IED buried on the banks of the river in Maankey village (c. 10 km south of Jowhar) detonated. The residents of the village were preventing floods in the area when the explosion occurred. There were no reports of casualties. The motive behind the incident was unknown.

Al Shabaab launches a large attack on Bariirre town. The ensuing battle lasted several hours. One soldier and three al Shabaab fighters were killed and four other al Shabaab fighters were injured. A second source claimed ""possibly ten killed.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab media claims to have attacked Ethiopian forces in Waajid district, causing 'huge' causalities. A second report claims one ENDF dead, one wounded.
Non-violent activity: Clan militia established two illegal CPs at the outskirts of Bossaso on Airport road in agitation to an issue with the Bossaso port.
Al Shabaab kidnapped five clan elders near Mahaday, Middle Shabelle region. The identity of the clan and the reason for the abduction is not known.
05 October, 18:45EAT - al Shabaab operative hurl a hand grenade towards security checkpoint, Mogadishu University, Wadajir. Causalities not known.
05 October, evening - suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF soldier, Suuq Xoloha, Heliwa.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF forces discovered and detonated IEDs near Hinshilow village (c. 10 km North West of Burdhuxunle village) on the road towards Burdhuxunle. An ENDF soldier was killed in one of the explosions. Al Shabaab responsible.
Murusade pastoralist killed by Hawadle militias.
Unidentified gunmen kill two civilians near Garsaalley. Motives unknown.
Al Shabaab gunmen shoot and kill a government soldier in Heliwa.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Gaaljecel clan militias at Burjada Ciinta CP (c. 05 km South West of Beletweyne town). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM supply convoy travelling outside of Qoryoley District exploded. One AMISOM truck was damaged. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy is hit by a roadside IED between Buulo Mareer and Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle region. Causalities not known. Perpetrator not known.

column9: Majeerteen Clan Group (Somalia); Ormale Clan Group (Somalia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two civilian males hailing from Majerten and Ormale clan at Lagta grazing area (c. 103 km West of Kismayo town). Both victims were local charcoal dealers. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

A pastoralist hailing from Murusade clan was shot and killed by Hawadle clan militias at Xeero area (c. 25 km North east of Mahaas). The motive of the killing was related to clan retaliation and linked to an incident that occurred at the same location on 04 October.
06 Oct, c. 2000 hrs: A VBIED detonated prematurely at Qolow village (c. 30 km South of Beletweyne town). Seven al Shabaab fighters were killed. The intended target of the blast is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab claim to have killed two Jubaland soldiers during clashes in Qam Qam (Xaar-Xaar). Incident described as response after IJA killed livestock.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: There was a reported IED strike on Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) convoy at Waajid, Casualties reported. Al Shabaab responsible.
Unidentified militias attack an al Shabaab camp in southern Xudur district, Bakool region. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab ambushes a SNAF convoy, IVO Buur Dhuxunle, Rab Dhuure district. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian, killed several donkeys and destroyed commercial commodities and donkey carts near Aleemow village (c. 30 km North of Wajid district). The donkey carts were used to transport commodities to Wajid district from Burdhuxunle village. Many people transporting commercial goods managed to escape. Al Shabaab fighters banned for the transportation and delivery of goods in areas under ENDF and Somali government forces in Bay and Bakool regions.
Alleged al Shabaab Militants kill 2 charcoal traders and wound a third. A secondary source claims the event occurred on 06/10.
A Grenade attack targets a security forces checkpoint and police station injuring three, attackers escaped the scene. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
A Grenade attack targets a security forces checkpoint and police station injuring three,attackers escaped the scene. No group has yet to claim either attack.

The body of a young male was discovered near Jiirada Macalin Nur in Wadajir district. Gunshot wounds were observed on the dead body. The perpetrators were unknown. The dead body was taken to CID for further investigation.
Al Shabaab operative hurled hand grenade towards Karan SNPF station. Outcome unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: KDF patrol notices IED. As patrol inspects it, device detonates, killing 2 KDF and injuring two.
08 October - IED targets SNAF convoy, Cabdow Dibile, Afgooye district. Al Shabaab likely responsible. Two soldiers injured.
Al Shabaab attacked SNAF base near Qoryoley. No casualties.
Two civilians killed by gunfire over a land dispute. The identities of the perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An African Union AMISOM convey was hit by road side IED. One vehicle has been damaged,casualty's unknown. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Reports claim an AMISOM convey was hit by a road side IED at Hawo Abdi, casualties figures remain unconfirmed but one civilian was reportedly wounded. Perpetrators not known.
Al Shabaab allegedly behead a man in Aleemow 20Km north of Waajid for supplying food to ENDF troops. A secondary source claims two were killed.
A lawmaker sustained gunshot wounds after a soldier opened fire on Members of the of Hirshabeel State Parliament. The motive of the attack is not clear.

A civilian man hailing from Ogaden clan shot and injured another civilian man from Bartire clan at Boqolka Guri area in Farjano neighbourhood of Kismayo town over a land dispute. The perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene but JSF, on security patrol, shot at the perpetrator and managed to capture him with minor injuries. Information indicated that the incident resulted in inter-clan disputes and violence which resulted the injuries of five civilians after machetes, knives and clubs were used in the incident. The situation was reported to be calm and all the injured people were taken to Kismayo hospital for medical treatment.
08 October, evening - al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a SNAF soldier, fled with confiscated weaponry, Heliwa.
08 October, 12:30EAT - IED targets SNAF convoy, Hawo Abdi, northern Daynile. Causalities, perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Puntland forces launched an air strike against al Shabaab hideouts in Majiyahan area (c. 25 km South West of Bossaso). Initial reports indicated that 15 al Shabaab fighters were killed and 17 others were wounded. The attack as in conjunction with a US air strike.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 02:00EAT, Hawl Kismayo (southern Bossaso), Bari - al Shabaab ambush a Puntland quick reaction force responding to the earlier incident at Bossaso checkpoint. Two Puntland deaths reported. Al Shabaab also ambushed a group of reinforcements sent to the checkpoint later in the day. Several injured.
A small IED detonated near Digfer Hospital. No causalities reported.
Al Shabaab storm SNAF checkpoint. Casualties reported, figures unknown.
Sa'ad and Omar Mohamud clans clashed at Sabansabdho vicinity (c. 45 km East of Galkayo). A pastoralist man was shot and killed and another was injured. The incident was related to clan revenge.
Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM forces at Mashalay village outside Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of fatalities.

Government troops attacked al Shabaab fighters at Cadow Dibile settlement outside Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire. Three al Shabaab attackers were killed and one vehicle and weapon were captured.
Wadani senior officers were beaten using sticks by Kulmiye supporters at Guleid Hotel. The victims were taken to Hargeisa Group Hospital for further treatment.

A man from Ugar Saleeban sub clan was shot and killed by an assailant from Ali Saleeban sub clan in Gaalmale area (c. 87 km South East of Qardho). The assailant escaped and police were reported to be investigating.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Arrests: A suspected IED and explosives devices were discovered in the proximity of Golis Telecom company in Bossaso. Security forces subsequently removed and neutralised the IED. The device was likely planted by al Shabaab. The intended target is not known. There were no reports of casualties or arrests.
A government official sustained minor injuries in as the result of an assassination attempt. Al Shabaab are suspected by authorities.

An explosion has been reported IVO Tarabunka junction Hodan, reports are at the moment limited with no confirmation on the type of explosion or number of casualties. The reason for the explosion is not yet known. The explosion was later determined to be an IED. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed a Jubaland convoy near Gobweyn. One IJA killed three injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Security measures: PSF forces launch security sweep in Majiyahan area. Four al Shabaab captured, including a high-profile leader (not named).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Green-on-green fighting reported in Garowe. No causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: AM, IVO Buur Dhuxunle, Bakool an ENDF EOD team dismantles a al Shabaab roadside IED.

Over hundreds of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration in Ainabo in protest of ""unfair distribution of food aid provided by the Somaliland government and Aid organizations to IDPs"" in town. The protestors accused the mayor and the other local councillors of unequally distributing the aid to the IDPs. The protestors marched through streets in Ainabo chanting against authority officials.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Early AM, Qoryoley main bridge, Lower Shabelle - al Shabaab attack the joint AMISOM/SNAF base located near Qoryoley's main bridge. Causalities not known.
Early AM, IVO Lanta Buuro, Lower Shabelle - security forces kill four al Shabaab militants responsible for an earlier assassination attempt of two clan elders near Mogadishu.

AM, Bariire, Lower Shabelle - al Shabaab fire mortar rounds towards FOB Bariire as a SNAF commander visited the base. Casualties of the attack not known. A secondary source claims the attack took place on 09/11.

Two unidentified assailants attempted to assassinate an ambulance driver of Bossaso General Hospital in Raf and Raho area. The assailants were intercepted by police patrol but escaped. There were no reports of casualties.

10 Oct. 17, 01:00 EAT, Ceelasha Biyaha, Daynile - Al Shabaab gunmen stopped a vehicle transporting two clan elders (not identified) in Ceelasha Biyaha. It was believed to be an attempted carjacking. The gunmen opened fire when the vehicle failed to stop, injuring one of the passengers. The assailants escaped. Other sources report the two elders and a third person were killed in the attack. The perpetrators were later killed by security forces.
10 October, evening - al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a former Southwest Electoral Delegate, Sar Kuusta, Daynile.
10 October, evening - grenade attack targets SNAF checkpoint, IVO ex-control Afgooye, Daynile. Three soldiers were injured in the attack. Perpetrators not named by the source.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Security forces of Jubbaland Regional State on 10/10 carried out an operation against al Shabaab near the town of Kamsuma, which lies about 90km north of Kismayo. At least three fatalities.
10 October, 18:00EAT - unidentified gunmen assassinated a civilian, Weydow neighbourhood, Dharkenley.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF convoy hit by roadside IED. Casualties unknown.

Detonation: 11th October, AM, Dur Dur, Belet Weyne, Hiiraan: Reports claim that at least seven al Shabaab militants were killed when a VBIED prematurely detonated. The intended target of the explosive is not known.

Al Shabaab attacked a government force checkpoint at Mukayga area in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least one government soldier was killed in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters and militias loyal to Muktar Robow engaged in a protracted armed clash at Seynilow village (c. 31 KM South of Xudur town). Three al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attack. Militias loyal to Muktar in Roobow destroyed and burnt the small al Shabaab base at Seynilow village. No casualty was reported from the other sides.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNA checkpoint at Basra area under Balcad district. At least three government soldiers were killed and two others were injured. Al Shabaab claims six government soldier dead. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab stated that they took vehicles and weapons from SNA. According to a secondary source the attack may have occurred the previous day.

Al Shabaab conducted a hit and run attack against SNA troops at Bariire town in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of causalities.

Two government soldiers exchanged gunfire for unknown reasons at Xawadley village (c. 24 KM North East of Balcad district). Stray bullets hit a civilian who sustained injuries. The victim later succumbed to her wounds on the way to hospital. The perpetrator was not apprehended by security forces

South-West State forces attacked al Shabaab fighters collecting taxation at War-Makinay village (c. 50 km West of Wajid). There was an exchange of small gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and another was injured in the attack. ISWA forces confiscated a rifle and small arms fire ammunition from the scene.

A man hailing from Tumaalo clan was shot and killed by an armed man hailing from Sa'ad clan in South Galkayo. It was believed that the killing was in connection to previous clan feuds. The perpetrator was arrested by Galmudug police.
Non-violent activity: Somalia's defence minister and army chief have both resigned, reasons unknown.

12 OCT: AM, IVO Xudur/Abal, Bakool - forces loyal to former militant leader Sheikh Mukhar Ali Robow 'Abu Mansoor' attack al Shabaab positions near Abal and south of Xudur. Three al Shabaab fighters are killed. The actors clashed at Seynilow the previous day.
Unconfirmed local reports claim al Shabaab have attacked the Somali National Army(SNA) position at Bariire. A similar attack occurred the previous day. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters executed a militiaman from Hawadle clan at Buq Aqable village (c. 90 km West of Beletweyne town) who shot and killed his fellow clanmate on 22 September 2017 at Hoolmooge village. The details of the original crime are not known - - may have been an internal or family dispute. Al Shabaab intervened and arrested the perpetrator. An al Shabaab court sentenced the perpetrator to death after both clans agreed to execute the perpetrator.

NISA and Mogadishu stabilisation mission forces clashed at Xoosh village in Dharkenley district. There was an exchange of gunfire. Mogadishu stabilisation forces were conducting a security operation in the area while NISA troops were escorting a wedding convoy which resulted in the dispute. One civilian was killed and two soldiers were wounded in the clash.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed and hijacked a truck transporting 11 tons of food for a UN entity. 2 passengers kidnapped. Truck headed east towards al Shabaab-controlled areas.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Arrests: Puntland forces arrest politicians and critics of Puntland's support to Saudi Arabia and the UAE.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab positions in the al Madow mountain in retaliation for the 09 October Bossaso south MECP attack. Attack targeting group of militants behind the MECP attack. Casualties unknown.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a government troop position at Ex-Daallo neighbourhood in Hodan district. The government forces shot at general directions of the attack. There were no reports of fatalities.

New Hargeisa residents destroyed irons sheets and other building material intended to build a business centre on the grounds of RIIS Intermediate Public-School. This is the second time that residents in New Hargeisa opposed the privatisation of RIIS Intermediate public school.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Security forces exchanged gunfire with three assailants who established an illegal CP at Laasadawaco (c. 110 km South of Bossaso). One assailant and a police officer were killed and two other assailants were wounded. The perpetrators were not identified.
13 October - local reporting suggest the Chairman of the Puntland Parliament may have survived an assassination attempt. Perpetrators not known.
Gunmen opened fire on a wedding car injuring three.
Civilians clash with al Shabaab, possibly over collection of taxes. Casualties unknown.
Al Shabaab executed Guhad Elmi (25), alleged killer of Barre Ibrahim (19).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al-Shabab has seized a ENDF military truck carrying supplies at Budada. No details of causalities.

An armed youth group using clubs, believed to be supporters for Wadaani party, assaulted a Kulmiye supporter near Kenya neighbourhood in Buroa. SLP intervened and arrested the perpetrators. The victim was transferred to Burao Hospital.

Security measures: Dishishe armed sub-clan militias established an illegal CP in Laasadaco area (c. 110 km South of Bossaso) where they shot at a vehicle transporting khat. There were no reports of casualties or arrests.
Movement of forces: Government forces withdraw from Bariire. It is believed this movement is strategic.

14 October. Two car bombs exploded outside a hotel at a busy junction in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Saturday, with officials and witnesses fearing many casualties. Initial reports stated at least 20 dead, though that figure was raised to 300+ in the following days, plus 429 wounded. Following a investigation the death toll was revised higher to 512. On 5 March 2018 a Somali committee investigating the toll of the truck bombing in Mogadishu on 14 October has released new figures, which reveal that 587 people were killed in the bombing.

Residents of Garbaharrey town held a peaceful demonstration against regional states presidents who held a meeting Kismayo during that week. The demonstration was conducted peacefully with no report of violence. The demo may have occurred the previous day.

column9: Reer-Hassan Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Jejele Clan Group (Somalia)
column17: A civilian man hailing from Reer AwHassan clan was shot and killed and another hailing from Jajeele clan was injured by SNA soldiers at Hilaac area in Hawlwadag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne town. The victims were taken to a private hospital in Hawlwadag neighbourhood. The motive behind the attack was unknown. It was suggested that the soldier panicked after people gathered around him and opened fire.

SNA soldiers sexually assaulted an 11-year-old at Bulo-Habey area of Hawtaka neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne. The victim was taken to Beletweyne main hospital for further treatment. Security forces arrested the perpetrators for further investigation.
An al Shabaab VBIED was stopped at a security checkpoint and the driver was arrested, it has yet to be ascertained why the VBIED detonated following the arrest. Four SNAF killed.

About an hour following the hotel attack in Hodan, a second VBIED exploded at Danwadagta neighbourhood near the Somalia airline residential building and NISA CP 4 in Wadajir district. The driver was apprehended by NISA personnel and was being taken for questioning. The VBIED detonated. There were no reports of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
Al-Shabaab have taken control of Bariire town in southern Somalia following the withdrawal of Somali troops during the early morning hours.
Anti-al Shabaab protest occurred at the site of the large hotel bombing on 14/10.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab killed two IJA soldiers during an attack on Buula Gaduud.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 15th October, AM, Buurane Village, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: An al Shabaab IED hits a Burundian convey IVO Buurane Village. Casualties have been reported but the extent and number of injuries and fatalities are unknown.

Movement of forces: Armed men, alleged to be Pro-ISIS militia from Galgala mountain, entered Lasqorey town on foot and stayed in the city but later left. Movement of forces: They hoisted the ISIS flag and delivered speeches to residents. They departed voluntarily without any incident. Radio Kulmiye claims al Shabaab was the actor.
A man was shot and killed at Goryo village (c. 65 km South West of Hargeisa). SLP arrested the assailant and were reported to be investigating the case.

Dishishe armed sub-clan militias established an illegal CP at Juurile area (c. 120 km South of Bossaso) where they shot at a vehicle transporting khat and wounded the driver. The assailants escaped and stole three bags of khat.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubbaland security forces in Dhobley conducted a security operation targeting two local police officers that defected from the police force from Dhobley at Waraq area (c. 90 km South West of Dhobely town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire between security forces and the two missing police officers. One of the targeted soldiers was injured and the other managed to escape. The injured police officer was taken to the AMISOM hospital in Dhobley for treatment. The two police officer was reported missing since 13 October 2017.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubbaland forces, on security patrol, clashed with al Shabaab fighters at Farwamo area (c. 04 km North of Bulogudud village). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and a Jubbaland soldier was injured in the attack. Jubbaland forces confiscated two AK47 rifles and small arms fire ammunition from the scene. The injured soldier was taken to Kismayo hospital for treatment.
15 October, evening - anti-al Shabaab protests are reported in Boondheere.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: A reported drone strike has been carried out on a suspected al Shabaab convey at Bariirre and Aawdiinle on 15/10. Resulting causalities not known. The following day the United States announced greater involvement against al Shabaab in Somalia.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Nine mortar rounds were fired by al Shabaab fighters at Dervish base at Af-Urur of Galgala (c. 65 km South West of Bossaso). There were no reports of immediate casualties or arrests. Later on the same day four other rounds were fired by the perpetrators. No causalities.
16 October, afternoon, IVO Baloow, Middle Shabelle - a SNAF convoy is hit by a roadside an al Shabaab IED at Baloow (likely Balcad). Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab and government forces clash in Daniga, near Balcad. The fighting started after troops commanded by [General] Abdullahi Ali Anod attacked the village, but met stiff resistance from the al-Shabab side. Causalities not known.

Armed al Shabaab elements attacked an SNA checkpoint at Buulo Foolyo area in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. Al Shabaab briefly took control of the checkpoint. There were no reports of fatalities
Kulmiye and Wadani supporters, using clubs and sticks, clashed at Lasanod. The reason behind the clash was believed to be rivalry between the two political parties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 16 October - al Shabaab attack the Jubaland base located near Gaduud. Causalities not known.

A large group of Somali citizens gathered at Xaawo Taako statue to protest on the deadly explosion that occurred at KM 5. The demonstrators chanted anti-al Shabaab slogans and encouraged Somali people to unite in solidarity to counter al Shabaab attacks.
A government soldier shot and killed a female civilian who was searching for her loved ones in the rubble of the collapsed buildings at the explosion site in Zope junction.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air assets conduct an airstrike against a convoy of al Shabaab fighters on 16/10. The result of the strike is not known. Later reports indicate both al Shabaab and civilian injuries. A second source claims ""high causalities.""

Armed al Shabaab attackers using pistols shot and killed a SNA soldier near Warmaxan in Wanleweyn district. The soldier was travelling on the road between Wanleweyn and Afgoye districts when the elements attacked him. The assailants stole the AK-47 belonging to the soldiers. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Al Shabaab assassinates a Jubaland MP.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy was hit by an IED at Kali-Caafimad. An IED struck a convoy at the same location the following day. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland guard shots dead civilian who attempted to enter municipality and failed to stop when ordered. Guard later arrested.

Jejele clan militias clashed with al Shabaab fighters who were collecting Zakat from Jejele clan at Gurwayne area (c. 55 km West of Beletweyne). Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were injured. Al Shabaab fighters were forced to retreat from the incident area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Defusal: BNDF forces find and dismantle an al Shabaab IED in the area of Mahadaay.
Residents in Lasanod marched peacefully along the street of Lasanod in solidarity with Somalis who lost their loved ones at the bombing incident at Zoobe Junction in Mogadishu on 14 October 2017.
Al Shabaab forces attack and overtake a police station in Buulo Folyo following an exchange of gunfire. Causalities not known. The event took place on or before 17/10.
Civilians take the streets for anti-al Shabaab protests in Cadaado and Kismayo. The protest comes following the hotel attacks in Mogadishu on 14/10.
Civilians take the streets for anti-al Shabaab protests in Cadaado and Kismayo. The protest comes following the hotel attacks in Mogadishu on 14/10.

There was an exchange of gunfire between two armed groups over a piece of land located North of Garowe CP near the main tarmac road to Las'anod. There were no reports of casualties. The police and local administration managed to control the situation.
A suspected IED, planted by an unknown perpetrator, detonated and destroyed a house located at the back of Golis Telecom company in Bossaso. Investigations were reported to be ongoing.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and security forces clashed at Isasaaraha area (c. 23 km South of Bossaso). The incident occurs after al Shabaab established an illegal checkpoint which police and PSF intervened. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated towards the western mountain. PSF continued to patrol on the tarmac road. There were no reports of casualties or arrests.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Reports coming from Aw Degle area in Lower Shabelle region [southern Somalia] say [an] air strike hit a vehicle carrying al-Shabab officials and it has been reported that the bombardment killed the targeted officials, numbers not known. About four civilians sustained injuries and were referred to Daarul Shifa Hospital in Mogadishu for treatment. Attacking force not known - likely either US or Kenyan.
Defusal: MoSF cordon off suspected al Shabaab LVBIED. Scene later cleared.
Civilians stage peaceful protest against al Shabaab following 14 OCT bombing.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in various locations including Dhusamareb, Guriel, Abudwak and South Galkayo. The protesters chanted slogans against the deadly terror attacks which occurred at Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. The demonstrators urged the FGS and all nationals to conduct operations against al Shabaab fighters to eliminate the terror group in Somalia.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in various locations including Dhusamareb, Guriel, Abudwak and South Galkayo. The protesters chanted slogans against the deadly terror attacks which occurred at Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. The demonstrators urged the FGS and all nationals to conduct operations against al Shabaab fighters to eliminate the terror group in Somalia.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in various locations including Dhusamareb, Guriel, Abudwak and South Galkayo. The protesters chanted slogans against the deadly terror attacks which occurred at Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. The demonstrators urged the FGS and all nationals to conduct operations against al Shabaab fighters to eliminate the terror group in Somalia.

Hundreds of people in Beletweyne demonstrated against the killing of civilians during the VBIED attack that occurred in Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. Local businesses were closed and vehicle movements were restricted during the demonstration. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Hundreds of people from all parts of the community of Baidoa staged a demonstration against the VBIED attack in Mogadishu and in support of the victims of the attack. The demonstration was organized by the local authorities and South West administration. Officials from the local authorities and South West state attended the rally. The demonstration ended peacefully.
Hundreds of locals conducted a peaceful demonstration in Qardho to condemn the VBIED incident in Mogadishu. They pledged to support the government and the Somali people in fight against al Shabaab.
About 50 locals conducted a peaceful demonstration at Gaaca area of Bossaso to express grief and sorrow for the bombing incident that occurred in Mogadishu on 14 October 2017.

Arrests: Somali Police Forces EOD team dismantled an IED placed inside a container which was found at the bridge on the main road that links the Beletweyne town and the airport, east of Beletweyne town. The telecommunication network was disrupted during the removal process. Two suspects, in connection to the IED incident, were arrested by security forces for further investigation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unconfirmed local sources have reported that an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy has been hit by an IED IVO Lambar KM60 (Marka). An exchange of gunfire followed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Fatalities not known.
Local Sources have reported that al Shabaab have launched an attack on a Somali National Army position on the outskirts of Afgooye. The attack continued for 30 minutes. Causalities are not known.

Residents in Garbaharrey held a peaceful demonstration against the VBIED attack that took place on 14 October 2017 in Mogadishu. Protesters showed solidarity and support to the affected families and those that were killed and injured in the explosions. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in various locations including Dhusamareb, Guriel, Abudwak and South Galkayo. The protesters chanted slogans against the deadly terror attacks which occurred at Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. The demonstrators urged the FGS and all nationals to conduct operations against al Shabaab fighters to eliminate the terror group in Somalia.

Unknown armed assailants, suspected to be al Shabaab, using pistols shot and killed a Jubbbland state assembly member at Somali star in Calanley neighbourhood in Kismayo town. The body of the victim was taken to Kismayo General Hospital. The perpetrators managed to escape from the location of the incident before the arrival of the security forces.

A man and his mother were abducted and subsequently slaughtered by alleged pro Islamic State fighters at Canjeel village (c. 70 km West of Qandala). The perpetrators circulated threat messages to locals and government workers that they would be slaughtered if found involved in spying activities.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A number of demonstrations took place around the city which has led to reported gunfire in the vicinity of KM4. While details from locals remain unclear it is understood the crowd assaulted an AMISOM soldier which resulted in his death after he shot and wounded a demonstrator. The reason of the protest is not known, however, several demonstrations have been occurring following the large-scale hotel attack on 14/10.

Protestors, who were against the deadly VBIED incident that occurred on 14 October 2017 at Zope intersection, conducted several marches along Mogadishu districts. The demonstrators marched along Maka-almukarama road and attempted to enter the explosion site but was prevented by security forces. The protesters forced their way into the explosion site. It was reported that security forces shot at the protesters resulting in three people being injured. The demonstrators, who were chanting anti-al Shabaab slogans, threw stones at many shops and restaurants along the road. Thereafter, a large crowd of residents in Mogadishu gathered at Stadium Koonis in Abdulaziz district for a demonstration attended by top government officials.

A number of demonstrations took place around the city which has led to reported gunfire in the vicinity of KM4. While details from locals remain unclear it is understood the crowd assaulted an AMISOM soldier which resulted in his death after he shot and wounded a demonstrator. The reason of the protest is not known, however, several demonstrations have been occurring following the large-scale hotel attack on 14/10.

A large crowd of residents in Mogadishu gathered at Stadium Koonis in Abdulaziz district for a demonstration attended by top government officials. This took place after protesters against the VBIED incident that occurred on 14 October 2017 were dispersed by police.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A AMISOM soldier kills a civilian. The soldier may have been stabbed by a third unidentified actor prior to the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM soldier kills a civilian. The soldier may have been stabbed by a third actor prior to the incident.
A civilian stabs another over political differences. Details limited. The extent of the injuries are not known.
Al Shabaab kidnaps 200 children in various locations in Bardaale.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Defusal: Puntland forces discover and safely detonate an al Shabaab IED. No casualties.

Recruitment: Al Shabaab fighters increased targeting youth to attend al Shabaab workshop and education centres opened at Ramacadey (c. 60 km South West of Baidoa), on the road to Diinssor and Labatan Jirow (c. 60 km West of Baidoa). The main purpose of al Shabaab was to recruit. A similar exercise was reported to be taking place in other regions in Southern Somali - location not provided. Additional information indicated that there was an increase in the number of females participating at the al Shabaab education centres.

A group of teachers in Cerigabo demonstrated in front of Cerigabo Ministry of Education against the Regional Education Officer accused of favouritism and corruption. The demonstrators demanded for the removal of Regional Education Officer. It was reported that the teachers were among those who failed the MoE exams and were disqualified. Police dispersed the protestors.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Defusal: A Toyota vehicle, loaded with explosive devices, was intercepted by NISA troops at Ceelasha settlement in Afgoye district. The vehicle, which was left unattended in the garage, was successfully defused by the security forces. The intended target of the vehicle could not be established. There were no reports of arrests.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fired an unspecified number of mortar shells at the AMISOM base at Arbacow settlement in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat from the area. Fatalities could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

An Oromo man was stabbed and seriously wounded by an unknown assailant at the seaport area of Bossaso. The victim was rushed to Bossaso General Hospital for treatment. Police were reported to be investigating.
19 October, afternoon, Balidhidin, Bari - pro-Islamic State fighters kill two civilians.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Alleged al Shabaab fighters fired five mortar shells at the Puntland base in Balikhadar area (c. 35 km South West of Bossaso). The mortars impacted on vacant land. There were no immediate reports of casualties, damages or arrests.
19 Oct: Al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a colonel in Warta Nabada (Wardhigley) District, Mogadishu.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked SNAF base in Qoryoley. AMISOM deployed QRF. Casualties unknown.

Armed supporters of Wadani political party, using clubs and machetes, assaulted a delegation of Kulmiye political party at Go'Da- Weyn village (c. 45 km North of Ood-weyne) where supporters of Kulmiye political party were opening a new office. An unspecified number of Kulmiye supporters sustained minor injuries. The police intervened and managed to control the tension between the two groups.

20 October, afternoon, Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle - SNAF forces capture three settlements from al Shabaab - Caanoole, Marreerey, Sabiid. This military offensive was a response to the 14 October bombing and was launched to created a security perimeter around Mogadishu. Other details limited.

20 October, afternoon, Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle SNAF forces capture three settlements from al Shabaab - Caanoole, Marreerey, Sabiid. This military offensive was a response to the 14 October bombing and was launched to created a security perimeter around Mogadishu. Other details limited.
20 October, evening, Aawdiinle, Bay - a grenade attack on a market leaves 21 people injured. Perpetrator identity not reported by source.

An 11-year-old girl died after an explosive device, believed to be a UXO, detonated at Abaya Bilow grazing area (c. 45 km South West of Afmadow town) on the main road of Afmadow and Dhobley. The victim was herding goats with her young brother who survived the blast.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fired five mortar shells that impacted on vacant land at Cali Onkod area near Af-Urur (c. 69 km South West of Bossaso). There were no immediate reports of casualties, damages or arrests.
Peace agreement/talks: Somaliland and Khatumo State Presidents signed a Peace Accord. Future constitutional reviews for both States were also planned.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 20 Oct: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds against a Brundian military base at Arbacow, west of Mogadishu. No injuries reported.
20 Oct: A VBIED detonates under the vehicle of an employee of the Ministry of Justice in Hodan. Two bystanders were injured.

20 October, afternoon, Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle - SNAF forces capture three settlements from al Shabaab - Caanoole, Marreerey, Sabiid. This military offensive was a response to the 14 October bombing and was launched to created a security perimeter around Mogadishu. Other details limited.

An IED attack against a civilian is reported from Ceelasha Biyaha on 20/10. Details limited. The explosive was believed to have detonated prematurely, injuring two. Shabelle Media Network reports two dead. ERA Database reports one death.

Armed men of Abgal-Mohamed Muse shot at a mini bus travelling outside of Biyo Cadde neighbourhood headed towards Mahaday district. The targets were of Abgal/Abukar. At least two passengers were injured. The motive behind the attack was unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Reported drone strike in Lower Shabelle. Details limited.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM/SNAF base near Mashalaay. Assailants repelled. Casualty figures unknown. A second attack was reported two days later.
Detonation: Military forces discover an al Shabaab IED. It is not known if it was dismantled or exploded.
Civilians stage peaceful protest against al Shabaab following 14 OCT bombing. Religious protest, led by religious leaders after prayers.

Three armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab, using pistols attacked SNA soldier at Halgan area of Halwadag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne town. There was an exchange of gunfire. One of the attackers and the SNA soldier was injured in the incident. SNA forces in the area rushed to the location and took the injured soldier to AMISOM level 2 hospital for treatment. The injured soldier was headed to his house during the incident. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 21 October, evening, Garowe, Puntland Puntland Police Commissioner Ereg attempts to shoot Nugaal Governor Shire during a meeting following a dispute over security strategies.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at a government forces position in Karan District. Two soldiers were injured. Targeted troops opened fire at the general direction of the attack but the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unidentified gunmen open fire against a group of students in Wardhigley. Causalities not known.
21 October, afternoon - a SNPF officer shot and killed a civilian being held at a police station in Heliwa. No arrests were made. The motive behind the attack is not known.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade into a teashop frequented by government soldiers in Berdale (c. 55 km North West of Baidoa). Three people, two soldiers and a female owner of the teashop were injured. Security forces arrived and cordoned off the area. There were no reports of arrests.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab media claims attacks on AMISOM bases in Mashaaley and Danow. Causalities not known.
Suspected al Shabaab militants assassinate SNAF soldier. Assailants escaped. SNAF soldier and one assailant injured.
Civilian killed during clashes between rival militias manning an illegal checkpoint. Clashing actors not identified.

Armed supporters of Wadani and Kulmiye political parties, using sticks, clashed at Hass fuel station near Maansoor Hotel. The police arrived at the scene and the two groups escaped from the area. There were no reports of arrests.

Armed Sa'ad and Omar Mohamud pastoralists clashed at Sangaduud vicinity (c. 60 km East of Galkayo). Six people were killed and 22 others were injured. It was believed that the fighting was associated with a dispute over grasslands and previous clan feuds. The situation was reported to be calm but tension was high as the situation was unpredictable.
22 October, AM, Godod, Mudug - armed clashes oppose two rival clan militias. Seven deaths reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM and SNA forces at Mashalay settlement outside of Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew from the location. Casualties not be ascertained at the time of reporting. The exchange may have occurred on the previous day.

22 Oct: Pro-Puntland Dhulbahante supporters and politicians demonstrated at Buhodle against the peace accord arrived at by the Presidents of Khatumo and Somaliland at Ainabo on 20 October. The demonstrators marched along the streets chanting anti- Somaliland/Khatumo slangs. The rally ended peacefully.
22 October, 09:00EAT, Degaanley, Middle Shabelle - a civilian vehicle is hit by a roadside IED. Perpetrators not named by source.

22nd October, AM, Baloow, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: A minibus travelling between Afgooye and Balcad is hit by a road side IED, resulting in the death of six passengers. The highway between the two towns is controlled by al Shabaab and the IED may have been placed to target a military convoy. Shabelle Radio Network claims the attack took place at Daniga village.
A woman was stabbed to death by another woman at Hodan-Qaylo neighbourhood in Burao. The incident was linked to a dispute over political differences. Police arrested the perpetrator.

Unknown armed assailants using pistols shot and killed an electoral delegate near Nasteho village in Wadajir district. The victim participated in the parliamentarian elections of Hirshabelle state in 2016. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

An IED buried along the roadside between Afgoye and Balcad exploded when a civilian mini bus, headed to Afgoye district, was passing at Daniga village (c. 11 km West of Balcad district). Four female passengers, the driver and his conductor were killed. Al Shabaab believed responsible.
A man has been killed in what is believed to be a clan based revenge killing in a settlement north of Elbur.

The vehicle belonging to the deputy governor of Awdal was stoned by teenagers supporting Wadani political party as he drove past a Wadani rally at Borama Liberty Garden. Police arrested two youngsters.

Armed supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at Boqol iyo Kotonka Junction in Kodbur District. An unspecified number of supporters sustained minor injuries. There were no reports of arrests.

Armed al Shabaab combatants allegedly attacked police forces on patrol near Buundo Yarey village in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. One soldier was killed and two others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy travelling at Ceelwareegow near Marka district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Armed men, believed to be a Pro-Puntland armed militia, attacked the residence of the President of Khatumo in Buhoodle town. The armed men clashed with the Presidential guards. There were no reports of casualties.

A woman was killed by an anti-aircraft stray round, suspected to be fired from South Galkayo, which impacted her residence near Barwaaqo market in North Galkayo. Puntland authorities were reported to be investigating the incident. The group that fired the round is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: A local resident and a Puntland soldier exchanged gunfire due to a water dispute in Qandala. Both were wounded and rushed to Bossaso General Hospital for treatment.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: An unidentified armed man attacked Miir Police Station by hurling a hand grenade from the backside of the station. The hand grenade exploded near the police building. There were no reports of casualties. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. Puntland police officials were reported to be investigating the incident.

column6: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubland local police forces, manning the main gate of Dhobley police station, shot and killed a mentally challenged man at c. 30 meters west of the gate. The victim defied instruction of the police before the shooting.
Reported infighting between members of the Somali security forces has resulted in three killed and two injured.
Al Shabaab have launched an attack against a Somali National Army (SNA) IVO Afgooye. Causalities not known. Al Shabaab briefly overtook the checkpoint.

Al Shabaab abducted two farmers from outside of Afgoye district. Al Shabaab burnt the generator before the two men were taken to an unknown location. The motive behind the abduction remains unknown. A second source claims four abducted.

A man hailing from Hawadle clan was shot and killed by a fellow clan member in a shootout at Qooqane village (c. 12 km North East of Beletweyne town). The perpetrator was seriously injured. The motive of the shooting was unknown but information suggested that both men had an unknown verbal dispute before the incident. The injured man was taken to Beletweyne Main Hospital for further medical treatment.

Pro-Somaliland Dhulbahante supporters and politicians gathered at Buhodle in support of the peace accord arrived at by the Presidents of Khatumo and Somaliland in Ainabo on 20 October 2017. The rally ended peacefully.

Two armed men using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a businessman at Waa Cuneyna village in Marka district. The man was a well-known businessman in the city. As result, security forces near the area responded to the incident and allegedly captured the perpetrators. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

Suspected armed al Shabaab assailants shot and killed a police man at Weydow neighbourhood, Deynile district. The officer was a municipal tax collector operating in the area before the armed attackers shot him. Police responded to the incident and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests and the perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A government soldier killed a civilian man at Kaawo-Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. The soldier and the man were involved in a dispute over alleged extortion of money. The perpetrator was not apprehended by the security forces. The body of the victim was brought to the Central Investigations Department for further examination.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Twin explosions reported in close proximity to the central police station, at present reports claim it was carried out by one suicide bomber. The explosion killed the attacker and reportedly wounded six others. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. A second source claims al Shabaab are responsible.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNPF officer in Weydow, Dharkenley. Assailants escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the event.

Supporters of Wadani and Kulmiye political parties clashed near Burao local government building during a Kulmiye rally. Police intervened to disperse the groups. There were no reports of arrests and casualties.

Hundreds of fishermen conducted a peaceful demonstration in front of Narch Fish at Bossaso Seaport. The protestors marched through the streets in protest to the five-day fishing ban due to the ongoing seaport construction. The demonstration concluded peacefully without any incident.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed South West State forces headed to Xudur at Hoogir village (c. 22 km South East of Xudur). The forces, with reinforcement from Xudur, returned from Korkor village where they clashed with al Shabaab fighters. There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab retreated. Three deaths reported.

The militia loyal to Muktar Roobow ambushed al Shabaab fighters driving a Toyota Landcruiser near Abal village (c. 22 km South East of Xudur). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire and RPGs. The vehicle overturned and four al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attack. The militia loyal to Muktar Roobow retreated from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED attack on an AMISOM convoy escalates in wider clashes between al Shabaab and AMISOM. Civilian casualties are reported, numbers not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An African Mission in Somalia (AMSIOM) convey was hit by an al Shabaab road side IED, with a reported secondary device detonating on the disembarkation of AMISOM troops. Reports claim small arms fire followed the IED strike resulting in an unknown number people killed - - locals claim 10 civilians died in the blasts and ensuing gunfire. Among the dead included a journalist. Dalsan Radio reports 20 deaths.

The deputy governor of Bakool has allegedly told media outlets that the Somali National Army (SNA) has taken control of several areas in the Bakool region previous held by al Shabaab. The effected areas were approximately 50km south of Xudur. The only known claimed area is Tor Tor.

Two camel herders were stabbed and wounded by another camel herder hailing from Reer Samatar sub clan at Qabaal (c. 80 km East of Garowe). The motive behind the incident was unknown. Investigations were reported to be ongoing.

Alleged armed clan militiamen hailing from Abgal sub clan of Hawiye killed a farmer from Jareer Weyne clan at Buurfuule settlement in Mahaday district. The killing was triggered by a dispute over farmland between the two clans living in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jubaland (JSF) on security patrol at Wirkoy area (c. 37 km East of Kismayo town). Seven JSF soldiers were killed and five others were injured in the attack. The bodies of the four JSF soldiers who were killed in the attack were taken by al Shabaab fighters to Jilib. The injured soldiers were transported to Kismayo for treatment.
Unconfirmed local sources have reported a man has been shot and killed by two men in the Yaaqshid district in what is suspected to be a CQA.
Detonation: Media reports have claimed that an individual aligned to al Shabaab killed himself whilst trying to wire an IED. His child and wife were also killed in the explosion.
A 3 Star Police officer was shot and killed in what is reported to be a targeted killing, al Shabaab have reportedly claimed responsibility for the killing.

Two armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab assailants, shot and killed a government soldier at Livestock market in Heliwa district. The soldier was in a local restaurant when the armed men shot him. The culprits escaped. The motive behind the killing was unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
25 October, Daynille. Gunmen wearing military uniform open fire against a group of civilians, killing three. It is not known if the gunmen were legitimate soldiers.
Unidentified gunmen kill khat trader in Marka. Assailants escaped.
Somali soldiers fought at undetermined location in Daynile. 1 killed 3 injured.
Civilian ""Jeeri"" assassinated by unidentified gunmen. Assailants escaped. Motives unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Defusal: UPDF foot patrol discovers an al Shabaab IED. Device safely detonated.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against a South West State force position located at the southern outskirts of Diisnoor district (c. 115 km South West of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the scene. There were no reports of casualties.
Early AM, Sarmaan, Bakool - fighters loyal to Sheikh Mukhtar Robow attack al Shabaab positions on 26/10. Causality numbers not known. A similar clash in the area occurred the previous day.
Reports claim that further clan based violence have erupted in settlements to north of Galkacyo at Godad and Galcadale. Six deaths reported between the two locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack a Jubaland military base at Buulo Gaduud. Four soldiers and an officer dead. Other injured. Later reports indicate 6 Jubaland fighters KIA and 10 al Shabaab fighters KIA.
Al Shabaab stones a woman to death on claims of adultery. A second source indicates the event occurred on 27/10.
At least seven people have been injured after Badhan police opened fire on demonstrators protesting against the Hargeisa administration.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: VBIED factory explodes. 1 KIA 2 WIA. NISA arrest two.
Reports claim that further clan based violence have erupted in settlements to north of Galkacyo at Godad and Galcadale. Six deaths reported between the two locations.
27 October, evening, Marka, Lower Shabelle - clan militiamen assassinate two civilians. Clan identity, motive not provided.
Kulmiye supporters stone the house of Waddani Party figures. Somaliland Police arrest five suspected perpetrators.

An al Shabaab IED targets convoy transporting FGS Governor of Cadale near Goley. DC and two bodyguards injured. A civilian vehicle was also reportedly hit the same day in the same area by an al Shabaab IED. 3 injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: KDF planes conduct an airstrike against al Shabaab positions in Dhasheq Wammo. Targeting grazing area whose access was restricted to local communities by al Shabaab. Causalities not known.
Unidentified warplanes conduct airstrike against al Shabaab positions, possibly HVT. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.
AM, IVO Cadale, Middle Shabelle - a Fedeal government convoy is targeted by an roadside IED. Outcome and perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Early AM, FOB Gaduud, Lower Jubba - al Shabaab fire several mortar rounds against the JSF base located near Gaduud. Causality figures not provided.
Suspected al Shabaab assassinated a federal district official at his home near Suuq Bacad market. One of the assailants was later killed by security forces.
28 October - Two groups of Somali soldiers clash at an unknown Mogadishu location. One person was allegedly killed. The reason for the exchange of gunfire is not known.
Suspected al Shabaab assassinated a federal district official at his home near Suuq Bacad market. One of the assailants was later killed by security forces.

Between two or three al Shabaab car bombers attackers target the Nasa-Hablod hotel, which is frequented by politicians and other members of Mogadishu's elite. 20 dead, 30 wounded. Later reports count 27 dead. Al-Furqaan report 50 dead. Al Shabaab claims 70 dead. The first VBIED detonated at approximately 17:00EAT. The secondary VBIED was remotely detonated at approximately 17:40EAT. Following the blasts five gunmen stormed the hotel where they were they stayed until they were dislodged by SNG forces. Two dead, three captured. Al Shabaab's statement claiming responsibility was released at approximately 17:55EAT. Among the dead were nine Danab (Somali Special Forces).
Following a large attack on a Xamar Weyne, security forces engage the attackers, killing two and capturing three.
Supporters of the Kulmiye and Waddani Somaliland political parties clashed in Ceerigaabo. Somaliland Police arrested six suspected perpetrators.

Approximately 300 local civilians stage a protest against the tenure of Somaliland elections in Baran. Unidentified gunmen opened fire, injuring nine. Puntland forces were subsequently deployed to the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Limited unconfirmed reporting claimed that African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops have engaged al Shabaab in Baraawe. No known causalities.
Al Shabaab attack SNAF checkpoint near Cabdow Dibile. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.

Al Shabaab attempt to kidnap four local NGO workers. ISWA responds. Armed clashes ensued. NGO vehicle destroyed by RPG round. Five ISWA soldiers injured when vehicle overturns on return to Baidoa. No casualties reported.
Civilians protest against the Aynabo Peace Agreement. Demonstration instigated by pro-Puntland politicians. Event remained peaceful.
Suspected al Shabaab operative hurled a hand grenade against joint SNAF/SNPF checkpoint at Horseed/Hawo Takko junction. No casualties reported. Assailant escaped.
Limited reporting claims Al Shabaab have launched an attack on a SNA position IVO Bulo Burto. It is believed the government forces repelled the attack with no reported causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unverified media claims stated al Shabaab recaptured Ras Cadey, 12km from Baraawe, following the evacuation of the defensive position protecting the settlement by AMISOM forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Limited unconfirmed reporting claims that African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops have engaged al Shabaab in the town of Buulo Mareer. Causalities not known.
30 October, An unidentified armed group assassinated a civilian in Hodan district. The motive of the attack is not known.

Detonation: An IED planted along the roadside by al Shabaab elements prematurely exploded at Daniga settlement (c. 11 km North of Balcad district). Security forces responded and recovered the bodies of the fighters. At least four al Shabaab operators were killed in the explosion. A second source claims the attack took place the following day.
Al Shabaab attacks and temporarily overtakes a checkpoint outside of Baidoa. Casualties not known.
Al Shabaab executes a man on charges of spying.

Biyo-maal armed clan militia attacked farmers and herdsmen from Mohamed Muse sub clan of Abgaal at KM 50 settlement in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire. The attack was as a result of clan feuds in the area. At least five persons were killed in the clan skirmish.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Local unconfirmed reporting has stated that the AMISOM base in Qooryoley had been attacked by al Shabaab. At present details remain limited.

A businessman hailing from Galjecel clan was abducted by Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan at Qabno (c. 38 km North of Beletweyne town). The incident was related to clan retaliation. Caafi sub-clan of Galjecel clan abducted four civilians from Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan in response to the abduction of the businessman. Efforts from influential clan elders were reported to be ongoing to defuse tension and secure the release of the abducted.

A businessman hailing from Galjecel clan was abducted by Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan at Qabno (c. 38 km North of Beletweyne town). The incident was related to clan retaliation. Caafi sub-clan of Galjecel clan abducted four civilians from Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle clan in response to the abduction of the businessman. Efforts from influential clan elders were reported to be ongoing to defuse tension and secure the release of the abducted.
Al Shabaab militants abducted a religious sufi-cleric man at Caad village (c. 30 km North of Harardheere).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED planted along the road, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling at Maryan Gubay in Barawe district, exploded. One AMISOM vehicle was damaged by the explosion. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Additional reports stated that another IED exploded at a convoy in the area which was not far from the site of the first explosion.

An armed al Shabaab fighter shot a municipal soldier at Weydow village in Deynile district. The soldier shot at the al Shabaab man killing him on the scene. The soldier later died of sustained injuries. Security forces responded to the incident and took the bodies of the soldier and al Shabaab operator. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the killing.

A civilian male was shot and killed by an SNA soldier at Tarbuunka neighbourhood in Hodan district. The motive of the killing was based on a land dispute. One civilian female bystander was also injured. The perpetrator managed to escape.
Following the abduction of a businessman from Galjacel, government forces clashed with Hawadle-Agoon militia. Two deaths reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: IED detonates against UPDF convoy en route to MIA. 1 Civilian vehicle hit, 1 injured.
Detonation: An al Shaabab IED detonates prematurely in Bossaso. No causalities.
Supporters of Wadani and Kulmiye political parties clashed in Bixin village (c. 30 km North West of El-Afweyn). Eight people were arrested in connection to the incident.

South West State (SWS) forces ambushed al Shabaab fighters near Jiiro Gurey area (c. 8 km South East of Berdaale) on the road between Baidoa and Berdaale. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which South West State forces retreated from the scene and returned to their base at Berdaale (c. 55 km North West of Baidoa). One SWS soldier was injured and two al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attack. Al Shabaab fighters were reported to be headed to Buulo Xaawo village (c. 60 km West of Baidoa and c. 20 km South West of Berdaale).
SNAF forces recapture Mukay Dumis, Iidow Guudow and Goosaarow, 15km west of Buulo Mareer from al Shabaab. No reported resistance.
SNAF forces recapture Mukay Dumis, Iidow Guudow and Goosaarow, 15km west of Buulo Mareer from al Shabaab. No reported resistance.
Reer Omar clansman killed by Reer Muse Cadde (subclan of Isse Mohamud/Majerten). Motive was previous shooting over land ownership dispute. Female bystander injured.
An IED placed on the roadside targeting a government convoy travelling in Shalanbod area exploded. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
SNAF forces recapture Mukay Dumis, Iidow Guudow and Goosaarow, 15km west of Buulo Mareer from al Shabaab. No reported resistance.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab combatants attacked AMISOM troops at Mashalay settlement outside of Qoryoley district. The clash was initiated with a mortar attack following heavy exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew from the area. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against SNA forces based at Daynuunay village (c. 25 km South East of Baidoa) on the road between Baidoa and Mogadishu. There was an exchange of small arms fire and heavy machine guns after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against an SNA position at KM 50 settlement. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about three hours after which al Shabaab withdrew from the position. Five SNA soldiers were killed while nine others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed South West State forces traveling in two Toyota Noah vehicles near Lug-Habar village (c. 22 km North West of Buurkahaba) on the road between Baidoa and Buurhakaba. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which SWS forces withdrew. Two SWS soldiers were injured. Al Shabaab fighters burnt two vehicles at the incident location. SWS soldiers were reported to be escorting khat back to Buurhakaba district.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Movement of forces: 01 November, afternoon, Gedo 1,000 Ethiopian soldiers cross the Somali border in Doolow, and are seen heading to Luuq.

A civilian man was shot and killed by an armed man at Xaaro village (c. 110 km North West of Hobyo). The motive of the incident was connected to a land dispute. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene. Both the victim and perpetrator were close relatives from Sa'ad sub-clan of Habargidir.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Hundreds of people conducted a violent demonstration at the main market near seaport in protest to the increase in tax and a construction company. Security forces intervened and fired warning shots in the air. One protester was killed, two others were injured and several vehicles were damaged.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: One person has been reported as killed and five injured when Puntland security force opened fire on protestors who had assembled over reasons surrounding inflation in the city and the closure of the now P&O owned port. The protesters were reportedly peaceful.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces shot at a speeding civilian vehicle in suspicion of al Shabaab at Argo Junction area in Kismayo town. A civilian bystander was injured in the incident. The victim was taken to Kismayo Hospital for treatment.

A government soldier shot and killed a rickshaw driver at Tarabunka intersection in Hodan district. The soldier denied the driver access to a restricted road but the driver disobeyed the instruction. The perpetrator was apprehended by security forces.

At least three people including a driver were seriously injured in a car bomb explosion in Zoobe. Perpetrators not named by the source. It is not known if the perpetrators were present at the time of the attack.

Reer Diini clan, sub-clan of Marehan and Suleiman clan, sub-clan of Habargidir militias clashed near Dhuumoodle village (c. 30 km West of Cadaado). There was an exchange of gunfire. The clash was due to the hijacking of a vehicle. Two people, hailing from Marehan clan, were killed.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Hundreds of local residents and traders conducted a violent demonstration in proximity of the main market near Bossaso seaport in protest to the increase of port charges and a construction company. Security forces intervened and dispersed the crowds.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air assets target Islamic State (IS) positions in Buqa village, 60 kilometres south of Qandala. ""Several"" killed. This was the first known case of direct United States involvement against IS in Somalia. The target of the attack was Sheikh Abdulkadir Mumin. IS later claimed the target survived. The attack consisted of two strikes.
Residents protest after the town of Bwelet Weyne changed currencies to the US dollar.

SLP arrested seven youngsters for creating a ""public disturbance"" in Galjano, Hargeysa. The youngsters confronted the police and the police resulted in firing warning shots. Two youngsters were slightly injured. It is not known if the disturbance is related to unrest between Kulmiye and Wadani.
Supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed at Hargeisa stadium during Kulmiye political rally. SLP dispersed the two groups. There were no reports of arrest or casualties.

Armed assailants, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled two hand grenades at police forces patrolling near Xawo Tako CP in Afgoye district. The hand grenades landed on an empty place and the forces shot towards the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for attack.
Habar-Yunis/Sacad Yunis and Habar-Jeclo/Baho militias clashed at Ceel-Afweyn over territorial control. SLP intervened and arrested four militiamen. There were no reports of casualties

A rally organized by Kulmiye political party was dispersed by police as a group of youngsters stoned the Horn Star music band performing at the rally. Police fired warning shots to disperse the crowd.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a civilian at Dhurey village (c. 16 km South of Wajid district). The victim was transporting personal commodities to Rabdhure district. Al Shabaab fighters accused him of transporting commercial goods to Wajid district. Al Shabaab fighters destroyed the goods and the donkey cart of the victim. Family members of the victim within al Shabaab in Rabdhure district demanded for the detention of the perpetrators.
03 November, evening, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle - unidentified gunmen assassinate a clan elder.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle transporting khat to Xudur town from Ceel Berde district at Maaray area (c. 45 km South West of Ceel Berde district). Four people were killed and the vehicle and khat was destroyed. Security forces arrived at the scene and took the dead bodies to Xudur for burial. Al Shabaab fighters managed to escape from the area before the security forces arrived.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces (JISA) and Kismayo police clashed at Siinaay Junction in Kismayo town. There was an exchange of small arms fire. The incident occurred after police officers manning a checkpoint at the junction attempted to stop a JISA officer, driving a vehicle with armed JISA officers. One JISA officer was injured. The JISA officers later clashed with other forces at Golgol areas of Farjano neighbourhood in Kismayo town. One JISA officer was seriously injured. The injured soldiers succumbed to their injuries in Mogadishu after being transported for further medical treatment.

Suspected al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a government soldier at Tabeleha Shiekh Ibrahim village in Deynile district. The body of the soldier was taken to CID for further examination. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Armed assailants attacked a government soldier at Livestock Market in Heliwa district. The attackers stole the AK-47 belonging to the victim and escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for this assassination.
AM, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle - al Shabaab operatives hurl hand grenades against two separate security checkpoints. Causalities not known.
