Al Shabaab militants attacked an SNA checkpoint at Bulo Folyo settlement in Afgoye district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab elements withdrew. There were no reports of fatalities.
Early AM, Xudur - Bardale, Bakool - al Shabaab ambush a Southwest military convoy. Al Shabaab claims 5 dead.

Al Shabaab ambushed two soldiers travelling by road between Cali Fooldhere settlement and Biyo-Cadde in Mahaday (Jowhar) district. The government soldiers were riding on motorcycles when al Shabaab elements attacked. There was an exchange of gunfire. As result, one of the soldiers was killed and another escaped. One al Shabaab fighter was killed.
04 November, 18:00EAT, Galkacyo, Mudug - an UVIED explosion targets the Deputy Mayor of Galkacyo. The target was injured. Perpetrators not identified.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland Security Forces conducted a military operation against al Shabaab in Harweyn Calmadow (c. 57 km South West of Bossaso). 13 al Shabaab fighters were killed.

Two armed assailants shot and killed a police officer at Jaamacadah village in Hodan district. The officer was sitting outside his house when he was shot by armed attackers. The perpetrators escaped. Police forces in the area responded to the incident and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility for the attack.
5 November, IVO Qandala, Bari - Islamic State fighters kidnapped nine civilians in retaliation for the 3 November US drone strikes.

A group of students in Wadamagoo secondary schools staged a demonstration against the arrest of their school principal by police after being accused of getting USD 5,000 from Wadani opposition party as compensation for lack of three months' salary.
SLP arrested seven youngsters involved in a ""public disturbance"" in Halane neighbourhood, Borama. No reported violence.
05 November, afternoon, Afgooye/Balcad districts - SNAF forces capture Baasra, Daniga/Baloow and Buulo Kuunto. No violence reported.
05 November, afternoon, Afgooye/Balcad districts - SNAF forces capture Baasra, Daniga/Baloow and Buulo Kuunto. Five killed in Basra. No violence reported in the other areas.
05 November, afternoon, Afgooye/Balcad districts - SNAF forces capture Baasra, Daniga/Baloow and Buulo Kuunto. No violence reported.
SLP arrested eight youngsters involved in public disturbance in Mohamud Haibe, Hargeysa. No reported violence.

Unknown assailants shot and injured a municipal officer at Bakara Market gold section in Howlwadag district. The victim was taken to hospital but later succumbed to injuries. The attackers escaped. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces launch an attack on an al Shabaab position near Bali Doogle airport. Causalities not known. The attack is part of a wider offensive in the area.

Non-violent activity: Two clan militias hailing from Saad and Suleiman clans, sub-clan Habargidir hijacked four vehicles amongst themselves, two from each corner of South Galkayo and Godinlabe (c. 30 km South of Cadado) in Mudug and Galgaduud regions respectively.

South West State forces attacked al Shabaab fighters preparing to ambush civilian vehicles at Ugaari area (c. 10 km North West of Buurhakaba) on the road between Baidoa and Buurhakab district. There was an exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. One al Shabaab fighter was killed in the attack and his body was brought to Buurhakaba town by South West State forces.
A Somaliland soldier was shot and killed by a fellow clansman in Lasanod during a scuffle. A stray bullet injured a civilian.
Tension was reported to be high in Meygagle following the murder of a Dhulbahante/Reer-Hagar man by an armed Dhulbahante/Ali-Geri sub-clan man. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

Al Shabaab publicly executed three al Shabaab fighters and one civilian of Somali origin. The victims were accused of aiding with Ethiopian/Somali troops and spying for foreign intelligence agencies. The victims were brought from other al Shabaab controlled areas a day before the killing.
Defusal: Security forces seized a small vehicle laden with explosive devices. The vehicle, which was parked on the road, was suspected by residents who informed security. Perpetrator not known.

Attackers shot and killed a correction police officer at Carafaat neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. Security forces responded to the incident and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.

A civilian vehicle travelling near Tixsiile was ambushed by armed militia who shot at the vehicle. As result, five passengers were killed and three others were injured. The attack occurred on either 07/11 or 08/11.

Four people hailing from Marehan clan were abducted by Suleiman clan militias in Cadado town. The motive of the abduction was connected to previous carjacking and abductions. The victims were later released.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Timirshe, Bari: Puntland security forces conduct offensive operation against Islamic State in the Bari region. Details limited.

column7: UCID: Justice and Welfare Party of Somaliland
column17: Armed supporters of UCID and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at Ahmed Dhagah district in Hargeisa. Police arrived at the scene and the two groups escaped from the area. There were no reports of arrests.

Al Shabaab launched a heavy attack against a newly established SNA base (c. 14 km from Balcad). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about two hours after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least eight people from both warring parties were killed and four others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 08th November, PM, Basra, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed local sources have claimed that African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops have been attacked by al Shabaab Militants. Causality figures not known.
Al Shabaab injures a civil servant with a remote controlled under-car IED attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: The US on Thursday launched an airstrike in Somalia's Bay region killing several Al Shabaab militants. The attack occurred about 100 miles west of Mogadishu. The Pentagon reports 36 al Shabaab dead in 5 airstrikes between 09/11 and 12/11, though the causality figure in this instance is not precisely known. Four of five strikes were conducted 'in the south' against al Shabaab.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: United States forces carry out a drone strike against IS personnel 'in the northeast' (likely near Qandala) on 09/11. Four deaths reported.

Armed supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at a roundabout near the local government in Burao. Police intervened and dispersed the supporters. There were no reports of casualties.

Unknown armed attackers shot and killed a NISA soldier at Dhagah Tuur Village in Afgoye district. The soldier was working in Mogadishu and went Afgoye for his leave before the armed attackers shot him. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility for the attack.

Armed assailants shot and killed a civilian man at Weydow village in Deynile district. The man was attacked by armed men while he was in his house. The motive behind the incident was unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

09th November 1100L, Hodan, Mogadishu: A road side improvised explosive devise (IED) detonated at the Ministry of Defence. The explosive missed its target, though it hit a Somali National Army (SNA) vehicle injuring three. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

An IED, buried alongside the road, targeting an SNA convoy travelling through Industrial Road near Caafi Factory, exploded. Troops opened fire at suspected directions of the attack. At least one civilian pedestrian and a government soldier were injured in the blast. The unidentified perpetrators escaped.

An IED planted near Perfume factory detonated in Heliwa district. The place was frequented by SNA forces. At least three soldiers were injured in the blast. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the explosion.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: United States forces launched an air strike against al Shabaab in Bay Region, around 20 miles north of Mogadishu More than a dozen militants were killed. The Pentagon reports at least 36 al Shabaab dead in 5 airstrikes between 09/11 and 12/11, though the causality figure in this instance is not precisely known. Four of five strikes were conducted 'in the south' against al Shabaab.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a base at Baqdaad. Causality figures not known.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a base at Jambaluul. Causality figures not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces launch an attack against IS members at Timirshe. A similar attack occurred at this location on 07/11. Causalities in this instance not known.

Al Shabaab recaptured on 10 November Baasra settlement, located approximately 15km west of Balcad in Middle Shabelle region, following a sustained attack against the base recently set-up by the SNAF. Causalities are not known. Basra had recently been claimed by government forces on 05/11.

Armed militia from Reer Mataan sub clan of Abgal shot and killed two other clansmen hailing from Mohamed Muse Reer Mataan sub clan at Dhaay Waraabe settlement in Jowhar district. The perpetrators escaped. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters were observed at Kalabayr junction (c. 22 km North of Beletweyne town) where they coerced the local power company, located on the eastern side of Beletweyne town, to switch off electricity to the town. The company switched off the electricity for 30 minutes. AMISOM Djiboutian contingent forces received the information and fired several rounds of artilleries to the area where al Shabaab movements was observed. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed South West State (SWS) force convoy headed to Berdaale at Ideedi village (c. 45kms North West of Baidoa and c. 11 km East of Berdaale). Al Shabaab fighters detonated an IED targeting one of the convoys followed by a protracted armed clash. Al Shabaab fighters used several RPGs in the attack. Five SWS soldiers and three al Shabaab fighters were killed, and seven SWS soldiers and five al Shabaab fighters were injured in the attack. SWS forces reportedly lost a PKM machine gun to al Shabaab in the attack. SWS forces retreated from the scene and the injured soldiers were transported to Baidoa for medical treatment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Minister of Information Abdirahman Omar Osman has released a statement that joint SNA and AMISOM operations have killed 81 members of al Shabaab. Al Shabaab denied the attack took place. The date(s) of the attack were not provided by the source. Source dated 11/11.
Limited unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have killed a Somalia National Army (SNA) soldier in Afgooye.

Attack without casualties: Al Shabaab members carjacked a vehicle transporting khat near Damase Village (c. 60 km South West of Cel Waaq district). The vehicle was destroyed by al Shabaab using explosives. The whereabouts of the driver and passengers were unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab conducted an IED attack against a Jubaland, AMISOM KDF contingent and international partners joint force convoy near Barka village (c. 40 km North West of Kismayo Town). A Toyota pickup was destroyed because of the blast. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: United States drone strikes were launched against al Shabaab in or near the village of Basra (possibly in nearby Mareerey). Casualty figures area unconfirmed but reports state at least 10 al Shabaab were killed. The Pentagon reports at least 36 al Shabaab dead in 5 airstrikes between 09/11 and 12/11, though the causality figure in this instance is not precisely known. Four of five strikes were conducted 'in the south' against al Shabaab. This attack may have occurred on 12/11.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Anti-al Shabaab drones (likely US) conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab base at Darasalam settlement village in Qoryoley district. Three civilian farmers were killed. Casualties of al Shabaab fighters could not be established at the time of reporting.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air strike against al Shabaab at Bulo Gudud. One causality reported.

Detonation: An unidentified man hurled a hand grenade against local security forces on patrol at Waaberi neighbourhood in Dinsoor district (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). The grenade landed on an empty place. There were no reports of casualties or arrests made in connection of the incident.

Detonation: An unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at South-West force position at Jidka Sodonka in Horseed neighbourhood of Baidoa. The security forces were not present at the location during the attack. There were no reports of arrests.
Ballot boxes deployed to Badhan were disrupted in Xingalool due to resistance from Puntland supporters in Badhan. There no reports of clashes or casualties.

Unidentified war planes conducted several air offensive operations at Sanguuni village (c. 50 km North East of Kismayo town). The planes destroyed several al Shabaab locations in the area. Al Shabaab fighters fled from the incident location towards Jamame/Kamasuma. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

Mogadishu Stabilization forces shot at the Commissioner of Mahaday District while travelling at Sanca junction in Karan district. The official was headed to his residence and the forces suspected his body guards. One of his security guards were killed.
A local elder and electorate was killed in a likely targeted killing in Baraka Market. Assailants escaped the scene. Al Shabaab are suspected.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 15 IS fighters are dead following a US drone strike 30km from Qandala on 12/11.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 12 November US airstrike against an al Shabaab camp located near Mareerey, south-west of Jilib in Middle Jubba region. This strike had resulted in 81 casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Two additional US airstrikes are carried out against al Shabaab 'in the south' between the dates of 09/11 and 12/11. Causality figures are unknown in the two instances where the location is not known. The strike on 12/11 occurred in ""Lower Shabelle Region about 64 km west of the capital of Mogadishu."" Coded as remainder: 3

Arrests: Military forces arrest several high profile al Shabaab members in Afgooye. Their identities have been revealed as Aweys Khadar Ahmed, the Emir of Afgooye district, Abdullahi Mohamud Mukhtar Ileey, an explosives technician, Salah Abdulkadir Abdulle, the head of finances in Afgooye district, Mohamed Aweys Ali, an Amniyat operative, Mohamed Hussein Salad (Yemeni/Somali), an Amniyat operative, Mohamed Ali Hassan, an Amniyat intelligence operative, Bakar Mohamed Yacqub, Zakariye Salad Mohamed, an Amniyat operative and Aweys Kamal Muhiadin, an Amniyat operative.

Two groups of Wadani and Kulmiye supporters were confronted at Mohamed Ali and Qasabka polling stations in Burao town whereby both groups attempted to bypass the queue forcefully. Police fired warning shot in the air to disperse the crowds. The administration in Burao intervened and resumed the voting process at those polling stations after an hour. There were no reports of casualties.

Two groups of Wadani and Kulmiye supporters were confronted at Daamurka polling stations in Borama town after both groups attempted to bypass the queue forcefully. SLP at the polling stations dispersed both groups and resumed normal functions at the polling station.
Somali National Army (SNA) have reported taking further previously al Shabaab controlled villages in the Baraawe district. The names of the locations were not given. No reported violence.
Wadani supporters assaulted an officer who was representing Kulmiye party at the polling station in Iskudar village (c. 56 km North of Oodweyne). Police intervened and dispersed the attackers.

A group of Kulmiye supporters stoned Waddani officers, who were observing the voting process, in Waddo-Makahiil and Fara- weyne. Two vehicles were damaged. Police fired warning shots in the air to disperse the crowd. The extent of injuries are not known.

A group of Kulmiye supporters stoned Waddani officers, who were observing the voting process, in Waddo-Makahiil and Fara- weyne. Two vehicles were damaged. Police fired warning shots in the air to disperse the crowd. The extent of injuries are not known.

An armed man from Dhulbahante/Samokaab Ali clansman shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Farah Ali sub clan in the vicinity of Taleh. The motive of the killing was linked to prolonged disputes and revenge killings between the two clans. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

SLP officers at two of the polling stations in Kaba-dhere and Mohamed-Ugas shot and injured a civilian who created unrest at a queue. Both police officers were arrested at the Burao Police Station. The nature of the 'unrest' is not known.

Security measures: Pro-Puntland militia/politicians attempted to disrupt the presidential elections in Widhwidh, Ceegaag and Balihadhac villages. Somaliland security forces pre-empted the move and reinforced security around the polling stations. There were no reports of clashes.
Al Shabaab throw agrenade at SNA position. One civilian was injured, it is reported one of the assailants was detained. The attack may have happened in Wadajir.

Unknown armed attackers injured a civilian man at Nageyle village in Karan district. The victim was taken to hospital but succumbed to his injuries. Security forces responded to the incident and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrest. The motive behind the killing was unknown. The perpetrators escaped. No group has claimed responsibility for the killing.

Three SNA soldiers driving a small vehicle shot and killed a civilian man at Tarabunka junction neighbourhood in Hodan district. The soldiers stormed into the house of the victim and shot at the man. The man and soldiers allegedly hailed from the same clan. The perpetrators escaped. The motive behind the killing could not be established at the time of reporting.

Local reports claim that local man was shot and killed by a Somali National Police (SNP) Officer. The reasons for the attack are not known. The attack occurred near the Karan district offices. An attack against government official occurred in Karan the previous day.

A group of armed Waddani supporters using sticks attacked the representative of Kulmiye at the polling station in Mandhere. SLP in Mandhera arrested four people and the representative was taken to Berbera Hospital.

Detonation: An unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at South-West special police forces position near Telesom Telecommunication Company in Berdale neighbourhood of Baidoa. The hand grenade landed on an empty place. There were no reports of casualties. There were no reports of arrests.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Defusal: An IED buried along the roadside was defused by AMISOM forces travelling on the road at Ceelwareegow (c. 13 km North East of Marka district). Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for this attempted attack and a second attack near KM67.

Local reports claim that the SNA have carried out offensive operations in a number of villages around Baraawe. Government forces gained control of a number of locations in the area the previous day. Fatalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A suspected al Shabaab suicide bomber rammed an AMISOM convoy with an explosive-laden vehicle outside of Mogadishu along the Mogadishu-Afgooye road at Garas Barey. One confirmed death. After the attack AMISOM forces conducted a security sweep and arrested 19 suspects.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against SNA forces positioned at Xudur town. Al Shabaab fighters fired small arms fire from a distance to the direction of the SNA base. SNA forces responded with small arms fire and machine guns. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two civilian charcoal burners and injured another at a grazing area near Buulo Xaaji village (c. 70 km South West of Kismaayo town). The injured was taken to Kismaayo Hospital for medical treatment. Al Shabaab fighters took the bodies of the victims from the scene to an unknown location. The motive of the killing was not clear.
A body of a teenager was found in a shallow well in Bad-wayn village (c. 27 km North East of Ainabo). The dead body was taken to Ainabo Hospital. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED buried along the roadside was defused by AMISOM forces travelling on the road at Ceelwareegow (c. 13 km North East of Marka district). It was reported that another IED exploded at KM 67 area and killed one AMISOM soldier and seriously injured another. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device (VBIED) has hit an AMISOM convoy on the Afgooye road north of Afgooye ex control. The vehicle's operator crashed into the convoy. Apart from the driver, the number of causalities are not known.

Two groups of government soldiers clashed at Haanta Dheer village in Deynile district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 15 minutes. The two groups disputed over land in the area. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: A suspected US drone targeted an al Shabaab base at Idow-Jalaad, near Yaaq Biri Weyne, killing 'several' militants - four confirmed. A later report claimed seven 'likely.'

A group of armed Wadani supporters using machetes assaulted other residents at Qasabka neighbourhood in Burao. The motive of the attack was unclear but it was believed to have been linked to rallies conducted by both Wadani and Kulmiye supporters for unofficial victory of the elections. SLP dispersed the crowd.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab combatants fired three mortar shells at the AMISOM base at Ambareeso area (c. 05 km North of Barawe district). The mortar rounds landed on an empty place in the camp resulting in no human fatalities. Following the barrage, al Shabaab forces attack the village with small-arms fire, but were rebuffed by the AMISOM forces. Causalities not known from the small-arms exchange.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Unconfirmed local reports have stated that low level fighting has occurred between al Shabaab and Ethiopian National Defence forces (ENDF) on the outskirts of Hudur. Outcome not known.
A civilian is killed in a clan motivated affairs. Identities not known.

A civilian man from Ayr sub-clan of Habargidir was shot and killed by clan militias from Ali sub-clan of Hawdle clan at Qabno area (c. 38 km North of Beletweyne). Another fellow clan member who was with the victim managed to escape from the scene. The vehicle that was driven by the victim was taken by the militia. The incident was related to a retaliation of a previous killing of a man from Hawadle clan at Mataban district by Habargidir clan.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired six mortar shells against Puntland forces at Af-Urur village of Galgala mountain (c. 70 km South West of Bossaso). There were no reports of causalities.
Wadani Party supporters, alleging voter rigging, clash with police and light fires. No reported causality.
Wadani Party supporters, alleging voter rigging, clash with police and light fires. One death reported. A second source claims 3 dead.
Al Shabaab attacked a government checkpoint at Hawa Abdi. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab launches grenade attack against Heliwa district police HQ. Causalities, damage not known.
16th November, 1100L, Heliwa, Mogadishu: A local elder was shot and killed by two gunmen in a likely targeted killing. Perpetrators not known.

Waddani Party supporters on 16/11 took to the streets of various opposition strongholds (locations not provided) to protest what they claim to be election irregularities. In Burco police had to use live bullets to disperse protestors who had lit bonfires and closed main roads. No reported injuries.
Al Shabaab attacks a government military checkpoint in Yaaqshiid. The government forces rebuffed the attack and made 10 arrests. No reported causalities.

18th November, AM, Geed Faqi, Lower Shabelle: Reports have stated that al Shabaab have retaken a settlement called Geed Faqay sat approximately 14km South West of Balcad. Incidents of violence not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Movement of forces: The United States (US) Pentagon announced over 500 US soldiers were currently deployed in Somalia. It was not reported when the soldiers were deployed. The announcement coincides with increased US air attacks in the recent period.
Al Shabaab carried out a drive-by shooting against SNG forces. One soldier killed, three wounded.
At least one government soldier was reported wounded in a gun attack on a Somali security checkpoint in Wardhigley. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. The Somali memo claims three dead.
Hundreds of local residents conducted a peaceful demonstration in the area between Gaaca and Bossaso main market in protest to a construction company. The demonstration ended peacefully at 1140 hrs.
Al Shabaab ambushed an SNA convoy between Balcad and Jowhar ivo Gololey. Two SNA troops reported killed in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against an SNA security checkpoint at Mukayga vicinity in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. One SNA soldier was injured. Al Shabaab casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

Unidentified armed militia shot and slightly injured a pastoralist from Sa'ad clan in Teerage area (c. 15 km South West of Galkayo). The attackers stole one camel from the victim and escaped from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 20th November, Galgala, Bari, Puntland: Puntland Security forces have claimed to have carried out further offensive operations against al Shabaab. Details limited.

Government forces launch a military campaign against al Shabaab in Sablaale, taking several villages under their control. Specific villages not named. There were no specific reports of violence, though the source implies some activity. Causalities not known. At the time of reporting the government forces were positioned at the outskirts of the Sablaale town. It was reported that al Shabaab had begun fleeing from Sablaale proper, but still held the town.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters burnt commercial commodities, killed donkeys and destroyed donkey carts transporting goods near Garsaley village (c. 40 km South of Rabdhure). The commercial goods came from Burdhuxunle headed to Wajid district. The owners of the donkey carts managed to escape from the al Shabaab fighters. Some of those who escaped burnt two houses of the two main perpetrators in Wajid district in retaliation to the loss of their property.

A violent demonstration erupted in New Hargeisa and Burao after the announcement of the preliminary results of the Somaliland presidential election by National Electoral Commission (NEC). The main opposition party, Wadani, accused the ruling party of rigging their votes. One person was reportedly injured in Burao. There were no reports of arrests.

A violent demonstration erupted in New Hargeisa and Burao after the announcement of the preliminary results of the Somaliland presidential election by National Electoral Commission (NEC). The main opposition party, Wadani, accused the ruling party of rigging their votes. One person was reportedly injured in Burao. There were no reports of arrests.

A violent demonstration erupted in Cerigabo after the announcement of the preliminary results of the Somaliland presidential election by NEC. The main opposition party, Wadani, accused the ruling party of rigging their votes. Two people were injured in Cerigabo town. There were no reports of arrests.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted an attack against Jajeele clan militias at Maroodile (c. 22 km West of Beletweyne town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about 20 minutes. Al Shabab fighters took control of the village. Three civilian villagers were abducted by al Shabaab fighters after the attack. The motive behind the abduction was not clear. There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the locations of the incident. A second source claims government forces were involved.

SNA forces vacated Qalimow village (c. 24 km North East of Balcad district) for Gololey village (c. 9 km South West of Balcad district. Shortly after SNA vacated the village, armed al Shabaab militants with a battlewagon took control of the village without resistance from government soldiers. Al Shabaab later vacated from the village early in the morning. There were no reports of casualties.

21st November, PM, Jowhar, Middle Shabelle: Unconfirmed local reporting has stated that al Shabaab assailants threw a number of hand grenades into the property of a Hirshabelle member of parliament. The target's wife and bodyguard were injured.
21st November, PM, Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab attack a Somali National Army (SNA) position. Security forces repealed the attack, 7 al Shabaab dead.

Unconfirmed reports indicated that the SNA commando unit conducted a special operation against al Shabaab explosives base where they apprehended at least 16 militants, including a senior al Shabaab security officer, at Danwale village (c. 20 km North West of Walaweyne district). SNA senior officials stated that the explosives base was destroyed and the name of senior AS official would be declared.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an government soldier transporting khat near Gasarta village (c. 12 km South East of Baidoa) on the road between Baidoa and Buurhakaba district. The soldier was riding a motorbike. There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab killed the soldier and the driver of the motorbike. Al Shabaab fighters burnt the motorbike and khat at the scene. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be established at the time of reporting.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters burnt commercial commodities, killed donkeys and destroyed donkey carts transporting goods near Garsaley village (c. 40 km South of Rabdhure). The commercial goods came from Burdhuxunle headed to Wajid district. The owners of the donkey carts managed to escape from the al Shabaab fighters. Some of those who escaped burnt two houses of the two main perpetrators in Wajid district in retaliation to the loss of their property.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted an attack against Jajeele clan militias at Maroodile (c. 22 km West of Beletweyne town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about 20 minutes. Al Shabab fighters took control of the village. Three civilian villagers were abducted by al Shabaab fighters after the attack. The motive behind the abduction was not clear. There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the locations of the incident. A second source claims government forces were involved.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A roadside IED targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded near Gumarta village (c. 20 km North East of Barawe district). The explosion slightly damaged an AMISOM truck. There were no reports of human casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: PSF, PMPF and Police conducted a joint security operation against ISIS fighters in various locations in Qandala. Operations were reported to be ongoing. There were no reports of immediate casualties or arrests.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Buur Ellaadhe, Buur Hakaba, Bay: Reports form U.S. Africa Command have stated that a U.S. air strike has been launched against al Shabaab at ivo Buur Ellaadhe. 100 al Shabaab believed dead. A second source states the attack occurred at nearby Doodaale. Al Shabaab later denied the air strike took place. However, locals account witnessing several loud sounds in the area.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a journalist and a second person in Mogadishu.

Al Shabaab attackers hurled a hand grenade at an SNA checkpoint located at the outskirt of Walaweyne town in Walaweyne district. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire towards different directions. At least two SNA were injured by the blast. Al Shabaab militants managed to escape. A second source asserts the attack was against a police station.

Al Shabaab militants ambushed an SNA convoy from Bufow headed to Afgoye at El-Waregow village (c. 13 km north east of Merka town) in Merka district. There was an exchange of gunfire. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. Casualties from AS could not be ascertained at the time of reporting. AS claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Armed al Shabaab combatants attacked SNA and AMISOM troops at Qoryoley Police Station and main bridge settlements in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about two hours after which AS were forced to withdraw. At least three SNA soldiers and two civilian bystanders were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an SNA force position located between Dhobley airfield and the UN way station in Dhobley town. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling near Shanta Buundo, outside of Bullo Mareer town under Kurtunwarey district exploded. The explosion damaged a military truck carrying soldiers coming from Bullo - Mareer headed to Mogadishu. At least two AMISOM soldiers were killed and three others were injured. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility
A Galmudug MP was killed on 22 November during a green-on-green incident near Villa Somalia.

An RCIED, targeting an SNA soldier on foot patrol, exploded at Tarabuunka field vicinity in Hodan district. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire towards different directions. Two SNA soldiers were injured. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack. One soldier dead.

22nd November, 1615L, Wardhigley, Mogadishu: Galmudug state MP Mohamed Abdi Guled has been shot and killed by security forces ivo Parliament building. The soldiers mistook the victim for 'a militant.' A second source claims the event took place in Waaberi.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: PSF, PMPF and Police joint security forces and ISIS fighters clashed in Jaceel area (c. 80 km South of Qandala). Clashes were reported to be ongoing. Casualties and arrests were unknown at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23rd November, AM, Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Limited unconfirmed reports have stated al Shabaab have ambushed a Somali National Army (SNA) and AMISOM patrol killing three.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Mudug, Galkacyo: 23rd November: Clashes between traders turns in to large scale clan fuelled firefight. The clash may have been triangulated from warring between Puntland and Galmudug states. Five dead.
23rd November, PM, Shibis district, Mogadishu: An SNA soldier has reportedly shot and killed a local man, motives are currently unknown.
23rd November, HawlWadaag, Mogadishu: Two armed assailants shoot and kill SNA soldier in Bakara Markert.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24th November, ivo Bulo Mareer: AMISOM troops ambushed, 4 killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Joint African Mission on Somalia (AMISOM) and Somali National Army (SNA) forces carry out offensive operation against an al Shabaab location. Causality figures not reported.
24th November, 1935L, Hodan, Mogadishu: Three grenades thrown at an SNA checkpoint no reported casualties.
Al Shabaab fighters threw a hand grenade against government forces in Afgooye on 24/11. Three reported dead.
25/11/2017: SNA checkpoint hit by IED killing one SNA soldier in Afgooye. Al Shabaab suspected.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 25th November, 1230L, Wabeeri, Mogadishu: Infighting reported between SNA and NISA, reasons not known. Three deaths reported.
25th November, 1230L, Hamar Jabjab, Mogadishu: Infighting reported between SNA and NISA. Causalities, reasons for the clash are not known.
Movement of forces: Reports indicate al Shabaab have moved in large number to Galguduud and Hiiraan regions seemingly to avoid heavy US air strikes in the south.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Suspected US forces strike a al Shabaab base in Hosingow. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a herder hailing from Biimaal clansmen at Afaqoow grazing area near Ceel Wareegow village (c. 13 km North East of Marka town). The perpetrators took the victims. Armed organized community clan militias followed the perpetrators and managed to recover the herder after a brief violent clash.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a herder hailing from Biimaal clansmen at Afaqoow grazing area near Ceel Wareegow village (c. 13 km North East of Marka town). The perpetrators took the victims. Armed organized community clan militias followed the perpetrators and managed to recover the herder after a brief violent clash.
26th November, 1000L, Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu: Infighting between government troops reported. The fighting is believed to be related to the illegal demolition of area shops. No causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 27th November, 2000L, Dhobley, Lower Jubba: KDF convoy ambushed near the town of Dhobley. The attack was initiated with an IED explosion then followed by small arms fire. At least two KDF dead. The attack may have been a reaction to recent Kenyan offensives against al Shabaab in the nearby Boni Forest, Kenya.
27th November, PM, Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle: Probing attack carried out on SNA position in Qoryoley. A solider was killed in the attack.

A group of women demonstrated in front of Borama local government office to protest the increase in price of water imposed by the local government. The demonstrators demanded that the local government review the new prices of the communal water.
27th November, 2010, Heliwa, Mogadishu: Al Shabaab launch an attack against security forces ivo SOS junction. At least one soldier killed in the attack.
A military officer is shot and killed in Daynille. Al Shabaab propaganda claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 27th November, 1500L, Bari: Press Release from U.S. Africa Command has stated they have carried out an airstrike against Islamic State (IS). The target is believed to be Abdulaziz Gurre, who was later confirmed dead. The attack was near Qandala.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM soldier on foot patrol at Danow neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unconfirmed reports indicated that a man was shot and killed in Wadama-goo town in an alleged revenge killing. The nature of the motive is not known, though 'revenge killings' are typically clan based.

A civilian businessman was shot and seriously injured by another man from the same clan at Buulo yaaquub neighbourhood in Buunda Weyne village located South of Beletweyne. The motive was related to a dispute regarding a well and water supply in the village. The injured man was rushed to Beletweyne Main Hospital for further treatment but later succumbed to his injuries after four hours.

A suspected armed man hailing from Dhulbahante clan shot at a vehicle belonging to a man hailing from Warsangeli clan at Damala Xagare village (c. 99 km South East of Erigavo) in an alleged carjacking attempt. One passenger in the vehicle was injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Police in Nugal and a unidentified anti-terrorism group exchanged gunfire for unknown reasons. There were no reports of casualties. The exact location of the clash is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland forces on foot patrol at Kulbiyow village (c. 178 km South West of Kismayo town). There was heavy exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab briefly took control of the village at civilian residences. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack a joint AMISOM/Jubaland base in Hosingow during the late night hours. Reliable sources say that the Kenyan forces suffered casualties including deaths (numbers not provided) and injuries in the 28 November night attack.
A soldier killed and three others injured in an al Shabaab attack in Yaaqshiid.
Heavy gunfire between military forces and al Shabaab near the Perfume Factory in Hodan. No reported causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 29th November, 2120L, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: Reports of RPG and small arms attack on a African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) position. Al Shabaab responsible. Causalities not known.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: 29th November, 1930L, El Adhe, Beledweyne, Hiirraan: Clashes between al Shabaab and armed Liyu Police paramilitaries in the area. Following the clash al Shabaab gained control of the town.

29th November, AM, Balad Aamiin, Wanlaweyn, Lower Shabelle: The Somali National Army (SNA) carry out a security offensive. Security forces reported a number of al Shabaab dead with others arrested. Government forces regained control of the settlement.
29/11/2017, Buur Hakaba: Fire fight between SNA and al Shabaab. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: A suspected US drone targeted a al Shabaab location at Tortoroow on 29/11. An unspecified number of causalities were reported.
Islamic State operators claim to assassinating a soldier in Afgooye on 29/11. The date of the physical attack is not known.
Dhagahyle, Guri Eel: ASWJ launch offensive attack against al Shabaab. ASWJ gained control of the town following the attack. Causalities not known.
30th November, AM, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: SNA carry offensive operations against al Shabaab positions outside Qoryooley. Causalities are not known, however one al Shabaab fighter was arrested.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: An IED attack against the Puntland Presidential Guard unit reported. Perpetrators not known (likely either al Shabaab or IS). Several injuries reported.
An under vehicle IED targets a journalist. Perpetrators not reported by source.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air forces launch two raids on al Shabaab positions on Qoryooley. Outcome not known.
Suspected al Shabaab attacked and killed a soldier in Waaberi.
Suspected al Shabaab attacked and killed a soldier in Wardhigley.
Government forces and al Shabaab clash at Gubat Galoole. The source indicates al Shabaab took control of the area following the clash; state forces deny this occurred. Causalities not known.
Suspected al Shabaab militants kidnap six people and their vehicle. Motives unknown.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated a clan elder. Assailants escaped. Motives unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Defusal: JSF discover IED planted near Shaqalaha Junction. JSF EOD safely dismantled the device.
01st December, 1900L, Boondheere, Mogadishu: UVIED detonates injuring one child. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Djibouti and government forces capture Indha Caad, Afar Irdood, Ceel lahele, and Ceeyrow from al Shabaab. No specific reports of violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Djibouti and government forces capture Indha Caad, Afar Irdood, Ceel lahele, and Ceeyrow from al Shabaab. No specific reports of violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Djibouti and government forces capture Indha Caad, Afar Irdood, Ceel lahele, and Ceeyrow from al Shabaab. No specific reports of violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Djibouti and government forces capture Indha Caad, Afar Irdood, Ceel lahele, and Ceeyrow from al Shabaab. No specific reports of violence.
01/12/2017, Hees: al Shabaab attack an SNA convoy transporting government officials. Three SNA killed and 6 wounded. Later reported indicate two soldiers dead, 12 al Shabaab.

Al Shabaab media reports a clash with Somali forces at Matabaan. Three soldiers reported dead. The government forces was escorting the Hiiraan governor at the time of the attack. It is not known if the governor was the target of the attackers. Following the attack a military commander claimed government forces killed 12 al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 2nd December, multiple settlements, Beledwenye, Hiiraan: Joint Somali National Army (SNA) and African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops carry out security offensive against al Shabaab. Casualties and outcome of the operation are not known.
Dhulbahante gunmen opens fire against Warsangeli-owned truck. One passenger was injured. Perpetrator later arrested by Somaliland Police.
Al Shabaab kidnapped 15 civilians accused of being spies for NISA and US. Twelve killed three released. Victims were al al Shabaab fighters or sympathisers.
KDF aircraft target al Shabaab positions. Outcome and casualty figures unknown.
Government forces and al Shabaab clash at Maxaas. 11 al Shabaab and one soldier reported dead. Four others wounded.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US forces launch an air attack against an al Shabaab position at Buulo Barow. Outcome not known.

An al Shabaab roadside bomb targeted a government soldier convoy travelling between Afgooye and Wanlaweyn. The blast is believed to have also resulted in fatalities and injuries, specific numbers not known.
Islamic State claims to have attacked Somalia soldiers on 12/03. IS claimed to have killed a solider (on 29/11, which was previously recorded) and two intelligence operatives.
Two unidentified clan groups clash in Galguduud region over two days. Two fatalities reported on the first day. Additional causalities reported on the second, though specific numbers not known.
Clan conflict flared up on 03 and 04 December in rural areas between Beledweyne and Maxaas. The identities, causalities not known.

3rd, December, AM, ivo Balcad, Gololey Middle Shabelle: Al Shabaab ambush a Somali National Army (SNA) convoy. Three government forces reported dead, including an officer. Al Shabaab claims the attack took place at Kongo village and eight soldiers died, unverified.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 03rd December, 1200L, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab launch an attack on African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) position just outside Qoryooley. 'A number' of al Shabaab causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM convoy from Afgooye struck by IED near Gandawi. Convoy subsequently ambushed for 20 minutes by al Shabaab. Two AMISOM soldiers injured, one truck damaged by second explosion.
Unidentified clan-based gunmen attack Garfuur. Two killed three injured.
Rahanweyn labourer shot and killed by Sacad gunman. Assailant escaped. Tensions subsided.
Al Shabaab carjacked a vehicle transporting Khat outside of Garbahaaray. Civilian passenger shot and injured during the incident. Driver escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM convoy from Afgooye to Buulo Mareer struck by an al Shabaab IED near Buulo Nagaad. Outcome not known.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Defusal: MoSF & NISA cordon off suspected VBIED near Nasa Hablood 1. Vehicle Toyota LANDCRUISER
Clan conflict flared up on 03 and 04 December in rural areas between Beledweyne and Maxaas. The identities, causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 04th December, 1400L, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Following on from 03rd December attack launched by al Shabaab, unconfirmed local reports have stated that AMISOM have ambushed militants ivo Qoryooley. ""A number"" of al Shabaab causalities reported.
Civilians stage a protest against the sale of the Ceel Afweyn Intermediate School grounds to Telsom. Police dispersed the crowds. 10 arrested.
Unidentified gunmen injure clan elder. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Hawadle clansmen attacked by Habargidir at Wardheer grazing area. Two killed three inured.
Al Shabaab fire one mortar round against Af Urur. Round landed in vacant area. No casualties nor injuries.
UVIED planted under the car of a SNAF General ""Abdiweli"" detonates inside Villa Baidoa. Casualties and target unverified.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate Puntland Custodial Corps officer ""Qassim"". Assailants escaped the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attack JSF base near Afmadow. One RPG fired. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.
A soldier killed three civilians in ex-control Afgooye district, Yaaqshiid. The violence was blamed on ""tensions.""

04th December, 0920L, Hodan, Mogadishu: An Under Vehicle Improvised Explosive Device (UVIED) attached to a senior military official's vehicle detonated in Villa Baidoa. No causalities reported. Perpetrators not known.
Two unidentified clan groups clash in Galguduud region over two days. Two fatalities reported on the first day. Additional causalities reported on the second, though specific numbers not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab said 5/12 it has killed a senior security official, Colonel Qasim, in Bosaso.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab destroys several communication masts.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 05th December, AM, Beletwayne, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab launched an attack (mortar fire) against the an Djibouti-AMISOM position in Beletweyne. The UN reports ""some"" causalities.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated Seyduna Hajow. Assailants escaped. Motives unknown.
Four unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a prominent local elder.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 05th December, AM, Dhoobley, Afmadow, Lower Jubba: Al Shabaab launched an attack on an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM)/Jubaland base on the border town of Dhoobley. It is possible that this was a diversionary attack to facilitate an attack into Kenya. Causalities not reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 06th December, PM, Farsooley, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that an airstrike has targeted and destroyed a vehicle in an al Shabaab controlled settlement. Between 3-7 KIA. A secondary report claims 5 dead and that the strike occurred at Irmannley.
Al Shabaab has claimed to have killed at least four Somali government soldiers in a landmine explosion occurred on the outskirts of Beledweyne at La-jecley.
A man from Siwakhron sub clan was shot and wounded by an unidentified assailant in Xiriiro village, c.60km South of Iskushuban. The assailant escaped and the victim was rushed to Bossaso hospital.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 06 December, c.1225hrs. A man was shot dead by his colleague over unknown motives at the Minister of livestock's residence. The two individuals were part of the Minister's security team. Comment: Both hail from Osman Mohamoud sub clan of Majeerteen.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Defusal: IED discovered in Halwo Kaynan, Netco road. Device taken away for inspection.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: An under-vehicle IED targeted a security official in Gaalkacyo. Perpetrators either al Shabaab or unidentified clan militia.

Two groups of SNAF troops engaged in an exchange of gunfire in the vicinity of Cali Geedi neighbourhood in Kaaran District. The SNAF soldiers divided along clan lines (Agbaal sub-clans) clashed over land dispute related matters. Reportedly, at least one civilian bystander was killed while three others were injured during the exchange.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: Peace agreement/talks: Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa and Galmudug Administration leaders sign a peace accord in Mogadishu.
RCIED targets SNAF patrol in Dhagaxtuur. One SNAF injured. Triggerman escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Movement of forces: AMISOM-Ugandan forces begin withdrawal (281 troops) from Somalia. Ugandan forces are based in Shabeellaha Hoose. The overall AMISOM force is planned to reduce by 1,000 by year's end.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Agreement: 07th December, 0900L, Diinsor, Bay: Seven al Shabaab militants surrender to African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) forces. One is believed to be a commander, name unknown.
IED planted at MECP detonates as SNAF forces occupy the checkpoint. 4 SNAF injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Hafun district Police Commissioner shots his deputy Mohamed Muse Bahaley dead. Motives unknown.
Protests in Mogadishu following the US announcement to recognise Jerusalem as Israeli capital.

At least two Somali civilians were reported to have been wounded after gunmen have opened fire at a nomad family on the outskirts of Galkayo at Laamafaqaaye area. The incident relates to a clan issue.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF convoy travelling from Mogadishu to FOB Shalambood near Ceel Waregow. 25 minutes gunfire before assailants retreated. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab attack SNAF base near Qansax Dheere. Assailants were repelled. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab gunmen assassinated two SNAF soldiers in Hawo Takko. SNAF launched a cordon-search, without success. Assailants escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fire 10 mortar rounds against Puntland base of Af Urur. No casualties reported. Al Shabaab later attacked the village with small arms.
Two groups of SNAF forces organised along clan lines clash over land dispute. Two civilian bystanders injured. No mediation ongoing, high tensions.
MoSF assault positions held by SNAF organised around clan lineages. One civilian bystander injured after 25 minute long firefight.

South West State forces have attacked an al-Shabab military base outside the town of Burhakaba in Bay region [southwestern Somalia]. Two al-Shabab fighters were killed in the attack which occurred on the afternoon of 08/12.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al-Shabab fighters attacked a Puntland military base Af-Urur village in Bari region. Al Shabaab claimed they inflicted losses on the Puntland forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces repel an attack by unidentified militia in Taleex. No reported causality.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Defusal: Civilian reports IED planted in Ariegle to UPDF. UPDF EOD safely dismantles the device.
Sacad & Omar Mohamud militias clashed in Lamafaaqaye. One Sacad injured, 11 camels killed. Motives linked to clan revenge.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 09th December, AM, Gansahdera, Qansah Dhere, Bay: Al Shabaab launch an attack against Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) base. The ENDF forces repelled the attack. Causalities not known.
Civilian killed at checkpoint by Hiirshabelle soldiers. Motives related to money extortion. Perpetrators escaped.

09th December, 0030, Galkacyo, Mudug: Two civilians killed in drive by shooting. The killing is likely related to recent clan-based violence in the area. A similar incident took place the previous day.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: IED targets Puntland convoy near Bali Khadar. No casualties.
09th December, AM, Hodan, Mogadishu: Al Shabaab shoot and kill a SNA soldier.

09th December, 1400, Hodan, Mogadishu: Somalia National Army (SNA) clash with Mogadishu Stabilisation Forces (MoSF) in Tarabunk junction. Three civilians died in the crossfire. The clash is believed to be related to a land dispute.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated two civilians, possibly NISA/SNAF soldiers. Assailants escaped. Motives unknown.
Unidentified gunmen kill two civilians outside of Ceelasha Biyaha.

On 10 December 2017, Al-Shabaab torched six commercial trucks in Maroodile village near the town of Beledweyne. A ""number"" of al-Shabab fighters were killed (later revealed as 4) in a brief gun battle with locals following the incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab forces launch several mortar rounds against Puntland forces stationed in Af-Urur. Causalities not known.

Residents block a road of Ceelasha Biyaha in protest of area checkpoints. The protesters claimed security forces were extorting motorists. The demonstrators blocked the road with vehicles making it impossible for other road users to pass through.
10th December, PM, Burhakaba, Bay: SNA and Interim South West State (ISWA) forces kill ""several"" al Shabaab militants in security operation.
10th December, AM, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: Local man shot and killed by SNA soldier. Motive not known.
10th December, 1600, Hodan Mogadishu: SNA clash with MoSF ivo Tarabunka junction. One civilian and one soldier reported dead. This clash is believe to be related to an on going land dispute.
Al Shabaab assassinate a police officer in Hodan.
Somali forces launch an offensive in Gedo recapturing several villages between Baardheere and Garbaharey. Al Shabaab offered no resistance and exited the area before the arrival of troops.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11th December, AM, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab have launched an attack against an AMISOM position. No reported causalities.
11th December, PM, Hudur, Bakool: Al Shabaab ambush SNA convoy on route between Hudur and Ceel Barde at Ted. Four soldiers killed, two wounded.
11th December, 1800, Wadajir, Mogadishu: A UVIED exploded killing the occupant, a TV journalist. Perpetrators not named by the source.
11th December, PM, Kaaran, Mogadishu: Infighting between SNA and MoSF. No causalities reported.
Members of the [Mogadishu] stabilisation security force attacked members of a military unit based at the Tarabunka intersection over the control of an area. Two deaths reported.
Suspected US air forces launch an air strike against al Shabaab locations in Mubaarak. Causalities not known. The United States later denied involvement in the strike.
Al Shabaab attacked Bakaara Market, at least one death.
12/12/2017 - Baidoa; SNA soldier shot and killed by al Shabaab.
10/12/2017 - El Cadde, Baardheere: Unconfirmed reports of al Shabaab infighting. Outcome not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 12th December, AM, Galgala, Bari: Al Shabaab claim responsibility for roadside IED which killed a senior military commander of Puntland bomb disposal team near Sugure.
12th December, AM, Hawl Wadaag, Mogadishu: A businessman was shot and killed by two unknown gunmen.
12th December, PM, Daynile, Mogadishu: Two unknown gunmen kill a woman, at present the motives are unknown and the assailants escaped the scene.

13th December, 1400L, Fafaxdhun, Baardheere, Gedo: An explosion which occurred outside of the property of a local administrator injures two children. It is not clear if the incident was the result of a grenade or an IED. Perpetrators not known.

13th December, PM, Karaan, Mogadishu: Unconfirmed reports have stated that further security force infighting has occurred between Somalia National Army (SNA) and the National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA). Land ownership is believed to be the motivating reason for the violence. Causality unknown.
An al Shabaab suicide bomber struck a group of police officers rehearsing for a parade in the police academy. 18 dead, 25 injured.

At least 12 people were killed in clashes between Al-Shabab fighters and militia loyal to Mukhtar Robow. The fighting erupted near the village of Abal. Al Shabaab affiliated websites claim that Mukhtar Robow Abu Mansoor's son was killed in the fighting.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air forces strike an al Shabaab location at Beerhani. The Somali military claimed 15 deaths. Radio Dalsan reports 12 dead, including two commanders.
15th December, PM, Hawl Wadaag, Mogadishu: Unconfirmed reports have claimed that a local man was shot and killed by two unknown gunmen.
At least one Somali soldier has been killed in an al-Shabab attack on a government military base in the town of Mahaday.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland and al Shabaab forces clash in Golis Mountains area. Causalities reported, though specific numbers are not known.

16th December, AM, Gololey, Balcad: Middle Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have claimed that al Shabaab have re-occupied Gololey village. State forces exited the area before the arrival of al Shabaab forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 17/12: A roadside bomb hit military vehicle carrying Puntland soldiers in Galgala village of Bari region, inflicting injuries on soldiers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Government security agents raided the home of former Presidential candidate and opposition leader Abdirahman Abdishakur injuring him and later arresting him after exchange of fire with his bodyguards. Five of the opposition leader's bodyguards were killed in the firefight with security agents identified as NISA. The target of the attack was wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Al Shabaab gunmen shoot and kill two police officers in Bossaso.
18th December, PM, Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: A local elder was shot and killed by al Shabaab, assailants escaped the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: In an effort to blockade Belet Weyne al Shabaab attack ENDF forces at Eel-gal. The fighting lasted 30 minutes. Causalities not known.
Islamic State claims the killing of a solider in Afgooye.
19th December, 2030L, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab launch an attack on Somali National Army (SNA). Casualties at present unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 19th December, AM, Galgala, Bosasso Bari: A Puntland Security Force (PSF) vehicle has been hit by a road side IED, injuring four occupants. Perpetrators not known.

Two unidentified clan groups (later identified as Darood-Dhulbahante and Majeerteen-Omar Mahmud) clash in Burtinle on 19/12. Fourteen reported deaths. The clash is believed to be related to a border dispute. Further violence followed in multiple areas on 23/12.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: An al Shabaab emplaced roadside Improvised Explosive Device (IED) kills two Puntland Security Force (PSF) members. Five others injured. The targeted Puntland (PIS) officials were part of a convoy that included United States forces and the so-called anti-terrorism unit from the PIS.
20th December, AM, Abal, Hudur, Bakool: Al Shabaab execute three locals in the settlement of Abal.

Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Somali security forces' station in Afgooye District, Lower Shabelle region reportedly causing casualties (numbers not known). A similar attack occurred in Afgooye the previous day.
Security forces clash with al Shabaab elements at Black Sea Junction in Howlwadaag. One al Shabaab member captured.
21st December, AM, Tixsiile, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: An al Shabaab ambush targets a Somali National Army (SNA) convoy killing at least three Danab soldiers.
Agreement: 21st December, AM, Berdale, Awdinle, Bay: Unconfirmed reports have stated that four al Shabaab militants including a deputy commander have surrendered to SNA.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy is targeted by a roadside IED on 21 December in Warta Nabada. Causalities, perpetrators not known.
Al Shabaab fires at least three mortar rounds towards Villa Somalia on 21 December. Casualties, damage not known.
Al Shabaab threw a hand grenade against a police station in Karaan on 22/12. Three police dead.
22nd December, 2200L, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Militants carry out a drive-by attack on a SNA checkpoint. Causalities not known.
22nd December Galhareeri, Galgaduud: Two local men are reportedly executed by al Shabaab.

Al Shabaab forces threw a hand grenade against a government building in Shibis District. The resulting blast caused ""deaths and injuries"" of military forces stationed inside. Civilian causalities not known.
Armed clashes between al Shabaab and area herders after the latter refused to provide cattle to al Shabaab. The fighting lased for several hours. Causalities not known.

At least 14 people have been killed and 50 others injured in renewed fighting between two clans in villages in Mudug, Sool and Nugal regions. The identities of the combatants, as well as the locations of the fighting is not known. The fighting began over use of water and pastureland. A second source claims the combatants were militia from Darood-Dhulbahante and M-Omar Mahmud clans, resulting in 15 dead. The second source also claimed the events took place on the 24th.

At least 14 people have been killed and 50 others injured in renewed fighting between two clans in villages in Mudug, Sool and Nugal regions. The identities of the combatants, as well as the locations of the fighting is not known. The fighting began over use of water and pastureland. A second source claims the combatants were militia from Darood-Dhulbahante and M-Omar Mahmud clans, resulting in 15 dead. The second source also claimed the events took place on the 24th.

At least 14 people have been killed and 50 others injured in renewed fighting between two clans in villages in Mudug, Sool and Nugal regions. The identities of the combatants, as well as the locations of the fighting is not known. The fighting began over use of water and pastureland. A second source claims the combatants were militia from Darood-Dhulbahante and M-Omar Mahmud clans, resulting in 15 dead. The second source also claimed the events took place on the 24th.
Detonation: 23rd December, 2340L, Dayniile, Mogadishu: Unidentified attackers throw two hand grenades at the Ministry of Defence. No causalities or damage reported.
23rd December, 1300L, Wardhigley, Mogadishu: Eight mortars are fired at Villa Somalia, with three reportedly landing inside Villa Somalia. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. Causalities not known.
23rd December, AM, Hamar Jabjab, Mogadishu: Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a Somali district official. The assailants escaped the scene.

23rd December, 1723L, Yaaqshid, Mogadishu: An explosion reported as a Large Vehicle Bourne Explosive Device (LVBIED) was found to be an explosion in a rubbish refuse collection site. No casualties reported. Perpetrators not known. The event may have occurred on 22/12.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air forces conduct an air strike against al Shabaab at a location known as Ball Raho, northeast of Kismayo. 13 reported fatalities. Two al Shabaab affiliated Kenyans were killed in the blast.

24th December, Beled Xawo, Gedo: Complaints over the demarcation of a Kenyan built security wall being built on the Somali Kenyan border have reportedly turned violent, with Somali protestors amassing and throwing stones.
24th December, PM, Buulo Mareer, Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports claim that SNA have launched an attack against al Shabaab. Details remain limited.
24th December, PM, Idaale, Baidoa, Bay: Al Shabaab execute five men accused of spying for the Somali, Jubbaland and U.S. intelligence services.

Agreement: 25th December, Unconfirmed reports have stated that three al Shabaab commanders and 20 militants from Dinsor and Bardale districts have surrendered to Interim South West State Administration (ISWA) forces.

Agreement: 25th December, Unconfirmed reports have stated that three al Shabaab commanders and 20 militants from Dinsor and Bardale districts have surrendered to Interim South West State Administration (ISWA) forces.
25th December, 2100L, Karaan, Mogadishu: Unconfirmed reports have stated that grenades have been thrown at a police station in the Karaan district. Causalities currently unknown.

Government forces and al Shabaab clash in Afgooye the evening of 25/12. Three dead and four injuries. Al Shabaab briefly gained control of parts of the town. Later reports indicate al Shabaab attacked two checkpoints simultaneously.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 26th December, AM, Galkacyo, Mudug: A senior Puntland Security Force (PSF) soldiers is shot and killed, al Shabaab have claimed responsibility for the incident.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air forces conduct an air strike against al Shabaab figures at a location 25 kilometres (15 miles) west of Mogadishu between Adow Dibille and Hawo Abdi area. The blast killed an estimated 4 and destroyed a truck carrying an explosive which was heading toward Mogadishu.

Two men dressed in Somali military uniform have killed a civilian in Mogadishu on Wednesday, Dec 27. A witness told Radio Shabelle that the killers riding in a rickshaw abducted the man and shot him dead at Badbado, an IDP camp in the broad-day light.
Al Shabaab militants were reported to have beheaded a Somali man whom they had accused of rape.
KDF air forces bomb an al Shabaab location at Bohadi, which is believed to be near Ceel Waaq on 28/12. Causalities reported, numbers unknown.

28th December, AM, Lambar 50, Afgooye, Lower Shabellle: Unconfirmed reporting has claimed that a firefight between al Shabaab and the Somalia National Army (SNA) has claimed the lives of ""several"" militants.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 28th December, AM, Buulo Barde, Hiiraan: A road side IED kills at least one AMISOM soldier. Al Shabaab claimed three dead.

28 Dec, c. 1620 hrs. Biyamaal clan militia attacked families hailing from Abgaal sub clan at Garas Shemo (c. 05 km east of KM 50 village) in Afgoye district. Four civilians, consisting of women and children, were killed and five others were wounded. Biyamaal clan militia fled from the scene of the incident. The motive of the incident was attributed to clan feuds.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 28 Dec, c. 1830 hrs. A man was shot and wounded by an alleged Darawish man at Af-Urur (c. 64 km South of Bossaso). The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fires heavy artillery at an ENDF base at Buraalayaasha in Hudur. No immediate causality details. This event may have occurred the following day.

A civilian man from North Galkayo was shot and killed by an armed man from South Galkayo at the main market near the border line between South and North Galkayo following a brief exchange of gunfire. A bystander was injured. The victim was waiting for a delivery of khat from South Galkayo near the border line at the time of the incident. Joint military forces responded and arrived at the scene of the incident and fully secured the market area.

29 Dec, c. 0400 hrs. Somali commandos, supported by anti-al Shabaab (not identified) forces, conducted an overnight raid in an al Shabaab controlled area in Galawaar village (c. 05 km north west of Afgoye district) targeting high ranking al Shabaab leaders at a meeting. One civilian male was killed while seven others were apprehended.

29 Dec, c. 1300 hrs. Two groups of SNAF soldiers clashed at Biya-Cadde village in Mahaday district. There was an exchange of gunfire. The two group of SNAF soldiers disputed over extortion money collected from public transport vehicles. One SNA soldier was injured.

A group of staff working for Cerigabo Hospital staged a demonstration in front of Cerigabo General Hospital. The protesters reportedly accused a local NGO that manages Cerigabo Hospital and Somaliland Development Fund of excluding them from the list of the local NGO staff. They also accused Cerigabo authorities of nepotism and favouritism.

29 Dec, c. 1830 hrs. Unknown armed assailants using pistols shot and killed a civilian while on his way to his home at khat market in Hawo Tako village in Afgoye district. The body of the old man was taken away by police who conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded two civilians at Abo Asharow (c. 05 km South of Baidoa town). The reason for the killing was not clear. Unconfirmed reports indicated that the victims had an argument with al Shabaab fighters over land.

A hand grenade that was hurled at Suuqa Qudaarta Police checkpoint, exploded at Bakaro market in Hodan district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attackers. There were no reports of casualties. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack.

An aggrieved armed SNA soldier in possession of an AK47, who was relieved off his duty, shot in a teashop at Bangala Military Camp where SNA soldiers frequented. The owner of the teashop was killed while three others, including two SNA soldiers, were injured. The perpetrator managed to escape.

Detonation: Local police detonated an IED that was planted at the livestock market located east of Bulloburte district (c. 115 km South of Beletweyne). There were no reports of casualties or damages. The security situation in the area was reported to be calm after that incident. The IED placing perpetrators not named by the source, nor was the suspected target.
30 Dec, c. 1842 hrs. An IED planted near an SNA checkpoint exploded at Bakaro junction road in Hodan district. Two reported deaths. No group has claimed responsibility for the incident.

30 Dec, c. 2020 hrs. : A UVIED, planted in a vehicle owned by a civilian man who worked with South West State as a coordinator in the Ministry of Health, exploded at Ramadan Mosque area in Hodan district. The explosion missed the intended target. The vehicle was damaged and there were no reports of casualties.

Masked men who appeared to be members of the Somali security forces raided the house of a Somali senator (Abdi Hassan Awale Qaybdiid) on 30/12. The raiders attacked the Senator's security detail. Several soldiers were arrested following the incident.
Al Shabaab attacks government forces in Diinsoor District. The fighting lasted for approximately 30 minutes. At least two deaths reported.

Local security forces in Burdhubo district conducted an attack against al Shabaab fighters believed to be collecting illegal tax from the pastoralists community at a grazing area located c. 40 km south of Burdhubo town. The security forces shot and injured the al Shabaab commander who managed to escape with injuries when al Shabaab withdrew. During the attack, over thirty herds of goats were recovered. Further report indicated that the al Shabaab commander later succumbed to his injuries.

One person was killed and another one was injured by an armed man at Horumar section located south east of Galkayo. The perpetrator and the victims hailed from same unidentified clan. The motive of incident was not clear.
