column17: Somali National Army officials said they have conducted joint military operation with US forces on al-Shabab base in Tortorow area. Two al Shabaab commanders (Farah Ali Hussein also known as Farah Kalar and Mohamed Omar), along with ""several others"" killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An al-Shabab commander has been killed in a joint operation in Raxoole.
Property destruction: 03rd February, PM, Oor-Gaafin, Wajid, Bakool: Local traders had livestock and assets destroyed by al Shabaab.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Police and NISA clashed at Jazeera village in Wadajir district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. The motive of the clash was ascribed to disputes over extortion money. At least five SNA soldiers were injured.
03rd February, AM, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab launch an attack on an SNA position. Government forces repelled the attack, with both sides taking a ""number of causalities.""
Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF position near Dalbiyango. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate ""Hassan"", Hormud employee, in Wabeeri.

Reports coming from Elwaq town, [Gedo region, southwestern Somalia] located on the Somali-Kenya border say Kenyan [military] helicopters carried out air strikes at an area known as Kalabayrka. The area is 8km from Elwaq town. No casualties reported, but following the air strikes [al Shabaab] fled the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF foot patrol. Casualties reported, figures unknown.
Armed clashes erupt between two groups of Somali soldiers in Jazeera. Casualties & motives unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy near number 60 vicinity (c. 30 km west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least four al Shabaab militants were killed and five others were injured in the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fire several mortar rounds against UPDF base in Danow. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Suspected SPU Policeman kills a foreign Ethiopian NGO worker. Incident linked to ongoing rumours that foreigners are 'infiltrating Bossaso and stealing jobs.'
Detonation: An IED prematurely detonates inside al Shabaab safe-house in Oodweyne, IVO Bangala Camp. Four killed three injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate NISA officer Abdulkadir Aflow in Bakaara Market. Assailants escaped.
A militia group loyal to Ahmed Abdi Hassan (Tajir), a member of the Jubbaland regional parliament, has blocked roads in the city in protest against the MP's arrest.
05th February, PM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed media reporting has stated that two people have been killed after a confrontation between al Shabaab and SNA.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SWSPF based in Qansax-Dheere district (c. 90 km south west of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties from the attack.
05th February, PM, Beletweyne, Hiiraan: The Former Mayor is shot and killed when exiting a local Mosque after attending evening prayers.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland force fired artillery at Somaliland forces based at Higlo-Fiqi (c. 40 km east of Lasanod). Somaliland forces did not respond to the attack. No causalities.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate teacher in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Al Shabaab attack Police station in Jalalaqsi. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM ENDF and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Ilkacade area (c. 12 km north of Beletweyne) on the MSR which links Beletweyne to the northern regions of Somalia. The incident occurred after al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM ENDF who were travelling from Ethiopia to Beletweyne. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour. Casualties could not be determined at the time of reporting. AMISOM ENDF reached Beletweyne after the incident.

Detonation: An explosion occurred on the road to Beletweyne airport at Nur hawad section of koshin village located east of Beletweyne. The person who planted the explosive device was killed. SPF EOD team searched the road and found the body of perpetrator. The security situation was reported to be calm.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian as the victim left a mosque.

A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked a security post manned by SNA forces at Qalimow village in Balcad district (c. 30 km north of Balcad district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. At least two SNA soldiers were killed while another was injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 06th February, Saakow, Middle Jubba: Limited reports have claimed the SNA-special forces have carried out a strike operation on al Shabaab in the town of Saakow. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab attack forward operating base Cali Fool Dheere with PKM and RPG7. No casualties, assailants repelled.

A 14-year-old boy was killed by a police officer at Abdullahi Isse stadium in Horumar section in South Galkayo. The incident occurred after the police officer shot at a crowd of young boys during an intermediate school football game. The perpetrator was arrested and taken into custody for further investigation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: An armed group conducted a complex attack against the central police station in Bossaso. The attack was initiated with an explosion and a volley of small arms fire. The attack was focused on the central police station and judiciary prison cell adjacent to the police station. During the attack, two civilians were killed and four police officers, including the deputy police commander of the police station, was injured seriously. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Arrests: NISA forces conduct security sweep in an attempt to apprehend killers of FGS/SNPF officials earlier on 07 February. 300 civilians arrested. Outcome unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab assassins shot and killed two soldiers in Daynile during the overnight hours.
07th February, PM, IVO Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: A roadside IED strike on security forces vehicle results in two SNA killed outside of Afgooye.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy traveling on the road between KM 50 and KM 60 near Buulo-Nageey village (c. 20 km west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties.
Civilians protest against arrival of an oil exploration company at Gelo-Kor, without the knowledge of local authorities. Elders intervened, company left.

An RCIED exploded in an open area at Alrahma located east of Bossaso. The RCIED was place beside the road targeting a government vehicle. The government vehicle passed safely. There were no reports of damages or injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: IED targets UPDF convoy near Buulo Nigiriish, outside of Marka. One vehicle slightly damaged, no casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: An IED, targeting a police patrol, exploded at NATCO area. One police officer was killed and two others were injured.

Unidentified armed attackers shot and killed a civilian man at Buundo Kowaad vicinity in Waberi district. The perpetrators, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, escaped from the scene after the incident. The motive of the assassination was unknown.

Two groups of SNA troops clashed at Ex. Control neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire. Further reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash was a land dispute between the two groups. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. A ceasefire was arrived at.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a junior officer near Gaheyr University during the early morning hours.
Recruitment: Reports of al Shabaab training clan elders marksmanship in Jilib in an effort for recruitment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 08/02, PM, Gaal, Beledweyne: EDNF ambush al Shabaab. Outcome not known.
Detonation: 08 February. Unknown number of al Shabaab fighters were killed after an IED exploded when al Shabaab fighters prepared to plant the IED at Talson road located north of Jalaqsi.
IED targets Southwest forces outside of Baidoa. Casualties unknown.
Al Shabaab operatives hurled two hand grenades towards SNAF checkpoint in Furayasha. Two SNAF injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

08 February. Suspected al Shabaab militants hurled two hand grenades at an SNA checkpoint at Furayasha village neighbourhood in Wardhigley district. Two SNA soldiers were injured in the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two groups of Somali soldiers clash near Zobe Junction. Motives & resulting casualty figures unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Islamic State claims to have assassinated a NISA officer in Afgooye. Event not independently verified.
Peace agreement/talks: Al Shabaab brokers a peace deal between Abgal-Hawiye and Hawadle militias. Both militia groups typically operate in Hiiraan Region.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a SNAF soldier in Buundo Weyn. Assailants escaped with confiscated AK47.
Detonation: IED prematurely detonates, three al Shabaab killed.

09 February. Al Shabaab fighters and local clan militias clashed near Tardo area (c. 185 km south east of Beletweyne) at the border of Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle. The cause of the incident was related to ownership of disputed land at Xalfooley between Hawadle and Abgaal clan. Al Shabaab intervened and ordered Hawadle clan members to move out of the land which resulted in the armed clash. Causalities not known.
09/02, AM, Awdhegle, Afgooye: Al Shabaab launch low level attack. Outcome not known.
Somaliland Police attempts to destroy illegal roadside structures. Dhulbahante/Qayaad groups respond, injure a police officer.

09/02, PM, Hawlwadaag: A grenade attack on the residential house of former Howl Wadaag district commissioner has resulted in two residents being killed, including one child. Perpetrators al Shabaab. A second report claims four dead.
Gunmen in uniforms suspected of being SNAF soldiers shot and kill Hormud employee. Motives unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Two civilian bystanders are killed after unidentified perpetrators threw grenades at the home of a NISA commander. Security forces responded to the attack, however, they did not succeed in capturing the assailants.

A group of students demonstrated against increased tuition fees proposed by the Ministry of Education. The students marched onto the streets from their schools to the location of the Ministry of Education. Police dispersed the crowds.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Buulo Folyo checkpoint, temporarily capture the area. Casualties unknown.
10 February. A man was shot and seriously wounded by an armed perpetrator in Bossaso. The perpetrator was arrested and taken to the central police station for further investigation.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Suspected US drone strike targets al Shabaab camp in Tortoorow. Two vehicles destroyed, casualties unknown.

Reports from Warmooley village which is located between Elbuur and Dhusamareeb in Galmudug (50km from Dhuusamarreeb), say that residents have clashed with al-Shabab after the militant group proposed to train elders to fight for the group. The clash was triggered after al-Shabab killed two civilians in the area before they came to train the elderly on use of weapons. The clash between the two sides resulted in deaths and injures on both sides, specific numbers not known.

Al-Shabab killed two civilians in Warmooley village which is located between Elbuur and Dhusamareeb in Galmudug (50km from Dhuusamarreeb) area after the group proposed to train elders to fight for the group.
Al Shabaab gunmen assassinate local clan militiaman. Assailants escaped with confiscated AK47. Victim was manning an illegal checkpoint in Gambarlawe (SE Belet Weyne).
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a Somali soldier. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Civilians protest against taxes levied by the Somaliland government at the clothes market. Somaliland Police disperse protesters. Event remained peaceful.
11/02, AM, Beledweyne: IED attack against SNA checkpoint. Outcome not known.
Al Shabaab operative hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF patrol. SNAF patrol opens fire, kills the driver of an auto-rickshaw and injure two civilians. Assailant escaped.
Somali soldiers kill another service member. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate unidentified Somali security officer. Assailants escaped.
11 February. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier at Sanca junction road neighbourhood in Kaaran district.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Agreement: An estimated 160 soldiers have defected from the northern breakaway republic of Somaliland amid tension in Tukaraq town in Sool region. Sources said the forces have surrendered themselves to the rival Puntland authorities in Boohoodle town in Togdher.
A landmine explosion kills one and injures another at Hansheekh village, outside of Balcad. Perpetrators not known.
Government forces met ""heavy resistance"" from al Shabaab forces at Janaale on 12/02. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab executed two Kenyans on changes of spying. The two were publicly stabbed.
Agreement: 200 Khatumo soldiers defect to Somaliland. Motives unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab retakes Mubarak, Darussalam and Awdhiigle after AMISOM and SNA forces vacated the area.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab retakes Mubarak, Darussalam and Awdhiigle after AMISOM and SNA forces vacated the area.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab retakes Mubarak, Darussalam and Awdhiigle after AMISOM and SNA forces vacated the area.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked an SNA checkpoint at Buundo-weyn and Mukayga neighbourhoods in Afgoye district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack with heavy gunfire and SNA forces responded with gunfire to the general direction of the attack. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. The troops conducted a search operation in the area after the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked an SNA checkpoint at Buundo-weyn and Mukayga neighbourhoods in Afgoye district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack with heavy gunfire and SNA forces responded with gunfire to the general direction of the attack. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. The troops conducted a search operation in the area after the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
12/02, PM, Wajid: Al Shabaab attack a Police station. Outcome not known.

Suspected al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at an SNA checkpoint at Buundo Yarey neighbourhood in Afgoye district. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire towards general suspected directions. The perpetrators managed to escape. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab combatants attacked a government troop position at Qoryoley Police Station in Qoryoley district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour after which al Shabaab fighters were forced to withdraw from the area. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
A man from Dir clan was shot and killed by an armed man from Sheikhaal clan at Horumar neighbourhood. The cause of the incident was unknown. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.
A man was stabbed to death in Siinaay neighbourhood in Hargeisa. The perpetrator was arrested by the police after the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Balcad district heading to Jowhar, exploded near Ceelka-Geelow neighbourhood in Balcad district. The AMISOM lead vehicle was damaged. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. There were no reports of human casualties.
12th February, 1200L, El Lahelay, Dhuusamareeb, Galgaduud: Media reports have stated that two children have been killed when unexploded ordnance with which they were playing detonated.
12/02, AM, Gololey, Balcad: IED strike on a civilian vehicle. A second IED attack against a AMISOM convoy occurred about the same time. Outcome not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12/02, AM, Gololey, Balcad: IED strike on AMISOM convoy. A second IED attack against a civilian vehicle occurred about the same time. Outcome not known.

SNA soldiers, in an escort vehicle, shot at a crowd of civilians at Hotel Amira Road near Zoppe junction road in Hodan District to clear the road of traffic. At least two civilians, including a driver of a rickshaw and passenger, were injured and rushed to Madina Hospital for treatment. The SNA vehicle proceeded after the incident.
SNAF soldiers shot Director of Relations for Ministry of Sports Abdullahi Hirey at checkpoint, reasons not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM & SNAF recapture Sablaale after al Shabaab vacate the area.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNA defensive base located at the main bridge of Mahaday town in Mahaday district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack by firing mortar shells and RPG rounds at the SNA base. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which SNA retreated from their position. Al Shabaab temporarily took control of the base. At least one civilian was killed and three others were injured.

Anti-al Shabaab forces (possibly Western, not confirmed) conducted a security operation at an al Shabaab position near Hargeysa Yarey village (c. 15 km south west of Jilib town). The Anti-al Shabaab forces landed in helicopters and briefly took control of the location without resistance from al Shabaab. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew before the arrival of anti-al Shabaab forces. The Anti-al Shabaab forces destroyed the base and withdrew. There were no reports of confrontation between al Shabaab and Anti-al Shabaab forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM fires artillery shells towards al Shabaab positions. Unverified report suggests seven civilians killed.
Arrests: Al Shabaab arrest 20 - 76 people in Mubarak, Uguji, Dara Salaam.
Detonation: IED detonates prematurely outside of Afmadow. Three al Shabaab killed.
Government security forces shot amongst themselves at Baidoa animal market in Berdale neighbourhood. One civilian was killed and four others were injured. The motive behind the incident was unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against a South West State Special Forces position in Wajid (c. 90 km south west of Xudur). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.
13th February, AM, Awdheegle/Mubaarak, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have beheaded ""several people.""
13th February, AM, Awdheegle/Mubaarak, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have beheaded ""several people.""
IED detonates between Shalambood and Beled Amiin. IED triggered by goats grazing in the field. Two children injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Armed al Shabaab militants shot and injured a NISA soldier at Suuqa Daawada (Medicine Market) neighbourhood near Bakara Market in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators escaped from the scene after the incident. The soldier was taken to hospital for treatment. Al Shabelle immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attack AMISOM forward operating base Masilah. RPGs fired. No casualties, assailants repelled.
Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position at Ex-Perfume Factory. RPGs used. 20 minutes firefight. Al Shabaab withdrew. Three SNAF injured.
13th February, PM, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: Infighting between MoSF and SNA result in one SNA soldier killed and several MoSF and SNA wounded.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based at the Livestock Market neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated using RPGs followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Three SNA soldiers were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
Al Shabaab elements shot and killed a soldier at Caymiska village neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. The perpetrators took the weapon of the dead soldier and managed to escape.
Al Shabaab militants, shot and killed an SNA officer while on his way to work at Timacadde village near Kawo Godey section in Wadajir district. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabaab forces have attacked a base belonging to AMISOM troops in the coastal district of Barawe at Ambareeso, Lower Shabelle region on the night of 13/02. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabaab fighters have carried out attacks on AMISOM [Africa Union Mission in Somalia] soldiers in their camps in Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia. The raids happened on AMISOM camps in Qoryoley and Bilal villages. Several [AMISOM] killed and injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al-Shabaab fighters have carried out attacks on AMISOM [Africa Union Mission in Somalia] soldiers in their camps in Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia. The raids happened on AMISOM camps in Qoryoley and Bilal villages. Several [AMISOM] killed and injured.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNA defensive base located at the main bridge of Mahaday town in Mahaday district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack by firing mortar shells and RPG rounds at the SNA base. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which SNA retreated from their position. Al Shabaab temporarily took control of the base. Al Shabaab vacated the town early the next morning and SNA retook control of the base without any resistance. At least one civilian was killed and three others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambush KDF patrol after premature detonation of an IED. Three al Shabaab killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Defusal: An IED was discovered at the parking area of Dinsoor Police Station. The district commissioner parks his vehicle at that area where the IED was discovered. It was suspected that the district commissioner was the target of the IED. AMISOM EOD team safely removed and destroyed the IED. There were no reports of arrests made.

Al Shabaab militants executed two men accused of spying for the Somali, Kenyan and Ethiopian governments at Kunyo Barow Square field (c. 75 km west of Barawe district). The men were tied to poles and shot dead by masked armed men. A self - proclaimed judge read out their verdict in front of a crowd at the execution ground.
Al Shabaab executes two men for spying for the KDF.
Detonation: An RCIED detonated at a teashop frequented by SWSFP in Awdinle village (c. 30 km north west of Baidoa). There are no reports of casualties or arrests made.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: IED targets Puntland convoy near Sugure. Casualties unknown.
14/02, PM, Hawl Wadaag: Unknown gunmen have shot and killed and SNA soldier.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali forces backed by African Union forces destroyed Al-Shabaab bases in the Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia. The forces raided the bases in Kurtunwarey and destroyed the bases used by the militants to attack Somali and Amisom forces. Security forces Tuesday also destroyed explosives in Lower Shabelle region suspected to have been destined for the capital Mogadishu. They also destroyed an FM station run by Al-Shabaab. No human causality or injury reported.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at the Former Presidential Palace in Isha neighbourhood of Baidoa. This facility was reported to be used by NISA as a temporary detention centre for captured al Shabaab fighters. The hand grenade landed and exploded at the perimeter of the facility. There were no reports of casualties. NISA forces at the facility responded with brief sporadic gunfire. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: IED targets AMISOM convoy ferrying supplies from Afgooye to Balidogle. One truck with container hit. No casualties, damages TBC.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: An RCIED, targeting a PSF vehicle, detonated at Sugure area located at the foothills of Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso). One soldier was killed and two others were injured. The vehicle was completely damaged. The victims were rushed to Bossaso General Hospital. PSF were reported to be conducting operations against al Shabaab bases.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Detonation: 15/02, 1850L, Waaberi: A UVIED fitted to a NISA officer's car detonates, no casualties reported. Perpetrators not named by the source.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF soldier near Bar Ubaax junction. Assailants escaped.

SNA soldiers, escorting the Deputy District Commissioner of Dharkenley, shot and killed a municipal police officer at the DC office area in Dharkenley district. The incident occurred after an argument over unknown reasons. The perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of arrests made.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: At least two Puntland soldiers were killed in a roadside bomb blast in Galgala Mountains of Bari region. Al Shabaab said in a statement posted on its affiliated website that the soldiers died after the roadside bomb struck the military vehicle on the outskirts of the Galgala Mountains.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: SNAF and Danab, with backing from suspected American troops, recapture Tortoorow. No violence reported.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a local civilian during an operation at Buulo Xaaji Village (c. 69 km west of Kismaayo town). Al Shabaab shot the victim after he attempted to escape during the al Shabaab operation on the village streets.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 16th February, PM, Galgala Mountains, Bosasso, Bari: Two Puntland Security Force (PSF) officer were killed in roadside IED strike. Perpetrators not named by source.

Rival government forces clash in Afgooye. The heavy fighting took place at a checkpoint manned by government forces in Bar-ismail neighbourhood. It is not clear what triggered the fighting, but the checkpoint was used by government forces to collect taxes from travellers using the Afgoye-Mogadishu road. Causalities not known.

column7: Military Forces of United Arab Emirates
column17: 17th February, AM, Buq-caqable, Bulo Burto, Hiiraan: Al Shabaab publicly execute a captured SNA soldier.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired around eight rounds of anti-aircraft artillery in the air targeting suspected anti-al Shabaab helicopters (not identified, however it is known US forces were active in the area two days later) that were observed flying over Jilib town. The helicopters did not respond to the attack.

Hargeisa local government, supported by SLP in Hargeisa conducted an operation in where they destroyed illegal shops constructed on the main street in Jijiga yar neighbourhood. The owners of the shops resisted and police finally dispersed them. Three people were arrested.

Suspected al Shabaab militants attacked a SNAF defensive base at Embareeso vicinity (c. 05 km north of Barawe district). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab forcefully withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

17 Feb, c. 1130 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters executed a civilian at a public place in Buqda village (c. 45 km south west of Beletweyne). The victim was a former SNA who was traveling to Abudwaq district. The motive behind the execution was unknown.
Civilian vehicle hit by roadside IED near Ababay. 3 killed 5 injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces based at Abdalla Biroole village (c. 45 km south west of Kismayo town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Danab and US forces conduct a raid on Jilib. Ground forces supported by air elements. One al Shabaab camp destroyed. Casualties and exact outcome unknown.

Unspecified groups of Borama business community staged a peaceful gathering against lack of hygiene and garbage on roads in Borama road and other public places. They accused the local government of not addressing the problems correctly. There were reports of arrests.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 18th February, AM, near Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that joint SNA and AMISOM troops have carried out an offensive on al Shabaab locations around Baraawe. Causalities not known.
AMISOM & SNAF conduct large security sweep. Two al Shabaab killed, 21 mobile phones seized, 2 RPGs and 5 pistols.

Truck drivers in Berbera, managed by Towfiq association, staged a peaceful demonstration in Berbera against the Minister of Transport and Road Development who was accused of replacing their chairman without their knowledge. There were reports of arrests and casualties.

A civilian man, who hailed from Omar Mohamoud sub clan of Reer Mahad, was killed by another man, hailing from Omar Mohamoud sub clan of Reer Hirsi, over a land dispute in Burtinle. The perpetrator escaped from the scene after the incident. Police were reported to be continuing enquiries into the incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 18 Feb, c. 0700 hrs: Somaliland and Puntland forces exchanged fire for about 30 minutes at the frontline near Tukaraq (c. 65 km north west of Garowe). There were no reports of casualties.
Bakaara Market remains closed as business owners protest against FGS decision to increase taxes.
Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position near Qoryoley. Assailants repelled, at least two militants killed.

19 Feb, c. 0520 hrs. Two groups of Osman Mohamud and Wabeeneeye sub-clans clashed at Jidka Sodonka area (c. 02 km south west of Bossaso airport) due to a land dispute. The clash lasted for about 10 minutes. Police intervened. One person was wounded. Two others were arrested.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 19th February, PM, IVO Bulo Gaduud, Kismayo Lower Jubba: A roadside IED disables an AMISOM convoy vehicle prior to an al Shabaab ambush at Yoontoy and Bulo Gaduud. Causalities not known in both instances.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 19th February, PM, IVO Bulo Gaduud, Kismayo Lower Jubba: A roadside IED disables an AMISOM convoy vehicle prior to an al Shabaab ambush at Yoontoy and Bulo Gaduud. Causalities not known in both instances.

19 Feb. Unarmed SLP officers in Xariirad were physically assaulted by three men using sticks. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. The police officers were taken to Xariirad Hospital for further treatment.
Al Shabaab court sentenced a man to one hundred lashes after being accused of raping a civilian female. The court ordered that the punishment be performed at a public gathering in Jilib town.
IED detonates near civilians between Bundabaq - Embresso, near Baraawe. At least two killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Jubaland forces, supported by anti-al Shabaab forces (identified as US in a second report), conducted a joint security operation against al Shabaab location at Araara village (c. 47 km north east of Kismayo). The joint forces briefly took control of the village without resistance from al Shabaab and subsequently withdrew from the area. During the operation an al Shabaab fighter who was in the village was killed and a civilian female was injured by a stray bullet.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: During an operation by Jubaland forces and anti-al Shabaab forces against an al Shabaab location at Araara village (c. 47 km north east of Kismayo), an IED exploded as the joint forces made their way back to Bulo Gaduud base. The casualty from the IED attack was unknown - al Shabaab's media claimed the death of a US soldier.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 19th February, Jilib, Middle Jubba: U.S. Africa Command carried out a drone strike resulting in three militant deaths.

20 Feb, c. 1240 hrs. An RCIED, buried by the roadside targeting an SNA battlewagon from Afgoye to Walaweyne, exploded at Tixsiile vicinity in Walaweyne district. The RCIED missed a Somali military convoy passing in the area. The RCIED exploded on a civilian donkey cart injuring the owner and donkey. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militants ambushed an AMISOM convoy moving along Baledogle road at Baqdaad village (c. 10 km north west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. The convoy managed to pass through the area, Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 Feb, c. 1120 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy traveling on the road between Ceel Waregow and Shalambood near Ceel Waregow village (c. 07 km north east of Merka district). There was an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack stating that they targeted an AMISOM convoy transporting military supplies to Shalambood. Causalities not known.

A civilian man was killed by another over land ownership dispute. The two men hail from Issa Mohamud Hassan Ugaar sub clan. The two men argued which escalated to an altercation with one being shot and later succumbing to his wounds at hospital. The attack took place at an unknown location in Nugaal.
Al Shabaab launch an attack against an SNA position on the outskirts of Qoryooley. The SNA repelled the attack. The attack may have occurred on 19/01, per a second reporting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 20 Feb, c. 1400 hrs. PSF and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Ceeldibir and Dhadhaabo areas of Galgala (c. 49 km south west of Bossaso). The clash lasted for almost two hours. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were arrested. Fatalities split between events.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 20 Feb, c. 1400 hrs. PSF and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Ceeldibir and Dhadhaabo areas of Galgala (c. 49 km south west of Bossaso). The clash lasted for almost two hours. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were arrested. Fatalities split between events.

Detonation: A magnetic IED attached to a luxury vehicle conveying NISA soldiers detonated at the vicinity of Village Restaurant neighbourhood in Hodan district. The vehicle was damaged. The targeted NISA soldiers were not in the vehicle at the time the explosion. There were no reports of civilian casualties. No group has claimed responsibility for the incident.
UVIED planted under vehicle of local government official detonates. No casualties. Extent of injury not known. Perpetrator not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Armed clashes reported between al Shabaab fighters and joint US/IJA/AMISOM forces. Resulting casualty figures unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 21st February, PM, Jamaame, Lower Jubba: Unconfirmed local reporting has claimed that joint AMISOM and SNA security forces are carrying out an offensive operation against the militant controlled town of Jamaame. Outcome not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM KDF Contingent force position in Qoqani village (c. 90 km east of Dhobely town). Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds and small arms fire from a distance to the direction of the base. AMISOM forces responded with small arms fire and machine guns. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Qoryoley. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 21st February, AM, Bagdaad, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that and AMISOM convoy vehicle has been hit by a roadside IED. Outcome not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: A police officer shot and killed an al Shabaab member in Netco area of Bossaso. The incident occurred after an al Shabaab member attempted to assassinate him.

Unidentified armed men using AK47s shot and killed two civilian men on a rickshaw at Akaaro road vicinity in Wadajir district. The district police arrived at the scene but there were no reports of arrests. The motive for the incident was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 21st February, AM, IVO Wanlaweyne, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that an AMISOM convoy vehicle has been hit by a roadside IED. Eight deaths reported. The attack may have occurred on 20/02, per a secondary report.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US airstrike targets al Shabaab positions. The US State Department claims the strike took place on 21/02 and killed 4 al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Armed clashes continued between al Shabaab and joint security forces. Casualty figures unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 22nd February, AM, Bardheere, Gedo: Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab have launched an attack against Ethiopian National Defence Forces (ENDF). Causalities not known.

About a hundred residents demonstrated in Cerigabo to protest lack of public services include firefighting services in the area. The demonstration was triggered by the destruction of a local building by fire due to the absence of firefighters. The protestors marched on the streets chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. Police dispersed the demonstration.
22nd February, 1200L, Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu: Local reports have stated that al Shabaab have shot and killed a SNA soldier near Suuq Bacaad.

22 Feb, . A hand grenade was hurled at SNA on foot patrol at Perfume Factory in Heliwa district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attack. One SNA soldier was injured. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate two FGS employees. Assailants escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambush a joint AMISOM/SNAF convoy outside of Kismayo, possibly including US advisors. Casualty figures unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Ugandan AMISOM forces shot and killed three Somali government forces following large bombing attacks on two sections of the city. The action may have been an instance of confusion following the blasts.

23 February 2018: Somali troops clashed with Al-Qaeda linked group, Al Shabab. The clash started when Somali military forces launched ambush attack against Al Shabaab near Awdhegle district. There was hours-long combat between them that caused an unidentified number of casualties.
SNAF forces raid and destroy al Shabaab camp near Jungal. At least two militants killed.

23 Feb, c. 0600 hrs. Somali government forces clashed with al Shabaab militants at their base in Aybutry village. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for hours. There were an unspecified number of casualties. Government forces overtake the village.

Dozens of IDP staged a demonstration at Ceel Jale IDP camp near the AMISOM protected area in Beletweyne. The IDPs complained of mismanagement of humanitarian aid by the local administration of Beletweyne. The protesters accused INGOs that operate in Beletweyne of mismanagement and reluctance to assist. The IDPs, through the local media, stated that their needs were food, and shelter and that there was a disease at the camps due to inadequate water. They requested the President of Hirshabelle to intervene.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a businessman who hailed from Hawadle clan at his house in Kooshin neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The incident was suspected to be related to clan revenge. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The victim was taken to Beletweyne hospital.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: Arrests: Puntland Police arrest 27 suspected al Shabaab militants in possession of weapons and ammunition.
Team of al Shabaab gunmen aboard a vehicle assault security forces after colliding with SNPF car.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 23rd February, 2040L, Waaberi: AMISOM forces shoot and kill two NISA officers and two civilians after a NISA officers had stopped AMISOM armoured vehicle on airport road checkpoint close to KM4.
Al Shabaab claims responsibility for alleged assassination of SNPF officer Abdulle Moalim in Suuq Bacad.
Al Shabaab assassinated a tax collector.

Two blasts occur in Mogadishu on the evening of 23/02. The first blast, apparently caused by a suicide car bomber, occurred near Somalia's intelligence headquarters. The second blast occurred near parliament's headquarters, where security forces were engaged with gunmen thought to be trying to attack the presidential palace. A gunfight with security forces followed. 25 dead in the second blast, plus 5 al Shabaab attackers.

Two blasts occur in Mogadishu on the evening of 23/02. The first blast, apparently caused by a suicide car bomber, occurred near Somalia's intelligence headquarters. At least 18 people, including government soldiers and civilian bystanders, were killed while more than 20 others, mostly civilians, were injured. AS claimed responsibility for the attack. The second blast near Villa Somalia totalled 30 dead.
Residents protest the killing of an auto-rickshaw driver by state forces.

hrs. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack on an SNA checkpoint at Captain Las vicinity (c. 12 km north west of Merka district). SNA responded and al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ISIS and locals clashed at Dacar area (c. 98 km south east of Qandala). The clash lasted for about 15 minutes after which ISIS fighters retreated back to the mountain. There were no reports of arrests.

24 Feb, c. 1030 hrs. An armed SNA soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a civilian auto-mechanic riding his motorcycle at Mukayga SNA checkpoint vicinity in Afgoye district. The victim was headed to town when a soldier who was at the checkpoint ordered for payment but the victim refused. The victim was shot as a result. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Arrests: 24 Feb, c.1600hrs. PSF detained an alleged prominent al Shabaab member (names not provided) near Panorama Hotel in Bossaso. The arrested was said to be the chief of Amniyat operating in Golis Mountain/Galgala. The detained was taken to PSF base for further investigation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: hrs. Galmudug security forces conducted a security operation to remove illegal checkpoint established by Sa'ad armed clan militias at Ceel-akhwaan village (c. 12 km south of Galkayo from the main road that links South Galkayo to Cadado). Two Galmudug soldiers were injured and four armed militiamen were arrested during the operation. The incident occurred after Galmudug security forces exchanged gun fire with some armed militiamen at the checkpoint.

. Al Shabaab element hurled two hand grenades at the District Commissioner Office neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. Two SNA soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based at Bar Jowhar neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated with RPGs followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Two NISA soldiers were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

Two al Shabaab elements shot and killed a government municipal police officer who was collecting tax revenue near Ex. Daalo Airline vicinity in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators took the pistol of the victim and managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

An RCIED, targeting an SNA vehicle, exploded as the vehicle passed near Biya Degeenka area in Heliwa district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire that lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. The vehicle was damaged but there were no reports of casualties.

24 Feb, c. 1147 hrs. An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy from Afgoye to Baledogle town, exploded at the outskirt of Tixsiille village under Afgoye district. The device exploded damaging the SNA lead battlewagon. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. The Somali Memo claimed three soldiers dead.
Arrests: Security forces conducted a large security operation throughout Mogadishu following a large scale al Shabaab attack on 23/02. Hundreds arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an KDFconvoy at a grazing area near Sheebow village (c. 18 km south east of Ceel Waaq town). The ambush was initiated by an IED that targeted the convoy followed by heavy armed clash that lasted for hours. Subsequently, al Shabaab withdrew after warplanes (not identified) reportedly arrived at the location of the incident. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland soldiers beat Garowe journalist Khalif Guelle Aden. Motives unknown.

25 Feb, c. 0945 hrs. A magnetic IED attached to a private vehicle detonated near Macalin Nuur village in Dharkenley district. The vehicle was destroyed and two people, who travelling in the vehicle, were injured and taken to the Madina Hospital for treatment. The motive of the incident was unknown.

Three suspected armed men shot and killed an SNA soldier at the Gaheyr vicinity in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests made. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

. An SNA soldier shot and killed a driver of a rickshaw at the milk factory in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of the incident was not ascertained. The family of victim sought for justice from the government.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Sustained air strikes have been targeting areas in Lower and Middle Jubba regions in ""recent days"" (source dated 25/02). Affected areas include Jilib, Bu'ale, and Berhani. Several bases destroyed, 20 al Shabaab dead. (3 dead accounted for in Jilib on 19/02.)

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Sustained air strikes have been targeting areas in Lower and Middle Jubba regions in ""recent days"" (source dated 25/02). Affected areas include Jilib, Bu'ale, and Berhani. Several bases destroyed, 20 al Shabaab dead. (3 dead accounted for in Jilib on 19/02.)

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an SNA convoy headed from Afgoye to Baledogle at Waraboole village located at the outskirts of Afgoye district. SNA responded and al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNA troops clashed with a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters at Embareeso village (c. 05 km north of Afgoye district). Exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the suspected al Shabaab members withdrew. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Armed clashes oppose AMISOM/SNAF and al Shabaab near Embresso airfield. Initiator unknown. Al Shabaab withdrew after 30min long firefight. Resulting casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: KDF conducts route clearance operation between Dhobley and Afmadow, claims four militants killed.

Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Qansax-Dheere Deputy District Commissioner in Qansax-Dheere town (c. 90 km south west of Baidoa). Three people were injured. No arrest report.

IS shot and killed a 70-year-old clan elder at Hawo-Tako vicinity in Afgoye district. The victim was reported to be in front of his home after evening prayers when he was attacked by two armed assailants. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but no confirmed arrest report.

An unidentified armed man shot and killed a civilian man who hailed from Omar Mohamud clan at Garsoor neighbourhood in Northern Galkayo. The motive of the incident was unknown. The perpetrator escaped from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate Puntland intelligence officer Bashir Baafa. Assailant escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attack Jubaland forces checkpoint. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

Two armed men, believed to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed a famous elder at Sarkuusta area in Dayniile district. The victim was a member of the defunct Somali Electoral College who elected the Members of Parliament from South West Regional Administration. The perpetrators managed to escape the scene.
Hodan, Mogadishu: A SNA soldier shoots and kills the driver for the district commissioner of Dayniile. The reasons for the attack are not known.

The driver of the District Commissioner of Kahda was shot and killed by one of his bodyguard at Ex-Control Afgoye vicinity in Dharkenley district. The district police attended to the scene after the incident and apprehended the suspect. The motive for the incident was reported to be verbal dispute.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: US air forces conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab targets in Jilib town (c. 105 km north east of Kismayo). The warplanes targeted an al Shabaab central base in the town and an al Shabaab checkpoint near Gududayda neighbourhood located north east of Jilib town. Initial reports indicate that the checkpoint was destroyed. Two al Shabaab dead, one wounded.

BAY REGION (Area 12) Al Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked SNA position at Iska-Darki (c. 7kms N of Baidoa). Both sides briefly exchange fire and al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. No casualty was reported from the attack.

Two groups who hailed from Omar Mohamud clan clashed near Taala'ad area (c. 15 km north of Galkayo) over a land dispute. There was an exchange of gunfire. Puntland police intervened and halted the fighting. Five people were injured. The injuries were taken to hospital. Authorities are investigating the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed KDF forces at Gelgesha Abdi Kheer village between Faxfaxdhuun and Giriley (c. 20 km south of Giriley village). AMISOM forces were headed to Faxfaxdhuun base at the time of the attack. Exchange of heavy gunfire lasted for a few hours. Additional SNA troops, led by Faxfaxdhuun district commissioner, were deployed to the location of the incident. Later, Kenyan fighter jet, supported by ground troops were deployed. Three KDF troops were killed and the Faxfaxdhuun district commissioner sustained minor injuries. Number of al Shabaab causalities is not confirmed.
Al Shabaab fighters abduct several Somali doctors, possibly working for a local NGO. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

Al Shabaab assailants shot and killed a military court staff member at Tabeelaha Weydow in Dayniile District. The incident occurred shortly after the victim stepped out of a restaurant. The perpetrators managed to escape. al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 28 February 2018: Somali Army backed up by AMISOM: Ethiopian forces recaptured the town in Hiiraan region. They faced heavy resistance from Al Shabaab which resulted in unidentified number of casualties. Al Shabaab had been controlling the town since 2016.
Al Shabaab abducts two people, kills nine donkeys at Elboon, 15 kilometres west of Wajid. Radio Kulmiye claims one dead.

c. 0200 hrs. SNA forces supported by clan militias - locally known as Macawisley - launched an attack against al Shabaab base in Moqokari village (c. 120 km south east of Beletweyne). al Shabaab retreated from the area and the local militias and SNA forces took control of Moqokori. Subsequently, SNA forces and the local militias withdrew from the village after receiving reports of al Shabaab reinforcement amassing near the village. No reports of casualties.
28th February, PM, Bardheere, Gedo: Suspected al Shabaab militants fire an undisclosed number of mortars at Bardheere airport. Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen open fire against vehicle transporting Somali team doing biometric registration of Puntland forces. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: PSF and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Balikhadar area of Galgala. There were no reports of immediate casualties and arrests.

A hand grenade was hurled at an SNA base in Suuq Bacaad Market vicinity in Yaqshid district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attack. One SNA soldier was injured. The attackers managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A hand grenade was hurled towards an SNA checkpoint near Ali Kamiin junction road in Wardhigley district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the attack. The attackers managed to escape. There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a police check point at Black-sea road near MBC building in Hodan district. At least one officer and one civilian male bystander were injured. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate shopkeeper Omar Guelle at tea shop near Heliwa DC. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
28th February, PM, Hamar Weyne, Mogadishu: A local Rickshaw driver is shot and killed by a security force member.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Government forces, jointly with KDF, attack an al Shabaab position near Faafax Dhuun. At least 23 al Shabaab reported dead. A second report claims 25 dead.
01 March. About 33-ISIS fighters took control of Balidhidin area after area police officers fled.

01st March, 1045L, Siinka Dheere, Mogadishu: A reported VBIED detonates at a vehicle checkpoint. Security forces have claimed that no more than five were killed although al Shabaab has claimed 20 security officers were killed.
Al Shabaab fighters fire several mortar rounds towards a defensive position in Lafoole.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 01 March. An unidentified armed man shot and killed a boy in Bulsho area. The incident took place after youth groups clashed in the area.
01 March, 1200L, Karaan, Mogadishu: Suspected al Shabaab militants throw a grenade at a police station. The blast caused no injury and the assailants escaped.
01 March. Two groups of government soldiers clashed in Haanta Dheer neighbourhood of Dayniile. The clash was over land.
Heliwa, Mogadishu: Suspected al Shabaab militants shoot and kill an SNA soldier.
01st March, 1520L, Wardhigley, Mogadishu: Local reports have stated that up to six mortars land IVO Mogadishu Stadium killing three locals. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 01 March. Anti-al Shabaab aircraft (origin not known, though US air forces have recently operated in the area) strike Bandar Salam village. Target destroyed. Causalities not known.
02 March. Following the al Shabaab capture of Balcad from government forces, al Shabaab leaves the village, leaving SNG to recapture control without resistance.
02 March. An RCIED targeted an SNA vehicle. Gunfire ensured following the blast. Two injuries reported.
02 March. An al Shabaab IED targeted government soldiers in Alamada area. Two soldiers killed, three injured.
02 March 2018: Al Shabaab carried out three separate attacks around Mogadishu. The Somali National Military training camp was targeted in Afgooye. No fatalities reported.
02 March 2018:Al Shabab carried out three separate attacks around Mogadishu. Somali national army forces was targeted in Balcad, which is 30 KM north of Mogadishu. No fatalities reported.

column7: Military Forces of United Arab Emirates; Military Forces of South Africa (1994-)
column16: Radio Risala; Undisclosed Source; Somali Memo; Calamada
column17: 02 March. Suicide bomber rams his VBIED against SNAF base near Afgooye Police Station. The base was operated by the UAE. Eight deaths reported. Pro-al Shabaab source, Calamada, reports 80 dead; Somali Memo, 100. Four South African soldiers were reported dead by Somali Memo, though the source is pro-al Shabaab and routinely aggregates.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 02 March. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy near Haansheekh village. At least 5 BNDF soldiers dead. Al Shabaab radio claimed 23 BNDF dead. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 02 March. At least three BNDF soldiers are killed in an al Shabaab attack near Jowhar. The attack took place during the late morning hours.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 March 2018: Al Shabaab carried out three separate attacks around Mogadishu. AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia, escorted by Burundian troops, was targeted in Balad, 50 km from Mogadishu. Three soldiers were killed, three wounded, many others missing and 17 vehicles of the Burundi convoy of AMISOM were damaged.

Peace agreement/talks: 03 March. Elder from Habar-Jeclo Baho and Habar-Yonis Sacad-Yonis arrived at preliminary peace agreements at Elafweyn following the recent clashes between the two clans in Dararweyne village.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 03 March. A police officer was shot and killed by an unidentified man at Horumar in N. Galkayo. The motive of the incident was not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 03 March, c. 1900 hrs. Puntland forces conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab in Balikhadar, Majiyahan, Macag and Madashon. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed in the Majiyahan area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 03 March, c. 1900 hrs. Puntland forces conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab in Balikhadar, Majiyahan, Macag and Madashon. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed in the Majiyahan area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 03 March, c. 1900 hrs. Puntland forces conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab in Balikhadar, Majiyahan, Macag and Madashon. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed in the Majiyahan area.
03 March. Green on green violence reported in Wadijir. One death reported.
03 March. Two groups of government forces clash in the Daynile neighbourhood of Hanta Dheer. Two killed, three injured.
03 March. Two groups of government forces clash in Kaawo Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. A military officer and four civilians were killed. The clash was over control of land.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 03 March. Al Shabaab launched several mortar rounds at a AMISOM base in Laantabuur. AMISOM forces responded in kind. No reports of causalities.
Detonation: 04 March. An al Shabaab operative is killed when his suicide vest prematurely detonates.
04 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack against security forces in Balcad. Causalities not known.
04 March. Government forces and al Shabaab clash in Laantabuur. Casualties reported, figures unknown.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 04 March, c. 1000 hrs. A group of police took control of Qardho region bank over unpaid salaries. The situation ended peacefully.
04 March. SNA forces and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Bufow village, near Marka. There was an exchange of gunfire before al Shabaab withdrew. Calamada (al Shabaab media) claims two dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 04 March. Al Shabaab IEDs targeting an AMISOM ENDF convoy exploded near Awdiinle village. Causalities reported, numbers not known. Calamada (al Shabaab media) reports 30 ENDF dead.
05 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position in Buufow Bacad. Two SNAF killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 05 March. C. 0500 hrs. Galmudug forces conducted a security operation to remove an illegal checkpoint at Godinlabe village. During the operation one armed militia was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 05 March c. 1355 hrs, An RCIED targeted an NISA vehicle transporting a senior officer in Yaaqshiid district. The commander was killed and others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 06 March. Al Shabaab kills a NISA officer in Afgooye.
06 or 07 March. Al Shabaab kills a university student in Afgooye.
06 March, c. 1000 hrs. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a civilian in Baacad village, motive not known.
06 March. Two gunmen armed with pistols assassinate a civilian in Hawl Wadaag. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

06 March, c. 0730 hrs. A ward commissioner of Hadan district was shot and killed by suspected al Shabaab in Shiigale neighbourhood in Hodan district. The motive of the killing was believed to be the victim's association with the government.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 06 March. Joint security forces assault al Shabaab positions, dismantle a logistic camp. No casualties reported.
07 March. Reer Hagar and Hayaag clans of Dhulbahante clashed at Gucundhale and Horufaghi villages due to a land dispute. Two people, one from each clan were killed in the incident.
07 March. Reer Hagar and Hayaag clans of Dhulbahante clashed at Gucundhale and Horufaghi villages due to a land dispute. Two people, one from each clan were killed in the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 March. c. 1410 hrs. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy passing at Ceel Waregow village. Causalities not known. Following the ambush, the AMISOM convoy hit an IED in the area. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the second attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 March. A road side IED disables an AMISOM vehicle. No causalities reported.

07 March, c. 1510hrs. An RCIED targeted a vehicle occupied by an MP and the State Minister of Security while they were travelling between Waraabaale Village and Donka Village. The MP, the Minister and two security guards were killed in the explosion.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 March. c. 1410 hrs. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy passing at Ceel Waregow village. Causalities not known. Following the ambush, the AMISOM convoy hit an IED in the area. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the second attack.
08 March. Two groups of government forces clash in Xaanshooley (Xawaadley) over a possible misunderstanding. Two dead, six wounded.
08 March. Unidentified aircraft conduct strikes against al Shabaab locations in Balay and Ruman grazing areas, 160 km south west of Kismayo town. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 08 March. An al Shabaab IED targeting Puntland forces explodes in Majiyahan. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 08 March. IED detonates at NISA checkpoint near Marhane IDP Camp. Five civilians injured.
08 March. A roadside IED disabled a vehicle transporting government officials. No causalities reported.
Movement of forces: 08 March. The government deployed an additional 2,500 forces into Lower Shabelle region.
08 March. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a shopkeeper in Xamar Weyne on 08/03.
08 March. Two government soldiers are dead during a green-on-green clash in Hanshole, located between Jowhar and Hanshole airport. The reason for the clash is not known.
09 March. Al Shabaab conducted a hit and run attack against government forces in Heliwa district. Causalities could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
09 March. An al Shabaab member threw a hard grenade at government forces in the Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Beletweyne. Three people, including two civilians were wounded in the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 March. Al Shabaab and AMISOM forces exchanged a volley of mortars and small arms fire in the Embareso area. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.
09 March. Shiidle and Abgal militias clash after each group had slaughtered the other's goats. Three Shiidle dead.

09 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a civilian truck driver on his way to Kismayo at Burjo grazing area, 65 km west of Kismayo town. The victim reportedly transported charcoal which was previously banned by al Shabaab.
09 March. A member of Ali Saleeban clan is dead the four others injured after militia from Ugaar-Saleeban attacked their vehicle. The motive of the attack is believe to be clan revenge.
10 March. Somalia forces gain control of Gamboole after al Shabaab fighters flee peacefully.
10 March. Six government soldiers are dead following an IED blast in the K13 area. A second source claims 8 dead.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 10 March. Two US soldiers dead and five wounded in a case of misidentification with Somali forces.
Agreement: 10 March. Elders from Habar-Jeclo-Baho and Habar-Yunis-Sacad Yunis finalize a peace deal in Ceel Afweyn.
10 March. Al Shabaab and government forces clash in Gamboole, as al Shabaab controlled city. Somalia forces were able to gain control of the area. Causalities not known.
10 March. Al Shabaab and south-west state forces clash in Ugaari. Five al Shabaab and one military officer dead.
10 March. A land-based clash in Garowe reported. Two members of Omar Mahmud dead, two from Isa Mohamud wounded.
10 March. Al Shabaab and government forces clash outside of Afgooye. Gunfire lasted 30 minutes. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 10 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack against AMISOM forces in Baraawe. Causalities not known.
10 March. Al Shabaab attacks a government position in Marian Guwaay. The subsequent exchange of gunfire lasted about 3 hours. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.
10 March. Two unidentified clan-based militias clash in Gaashaanle. Four deaths reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 10 March. Al Shabaab fired several heavy artillery shells at ENDF positions in Baardheere, ENDF responded in kind. No reports of causalities.
10 March. Three members of Osman Mohamud clan were seriously wounded following an attack by Siwaqron militia in Murcayo (80km NW of Alula). The motive of the attack is believed to be clan revenge.
10 March. An individual from Hawadle is shot and killed by Habargidir militia. The attack is believed to be related to land.
10 March. An Oroma civilian is kidnapped by unidentified perpetrators in Lanta Hawada. Motive not known.
10 March. A road-side IED strikes a military vehicle in Daynile. Two soldiers dead.
11 March, noon. Al Shabaab killed a soldier and two civilians in Yaaqshiid. Another soldier killed several hours later.
11 March. Youths stoned the offices and vehicle of an INGO in Hargeysa. The automotive was reportedly damaged. The reason for the unrest is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 11 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a NISA government soldier during a clash in Kahda district on 11/03. The attack led to a second clash four hours later.
11 March. Two groups of government forces exchanged fire in Belet Weyne. One soldier was critically injured. The motive of the exchange is not known.
11 March. Al Shabaab conducted an attack against a government military base in Garbahaarey. Injuries reported. A second source claims the attack took place on 12/03.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 11 March. Al Shabaab launch an attack against an Ethiopian AMISOM troop position in Baardheere. Causalities not known.

11 March. A civilian man who hailed from Habargedir clan was shot and killed by Hawadle militia in Waradhuumaleh, near Mahas district. The attack is believed to be a revenge attack of an ongoing land dispute.
11 March. A man hailing from Ali Saleeban is killed by unknown actors in Qoton, near Bandarbeyla.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 March. An IED strike destroying an AMISOM vehicle between Baidoa and Burhakaba results in one AMISOM soldier dead and one wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12 March. Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM position in Golweyn. A civilian was injured by a stray bullet. Al Shabaab retreated.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 12 March. A US strike targets al Shabaab checkpoint between Kamsuuma and Buur Koy. Casualties unknown.
12 March. Unrest reported in Burao at the food distribution site. Several injuries reported.
12 March. Two unidentified militia were killed and 20 arrested following a clash with security forces in Cadaado. The reason for the clash is not known.
12 March. Unidentified armed group tossed a hand grenade at a group of soldiers in Qansax Dheere. One death reported.
Detonation: 12 March. IED detonates prematurely during emplacement in Baraawe. Seven militants killed.
Defusal: 12 March. Security forces discover and dismantle an al Shabaab IED.
12 March. Protests in Dararweyn and Elafweyn to encourage locals to the support the reconciliation efforts made by the Somaliland government.
12 March. Protests in Dararweyn and Elafweyn to encourage locals to the support the reconciliation efforts made by the Somaliland government.

12 March. Government forces attack a al Shabaab position in Mareer Dheer, Kurtunwaarey district. The forces killed seven al Shabaab members, including the son (Hassan Ahmed Diriye)of a commander. In a conflicting report, a second source claims the event occurred on 10/03 and claimed 6 lives.
12 March. Al Shabaab elements targeted government forces with a hand grenade at the main market in Qoryooley. The soldiers opened fire in the direction of the attack. No reported causalities.
12 March. Two groups of police officers clash in Mahahay. The incident occurred after one group wanted to arrest the deputy commissioner. Two police dead.
12 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position at Maryaan Gubaay. Three hours fighting before al Shabaab withdrew. Casualty figures unknown.
12 March. An SNA soldier opened fire on a UN vehicle, reasons not known. No injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 12 March. An RCIED targeted an AMISOM-ENDF convoy in Aawdiinle. The blast struck the truck, though only caused minor damage.
12 March. A military patrol was attacked by al Shabaab. One soldier dead and several others wounded.
12 March. Security forces kill a suspected al Shabaab members during a security sweep of Dharkenley.
12 March. A government soldier is shot and killed by al Shabaab.
12 March. Security forces open fire against the Auditor General's car after the vehicle failed to stop at a security force checkpoint. Any possible causalities unreported.
13 March 2018: More military forces have been moved to Mahaday town, middle Shaballe region following the recent Al Shabaab attack on Somali military forces and AMISOM in the area.
13 March. 12 government soldiers are dead following an encounter with al Shabaab.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
