column17: 13 March. An explosive drone (likely US) strikes an al Shabaab position during the overnight hours. Causalities could not known at the time of reporting. The Shabelle Media Network claims the strike occurred 12/03 and hit a civilian truck.
13 March. Government forces attack an al Shabaab location causing them to retreat. Five soldiers dead, three wounded. Status of al Shabaab not known.
13 March. Green-on-green violence in Bulo Burto. Motive not known. One dead.
13 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack a government base in Embresso from different directions. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
13 March. Two groups of al Shabaab fighters clash in Madarshon after one of the groups attempted to flee their base. Three dead, two wounded.
13 March. SNA forces launch an attack on an al Shabaab position at Dudumaale, 24km east of Xudur. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack against AMISOM forces near Qansahdhere. Causalities not known.
13 March. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of KDF forces outside on Ceel Waaq. The ensuing clash lasted for several hours. Several vehicles were destroyed. Causalities not known.
13 March. Al Shabaab attacked a soldier and a civilian in Janta Noobe area of Qoryooley. The soldier was KIA while two civilians were injured.
13 March. 13 are injured during a clash between Gaaljecel and Majeerteen groups over rights to a rock excavation site in Qandal.
Detonation: 13 March. An IED being placed by al Shabaab in Madarshon detonated prematurely killing two al Shabaab members.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 13 March. A police officer and civilian are dead following an al Shabaab attack in Bosasso.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 13 March. Jubaland forces attack an al Shabaab position at Buur Koy. One Jubaland soldier is reported wounded. A second report claims the death of four al Shabaab.
14 March. Four al Shabaab were killed in fighting with local militia.
14 March. People from Warsangeli blocked a road in protest of police burning a supply of khat. The road block was at Ceeldahir, 95km south of Bossaso.
14 March. Al Shabaab attacked government soldiers in Bulo Mareer. Two deaths reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14 March. Al Shabaab have shot and killed three Puntland soldiers in Bosasso.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14 March. Two Puntland forces are killed attempting to disarm a IED they had discovered. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14 March. A roadside IED targets Puntland forces, two dead. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 14 March. Seven al Shabaab killed after launching an attack on Jubbaland Forces in Wurkoy, Kismayo.
14 March. Al Shabaab attacked a checkpoint at Calamada in Afgoye district. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack.
14 March. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier in Wadajir District. The assailants stole the gun of the deceased soldier and escaped.
14 March. Al Shabaab claims an explosive targeting Kenyan forces in Ceel Waaq killed two. Kenya military command conducted an air strike in the area either before or after the incident.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

15 March. Hundreds of people staged demonstrations in Hargeisa, Burao, Berbera as well as ""other places in Somaliland."" The cause was to protest against the decisions made by the Somalia government to reject a company from operating in Berbera.

15 March. Hundreds of people staged demonstrations in Hargeisa, Burao, Berbera as well as ""other places in Somaliland."" The cause was to protest against the decisions made by the Somalia government to reject a company from operating in Berbera.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 March. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded near Arbacow settlement. One AMISOM truck was damaged and two AMISOM soldiers were injured. Perpetrators not named by the source.

15 March. Hundreds of people staged demonstrations in Hargeisa, Burao, Berbera as well as ""other places in Somaliland."" The cause was to protest against the decisions made by the Somalia government to reject a company from operating in Berbera.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 15 March. An IED strike followed by an Ambush on an AMISOM convoy has resulted in one vehicle being immobilised and several Ugandan AMISOM soldiers wounded.
15 March. KDF helicopters raid al Shabaab positions near Ceel Waaq, claim 8 killed, no confirmation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 15 March. Suspected al Shabaab operatives hurl a hand grenade towards Higlo Checkpoint. Two civilians and a Puntland security official injured. Assailants escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 15 March. Two people were injured after Galmudug security forces clashed with local armed militia at Badiradley town (c. 70 km of South Galkayo). The incident occurred after the militia established an illegal checkpoint.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 15 March. Jubaland forces capture al Shabaab camp in Buur Koy, kill seven militants.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 15 March. Al Shabaab attacks and kills a police officer, as well as two civilians, in a grenade attack on a checkpoint in Bossaso city (Bari). Several other injuries were reported.
16 March. Armed clashes erupt between armed civilians, SNAF and al Shabaab. Civilians resisted al Shabaab taxation. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia); Pastoralists (Somalia)
column16: Shabelle Media Network; Somali Memo; Undisclosed Source
column17: 16 March. Al Shabaab clashed with ENDF and Somali government forces in Bulale area near Maxaas. The fight started between Herders and Al Shabaab as Al Shabaab tried to put taxes on the Herders. The government reported 32 al Shabaab dead following the gunfight.
16 March. Two local unidentified clan militia groups clashed at Tagaabeeye village, near Dhuasamareb. Three people were killed. The incident was reported to be clan revenge between the two clans.
16 March. Workers at a hospital demonstrated over funds.
16 March. After the attempted assassination of a man from Siwakhron clan in Bargaal area, the perpetrators exchange fire with police. It is not known the extent of the Siwakhron man's wounds.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 16 March. After the attempted assassination of a man from Siwakhron clan in Bargaal area, the perpetrators exchange fire with police. It is not known the extent of the Siwakhron man's wounds.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 16 March. An IED was remotely detonated by al Shabaab near the Bossaso port. One police officer and a civilian were killed and five other police officers were wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 17 March. Armed clashes continue at Maxaas between AMISOM and AS. Additional causalities not known.
17 March. Three mortar shells were fired by al Shabaab towards Baraawe city. There were no reports of human fatalities.

17 March. Armed militias from Warsangeli sub-clan exchanged gunfire with body guards of the Governor of Bari at Ceeldahir area, 95 km south of Bossaso). One militiaman was wounded and eight other militias were arrested.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 17 March. Al Shabaab ambush an AMISOM convoy in Yurkud. The attack was initiated by an IED. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 17 March. US aircraft conduct airstrike against al Shabaab positions in the Galgala. Outcome not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 17 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack on a KDF position with heavy mortars. Casualty figures are unknown.
17 March. A soldier shot and killed a civilian man and injured three others after he opened fire in Jowhar town. The soldier attempted to extort money from a rickshaw driver.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 17 March. Puntland forces claim kill 18 al Shabaab during a security operation in the Cal Madow Mountains.
17 March. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a local elder in Hodan on 17/03. The assailants escaped the scene.
17 March. A roadside IED strikes a Somali Army vehicle. Casualities reported; numbers not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 18 March. An al Shabaab roadside IED detonates against an ENDF convoy killing five soldiers. Al Shabaab claims 10 dead. The convoy was travelling outside of Luuq.
Agreement: 18 March. An al Shabaab explosives expert known as Adow Maalim Isaack surrendered to government forces on 18 March. The location of the surrender is not known.
18 March. A civilian is shot and killed by an unidentified perpetrator with an AK47.
18 March. An SNA officer is shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Dharkenley.
18 March. Security forces open fire and kill three civilians. The reason for the attack is not known. Hundreds of youths were also detained in the security operation.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 19 March. A US airstrike against al Shabaab in Mubaarak. Two reported dead, three injured.
19 March. Suspected al Shabaab shoot and kill a soldier and civilian in Yaaqshiid.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 19 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM and government forces in Buurdhuubo. A second source states 5 al Shabaab dead. Shabelle Media Network reports they al Shabaab overtook the town, but vacated on their own accord later in the day.
20 March. Government forces, supported by 'anti-al Shabaab helicopters' conducted an operation against al Shabaab at Busley. Exchange of gunfire reported - causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 March. SNA and AMISOM forces conducted an operation against al Shabaab positions outside Buulogudud village at Singaler/Wirkoy and Sabcasharaf areas. The forces clashed with al Shabaab. After a brief exchange of gunfire, al Shabaab fighters retreated. No reports of possible casualties.
20 March. Unidentified gunman assassinate civilian in Bariga. Assailant arrested, motives unknown.
20 March. Unidentified clan militia killed a civilian in Muuri. The motive behind the killing reported to be clan feuds.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 20 March. US and Jubaland forces raid an al Shabaab hideout near Buur Koy. Details limited. No causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 20 March. SNA/AMISOM patrol hit by IED in Yoontoy Yarey. Casualties not known.
20 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier in Dharkenley.

21 March. Al Shabaab attacked a government security checkpoints at Buundo-Yarey village in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour after which al Shabaab withdrew. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting.

21 March. SNA forces attacked an al Shabaab base located at Shangulow (Shaatilow) village. Four al Shabaab fighters killed and several others injured reportedly. The troops returned to Baardheere town.

21 March. KDF troops conducted an attack against al Shabaab fighters at Wardenle village, 30 km north of Cel Waaq. A warplane (unknown origin, however Kenya operates aircraft in this region) launched an airstrike targeting al Shabaab fighters followed by a KDF infantry troop attack. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters have not been confirmed at the time of reporting.
21 March. SNAF forces launch operation against al Shabaab camp in Habal Been. Four al Shabaab killed.
21 March. One child died and 13 others wounded after an explosive detonated in Gaalkacyo. Initial reports indicated that the explosion occurred in front of Quranic School.

21 March. Unidentified armed men ambushed a minibus carrying passenger travelling near Laanta-Buuro settlement in Afgoye district. Four passengers were killed and the driver of the vehicle abducted. Motive of the incident is likely to be a clan retaliation.
21 March. Al Shabaab shoots and kills a tax collector in Afgooye.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 21 March. Al Shabaab fighters fired two mortar shells towards Darawish Base at Afurur. The mortar landed on vacant place. There is no immediate report of possible damages.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 21 March. NISA and SNA clashed near Tarabunka Junction in Hodan district. Two civilian bystanders and two NISA soldiers killed and at least four other civilians wounded. The reason for the clash is not known.
21 March. Al Shabaab launch a sustained attack against Kaxda in Dharkenley. Causalities not known.
21 March. Al Shabaab assassinated a tax collector in Heliwa market.
22 March. Somali policeman assassinated by al Shabaab in Afgooye, assailants escaped.
22 March. A government soldier shot and injured three civilians in a house at Xaawo Taako village in Balcad District. The motive behind the attack is not known.
22 March. Nine civilians were admitted to hospital after inhaling a noxious gas that was released from a passing vehicle. At present it is unclear if the incident was intentional.
22 March. Three men were shot and killed in Badbabo IDP camp, details remain limited.
22 March. Unidentified assailants spray acid towards group of civilians cleaning the road. Three injured.
22 March. A Radio Controlled Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device detonates outside the Wehliye hotel in Hawl Wadaag. At least 17 killed.

23 March. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle transporting Mira khat plants near Moodi Moodi village. Both sides briefly exchanged fire and al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. One al Shabaab fighter and another armed man (unknown militia) escorting the vehicle killed during the clash.

23 March. Two groups armed with machetes and sticks from Essa-Muse (Reer-Wacays and Reer-Cadaawe) sub clans clashed near Laso Dawaco village over a land dispute. Police arrested around 40 people from both clans reportedly. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 24 March. Armed clashes erupt between al Shabaab and Djiboutian forces near Belet Weyne. Resulting casualty figures are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 or 25 March. Government and AMISOM forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab hideouts in North and East of the region. The forces clashed at Hees area. Six al Shabaab fighters killed and two soldiers injured. One of the killed al Shabaab members is reportedly Ali Ahmed Gure, the head of al Shabaab Zakawat in North and East of Hiraan region.
24 March. Clan militiamen reportedly shot and killed two men hailing from Biyo-Maal in Muuri Settlement, Afgoye District. The perpetrators allegedly from Abgal sub clan of Hawiye fled from the scene.
24 March. Two women are wounded after al Shabaab militants threw a grenade at a local police station. It is not known if the target of the attack was the police station or the civilians.

24 March. Unknown attackers reportedly hurled a hand grenade to the district headquarters but it landed in front of a residential house opposite of the targeted location. Security forces opened fire to different directions. One person injured by the shooting and two female bystanders wounded as result of the explosion. There was a grenade attack against a police station elsewhere in the area.

24 March. KDF attempts to continue building the security fence on the Somali Kenya boarder meets resistance from locals who claim the fence is annexing parts of Somalia. There were reported injuries between locals and KDF forces erecting the border.
25 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack on security forces in Belet Weyne. Causalities not known.
Detonation: 25 March. A VBIED detonates near an NISA checkpoint after it becomes bogged down in sand after attempting to use routes that avoid security forces. The perpetrator was reported killed.

25 March. A group of people gathered at Dajirka-Dahsoon monument, Bondhere District to protest against Kenyan Government on decision to build a wall between the border of Kenya and Somalia. Police forces dispersed the crowd and reportedly arrested several people.
25 March. Two groups of Government forces engaged in an exchange of gunfire for unknown reasons in Dharkenley District. One soldier killed and another one injured.
25 March. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed an elder and electoral college delegate at Bakara junction during the evening hours.

25 March. A VBIED suicide bomber detonates near a security checkpoint that sits at the entrance of Parliament building. The car had been stopped prior to its detonation. VOA report 6 dead, including three civilians.
26 March. A security forces operation results in three government forces KIA in Baidoa. Despite the loss of life, government forces claim the operation was a success.
26 March. Al Shabaab fighters fire several mortar rounds towards a military base at Hosingow, followed by probing attack. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.
26 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint near Afgooye. Casualties unknown.
26 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed one person and another was wounded in the milk market of Bosasso. The deceased was later revealed to be an intelligence officer. The Attacker escaped the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 26 March. An unidentified armed man attacked an INGO office and fired several rounds at the SPU guard post. The on-duty police officer responded and wounded the attacker. The perpetrator transferred to hospital. Police are investigating the case.

column16: Somali Memo; Undisclosed Source; Shabelle Media Network
column17: 26 March. Two land mine explosions occur in Mogadishu. The first occurred in Daynile, killing two. The second occurred along Industrial road (district not reported), causing injuries. Al Shabaab claimed five dead.

26 March. Two land mine explosions occur in Mogadishu. The first occurred in Daynile, killing two. The second occurred along Industrial road (district not reported), causing injuries. Al Shabaab claimed five dead.

27 March. A Remote controlled RCIED exploded at Yabaryaale, 35kms SE of Beletweyne town. Nine soldiers sustained injuries and the front part of the vehicle was damaged. Al Shabaab fighters claimed the responsibility.
27 March. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade to a police forces position in Wadajir District. One police officer was reportedly killed in the explosion. The assailants escaped.
27 March. Two Government soldiers reportedly engaged in an exchange of gunfire in Deynile District. Reports stated that the soldiers have had land disputes in the area. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 27 March. One under vehicle IED, allegedly fitted on Yaqshid District NISA commander's vehicle detonated. The officer survived the blast as he was not in the vehicle at the time of the incident. No group has claimed the responsibility for the explosion.

27 March. A road side bomb exploded at KM13 neighbourhood, Deynile District. The blast missed its target, believed to be an military vehicle. The forces reacted by opening fire in different directions. No casualties were reported. No claim was made in connection with the attack.

27 March. Unknown assailants gunned down a MP from South West state in Shibis District. The name of the victim identified as Ruqia Abshir Nur was attacked by the armed attackers while she was sitting outside of her home. Al Shabaab was later identified as the perpetrator.
27 March. Al Shabaab claims through their media sources that they overran a military convoy at Galhamar, near Belet Weyne, and killed 27 soldiers. Independent verification not known.
27 March. At least three people killed and 4 others wounded in heavy clashes between Somali government forces and Al Shabaab militants in Goof Guduud.
28 March. Madobe militia clashes with al Shabaab in Bulogudud and Qam Qam. Causalities not known.
28 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a government soldier in Dhagahtur. Police forces deployed to the scene, and reportedly arrested several suspects.

28 March. Al Shabaab attacked government troops position at the Livestock Market, Heliwa District. The two groups engaged in a gun fire that had continued for approx. 30 minutes. Al Shabaab attackers were eventually forced to withdraw. One civilian was reportedly killed during the clashes.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Somalia)
column17: 28 March. An IED reportedly fitted to a ICRC national staff auto detonated in Wadajir District. One Red Cross staff member subsequently died, while the other two were slightly injured. No group has claimed responsibility for this attack.
28 March. Madobe militia clashes with al Shabaab in Bulogudud and Qam Qam. Causalities not known.
28 March. Three are injured and one dead after a car bomb explodes near International Committee of the Red Cross in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 29 March. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM-BNDF convoy travelling from Mahaday to Cali Fooldhere settlement in Mahaday district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire. Casualties not known. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

29 March. A group of armed men carjacked a vehicle of a religious leader in Garowe. The incident took place when the group of armed men and the guards of the religious leader exchanged sporadic gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. Both parties hail from Leelkase clan. The motive of the incident was unknown.
29 March. Infighting among security forces results in one dead. The motive for the clash is not known.
29 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint in Balcad. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
29 March. Two Oromo men were shot and wounded by unspecified perpetrators in two different locations of Bossaso. The motive was not clear.

Detonation: 29 March. Unknown assailants tossed a hand grenade at government troops positioned at Laanta-Towfiq vicinity in Yaqshid district. The grenade landed on an empty place causing no casualty. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
29 March. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed two SNA officers in Heliwa district. There was an exchange of gunfire. One SNA officer was killed and one al Shabaab fighter was wounded.
29 March. An al Shabaab IED emplaced near a security force checkpoint kills one civilian and injures two soldiers in Heliwa.
29 March. A road side bomb detonates along the road in Deynile District. Two donkeys were reportedly killed in the explosion. No human fatality was reported. The intended target not known.
29 March. Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a senior military officer in Yaaqshiid. Two are reported dead in a source published two days after.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 March. Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM convoy in Jowhar. Causalities not known.

30 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack against an SNA position in the village of Lafoole 6km southwest of Afgooye. Initial reports had suggested the position had been overrun, but SNAF have reportedly retained control of the position. Causalities not known.
30 March. Green-on-green fighting continues for a second day in Jowhar. Additional causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 30 March. The body guards of a customs officer and armed men hailing from Warsangeli sub-clan exchanged gunfire at Kala Dhacda area, 71 km north west of Qardho, due to taxation on khat. One body guard was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Arrests: 30 March. Puntland security forces arrest two prominent ISIS members. Their names were not provided.

30 March. A government soldier shot at a group of youth at Liido seashore in Abdulcaziz district. The soldier attempted to disperse several young people near a boat. One civilian male bystander was killed. The soldier was apprehended by the security forces.
31 March. About 200 people protested at Heraale village against recent integration of Galmudug parliament in Dhusamareb. The demonstrators chanted slogans against the former ASWJ leader.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 31 March. Armed clashes erupt between Djiboutian troops and al Shabaab fighters near Belet Weyne. Outcome unknown.

31 March. Al fighters attacked local security guards guarding a weigh station during the evening hours. There was an armed clash which lasted for few hours after which al Shabaab fighters retreated with casualties, specific number not known.
Weapons seizure: 31 March. Police forces intercept a donkey cart full of IED components in Baidoa.

31 March. Armed perpetrators hailing from Ali Saleeban sub clan ambushed people hailing from Ugaarsaleeban sub clan while travelling in a vehicle in Dhuudo, c. 80 km south east of Bossaso. The motive of the incident was clan revenge. Five people from Ugaarsaleeban sub-clan were killed and two others were wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 31 March. Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland forces at Afmadow town. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire. No causalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 31 March. Jubaland forces clash with another Jubaland soldier who attempted to hijack a civilian vehicle. The soldier targeted was injured.
31 March. Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a police check point in Yaqshid district. The forces opened fire towards suspected directions of the attack. There were no reports of casualties.
31 March. Government forces clash over a land dispute in Daynile. Causalities not known.
31 March. Two men, one of whom is a district official are shot and killed by al Shabaab in Xamar Weyne.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 31 March. Unidentified warplanes (likely either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab targets near Garoomiste, 95 km west of Kismayo town. Four civilian pastoralists were injured and taken to Kismayo for medical treatment. Initial reports indicated that at least four dead al Shabaab.
01 April. Personnel of the National Printing Agency in Hargeysa held a demonstration at the front office demanding for their salaries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 April. AMISOM forces withdraw from a base in Cali Fool Dheer, local reports claim that al Shabaab have reoccupied the position.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 01 April. AMISOM-Burundi forces establish a forward operating base in Gololey.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 April. A group of al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy moving near Hanshiekh, Balcad district. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
01 April. Al Shabaab attacks a forward operating base in Mashalaay. Causality numbers not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 April. Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM base in Qoryooley, 6 al Shabaab attackers reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 April. A low level attack was launched by al Shabaab on an AMISOM base in Beled Amin. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 April. An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy at Tabeekaha. An AMISOM truck was destroyed. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
01 April. Al Shabaab fire 11 mortar rounds towards a forward operating base in Beled Aamin. No casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 01 April. Al Shabaab fire mortar rounds towards Shalambood. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 01 April. Sporadic gunfire between Somaliland and Puntland forces in Tuko Raq. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 01 April. Puntland forces conducted security operations against al Shabaab in Booj and Dhagax Dhaabuur areas of Galgala Mountains. Four al Shabaab fighters were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 01 April. Al Shabaab conducts an attack against Jubaland forces at Gaduud. No causalities.

01 April. Somali National Police open fire on a vehicle trying to access airport road in Wadajir. The vehicle managed to escape the Police cordon and it is at present unclear whether this incident was criminality or al Shabaab related.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 01 April. An al Shabaab IED targets UPDF convoy. One truck destroyed. Casualty figures unknown.
01 April. A government soldier shot and killed a civilian at Deynile district. The soldier opened fire on a mini-bus parked in front of the force base nearby.

01 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a woman near Cinema Abdi-Wayel neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The woman was reported to be part of the women council in the district and head of sanitation for Barwaqo ward.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 01 April. US aircraft target al Shabaab locations at Kamjaroon. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 01 April. An unknown warplane (likely either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab target near Aboodin, 100 km north west of Kismayo. A civilian was injured and taken to Kismayo hospital for treatment. Additional casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column16: Shabelle Media Network; Somali Memo; Undisclosed Source
column17: 01 April. An airstrike was conducted against an al Shabaab base located south west of Ceel-Buur town. Additional reports indicated that 16 al Shabab fighters were killed. A second report claims US responsibility. The Somali Memo claims four civilians dead.
01 April. Four are killed in a local militia clash over rights to a borehole at Rako Raaxo .

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column16: Goobjoob; Shabelle Media Network; Undisclosed Source; Radio Risala
column17: 01 April. Al Shabaab fighters attacked two (possibly multiple) AMISOM bases at Buulo-Marer and Golweyn settlements in Kurtunwarey district. A VBIED advanced towards Golweyn but AMISOM soldiers fired towards the vehicle destroying it. Causalities not known. The second incident involved two VBIEDs approaching an base at Buulo-Marer. One VBIED managed to infiltrate the base and detonated. Afterwards, there was an exchange of small arms fire between AMISOM and al Shabaab. AMISOM troops repelled the attack. At least four AMISOM soldiers and 22 al Shabaab were killed. Ammunition was also confiscated by AMISOM troops. AMISOM claims 30 al Shabaab dead; a Somali official claims 66 dead; numbers widely varied. The most common figure in the days following the attack is 59.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column16: Shabelle Media Network; Radio Risala; Undisclosed Source; Goobjoob
column17: 01 April. Al Shabaab fighters attacked two (possibly multiple) AMISOM bases at Buulo-Marer and Golweyn settlements in Kurtunwarey district. A VBIED advanced towards Golweyn but AMISOM soldiers fired towards the vehicle destroying it. Causalities not known. The second incident involved two VBIEDs approaching an base at Buulo-Marer. One VBIED managed to infiltrate the base and detonated. Afterwards, there was an exchange of small arms fire between AMISOM and al Shabaab. AMISOM troops repelled the attack. At least four AMISOM soldiers and 22 al Shabaab were killed. Ammunition was also confiscated by AMISOM troops. AMISOM claims 30 al Shabaab dead; a Somali official claims 66 dead; numbers widely varied. The most common figure in the days following the attack is 59.

02 April. Al Shabaab attacked an SNA force base located west of Bulo Burte district. Al Shabaab fired small firearms from a distance towards the direction of the base. SNA forces did not respond to the gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: 02 April. An AMISOM EOD team discovered an IED on the road at Aborko village (c. 17 km north west of Buurkahaba district). The EOD team managed to destroy the IED. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 02 April. SNA troops and AMISOM Burundian contingent clashed at Jowhar Airport. The incident occurred after a plane carrying khat landed in Jowhar airport and SNA troops, alleged to be loyal to one businessman involved in the khat business, entered into the airport and open fire against the AMISOM Burundian forces. One AMISOM solider killed, two others wounded.
02 April. Police shot and killed two men riding motorbikes at Tiidale village, 10 km north west of Dinsoor. The two are believed to be al Shabaab conducting a mission to capture defectors.

02 April. Two unknown perpetrators hurled two hand grenades at Bossaso municipality office. There were no reports of casualties. PSF arrived at the scene and conducted a security operation in the area.
02 April. Protests in Borama over water scarcity.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 April. An al Shabaab IED targets AMISOM logistics convoy at Warmahan. One vehicle possibly destroyed. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 02 April. An al Shabaab IED targets a BNDF convoy travelling from Mahaday to Jowhar. One water truck damaged, one injured.
02 April. Two civilian men were abducted at the centre of Garowe city by Issa Mohamoud militia. The abducted men hailed from Isaaq clan. The kidnapping was related to revenge.

02 April. An IED prematurely detonated near Manyafulka. An AMISOM convoy was on its way to Baidoa from Burhakaba at that time. However, the convoy had not reached the area where the explosion occurred. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 02 April. Al Shabaab fighters conducted an attack against Jubaland forces at Bulogudud. Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds and shot at the base using light firearms at a distance towards the direction of the base. Jubaland forces responded with heavy gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters retreated. There were no reports of casualties.
02 April. A person was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Hodan district. The motive behind the incident was not clear.

02 April. Al Shabaab attacked a military base at Busaar. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. At least one confirmed death.

02 April. An RCIED exploded at a location 8 km west of Bulo Burte. Seven civilians killed. The target was not clear. No one claimed responsibility for the incident, though authorities blame al Shabaab. Radio Risala claims 10 dead.
02 April. IDPs staged a demonstration at the Office of the Regional Governor in Burco to protest of lack of food and drinking water.
03 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a SNAF convoy near Buusaar. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
03 April. A man was wounded by an unknown assailant at Jiiragarob, south east of Bossaso. The motive was not clear. Police were reported to be investigating.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 03 April. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against Jubbaland forces based at Afmadow. Al Shabaab fired at Jubaland force base using small firearms and machine guns. There was a brief exchange of gunfire which lasted for about ten minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Initial reports indicated that mid-level al Shabaab officer was killed in the attack. His body taken by al Shabaab.
03 April. Unidentified armed attackers shot a civilian man who participated in the 2016 Lower House elections in Dharkeynley district. No one claimed responsibility of the attack.
03 April. An al Shabaab RCIED targets vehicle of Wadajir district commissioner. One bystander injured.
04 April. Security forces attack journalists outside the Parliament building. The reporters were covering a governing dispute.
04 April. Two soldiers exchanged gunfire at Buundaweyne. During the armed confrontation one civilian bystander was killed and a second injured.
04 April. Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis clans clashed at Fadhi Gaab. Four people were killed and nine others were injured.
04 April. A deceased man was found in South Galkayo. Bullet wounds were observed on his body. The motive for the killing is unknown.
04 April. Local clan militia assassinates local Khat dealer outside of Belet Weyne, injures two bystanders. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
04 April. IED targets SNAF vehicle near Sinka Dheer. Two SNAF injured.
04 April. An al Shabaab IED planted at house of electoral delegate detonates in Belet Weyne. One child injured.
04 April. An al Shabaab IED detonates at Sana' Junction against SNAF convoy. Three bystanders killed.

04 April. An RCIED targeting the deputy district commissioner of Deyniile exploded in Karan District. The Commissioner survived after the incident. Five bystanders were killed and four others were injured. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 05 April. A US airstrike leaves three al Shabaab dead near Jilib.
05 April. Al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF checkpoint in Afgooye. Three civilians and one SNAF injured. Assailant escaped.

05 April. An SNA soldier was shot and killed by another soldier at the centre of Baidoa town. The circumstance surrounding the killing of the soldier was unknown. Police forces arrived at the scene of the incident and managed to arrest the perpetrator. He was reported to be under custody for further investigation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 05 April. Al Shabaab ambushed a KDF reinforcement convoy from Tabta at Jaldesa (c. 42 km east of Dhobley). The group was travelling to aid following an IED attack in the area. No reported causality.
05 April. Rival clan clashes (actors not identified) near Mandheere. One civilian killed. Clashes triggered by dispute over farmland ownership dispute.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 05 April. Two roadside IEDs have immobilised two KDF vehicles near Dhobley. Causality figures, perpetrators not known.
05 April. Unknown armed men shot and killed a herder from Dhulbahante clan near of DaboTaag. The motive of the killing was unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 05 April. A Puntland soldier from Reer Mohamud clan sub-clan of Majeerteen was shot and killed by a man hailing from Leelkase clan near a police post at Garsoor. The motive is unknown. Perpetrator escaped from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 05 April. Al Shabaab conducted an attack against Jubaland forces based at Bulagadud. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated. There is no reports of casualties.
05 April. Infighting between SNA troops in Daynile, with a number of casualties of both SNA and civilians reported - Numbers not known.
06 April. Two al Shabaab suicide VBIEDs detonate along airport road. Three al Shabaab dead, one soldier. The Somali Memo, al Shabaab's propaganda arm, claimed 18 soldiers dead.
06 April. Somaliland police shot and injured a person who refused to stop at a checkpoint in Waridaad.

06 April. A hand grenade was hurled at a house in Yaaqshid. The house hosted a wedding ceremony during the attack. The motive of the attack was unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 06 April. SVBIED stopped at checkpoint detonates. One NISA killed, three bystanders injured.
06 April. Unconfirmed local reports claim a grenade is thrown at a wedding party. No casualties reported at present. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 07 April. A NISA commander and his body guard were shot and killed by al Shabaab at Elasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. The perpetrators took the vehicle of the commander and AK47 belonging to the body guard.

07 April. An RCIED buried at a military checkpoint exploded at Xaanshooley (c. 05 km from Jowhar town). Two soldiers and one civilian were killed and four others were injured. Perpetrators not named by the source.
07 April. Unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a prominent businessman who hailed from Dhulbahante/Nuur-Ahmed sub clan near Goolada in Las Anod.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 07 April. Armed clashes oppose al Shabaab with Jubaland troops outside of Kismayo, one officer killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 07 April. Media reports state that a security official was killed in clashes between opposing Jubaland forces. The reason for the clash is not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 08 April. US forces launch an air strike against ISIS figures in Dadar. Four deaths reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Movement of forces: 08 April. A large number of ENDF forces leave Dhuusamarreeb and are travelling back to Ethiopia.

09 April. Two local clan (identities not given) militias clashed at Faangurmurre grazing area near Bukure (c. 125 km east of Beletweyne town) due to a dispute over grazing land. The armed clash lasted for about three hours after which one of the clan militias retreated from the location. Eight militias were killed from both clans and 24 others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 09 April. AMISOM Burundian troops established a new military camp near Balcad town to allow for a timelier response to incidents in the area.
Recruitment: 09 April. 43 boys, aged between 12 - 15 years, were recruited by al Shabaab fighters in Harardhere town and surrounding villages.
09 April. Kenyan forces bombed three al Shabaab locations near Faafax Dhuun. It is not known if the Kenyan force used aircraft or artillery. Causalities not known.
09 April. Government forces conducted a security operation at Goofgaduud where they clashed with al Shabaab. One al Shabaab fighter was killed.
09 April. A group of traders in Wajale border town demonstrated due to new taxes levied by the Somaliland government.
09 April. Unidentified assailant injures Omar Mohamud/Majerten civilian in Qardho. Assailant later arrested, motives unknown.
09 April. A heavy explosion was heard at an al Shabaab location near Jilib. The type of blast and casualties could not be established.
09 April. Two hand grenades exploded at Lanta Towfiq in Yaqshid district. Two soldiers were injured. The unidentified perpetrators managed to escape.

09 April. A hand grenade was hurled at SNAF soldiers in Howlwadaag district by unknown perpetrators. The soldiers opened fire towards suspected directions of the attack. A female bystander was injured. The perpetrators manage to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 April. Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM base in Ambareeso Settlement located outside Barawe district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack.
10 April. An RCIED, placed on the roof of a small teashop located exploded. Five people were injured. A child, who was injured in the incident, died in hospital. Perpetrators not named by the source.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 10 April. Puntland and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Madarshon area of Galgala, 67 km south west of Bossaso. There were no reports of immediate casualties and arrests.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 10 April. Civilian bus driver shot and injured by custom police at Main Customs checkpoint. Driver had attempted to escape. Perpetrator also arrested.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 10 April. Al Shabaab detonated an IED, targeting a Puntland military vehicle, at Balikhadar area of Galgala, 35 km south west of Bossaso. One soldier was wounded.
10 April. Two groups of SNAF soldiers, organized along unidentified clan lines, clashed in Wadajir district over a land dispute. Two soldiers were killed and four others were injured.
10 April. Two SNAF soldiers assassinate two others in Daynile. This clash is distinct from a similar one in Wadajir. Assailants fled with confiscated weaponry. Motives unknown.
10 April. An IED, targeting an elder and broker, exploded in Wadajir district. The victim was seriously injured. Three bystanders were injured. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 11 April. US AFRICOM conducts airstrike against VBIED in Jana Cabdalle. Casualties unknown, VBIED destroyed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 11 April. Joint Jubaland/US forces advance on Sunguuni near Jamaame, clash with al Shabaab. No casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 11 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack UPDF defensive position near Baraawe. Resulting casualties unknown.
Detonation: 11 April. Two senior al Shabaab technicians were killed in an explosion during preparation of a VBIED near Harardheere.
11 April. Al Shabaab killed a police officer near Badbaado settlement in Wadajir district.
11 April. Armed clashes erupt between two SNAF soldiers. Casualties and motives unknown.
12 April. A bomb explodes during a football match in Baraawe, between 4-5 dead. The bomb was placed in the 'VIP' section of the stadium, targeting soldiers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12 April. Al Shabaab combatants attacked an AMISOM convoy moving near Danow settlement at Buulo Marer town. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 12 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF convoy travelling to Buulo Mareer, near Danow. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.
Agreement: 12 April. Al Shabaab commander, Adan Mohamed, otherwise known as Adan Shah, surrenders to government forces in Baidoa.
12 April. A IED, attached to a vehicle owned by a tax official, exploded at Hanti-wadag district in Jowhar town. No reports of causalities. Perpetrators not known.
12 April. An accountant working for the municipality was shot and killed at Israac Village in North Galkayo. The motive of killing was unknown. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.
12 April. A roadside bomb exploded at Kahda district. A civilian truck was damaged. Two passengers were injured in the explosion. Perpetrators not named by the source.
12 April. IED detonates when civilians attempt to remove it, 2 killed. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 13 April. A Puntland soldier shot and injured a khat dealer from Dhulbahante Wacays Ali Sub-clan near Godaqaboobe village, 53 km east of Lasanod. The motive of the incident was not clear. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 13 April. Al Shabaab kills a Puntland soldier in Gaalkacyo.
14 April. Hawadle and Jareerweyne clan militias clashed at Banaaney area, north of Beletweyne town. One death, two injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 14 April. Al Shabaab fighters attacked NISA troops based in Yaqshid district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes. Two civilian bystanders were injured. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
14 April. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate an official of the Ministry of Education. Two assailants escaped.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

15 April. Residents from Hargeisa staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the Hargeisa local council to protest of the apparent lack of response to infrastructural damages and dirt caused by floods in the town.

15 April. An IED, targeting government soldiers, exploded at Buulo Foolyo in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire between al Shabaab fighters and government forces. Al Shabaab briefly took control of the checkpoint and took an unspecified amount of money. At least three soldiers were killed. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
15 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a businessman in Wanleweyn district. The businessman refused to pay tax to the group. The perpetrators escaped.
15 April. Pro-Puntland militiaman (group not identified) shoots and injures Dhulbahante/Wacays Khat dealer in Qod Qaboobe, near Las Anod. Motives unknown, assailant escaped.
15 April. Al Shabaab operative hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF checkpoint near former Milk Factory. No casualties reported, assailant escaped.
15 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a police officer near Yaqshid district offices at Fagah junction.

15 April. An RCIED, buried along the roadside and targeting an SNA vehicle, exploded near the Ministry of Defence. Security forces opened shot towards suspected directions of the attack. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.
15 April. SNAF troops clash with an unidentified armed militia after later attempted to set-up an illegal checkpoint and extort taxes from ongoing building sites. Casualties unknown.

15 April. Armed men using pistols shot and killed a university lecturer at Oodweyne village in Deynile district. The victim came out of a nearby garage when the armed men attacked him. The motive of the killing was not clear. The assailants escaped.

Movement of forces: 16 April. Three al Shabaab vehicles carrying about 40 militants were observed near Bacaadweyne village, 70 km west of Hobyo. Galmudug police officers confirmed that al Shabaab fighters arrived in the area immediately departed. Additional reports indicated that al Shabaab continued to be engage in recruitment of young children in their area of control and surrounding villages.
16 April. Al Shabaab ambush of soldiers in an El Garas location. 2 SNA killed.
Recruitment: 16 April. Al Shabaab are observed recruiting children in the Hobyo area. It is not known if the conscription was voluntary.

16 April. A government soldier shot and severely wounded a rickshaw driver at Ceelasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. The soldier was managing traffic congestion on the road before he shot at a crowd. The perpetrator was arrested by security forces.

16 April. Al Shabaab fighters abducted a member of Hiraan Regional Youth Group from Miircadde area, 40 km east of Beletweyne town. The motive behind his abduction was related to his active role in the youth and social activities in Maxas district especially with the youth organization in that district.
16 April. Two armed men shot and killed a civilian man in Bondhere District. The victim was closely associated with NISA soldiers in the district.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 16 April. Jubaland forces clashed with a group of al Shabaab fighters at Qoqani. There was a brief exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties, however it is believed al Shabaab forces gained control of the area following the clash.
17 April. Al Shabaab assailants shot and killed two government soldiers in a tea shop located at Arbiska neighbourhood in Afgoye. The perpetrators escaped after the incident.
Looting: 17 April. SNAF soldiers enter Daryeel IDP Camp, reportedly loot food and aid.

17 April. Military forces engage al Shabaab along the road linking Beledweyne town to Mataban and Mahas. After a sustained gunfight, military forces regained control of the area, as well as other surrounding areas. 30 al Shabaab dead. No reported military dead.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 17 April 2018: Al Shabab Assailants killed Somali intelligence agent in Mogadishu. The assailants had managed to escape the scene before security forces arrived.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 17 April. Combined Jubaland/Kenyan forces overtake al Shabaab forces in Qoqani, after it have been under their control ""for several hours."" No Jubaland/Kenya causality, though witness claimed to have seen ""dead bodies"" of al Shabaab.
15 - 19 April, period between. Details limited - clan clashes reported in Bossaso and Belet Weyne. One death reported.
18 April. SNAF and Hiirshabelle forces recapture Qurac Madobe, Waraxley, War Cise and Qab Duco from al Shabaab. Al Shabaab vacated the area prior to the arrival of security forces.
18 April. SNAF and Hiirshabelle forces recapture Qurac Madobe, Waraxley, War Cise and Qab Duco from al Shabaab. Al Shabaab vacated the area prior to the arrival of security forces.
18 April. SNAF and Hiirshabelle forces recapture Qurac Madobe, Waraxley, War Cise and Qab Duco from al Shabaab. Al Shabaab vacated the area prior to the arrival of security forces.
18 April. SNAF and Hiirshabelle forces recapture Qurac Madobe, Waraxley, War Cise and Qab Duco from al Shabaab. Al Shabaab vacated the area prior to the arrival of security forces.
18 April . Al Shabaab ambush in Balcad, 5 SNA killed.
18 April. Idig Facle and Warsangeli clans cash over land dispute outside of Balade. One injured. PSF and Police intervened, arrest four perpetrators.
18 April. Unidentified gunmen open fire against civilian minibus in Beled Weyne. Four injured.
18 April. Al Shabaab fighters shot and injured three civilians at charcoal burning site 5km from Beerhani.
18 April. Two groups of SNAF soldiers exchange gunfire during checkpoint incident in Hodan. Resulting casualties unknown.
19 April. Two Gahayle/Reer Arab clans clash in Arta over land dispute. Two people killed, two injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 19 April. Puntland forces launched a military operation against Al Shabaab in Mardarshon area of Galgala and killed three al Shabaab fighters.

19 April. A UVIED, attached to a vehicle belonging to an official of the Ministry of Fisheries, exploded in Taleex Village near Hodan Police Station in Hodan district. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.
19 April. Government forces and al Shabaab clash in Yaaqshiid. At least one al Shabaab dead.

20 April. Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a tea shop in Barawe district. Government forces were in the area before the assailants threw the hand grenade. Four people, believed to be civilian bystanders, were injured. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

20 April. Residents of El-Afweyne demonstrated against the arrest of a prominent Somaliland traditional leader by Somaliland authorities. The demonstrators burnt tires and blocked roads in El-Afweyn. Demonstration were also reported in Ainabo town, but it is not known if these demos were violent.

20 April. Residents of El-Afweyne demonstrated against the arrest of a prominent Somaliland traditional leader by Somaliland authorities. The demonstrators burnt tires and blocked roads in El-Afweyn. Demonstration were also reported in Ainabo town, but it is not known if these demos were violent.

20 April. A dead body was found near Buulo-Dooro IDP camp in North Galkayo. The victim was from Leelkase clan. Bullet wounds were found on his body. The motive for the killing was unknown. Puntland police were reported to be investigating the incident.
21 April. Al Shabaab attack a government forces base in Wardhigley. One death reported.
21 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a military convoy travelling between Middle Shabelle and Hiraan regions at or near Jalalaqsi. Casualties and outcome unknown.
21 April. An armed clash occurred between two groups of Gahayle Reer sub-clans in Arta area of Bossaso due to a land dispute. Two people were killed and two others were wounded.

21 April. Unidentified armed assailants attacked a government force checkpoint at Hamarjadid village in Wardhigley district. The attackers initiated the attack using a hand grenade towards the checkpoint. There was a brief exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour. One soldier and a civilian bystander were killed. The attackers escaped.
22 April. Two SNA groups clashed for unknown reasons in Balcad district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour. There were no reports of casualties.

column8: Military Forces of the United Arab Emirates (2004-)
column17: 23 April. Two dead and five others injured when soldiers trained by the UAE and Somali government forces clashed in Mogadishu. The clash started after UAE soldiers attempted to take some military hardware from the government forces.
23 April. The General Gordon military base in Mogadishu was looted, following the departure of United Arab Emirates training forces.
23 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack a government forces location in Afgooye. Military forces pushed back the attack, ""causing causalities"" - numbers not known.

23 April. Two groups of students of Dayaxa Boarding School clashed in Cerigabo due to clan related conflict. The fighting started after two students from Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis clan fought. The fight escalated to other students from both clans.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 23 April. Al Shabaab conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM Burundian troop base at Arbacow vicinity (c. 15 km west of Mogadishu in Afgoye district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.
23 April. Two groups of students at Dayaxa Boarding School clash. Incident triggered by ongoing clan conflict between Habar Jeeclo and Habar Yonis. Causalities not known.

23 April. A woman was shot and sustained a non life threatening injury after an armed man hailing from Omar Mohamud clan shot at a rickshaw driver who was carrying the victim near Classic Hotel in North Galkayo. The motive for the incident was unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 23 April. Several gunshots were heard behind a UN compound in Garowe. Reports confirmed that the commander of the residence of the former Vice-President was killed by his fellow soldier, reasons unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 23 April. An armed civilian man (from Reer Hussein sub-clan of Isse Mohamoud clan) shot and wounded two police officers in front of the central police station in Garowe. In response to the incident, another police officer shot and killed the attacker. The motive for the incident was unknown and the dead body was taken to hospital.
23 April. Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards police checkpoint in Suuq Bacad, Yaaqshid. No casualties, assailant escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 23 April. Al Shabaab fighters conduct a hit-and-run against Moalim Nuur NISA checkpoint. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 23 April. Jubaland and al Shabaab forces clash at Buulo Gaduud. Causalities of unknown number reported on both sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 24 April. Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM-Uganda forces in Ceelasha Biyaha during the early morning hours. There were no immediate reports on casualties, however al Shabaab said in a statement that its fighters inflicted ""heavy casualties"" on the AMISOM troops. Enemy casualties are often embellished inflated by al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 April. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Merka to Afgoye, exploded at Buullo Naagad village near Kelicafimaad, 18 north of Merka. There was an exchange of gunfire between al Shabaab fighters and government forces. The lead vehicle of the convoy was damaged and two AMISOM soldiers were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 24 April. Jubaland forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters in areas located 5 km east of Abdalle Birole village. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 April. Al Shabaab fighter hurls hand grenade towards AMISOM position in Shibis. Al Shabaab claims two injured.
24 April. Unidentified gunmen assassinate an auto rickshaw driver in Bakaara market.

24 April. A hand grenade was hurled at the Office of the District Commissioner at 1st May village in Waberi district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. There were no reports of casualties and the unidentified assailant managed to escape.

24 April. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a rickshaw driver at a bus station at the Livestock market in Heliwa district. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of the incident was not clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 24 April. NISA soldier kills civilian driver of auto-rickshaw. No arrests made.

24 April. An unidentified armed soldier shot and killed a civilian female at Lido Beach vicinity in Abdiaziz district. The victim was on her way home when the armed man attacked and shot her. Her body was taken to CID for further investigation. The motive of the incident was not clear.
25 April. A group from milk and charcoal dealers demonstrated in front of local government offices against a new tax imposed by Borama local government.
25 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a military convoy near Tayeeglow. Casualties unknown.
25 April. A SNA soldier was stabbed and injured by a civilian over a land dispute at Wabari neighbourhood in Dhobley town.

25 April. Unknown attackers, suspected to be rogue SNA elements, shot at a public vehicle carrying khat from Mogadishu to Afgoye at Elasha Biyaha area in Afgoye district. One female khat dealer was severely injured. The perpetrators stole the khat and escaped from the area.

25 April. An IED, buried alongside the main road and targeting an SNA vehicle, exploded near Imbaresso village at Barawe. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. Al Shabaab fighters claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 25 April. ISIL assassinates a NISA officer in Hawl Wadaag and later claimed credit.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 25 April. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a NISA soldier at Buurdheere village neighbourhood in Waberi district.

25 April. Two armed al Shabaab elements shot and killed an unidentified youth in Howlwadag district. The victim was attacked shortly after he came out of a shop. The perpetrators escaped. The District Police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests made.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 25 April. Al Shabaab forces ambush a group of AMISOM-Uganda soldiers at Ceel Waregow. An exchange of gunfire followed. An unknown number of causalities reported on both sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 25 April. An RCIED, planted on the road between Bulo-gudud and Wirkoy villages and targeting AMISOM and SNA forces on foot patrol (the force may have been led by the Americans), exploded near Wirkoy village, 38 km north of Kismayo town. The joint forces were conducting a security operation against al Shabaab fighters when the attack occurred. Three SNA soldiers were injured and transported to Kismayo for medical treatment. Perpetrators likely al Shabaab.
26 April. Two unidentified rival clan militias clash over unspecified motives. At least three killed.

26 April. Two clan militias clashed near Surmay Daaraya village (c. 22 km south west of Baidoa). The clash occurred after a dispute over ownership of land. Three people were killed. One of the clan militias were overpowered and managed to escape from the area.

26 April. A man who hailed from Dasheshe clan was shot and killed by an armed man hailing from Omar Mohamud clan at Golise Masjidul Huda, Bosasso area. The perpetrator was arrested and taken to the central police station for further investigation. The motive of the killing was not clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 26 April. Jubaland forces attacked an al Shabaab position at Bu-xaji village (c. 70 km south west of Kismayo). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed. The soldiers confiscated three AK47s from al Shabaab fighters.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 26 April. A group of al Shabaab attacked a Jubaland position at Degelame village located along the Kenya-Somalia border (c. 12 km south of Dhobley town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which JSF were forced to withdraw from the location. Injuries reported.
26 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF checkpoint in Hawl Wadaag. Female civilian bystander killed, assailants escaped.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 26 April. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of US forces at Buulo Gaduud, ""inflicting losses."" Numbers not known.

27 April. Small business owners demonstrated in front of Borama local government against the destruction of their businesses along one of the main roads in Borama by Borama local government. The business owners demanded for more land to be provided to Borama local government. There were reports of arrests.
27 April. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian in Xudur.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 27 April. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling along the Afgooye-Mogadishu road, exploded at the vicinity of Boodboodka (c. 02 km south east of Afgoye District). The convoy was headed to Baraawe from Mogadishu. An AMISOM armoured vehicle was extensively damaged by the blast. Casualties from the incident was unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 27 April. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Afgoye to Shalamboot town, exploded at the outskirt of KM 60 village (Siinka Dheer). The AMISOM lead battlewagon was damaged. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape and al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
27 April. An al Shabaab IED targets a civilian minibus in Mahadaay. Casualties not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 27 April. A group of Jubaland soldiers from academia base located north east of Kismayo went on a search for rogue soldiers. There was an exchange of gunfire between the two JSF groups at Afmadow Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismayo town. JSF managed to arrest three absconders. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 27 April. An IED, targeting a mobile Jubaland (JSF) Toyota Pick-up carrying a civilian, exploded at c. 09 km south east of Dhobley town. Six JSF were killed and the vehicle was destroyed. The civilian driver sustained slight injuries.

27 April. Clan militia shot and killed three women from a rival clan (both unidentified) near Aliyow Mumin village (c. 20 km south west of Baidoa). The incident was related to ongoing clan conflict between two rival clans in the area. Al Shabaab fighters intervened as the incident location is under their area of influence.

27 April. Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed two people including an SNA soldier and a civilian female bystander at Howlwadag junction area in Howlwadag District. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

27 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a police officer at Gaheyr University vicinity in Dharkenley district. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident. Government soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 27 April. Al Shabaab gunmen assassinate NISA officer near Gaheyr University. Assailants escaped.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force; AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 27 April. US, Jubaland and Kenyan forces attack an al Shabaab base at Bar Sanguni, 45km north of Kismayo. 30 al Shabaab dead. Al Shabaab claimed they had inflicted losses on the allied forces, but did not provide numbers.

28 April. Militia hailing from Biimaal and Abgaal/Abdulle-Arooni sub clans clashed at Muuri village (c. 16 km south west of Afgooye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for more than three hours. At least three fighters were injured and a civilian female bystander was killed.

28 April. Al Shabaab fighters shot and injured a man at Rays-Gore village (c. 18 km east of Garbaharey district). The victim had an argument with al Shabaab fighters after the man was denied access to his farm by al Shabaab fighters. The victim was taken to Garbaharey town for treatment.
28 April. A Gaaljecel militiaman killed a member of his own clan for unknown reason near Mukuyle. The perpetrator was executed by al Shabaab in the following days.

28 April. Residents of Ceelafweyn, mainly women and youth, took to the streets in Elafweyn against a prominent person by a Hargeisa regional court. The demonstrators demanded for his immediate release. There were reports of arrests.

28 April. Residents of Burao, mainly women and youth, took to the streets in Burao on protest of a ruling made by a Hargeisa regional court of a prominent person. The demonstrators demanded for his immediate release. There were reports of arrests.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 28 April. A UVIED, targeting an immigration personnel, exploded at Buundo Kowaad (first Bridge) neighbourhood in Waberi district. The targeted person informed the EOD team. However, the IED exploded before arrival of the EOD team injuring a NISA District Commander who was standing near the vehicle.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 28 April. The deputy chief of Waberi District's National Intelligence Security Agency was wounded when an explosive planted under his vehicle detonated. Perpetrators not named by source.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Somalia)
column17: 28 April. An aid worker with the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) was killed after an explosion caused by a device fitted to his car. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 28 April. An al Shabaab landmine strikes a Jubaland vehicle in Urungow, near Dhobley, killing between four and five.
28 April. An al Shabaab suicide bomber kills three police officers, including a commander, in Gaalkacyo. Several other injures reported. The fatality total was raised to seven the following week.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 29 April. A magnetic IED attached to a private vehicle detonated near El - Hindi village vicinity in Howlwadag district. The target was a NISA officer. However, he was not in the vehicle when the explosion occurred. The vehicle was destroyed. There were no reports of casualties. NISA soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation where they arrested one male alleged to be behind the UVIED explosion.
Recruitment: 29 April. Al Shabaab recruited a group of 13 Kenyan youths in Ras Kamboni.
29 April. Al Shabaab clashes with farmers in Garbahaarey. Both sides suffered an unknown number of causalities.

29 April. Two groups of government soldiers clashed at Haanta Dheer neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. At least five civilians were killed and six others were injured. Further reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash related to a land dispute between the two groups.
30 April. Al Shabaab attacks a government soldier position in Wadajir. Three reported dead.
30 April. Al Shabaab attacks and kills an intelligence official in Siinka Dheer.
