30 April. SNA and armed pastoralists from Marehan clan, sub-clan of Daarood clashed at Abudwak town. There was an exchange of gunfire. The incident occurred after pastoralists refused to comply with firearm restrictions in Abudwak town. One pastoralist was killed and another was injured.

30 April. Drivers and co-drivers accessing Berbera port demonstrated at Berbera port after a private company managing the port imposed new regulations instructing truck drivers accessing the port to wear safety helmets and vests

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 30 April. SLA soldiers while collecting firewood from an area near Tuka-raq were shot at by Puntland troops. One SLA soldier was injured and later succumbed to his injuries at the SLA military base in Tuka-raq.

30 April. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA officer at Siinka Dheer area in Suuq Bacaad in Deyniile district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests made. The perpetrators escaped and al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
01 May. Al Shabaab claims to have killed ""more than 10"" government soldiers in an attack in Dhobley on or before 01/05.
01 May. A members of the WHO is shot and killed in Mogadishu. Radio Risala implies al Shabaab responsible.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 01 May. Galmudug forces clash with local militias in Cabudwaaq following set-up of illegal checkpoint. Casualties reported, figures unknown (coded as 10).

01 May. Drivers stage a protest against a private company attempting to impose regulations on vehicles and personnel working at Berbera seaport. Somaliland Police dispersed the crowds peacefully. No arrests.
01 May. Pastoralists clash with al Shabaab outside of Afmadow over taxation. Casualties reported, figures unknown (coded as 10).

01 May. A hand grenade was hurled at SNA on foot patrol at Ali Kamiin village vicinity in Wardhigley district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attack. One SNA soldier was injured by the blast. The unidentified assailants managed to escape from the scene.

column9: Civilians (Germany); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
column17: 02 May. Unidentified actors abducted a German Red Cross nurse in Mogadishu. Another Red Cross worker was assassinated on 28/04.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 2 May 2018: Jubbaland troops backed up by locals clashed with Al Shabab over Livestock tax dispute In Dhobley town (Jubbada). No reported casualties

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 2 May 2018: Jubbaland troops backed by KDF: Kenya Defense Forces made massive military movement on the outskirts of Dhobley town, near Kenya border. The move came after Jubbaland announced a fresh offensive aimed at flushing out Al Shabab militants from the entire region under its control.

02 May. Al Shabaab fighters executed a militiaman hailing from Gaaljecel clan at a public gathering in Mukuyle village (c. 125 km south west of Beletweyne town). The victim was detained by al Shabaab near a nearby rural area on 30h April 2018 after he killed his fellow clan member.
02 May. IED detonates in front of hotel Nasaney in Qansax Dheere. Two civilians killed, Southwest forces arrested several suspected al Shabaab militants in the aftermath of the explosion.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 02 May. Puntland forces shoot and kill a civilian near the airport for unknown reason.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 02 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack Jubaland checkpoint near Gaduud. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.
02 May. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two people consisting of an SNA soldier and a female khat dealer at Bar Ubah junction road neighbourhood in Howlwadag district.
02 May. A police officer was shot and killed by al Shabaab at Kaaran Police Station.

02 May. Two groups of government soldiers, divided along clan lines namely Hawaadle and Habargidir sub clans, clashed over extortion of money from a new building at the Siliga (Ex. US Embassy) village in Wadajir district. At least four government soldiers were killed and four others were injured

03 May. SNA forces, on a reconnaissance mission, clashed with al Shabaab fighters at the edge of Morgabet village (c. 40 km west of Xudur town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties and SNA forces returned to their base.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 03 May. Two groups of Puntland police clash at Burawadal for unknown reason.

03 May. Al Shabaab killed a police officer who was sitting in front of a coffee shop at Kulmiye Hospital in Bondheere district. The motive of the assassination was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 03 May. Somali government forces backed by African Union troops have captured the strategic town of Baidoa from al Shabaab. A soldier was killed and three others were wounded in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 04 May. A group of armed men manning a checkpoint in Bura Wadal village, Sool region, have injured Puntland's Deputy Police Commander Colonel Bile Farah Ali after they opened fire on his vehicle.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 May. Jubaland and US forces conduct joint operation against al Shabaab in Bar - Sunguuni. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 04 May. Puntland troops ambushed a group of Somaliland forces who were collecting firewood near God-Qaboobe (52km E of Lasanod). Somaliland forces reportedly responded with gunfire and both exchanged fire. There were no reports of casualties.

04 May. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a senior police officer at Suuq Weyne vicinity in Wadajir district. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Later, a second attack claimed by AS as hand grenade was hurled at Wadajir Police station near Hassan Hilaac village in Wadajir district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. One police officer was injured by the blast. A suspected man was arrested by the police after the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 05 May, or before. The US military has begun refitting an old Soviet air base in Bali Doogle, including adding 800 beds/officers quarters. Analysts believe this is an indication the United States are planning on expanding their presence in the area. Source dated 05 May.

05 May. Pastoralists hailing from two sub-clans of Ceyr clan clashed at an isolated area near Qalanqale (c. 40 km north west of Dhusamareb). Two people were killed and around 15 others were injured. The armed clash was triggered by a previous clan confrontation.

05 May. Hargeisa local municipal, supported by SLP, conducted a security operation intended to relocate people residing near Qudhac-dher Dam in Hargeisa.The residents resisted and pelted stones at the police. Three people were shot and injured and an unspecified number of people were arrested.
Detonation: 05 May. Al Shabaab IED emplacer intercepted by SNAF in Baraawe. IED detonates prematurely, killing the emplacer.
05 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush Southwest convoy near Gasarla. Five militants , three Southwest soldiers killed.

05 May. A group of people, mostly youths and women, peaceful demonstrated at Cerigabo and accused the Somaliland President and ministers who refused to meet with 120 prominent elders from Cerigabo in Hargeisa. SLP in Cerigabo dispersed the demonstrators and there were no reports of arrests.

05 May. Suspected armed SNA freelance men reportedly shot and killed a businessman at Beerta Katka neighbourhood near Seybiano in Hodan district. SNPF arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. However, there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. The reason for the attack is not known.
05 May. Somali soldier shoots and kills civilian in Kaxda (Dharkenley). Assailant escaped, motives unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 06 May. Eight Kenyan soldiers were killed and two others seriously injured after an improvised explosive device (IED) hit a military vehicle near the Somali town of Dhobley on Sunday. Al Shabaab claims 15 dead.
06 May. Al Shabaab assassinates a police officer in Wadajir during the morning hours.
06 May. A bomb placed under the vehicle of a Yemeni national detonates in Shibis district, killing the target. Al Shabaab blamed.

06 May. Al Shabaab attackers hurdled three hand grenades at the residence of Baraawe Deputy District Commissioner at Bashiir Goobe in Dayax village neighbourhood in Baraawe district. The attack was followed by a brief exchange of gunfire between the attackers and the guards of the Deputy District Commissioner after which the attackers withdrew. Three civilian bystanders were injured.

06 May. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clash near Qurunlow village (c. 32 km east of Baidoa) on the road between Baidoa and Burhakaba district. The armed clash occurred after SNA forces attacked al Shabaab fighters on the road. Three SNA soldiers were killed and two others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters could not be established at the time of reporting.

06 May. A man was shot and wounded by an armed civilian over a land dispute at Waaberi roundabout at the centre of Garowe town. Both men hailed from Reer Yoonis sub clan of Isse Mohamoud. The wounded person was taken to hospital for treatment. The culprit was arrested and investigations were reported to be ongoing.
On 7 May 2018, a police officer was shot and killed by an assailant hailing from Ali Saleeban sub-clan in the Armo area (Bossaso, Bari).
07 May. Fighting between Somali soldiers and al Shabaab in Daynuunay. Three al Shabaab dead, two soldiers wounded.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 07 May. US air forces conducted an airstrike targeting al Shabaab hideouts in Warad and Hararrow (JiilJiiley general area) grazing areas located west of Ceel Cali village. The security official said a number of al-Shabab fighters were killed in the air strikes and destroyed materials in the militants' camp which included technical vehicles and weapons.

07 May. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack at an SNA checkpoint in Captain Las vicinity (c. 12 km north west of Merka district). SNA responded and the al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

07 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed security personnel at One Shabelle University at Tabeelaha Sheikh Ibrahim village in Dayniile district. The incident occurred shortly after the victim exited from a shop to enter his vehicle. The perpetrators managed to escape with his vehicle after the shooting. Government forces arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 07 May. Islamic State ""Amaq News Agency"" claims responsibility for assassination of NISA officer. Video released.

08 May. Armed militiamen hailing from Habarjeclo took control of Bahdon village located east of Berbera town. Residents in the village did not react but the situation in the area was reported to be tense.

Movement of forces: 08 May. The government deployed hundreds of special forces on standby to protect Mogadishu from al Shabaab attacks during the holy month of Ramadan. The Prime Minister lauded the new security measure unveiled security chiefs ahead of Ramadan. The joint troops drawn from the police, Intelligence and custodial corps would patrol the city centres, establish CPs and cordon off areas where an alert was reported. The new security plan comes amid fears that al Shabaab could increase its attacks in Mogadishu during Ramadan.

08 May. Two groups of government soldiers, divided along clan lines namely Daud and Kabale of Abgaal sub clans, clashed over land dispute at Kawo-Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. At least one government soldier was killed and three others were injured. Tension was reported to be high and there was no mediation between the two groups.

08 May. Four mortar rounds, fired from an unknown direction(s), impacted on Stadium Mogadishu neighbourhood in Wardhigley district. At least five civilians were injured by a mortar which landed near Ali Kamin area. Perpetrators believed to be al Shabaab.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 09 May. Weapons and ammunition seized by a Uganda People's Defence Forces contingent of AMISOM in Bulo Mareer, in Lower Shabelle region.
09 May. Al Shabaab kills three police officers in an open air market in Yaaqshiid.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 09 May. Suspected US drone strike targets unidentified al Shabaab position near Aw Dheegle. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.
09 May. Al Shabaab fighters recapture Badho following withdrawal from local security forces.
09 May. Al Shabaab stoned a woman to death for multiple marriages in Lower Shabelle Region.
09 May. Green on green clash in Wadajir. Causalities not known.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.
09 May. A suspected al Shabaab suicide bomber kills between 4-14 and wounds several others in Wanla Weyne.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column16: Daily Nation (Kenya); AFP; Garowe Online; Radio Risala
column17: 10 May. Between 3-5 al Shabaab officials are killed in a US/Somali airstrike and raid in Bariire. The special forces are believe to have killed five civilian farmers in the process, though the government denies this.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 May. Al Shabaab elements attacked AMISOM and SNA troops positioned at Xero Labaad and police station neighbourhoods in Qoryole district. The joint forces managed to repel the attackers. Three al Shabaab attackers were killed and three civilian passers-by were injured in the clashes. Casualties from the Government and AMISOM were not reported.

10 May. The regional chair of the ruling political party, Kulmiye, for Sool region was killed by unknown armed men in Lasanod. The motive of the perpetrator was not clear. The regional authorities authorized an extensive security operation in Lasanod and its vicinity.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 10 May. Al Shabaab fighters detonated an IED against Jubaland forces near Qam-Qam village area. The soldiers were on foot patrol when the incident occurred. One soldier was killed and three others were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 10 May. Jubaland convoy struck by an al Shahaab roadside IED near Luuglaaw. Casualties reported, exact figures unknown (coded as 10)

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 10 May. Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at NISA soldiers (Alpha Group unit) who were chewing khat in a house near Saybiano neighbourhood in Hodan district. There was an exchange of gunfire thereafter. At least four NISA soldiers, including a senior officer, were killed and two others were injured. The assailants managed to escape after the incident. NISA soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

10 May. Two armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed an SNA soldier who was sitting in a cafeteria near Ex. control Afgoye in Dayniile district. The perpetrators stole the AK47 riffle of the victim and managed to escape. The district police arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

10 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a businessman at Bakara Market neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. SNPF arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
10 May. Al Shabaab capture Kahda in Mogadishu following an assault. Causalities not known.
10 May. An al Shabaab IED targets a government vehicle travelling between Afgoye and Wanlaweyn districts. ""Deaths and injuries"" reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 11 May. Al-Shabaab forces in the Sei Piano neighbourhood (Hodan) of Mogadishu killed a commander, who was a member of the US-trained Alpha Group. The commander and three other soldiers who were his bodyguards were shot dead - total numbers not known.
11 May. Al Shabaab launched 13 mortar shells against a Turkish military base in Mogadishu. An unknown number of causalities reported.

11 May. Two groups of armed youngsters using machetes and sticks clashed at Qasabka neighbourhood in Burao. Three youths were seriously injured from both sides and were taken to Burao Hospital. There were no reports of arrests. The reason for the clash is not known.
11 May. SNAF received a tip over three IEDs being emplaced near FOB Albacow Junction to Afgooye-Mogadishu road. Two IEDs detonate when SNAF patrol reach the area. No casualties.

11 May. Al Shabaab attack and overtake Qoryooley District from government forces. Government military forces suffered an unknown number of causalities. Al Shabaab control of the area was ""brief."" It is not known if government forces regained control. Military forces later denied al Shabaab was in control of the area.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
column17: 12 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
column17: 12 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.
12 May. An al Shabaab blast targets a market in Bulo Mareer, four civilians dead, five injured.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 12 May. SNA and AMISOM ENDF contingent forces peacefully took control of Moqukori district (c. 120 km south east of Beletweyne town). Al Shabaab fighters had withdrawn from the district and disappeared towards the nearby bushes.
12 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.
12 May. A civilian man was beheaded by al Shabaab fighters near Xalfooley village (c. 39 km north east of Jalalaqsi district) and seized his livestock.
12 May. Al Shabaab assassinates a civilian in Dharkenley.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
column17: 13 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
column17: 13 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 May. Al Shabaab media reports that a US airstrike (likely targeting al Shabaab) struck civilians in Afgooye district, causing an unknown number of fatalities and injuries.
13 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 May. An RCIED, buried alongside the road linking Jowhar and Balcad and targeting an AMISOM/SNA convoy, exploded at Gololey village neighbourhood (c. 16 km north east of Balcad district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire thereafter. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack. Causalities not known.

13 May. Armed SNA uniformed men using AK47s shot and killed a civilian driver of a minivan at Sharey Village vicinity in Wanlaweyne district. The incident occurred after SNA demanded for extortion money which the driver refused. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.

13 May. Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a civilian Nissan pick-up from Dhobley at Hawuna area (c. 25 km east of Dhobley town). The driver of the vehicle was killed and the passenger was injured. The injured victim was brought to Dhobley Hospital for treatment. The suspected al Shabaab fighters took the vehicle and drove to an unknown location.

13 May. At least three hand grenades were hurled at an SNA base located in Badbaado IDP camp in Dharkenley district. Security forces responded to the location and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. Four people, including two SNA soldiers, were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 13 May. A hand grenade was hurled at NISA checkpoint near Aimiska neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. Thereafter, there was an exchange of gunfire between NISA and the perpetrators after which the perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not known.
14 May. A soldier who hailed from Marehan clan was shot and killed by another soldier hailing from Sa'ad clan in Galinsoor. The perpetrator escaped from the area.

14 May. There were violent demonstrations reported in Burao where demonstrators protested to the Somaliland government bias towards one of the clans fighting in Elafweyn. The demonstrators burnt tires in Burao and damaged an unspecified number of shops. Somaliland security forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the protesters. A police officers and a civilian sustained serious injuries. There were reports of arrests. The protests lasted over two days, 14-15 May.

14 May. There was a violent demonstration reported in Cerigabo against the Somaliland government. The demonstrators looted shops belonging to Habajeclo Isaq sub-clan members. One person was killed and two others were injured by police. The demonstration was triggered by an attempt to arrest a commander of the Somaliland military who defected SLA in support of his clan (Habar-yonis sub-clan). Additional reports revealed that the defected commander and his militia took a military truck carrying salaries for military personnel into Sanag region.
14 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.
14 May. A man was shot and killed at Bulsho Junction in Waaberi Village, near Garrowe. The culprit was arrested by police. Investigations were reported to be ongoing.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14 May. Puntland and Somaliland surveillance units briefly clashed at a place near Tuk-raq. There were no reports of casualties but tension was reported to be high.

14 May. ISIS elements shot and killed a young male at Abdalla Shideye vicinity of Bakaro Market in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators made a recorded of the dead body after which they escaped from the scene. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Pro-ISIS group claimed responsibility for the attack.

14 May. A rickshaw driver was shot and killed by unknown armed men at Zobe junction road in Hodan district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The motive of the incident was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

15 May. Armed clan militias (not identified), supported by SNA, clashed in an area at Xalfooley and Tardo (c. 80 km east of Jalalaqsi). There was an exchange of gunfire. Initial reports indicated that two militiamen were injured at the armed conflict incident located at Xalfooley.

15 May. Armed clan militias (not identified), supported by SNA, clashed in an area at Xalfooley and Tardo (c. 80 km east of Jalalaqsi). There was an exchange of gunfire. Initial reports indicated that two militiamen were injured at the armed conflict incident located at Xalfooley.

15 May. Around 200 al Shabaab members established a base at the mountains near Jidali (c. 40 km east of Cerigabo and c. 22 km north of Jidali). It was further reported that al Shabaab forcefully stole animals of the locals.

15 May. Southwest state forces raided the residence of a mid-level al Shabaab member in Misir village (c. 10 km south east of Tiyeeglow town). There was an exchange of gunfire between the man and the armed forces. The son of the mid-level al Shabaab member was killed and another was injured.

15 May. A former al Shabaab defector who later joined the security forces in BeletHawa district shot and killed a security officer. At the time of the incident, the deceased was believed to be on his way to visit his family at Kaboleey neighbourhood. The perpetrator escaped with the AK47 belonging to the deceased man fled to nearby villages in Belethawa district. Police were reported to be investigating the incident.
15 May. Al Shabaab fighters fire one, possibly more, mortar rounds towards FOB Baraawe. One round landed inside the perimeter of the base. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 15 May. Four people were shot and wounded by an alleged policeman at an IDP camp located east of Bossaso. The motive was not clear and the perpetrator escaped. Police were reported to be investigating.
15 May. SNPF conduct security sweep in Kaxda (Dharkenly). Gunmen, likely al Shabaab fighters, engage the SNPF detail. No casualties reported, SNPF forced to abandon the operation.
15 May. Somali soldier kills civilian driver of a tanker on Zobe Junction, Hodan.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column16: Undisclosed Source; Puntland Post; Radio Risala
column17: 15 May. Early morning hours, reports were received on fighting that broke out at Tuk-Raq (Sool-Sanag disputed region between Somaliland/Puntland) between Somaliland Army (SLA) and Puntland Army (PLA), using all types weapons, including heavy artillery and tanks, and infantry units supported by technicals. Reportedly, the PLA initiated the attack in order to take the advantage, as SLA was celebrating the Independence Day. Heavy casualties from both sides were reported and the fighting continued during the day. The Puntland Post reports 48 dead, mainly Somaliland soldiers. Small clashes were also reported the previous day. Puntland forces claim capture of the area.

15 May. There were violent demonstrations reported in Burao where demonstrators protested to the Somaliland government bias towards one of the clans fighting in Elafweyn. The demonstrators burnt tires in Burao and damaged an unspecified number of shops. Somaliland security forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the protesters. A police officers and a civilian sustained serious injuries. There were reports of arrests. The protests lasted over two days, 14-15 May.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 15 May. Hundreds of locals conducted a violent demonstration in protest to the demolition of illegal structures in Golcise area of Bossaso by municipal authorities. The protestors blocked a road and burnt tyres. Police dispersed the crowd. There were no reports of immediate casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 16 May. Unknown warplane (either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against a suspected al Shabaab location at Abdulle-alim grazing area (c. 20 km south east of Dhobley town). Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 16 May. Fighting continued between Somaliland and Puntland forces in Tuko Raq.

Defusal: 16 May. Two vehicles, suspected to be VBIEDs, were parked alongside the road near Madina Hospital in Wadajir district neighbourhood. NISA and SNPF joint forces cordoned off the area and a police EOD team attended to the scene and conducted an operation. The operation was ongoing at the time of reporting.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 16 May. At least 11 IEDs concealed in a paper bag exploded at multiple locations in Hodan, Howlwadag, Wardhigley and Waberi Districts. Sporadic retaliatory gunfire was reported in the districts. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 16 May. At least 11 IEDs concealed in a paper bag exploded at multiple locations in Hodan, Howlwadag, Wardhigley and Waberi Districts. Sporadic retaliatory gunfire was reported in the districts. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 16 May. At least 11 IEDs concealed in a paper bag exploded at multiple locations in Hodan, Howlwadag, Wardhigley and Waberi Districts. Sporadic retaliatory gunfire was reported in the districts. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

16 May. Suspected al Shabaab elements hurled two hand grenades at the residence of Banadir Region Stabilisation Forces Commander located at Howlwadag district commissioner office near Dabka junction road in Howlwadag district. Government forces at the location reacted with retaliatory gunfire toward the general direction of the attack. At least four people were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

16 May. A hand grenade was hurled at Marwaz Mosque near Afar-Irdood Police Station checkpoint neighbourhood in Hamarweyne district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of casualties and the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
16 May. Al Shabaab assassinated a government employee in Yaqshiid.
17 May. Al Shabaab explosions took place in Heliwa and Hawl Wadaag Districts killing 10 soldiers total.
17 May. Al Shabaab raided a house in Hodan district, killing a Somali intelligence official and two other soldiers.

17 May. Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards Southwest forces in Onkod, possibly Southwest Special Police Force. One Southwest soldier and three civilians injured. Assailant escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: 17 May. A vehicle belonging to PMPF was carjacked by six armed perpetrators in Bossaso. The vehicle was driving towards Qardho. There was an exchange of gunfire between police and the perpetrators at Alhamdulilah CP. Two perpetrators and two police officers were wounded. Police arrested the perpetrators and seized the vehicle. The vehicle was taken to Qardho Police Station for further investigation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 17 May. Unidentified assailants hijack a Puntland police vehicle. Firefight ensued. Two assailants and two Puntland Police injured. Puntland forces arrested all perpetrators.
17 May. Al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF checkpoint in Yaashiid. One SNAF injured. Assailant escaped.
17 May. Al Shabaab fighters conduct a drive-by shooting against Damanyo Army camp, opposite UAE training camp. One SNAF soldier injured. Assailants escaped.
17 May. Al Shabaab explosions took place in Heliwa and Hawl Wadaag Districts killing 10 soldiers total.
17 May. A man throws a hard grenade into a Baidoa restaurant after he was denied a Ramadan meal card. Four injures.

18 May. Al Shabaab assassinated two soldiers at two different locations in the night-time hours. The first attack occurred in Shibis Districts, while the second occurred at a location near Bar-Ubah junction.
18 May. Two groups of SNAF soldiers clash over unspecified motives in Balcad. Two SNAF and three civilians injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 18 May. Al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards a NISA checkpoint near Salama Hotel. One NISA soldier injured. Assailant escaped.
18 May. Al Shabaab gunmen conduct a drive-by shooting against SNAF checkpoint at Bar Ubaax Junction. One SNAF killed, three injured, including a civilian bystander. Assailants escaped.
18 May. An al Shabaab explosive detonates in Daynile killing two soldiers.
18 May. An al Shabaab explosive detonates in Yaaqshiid, killing four police and wounding two others.

18 May. Al Shabaab assassinated two soldiers at two different locations in the nighttime hours. The first attack occurred in Shibis Districts, while the second occurred at an unknown location near Bar-Ubah junction.
19 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate University Graduate and current construction engineer Mohamed Addow. Assailants escaped, motives and exact incident location unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 19 May. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange ""artillery fire"" near Qod Gaboode, near Las Anod. No casualties reported.
19 May. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF officer Mohamed Adow in Wabeeri. Assailants escaped.
19 May. Al Shabaab assassinates Colonel Ali Raaghe by planting a UVIED under his vehicle. Group claims responsibility.
20 May. Al Shabaab gunmen killed a staff member of Prime Minister Hassan Ali Kheyre's office in Taleh neighbourhood, Hodan.
20 May. Military forces clash with al Shabaab and overtake Mubah, El Ali Ahmed, Yasoman villages in Hiiran. Al Shabaab suffered 'heavy causalities.'
20 May. Military forces clash with al Shabaab and overtake Mubah, El Ali Ahmed, Yasoman villages in Hiiran. Al Shabaab suffered 'heavy causalities.'
20 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF base near Ceelasha Biyaha. Small arms fire supported by mortar rounds. Resulting casualty figures unknown.
20 May. SNPF officer kills a civilian in Jowhar. Motives unknown. Assailant later placed in custody.
20 May. An al Shabaab fighter was killed and another injured after an IED they had planted exploded prematurely near Galgala Village.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 May. Beheaded body of Somali/Kenyan allegedly working for AMISOM discovered in Daynile. Victim identified as ""Hassan"". Al Shabaab believed responsible.

21 May. Clan militias of unknown origin clashed at Waradheere rural grazing area (c. 25 km south of Matabaan district). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about half an hour. Three armed militias were killed and two others were seriously injured. The motive of the incident was related to disputes over gazing land. The security situation was reported to be tense. Both clans were reported to be mobilizing for a possible armed confrontation. Traditional leaders and politicians from both clans attempted to deescalate hostilities between the two clans.
21 May. Al Shabaab fighters fire three mortar rounds towards FOB Arbacow. Rounds land inside the base. No casualties reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Change to armed group: 21 May. Khatumo splinter group pledged support to Puntland and announced that they would fight to liberate Tuka-raq from Somaliland. This came amid rising tensions in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 21 May. Jubaland soldier kills his commander near Via Afmadow, following refusal of following orders. Soldier had previously left his unit in Gaduud without authorisation.

21 May. An RCIED, buried alongside the road targeting a vehicle belonging to SNA headed to Haanta Dheer, exploded at Ex. Control Afgoye. After the explosion, there was an exchange of gunfire between SNA and the unidentified perpetrators. The vehicle belonging to SNA was damaged. Three civilian bystanders were killed and two soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape.

21 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed an SNA soldier at the District branch one vicinity in Dharkenley district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape the scene.

21 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a custodial corps soldier travelling to his home at Branch four village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. Government soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

21 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a public land broker at the Dabaqeynka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The victim was from the mosque when two armed men attacked him. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Around 22 May 2018, Puntland government restricted fuel-tankers and public movements from travelling to Somaliland due to the tension in Tuko raq village (Laas Caanood, Sool). The following day, it was reported to be mobilizing clan militias in Badhan, Dhahar and Hiingalool (Sanaag) to widen the frontline at the border in preparation of an armed encounter between Somaliland and Puntland.
22 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack FOB Arbacow. RPGs and possibly mortars used during the attack. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 22 May. A Toyota Noah VBIED, targeting an SNA Danab (special forces) unit convoy from Bali-dogle Airport headed to Mogadishu, exploded at ITOP Factory in Afgoye. At least nine people consisting of two government soldiers and seven civilian bystanders were injured. The suicide bomber who drove the VBIED was killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
22 May. Somaliland police shot and killed an Ethiopian migrant who attempted to escape from Wajale Immigration.

22 May. An Egyptian national working with fisheries for the past three months was abducted by unknown armed perpetrators in the proximity of Botaan hotel in Bossaso. The motive was unknown. Police were reported to be investigating.

22 May. Suspected pro-ISIS elements, shot and killed a traffic police officer at Bakara junction road neighbourhood in Hodan district. A civilian bystander was injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Pro-ISIS claimed responsibility of the attack. Pro-ISIS published photos of the incident to prove their claim.
22 May. Unidentified armed perpetrators assassinate a police officer in Bakaara Market.
22 May. An al Shabaab roadside blast kills two civilians between Ex-Control Afgoye and Hanta Dher neighbourhoods in Daynile.
22 May. Al Shabaab car bomb detonates in Afgooye killing 12 Somali soldiers.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 23 May. US AFRICOM announces drone strike targeted group of al Shabaab fighters 20km north-west of Mogadishu. 10 militants killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 23 May. Unknown warplanes (likely either US or Kenya) conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab location at Shimbirole -Gudududow grazing areas (c. 45 km south east of Dhobley town). Casualties from the attack could not be established at the time of reporting.

23 May. An SNA soldier shot and killed a fellow soldier near Xawaal Arundi village (c. 16 km north west of Buurhakaba district). The victim was driving one of the vehicles in a convoy transporting military rations to Buurhakaba district. The perpetrator was part of reconnaissance mission patrolling the road between Buurhakaba and Daynuuney village. The motive behind the incident was not clear. The victim was brought to Baidoa.

23 May. Habar Jeclo and Habar Yunis sub-clans clashed at Yufle located north east of El-Afwein (c. 30 km west of Erigavo). Three casualties were reported. Inter-clan conflict between the two rivalling sub-clans increased in the region. The Somaliland government mobilized a team of elders and prominent politicians to mediate the clan conflict in Elafweyn.
23 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed an unidentified male at Elasha Biyaha settlement in Afgoye district. Pro-ISIS group claimed responsibility of the assassination.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23 May. AMISOM fired artillery rounds towards residential areas in Elasha settlement village (c. 20 km west of Mogadishu) in Afgoye district after their defensive base was hit by a mortar round. Residents at the village confirmed that the artillery rounds impacted the village from the AMISOM base near Hormuud building in Elasha settlement. There was no response fire from al Shabaab militants or reports of casualties.
23 May. Al Shabaab fighters fired at least five mortar rounds towards FOB Arbacow. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 23 May. Puntland forces fire several mortar rounds towards Somaliland base near Qod Gaboobe. Rounds land outside of the base. No casualties reported.

23 May. A member of the Puntland parliament and his guard were shot and killed by unidentified armed men in front of Classic Hotel in Galkayo. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the assassination. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Police arrived at the scene but there was no report of arrests.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 23 May. NISA agents and bodyguards of a Member of Parliament clashed at Fiat NISA checkpoint near KM 0. NISA agents shot at his vehicle after he passed through Fiat security checkpoint without stopping and his guards responded with gunfire. The Member of Parliament escaped unhurt. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 23 May. Two suspected armed al Shabaab elements were shot and killed by NISA soldiers at Bakara market area. The NISA soldiers confiscated two pistols from the deceased and the bodies were taken for further investigation. Al Shabaab denied that the militias were their fellow fighters, however this was not confirmed.

23 May. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier at Hawo-Tako village vicinity in Wadajir district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation after the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators stole a firearm belonging to the soldier and escaped.
23 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a civilian. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
23 May. Al Shabaab attacks military camps at Bulo Mareer and K50. The casualties resulting from the two attacks are not yet known.
23 May. Al Shabaab attacks military camps at Bulo Mareer and K50. The casualties resulting from the two attacks are not yet known.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 May. Anti-al Shabaab forces (likely US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike in Afgoye district killing 10 al Shabaab militants.

Property destruction: 24 May. Al Shabaab fighters burnt commodities, destroyed donkey carts and killed seven donkeys at Bulo Addoy village (c. 23 km south of Qansax-Dheere district). Al Shabaab banned delivery of commercial and other goods to government and AMISOM controlled towns.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 24 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a KDF patrol near Afmadow. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 24 May. Somaliland and Puntland security forces clashed at Tukaraq and surrounding areas. There were reports of casualties, numbers not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Defusal: 24 May. JSF and AMISOM KDF, while on security patrol, discovered an RCIED planted on the road at Shaftuug border line area (c. 06 km south of Dhobley town). AMISOM KDF Contingent EOD team cordoned off the area to successfully dismantled the RCIED.

24 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a municipal tax collector at El- Dhere market in Dharkenley District. The assailant managed to escape. Police officers responded and conducted search operations but there were no reports of arrest.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Defection: 25 May. About 118 armed men with a battle wagons and a truck defected from Puntland army to Somaliland due to a disagreement amongst them. The defected soldiers hailed from Dhulbhante Naleye Ahmed sub clan.

25 May. Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based at Biyo Degeenka neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated using an RPG followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

26 May. Residents of Baki district demonstrated at the office of the Mayor appealing to the Somaliland government to support the victims of Cyclone Sagar which destroyed irrigated farms and livestock. The Mayor of Baki addressed the protestors stating that he would convey their demands to the Somaliland government.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 26 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a SNAF patrol near Cusman Qule. Assailants retreat after a 20 minute firefight, and the intervention of UPDF forces, who shell the area.

26 May. An INGO staff member sustained minor injuries after an armed group shot at their rented vehicle at Labad village (c. 30 Km north of Hobyo district). The motive of the incident was related to registration of beneficiaries. The perpetrators escaped from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 26 May. Puntland and Somaliland forces clash in Tuko Raq.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 26 May. Jubbaland soldiers, while on security patrol, clashed with fellow soldiers over suspicions of al Shabaab presence at via-Afmadow neighbourhood in Kismayo town. Four soldiers were injured.

26 May. Two groups of government soldiers clashed at Godka Jilacow and Dabka junction road neighbourhoods in Boondhere and Howlwadag Districts. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. One SNA soldier was injured. Further reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash was related to both groups suspecting each other. An SNA soldier intervened and successfully mediated a cease fire.

26 May. Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a young male at the Medicine section of Bakara Market in Heliwa district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.
26 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate businessman Mohamed Ali Hariir in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped.

Change to armed group: 26 May. On 26 May, Somalia's Radio Kulmiye reported that a faction of al-Shabab has elected a new leader, Sheikh Hussein Ali Fidow, which has split the group into two factions. There have been rumours that the current leader, Ahmed Omar aka Abu Ubeidah, has been ill for seven months.
27 May. Rival clans (not identified) clash east of Mataban over unspecified motives. Media reports suggest high tensions between Galgaduud, Hiiraaan and Middle Shabelle.

27 May. Pastoralists and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Elbaraf village vicinity in Mahaday district. The clashes occurred after al Shabaab militants imposed taxation to residences. Casualties from the clash could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

27 May. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Buufow Bacaad (c. 07 km north west of Merka district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab managed to take control of the town. SNA soldiers vacated the town. After one hour, SNA troops with re-enforcement recaptured the town from al Shabaab militants without resistance. At least two SNA soldiers were killed and three others, including two civilian bystanders, were wounded.

27 May. Police forces raided the residence of the al Shabaab deputy commissioner for Miisra village (c. 30 km north east of Diinsoor district). The targeted al Shabaab member was not at the house during the attack. His son was killed and the daughter was injured in the raid. The security forces reportedly returned to their base in Dinsoor.

27 May. An SNA soldier shot and killed an owner of a restaurant over a payment dispute in Diinsoor district (c. 90 km south west of Baidoa). The victim demanded for payment from the soldier which caused a brief altercation. Security forces arrived at the location of the incident and managed to arrest the perpetrator.
27 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint at Ex-Control Balcad landmark in Heliwa. Two civilian bystanders injured, assailants repelled.

27 May. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle owned by a civilian man detonated near 21 October School in Waberi district. The target survived the attack because he was not in the vehicle at the time of explosion. A child was injured. Government soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests. There was no motive established for the incident.

27 May. Suspected al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a famous clan elder at Dabaqeynka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The man was one of the electoral delegates who participated in elections in Southwest state in 2017.
28 May. An RCIED, suspected to be planted by alleged pro-ISIS, exploded killing cattle (c. 05 km west of Qandala). There were no reports of immediate arrests.

28 May. Hundreds of people hailing from Jareerweyne clan staged a peaceful demonstration on the main road in front of Hotel Daresalam located east of Beletweyne. FGS Members of Parliament resided at the hotel. The motive behind the demonstration was in relation to two men, hailing from Jareerweyne clan, who were injured by the SNA in the previous week. The incident was not justified by the local administration. The local administration spoke to the demonstrators stating that their complaints would be considered.
Movement of forces: 28 May. Islamic State fighters move into Canjeele. No reported violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 May. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy transporting supplies from Golweyne to Shalambood, exploded at Bullo Mareer town neighbourhood in Merka district. One supply lorry was damaged. There was an exchange of gunfire between AMISOM and al Shabaab which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

28 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA soldiers who were driving a Noah vehicle on the main road between Baidoa and Buurhabaka district near Ugaari village (c. 10 km north west of Buurhakaba district). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which SNA soldiers escaped from the scene and returned to Buurhakaba. An SNA soldier was killed in the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be established at the time of reporting.

28 May. Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against the SNA base located c. 03 km south of Garbaharrey town. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. There were no reports of casualties from SNA. It was suspected that there could have been casualties from al Shabaab though they were taken when they retreated.

28 May. There was a violent demonstration conducted in Lasanod in protest of the Somaliland administration. One person was killed and more than 50 others including three journalists were arrested. SLP dispersed the protestors. Movement of vehicles was restricted and most of the businesses in Lasanod were closed.

28 May. A UVIED, attached to a private vehicle owned by a civilian man, detonated near Siinaay junction road vicinity in Boondhere district. The targeted person survived the attack because he was not in vehicle at the time of the explosion. One civilian bystander was killed. Government soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The motive behind the attack was not established.

28 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a traffic police officer at Manapolyo junction road neighbourhood in Shibis district. The police officer was directing traffic when the two armed men shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

28 May. Al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a staff member, working at the parliament, and injured another at Kuwait Palace Hotel vicinity in Waberi district. The man reportedly worked in parliament as head of finance section. The victim was in his vehicle when two assailants approached him and shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

29 May. A peaceful demonstration was conducted at Dhahar town against the Somaliland government. The protestors waved the flag of Puntland and chanted anti-Somaliland slogans. The demonstration concluded peacefully.

29 May. Hundreds of residents of Buhoodle staged a demonstration in Buhodle town in protest of Somaliland presence in Sool, Sanag and Cayn regions. The protestors marched onto the streets chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and later gathered at Habado football grounds. The demonstration ended peacefully.

29 May. A grenade was hurled at an SNA checkpoint located at the entrance of Wanlaweyne district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. One SNA soldier was killed and three others were injured. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

29 May. An al Shabaab defector shot and killed an SWSPF soldier and defected back to al Shabaab at Miidow village (c. 22 km north west of Baidoa). The perpetrator took the rifle of another SWSPF soldier as well. The circumstances surrounding the incident was not clear. The perpetrator arrived in an al Shabaab controlled area in possession of the two rifles.
29 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack forward operation base Embresso, outside of Baraawe. Assailants repelled.

29 May. Two men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, assassinated a prominent clan elder at his house in Far Laysaan village (c. 30 km west of Garbaharrey town). The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive behind the assassination was not clear.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 29 May. Pro-ISIS and police clashed at Canjeel village (c. 70 km south west of Qandala). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about two hours after which pro-ISIS retreated to the mountain north of Canjeel. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 29 May. Al-Shabaab carried out a grenade attack on an NISA checkpoint. 2 injured.

29 May. A grenade was hurled at Banadir Region Stabilization Forces defensive base near Carwo Idko junction road neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire at suspected directions of the attack. One SNA soldier was injured and the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 29 May. NISA soldiers condoned off a private residence that was suspected to be used by four suspected al Shabaab militants as a hideout in Waaberi. NISA apprehended two armed men in possession of pistols at Ansaloti village in Waberi district. The two suspected al Shabaab elements were taken into custody by NISA for further interrogation. NISA troops conducted a security search operation where one suspected al Shabaab militant was killed and another was injured.

29 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a Koran school teacher at his home at Kawo-Godey vicinity in Dharkenley district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive of the incident was not clear.
29 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a civilian. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 29 May 2018: Pro-ISIL elements and Puntland state police clashed in Anjeel village near Qandala, Bari region. No reported fatalities.
29 May. Al Shabaab executes two Kenyans in Fino, Lower Shabelle after they were accused of spying.
29 May. Islamic State claims responsibility for an IED explosion in the 'Bar Oba' section of the city. Six Somali intelligence personnel died in the explosion.

30 May. A demonstration of an estimated 100 individuals was conducted at the famous square known as 'Barxadda' in the centre of Garowe city. The purpose was to show support to the Puntland army at the frontline in the conflict against Somaliland.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 30 May. Al Shabaab attack a Uganda base in Baraawe. Assailants repelled.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 30 May. Al Shabaab attack a Uganda military base in Buulo Mareer. Assailants repelled.

30 May. Kenyan air forces conducted an airstrike against a suspected al Shabaab location at Shimbiray grazing area (c. 35 km south east of Dhobley town - approx coordinates used). Casualties from the attack could not be established at the reporting period.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 30 May. UPDF forces shell suspected al Shabaab positions in Labayaq from Golweyn. Two technicals and one VBIED allegedly destroyed.
30 May. An al Shabaab RCIED detonates at SNAF Bar Ismail checkpoint, Afgooye.
30 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a school teacher in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Defection: 31 May. A mid-level al Shabaab commander defected to SNA forces in Xudur town. He arrived in Xudur riding a motorcycle. The defector was received by the local administration.
31 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint in Afgooye. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 31 May. Al Shabaab fighters conduct a hit-and-run attack against a KDF military base in Abdalla Birole. Three mortar rounds fired.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 31 May. SNAF and NISA forces clash near KPP junction in Hodan District. Motives and resulting casualty figures unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 31 May. US forces launched an air stake against an al Shabaab position 48km southwest of Mogadishu at Gendershe. 11 - 12 deaths reported.

31 May. A prominent youth activist was assassinated by two al Shabaab militants while walking home from work near Abdalle and Awareere Mosque neighbourhood in Wardhigley. The perpetrators stole the pistol of the victim and managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

01 June. Banadir region stabilization forces conducted security search operation in Hoosh village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district where they clashed with other security forces. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two SNA soldiers were killed after they refusing to lay down their weapons. Three people, including one civilian bystander, were injured. Tension was reported to be high in the area.
01 June. Skirmish erupts between two groups of SNAF forces near Ex-Control Afgooye. Two killed, seven injured. Motives unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 01 June. NISA and SNAF forces clash at Jaale Siyaad neighbourhood. Motives related to mutual suspicion of being al Shabaab militants. Two civilian bystanders killed, three perpetrators injured.
01 June. Unidentified militants assassinate a civilian in Yaaqshiid. Motive not known.
01 June. A soldier shot and killed civilian driver in Karaan, motives not known.
01 June. Unidentified assassinate a government administrator in Hodan. Motive not known.
01 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a cleric as he exited a mosque in Baardheere.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 01 June. Al Shabaab attacks a government forces base in Moqokori, later claiming 60 SNG dead. Al Shabaab overtook the area. Al Shabaab updated their figure the following week, claiming 72 confirmed deaths. Ethiopian forces were also involved.

01 June. Two women groups hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Baho and Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis sub clan clashed at Fadhigaab village. A military soldier who attempted to intervene was shot and injured by a man hailing from Habar Yonis sub clan. SNA later arrested the perpetrator.
01 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF checkpoint near Afgooye. No casualties reported.

01 June. A man hailing from Habar Yonis sub clan shot and killed his fellow clansman at Cerigabo Stadium while attempting to shoot a man hailing from Dhulbahante clan. The victim attempted to separate the two men who were quarrelling when the incident occurred. SLP in Cerigabo arrested the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: 01 June. Al Shabaab fighters attacked a PMPF base located at Balikhadar of Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso). Four PMPF soldiers were killed and more than 10 soldiers were wounded. Al Shabaab took control of the base for about two hours and destroyed six PMPF vehicles. PSF intervened and recaptured the base. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed and five others were wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 01 June. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against Jubbaland forces positioned at Abdi-Birole village (c. 45 km west of Kismayo town). Al Shabaab fighters fired one RPG-7. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 01 June. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against Jubbland force base at Bulo-gudud village (c. 30 km north of Kismayo town). Al Shabaab fired three mortar rounds. There was a brief exchange of small arms gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 02 June. US air forces carry out a strike on an al Shabaab position outside of Bosasso. 27 reported dead, none of whom were civilians.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 02 June. Puntland forces attacked an al Shabaab position in Maraja, killing 40. The operation was in response to an al Shabaab attack on Ballo Khadar the previous day.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 June. Al Shabaab forces launched an attack on an AMISOM base in Qoryooley during the nighttime hours. Causalities not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's ""Ramadan campaign.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 02 June. Al Shabaab attacked a AMISOM-Uganda base in Amabareson village outside the port town of Barawe. Casualties not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's ""Ramadan campaign.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 June. Al Shabaab attacked and overran an AMISOM base in Shalaambood. Casualties not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's ""Ramadan campaign.""
02 June. Government forces regain control of Moqokori after al Shabab vacates the area.
02 June. Two gunmen exchange gunfire in southern Galkaacyo. One killed one injured. Motives behind the incident unknown. Gunmen hailed from Sacad and Jalah sub-clans of Habargidir.
02 June. Ali Saleban gunmen assassinate a Warsangeli clansman in Xammure. Motives unknown. Assailants escaped.

02 June. An RCIED, buried along the road and targeting a Bancroft convoy moving from Baledogle Airport to Mogadishu, exploded at Waraboole village. The lead vehicle in the convoy was damaged. Three soldiers were injured and taken to a nearby hospital for treatment. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 02 June. An al Shabaab IED detonates near Djiboutian convoy coming back from Buulo Burto airstrip. One vehicle hit, no casualties reported. A second IED detonated in the area, but caused no damage.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 02 June. An al Shabaab IED targets UPDF convoy between KM50 and KM67. Convoy had departed FOB Lanta Buur and was headed to Marian Gubaay. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 02 June. Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against Jubaland forces positioned at Kulbiyow village (c. 178 km south west of Kismayo town). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 02 June. SNA and NISA forces clashed at Jaale Siyaad college neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two civilian bystanders, consisting of a rickshaw driver and a female student, were killed while three others, including a soldier, were injured. Additional reports stated that the primary motive of the clash was related to suspicion of the two security forces.

02 June. Suspected al Shabaab militants attacked SNA soldiers while on security patrol near Baidoa Bus Station at Bakara market neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two SNA soldiers and a civilian bystander were killed and two other civilians were injured. Casualties from suspected al Shabaab militants could not be ascertained. The perpetrators managed to escape.

02 June. Unknown armed attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed two male youths at Suuq-bacaad vicinity in Yaqshid district. The victims were reported to be in their vehicle when they were attacked. Government soldiers conducted security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 02 June. A driver of a public minibus was shot and killed by a NISA soldier at Jamuuriya village neighbourhood in Kaaran district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The motive of the incident was not ascertained and the perpetrators managed to escape.
02 June. Unidentified pistol armed gunmen killed 2 civilian businessmen in the Bakaara market. Both assassins escaped from the location.

02 June. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a female civilian while on her way home at Sigaale village neighbourhood in Hodan district. Unconfirmed reports indicated that the victim was a government staff member. Another two civilian men were killed by unidentified gunmen on the same day at Bakara Junction road vicinity also in Hodan district. The motive of the assassination was not clear. In both cases, the perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Weapons seizure: 03 June. An anti-al Shabaab drone (likely US) crashed at Mubarak village. Al Shabaab militants were deployed to the site and took possession of the debris from the aircraft. The cause of accident was unknown.
03 June. Al Shabaab assassinated two Somali soldiers in Bakaara Market.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 03 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF base located near a KDF base in Kolbiyow. Assailants repelled. One injured militant reportedly arrested.
03 June. Al Shabaab fighters ambush civilian convoy in Xudur. Possibly 11 trucks burnt, 2 civilians killed.

03 June. A man who hailed from Warsangeli sub clan was shot and killed by armed assailants hailing from Ali Saleeban sub clan at Xamure area (c. 78 km south west of Qandala). The motive of the incident was not clear. The assailants managed to escape.
03 June. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of civilians between Qurac Joome and Xudur while travelling to Belet Weyne. Six dead and 11 trucks destroyed.
03 June. An al Shabaab IED targets Bancroft vehicle accompanying SNAF forces at KM50. One vehicle damaged.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 03 June. PSF launched a military operation against al Shabaab hideouts at Maraje valley (c. 41 km south west of Bossaso) where they clashed with al Shabaab. 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed. The two actors clashed in the area the previous day.

03 June. Residents of Ceelbuh village, mainly youth and women, staged a demonstration in protest of Somaliland presence in Sanag and Sool regions and in support of the Puntland government. The protestors marched on the streets of the village chanting anti-Somaliland slogans.
03 June. Green on green violence reported in Dharkenley. One soldier killed, three injured.
03 June. Two suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed an unknown youth at the Livestock market in Heliwa district. The perpetrators escaped.
03 June. Unidentified gunmen killed a Heliwa District Commission employee.
04 June. Al-Shabab fighters attacked a police post between Kahda and Dharkenley districts at in Turka Ali Janale village in Mogadishu. The attackers overtook the post. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 04 June. Jubaland forces engage al Shabaab in Kulbiyow. Jubaland forces claim six al Shabaab dead.
04 June. Al Shabaab attacks Bulo Burde, capturing and later beheading two Somali soldiers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 04 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack UPDF FOB in Qoryoley. Four mortar rounds land outside of the base. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.
04 June. An al Shabaab IED detonates in Qoryooley. Five children injured.

04 June. Banadir Stabilization Forces, while conducting a security search operation, clashed with other SNA soldiers at Waaxda Sadexaad (Branch Three) village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. There was an exchange of gunfire. At least two people - a civilian female bystander and a soldier, were killed and three others were injured.

04 June. Armed government soldiers using AK47s shot and killed a driver of a rickshaw at Via Liberia road vicinity in Waberi district over extortion of money. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests made. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 05 June. Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM bases in Baraawe and Qoryooley on 05/06. Causality figures remain unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 05 June. Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM bases in Baraawe and Qoryooley on 05/06. Causality figures remain unknown.

05 June. An electoral delegate involved in the election of members of the Somali parliament was killed in Mogadishu's Wadajir district. Perpetrators not known, though al Shabaab has conducted similar assassinations in the area.

05 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of Ceel Waaq town. Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed (possibly executed following takeover) two men, believed to be clan militias who fought alongside local forces. Al Shabaab burnt down the residence of the district commissioner and summoned residents at the local mosque. The local forces left from the town to Ceel-Waaq in Kenya for safety. Three hours later, al Shabaab withdrew from the town. Al Shabaab fighters amassed again around the town three days later with the believed aim of overtaking the village for the second time in a week.
05 June. Biyomaal and Abdalla Arooni militias clash near Muuri settlement. Three people were killed following a one hour long firefight. The motives behind the eruption of violence are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: Movement of forces: 05 June. Puntland deployed a considerable number of troops from Buhodle town to Tuka-raq frontline.
05 June. Al Shabaab carried out an attack on a government military base in Baardheere during the early morning hours. Nine al Shabaab reported dead, two captured.
05 June. Al Shabaab ambushes a Hirshabelle-area government military escort in Elka-Gelow in between Bal'ad and Kalimow. 5-17 total casualties reported, including 2 MPs.

06 June. Biimaal and Abgaal/Abdul Arooni sub clans clashed at Muuri village (c. 16 km south west of Afgoye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour. At least three militias from both groups were killed. The motive behind the incident was reported to be clan feuds.

06 June. Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed a Bancroft soldier who was on leave at the centre of Balcad town neighbourhood in Balcad district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation in the area but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 06 June. ENDF forces based at Baardheere opened artillery fire against al Shabaab fighters that were observed at Jungal village area (c. 08 km west of Baardheere town). Additional reports suggested that al Shabaab fighters were planning to attack the ENDF base. There were no reports of casualties.

06 June. Al Shabaab shot and killed a clan elder in front of his home at Ali-Shire village vicinity in Howlwadag District. District police attended to the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. The victim was a former Somali lawmaker.

06 June. An armed government soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a drier of a rickshaw at Marwaas Mosque vicinity in Hamarweyne district over extortion money. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
