The security officers deployed in the area were confronted by residents protesting over the demolition of their houses. Three unarmed civilians were killed and five others were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 16 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based in Sifeynta Batroolka Factory neighbourhood in Wadajir district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Two NISA soldiers were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
16 July. Al Shabaab militants killed a Somali police officer in Dharkenley
16 July. After a hand grenade was thrown at them, Somali police fired back at the unidentified attackers in Weeberi.
16 July. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing of a senior police officer in Yaaqshiid.
16 July. Somali police forces reacted with gunfire after a hand grenade was thrown at them by an unidentified armed group in Daynile.
16 July. Al Shabaab attacks and killed a soldier in Jamhuriya neighbourhood of Karaan district.

17 July. Al Shabaab clashed with a clan militia at ILJI village (c. 05 km east of Mahadaay district). Three al Shabaab fighters and one senior al Shabaab amir were killed. The clash occurred after residents ignored al Shabaab orders to pay Zakawat (tax) on their properties including farms produce and other assets.

17 July. A hand grenade was hurled at an SNA checkpoint near Mukeyga SNA checkpoint in Afgoye district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire at the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of casualties and the perpetrator managed to escape. Perpetrator not identified.
17 July. Unknown armed men shot and killed a civilian man at Cirshiida village in Maydh district (c. 90 km north of Cerigabo). The victim was a resident of Cirshiida village.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 17 July. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange artillery fire along the frontline near Tukaraq.
17 July. An elder who hailed from Qubays-Dir clan group was shot and killed by two unidentified gunmen on his way to the mosque in Gaalkacyo.

17 July. Two SNA soldiers and Mogadishu Stabilisation Mission Forces clashed at Towfiq junction road in Yaqshid district. The stabilisation forces tried to stop SNA their battle wagon at their checkpoint near Towfiq junction road for security check but the SNA personnel resisted the order. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. Two SNA soldiers were killed while three others were wounded.

17 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNA troops based at Bar Jowhar neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated with hand grenade followed by an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
17 July. A UVIED attached under a private vehicle detonated in Waaberi, injuring a female bystander.
18 July. Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three village chiefs from Shatilow, Cadaley (coordinates approx) and Barkale villages (coordinates approx) (c. 15 km north west of Luuq District).
18 July. Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three village chiefs from Shatilow, Cadaley (coordinates approx) and Barkale villages (coordinates approx) (c. 15 km north west of Luuq District).
18 July. Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three village chiefs from Shatilow, Cadaley (coordinates approx) and Barkale villages (coordinates approx) (c. 15 km north west of Luuq District).
18 July. Militiamen hailing from Saad attacked and injured two Majeerteen khat sellers in Gaalkacyo.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 18 July. Armed clan militias from Saad shot at a joint military force checkpoint at the main market area. There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. It was believed that the perpetrators are supporters of the dismissed commander of the 21st battalion of Somalia military forces based in Dhusamareb town. Galmudug security forces in South Galkayo arrested three perpetrators and four others escaped from the area.

18 July. Two suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed a soldier from the stabilization forces who control traffic at Bar Heydhaafin area in Hamarjajab district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incidents but there were no reports of arrests.

18 July. Two unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed an unknown young man at his shop at Ex. Control Afgoye neighbourhood in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape. No group claimed responsibility of the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 18 July. A NISA (Alpha Group unit) convoy from Gubadley headed to NISA headquarters shot at a civilian truck carrying stones for building construction at Wajeer village in Kaaran district. The security forces suspected the vehicle to be a VBIED. One civilian male porter was killed while another was injured and rushed to Hospital for medical care. The convoy proceeded to the NISA HQ. Government forces arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

18 July. A government soldier shot and killed a civilian minibus conductor at Ex. Control Balcad in Heliwa district after a dispute over extortion of money. The perpetrator was not apprehended by the security forces.

18 July, on or about. Al Shabaab forced child soldier recruitment causes many residents to flee Cadale District during the week of 18 July. The development sparked off clashes between Al-Shabaab militias and the locals in Gullane and Kadere (coordinates approx) villages.

18 July, on or about. Al Shabaab forced child soldier recruitment causes many residents to flee Cadale District during the week of 18 July. The development sparked off clashes between Al-Shabaab militias and the locals in Gullane and Kadere (coordinates approx) villages.

18 July, on or about. Al Shabaab forced child soldier recruitment causes many residents to flee Cadale District during the week of 18 July. The development sparked off clashes between Al-Shabaab militias and the locals in Gullane and Kadere (coordinates approx) villages.
19 July. Al-Shabab's fighters carried out a special operation in Qoryoley town in Lower Shabelle Region [southern Somalia] killing two soldiers from the Somali government. Several others wounded.
19 July. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen open fire against a vehicle transporting Khat. Driver injured. The assailants escaped with the vehicle.
19 July. Suspected al Shabaab shoot and kill a military officer in Heliwa.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 20 July. Al Shabaab gain control of Af Urur after Puntland forces stationed there flee. No reported violence.

20 July. Habargidir and Hawadle armed clan militias, while on foot patrol, clashed at Baanyaaley (c. 76 km north east of Beletweyne at the border of Matabaan and Mahaas districts). Two clan militiamen from Habargidir clan were killed. The motive behind the clash was related to disputed grazing land. Further reports indicated that the two clans were mobilizing their militias for a potential armed clash.

Movement of forces: 20 July. Nearly 13 battle wagons with unspecified numbers of troops from SNA were deployed in Karin-dabaylwayn (c. 75 km south east of Lasanod district) in response to hit-and-run attacks conducted by Puntland against Somaliland military in Tukaraq area.. The reinforcement troops were initially based at Kalabaydh village.

20 July. Armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, shot and killed a businessman in a shop at Cilmi-Loos area of Kooshin neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The victim was an electoral delegate who participated in the elections at Hirshabelle parliamentarians. Local security forces arrived at the scene of the incident where they conducted a search operation around the incident area. Four suspects were arrested in the operation.

20 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters burnt two Toyota Noah vehicles, allegedly headed to Wajid town near Ideed Hoosle village (c. 25 km south east of Wajid). The two drivers managed to escape from the suspected al Shabaab fighters but one was injured. The motive behind the incident was unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 July. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy from Afgoye, exploded at Lanta Buuro village vicinity. The AMISOM lead battlewagon was damaged. There were no reports of human casualties. The unidentified perpetrator managed to escape.

column9: Habar Yoonis-Sacad Yoonis Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Women (Somalia)
column17: 20 July. A three-year-old girl was shot and killed by armed men from Biicido clan. The armed men attacked a house that belonged to Sacad Yonis clan in pursuit of the occupants but they were not found.

20 July. Two unidentified armed men shot and killed a government police officer while on his way home near Suuq-bacaad market vicinity in Yaqshid district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack.
21 July. Military forces destroy an al Shabaab communications network during a raid. Weapons recovered, arrests made. There may have been a violent clash; causality numbers not known.

21 July. Habargidir and Hawadle clan militias clashed at Baanyaaley (c. 76 km north east of Beletweyne) at the border of Matabaan and Mahaas districts. Six clan militias were killed and 20 others were injured from both clans. The clash is a continuation from the previous day.
21 July. Islamic State fighters shot and killed a man in his shop at the Bakara Market in Hodan district.

21 July. An RCIED, targeting a Toyota Pickup carrying police officers, exploded while the vehicle passed near Tabeelaha Weydow neighbourhood in Dayniile district. One civilian bystander was killed while two others, including one police and a civilian, were injured. The injured were taken to the hospital for treatment. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
21 July. Two soldiers are confirmed wounded following an al Shabaab bomb attack in Bulo Nuriyo neighbourhood. The detonation took place during the nighttime hours.
21 July. An IED targeting a senior police officer detontes in Mogadishu's Forilow area, killing a civilian bystander. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
21 July. A government official is killed and his brother injured after a bomb that was fitted to this car detonated in Bondere District. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
22 July. A soldier is killed in an al Shabaab attack in Xudur.
22 July. Al Shabaab attacks a group of soldiers with a grenade in the Arra Gudud area of Kismayo. Three soldiers reported dead.

22 July. SNA soldiers on reconnaissance mission clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Warshiidle village (c. 12 km north east of Moro Gabey). Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and one SNA soldier was injured. The injured SNA soldier was transported to Hudur for further medical treatment.

22 July. A group of al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Kenyan police reservists at the borderline of Kenya and Somalia (c. 02 km south west of Belet Xaawo town). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for a few minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 22 July. Al Shabaab militants travelling in four small boats along the coastline conducted an attack against AMISOM/SNA troops at Barawe Seaport neighbourhood in Barawe district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for over 30 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

22 July. Armed clan- based militias (not identified) using AK47s shot and killed a civilian man in his home at Buurdheere village (c. 15 north of Cadale) in Cadale District. The motive of the killing was reported to be clan feuds over disputed land. The perpetrators managed to escape.

22 July. An 18-year-old boy was abducted by al Shabaab militants near Camaara village in south Mudug. It was believed that the motive behind the incident was recruitment to al Shabaab militants. Many families fled with their children from the area for fear of al Shabaab conscription.

22 July. Al Shabaab fighters abducted about 26 civilians from Abaqsole village (c. 20 km east of Garasweyne village). The arrest was in relation to the armed confrontation between SNA and al Shabaab fighters earlier that day near Warshiidle Village. Al Shabaab accused the civilian of collaborating and providing information to SNA soldiers. Al Shabaab fighters took the detained civilians to Garasweyne village (c. 48 km north west of Xudur).

22 July. An IED targeting SNA forces manning a makeshift check point near Baddi Cadde village (c. 08 km West of Baidoa) exploded while SNA soldiers were screening a rickshaw. One civilian was killed and three others consisting of two SNA soldiers and a civilian were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Defusal: 22 July. Jubaland security forces received information indicating that there was a suspicious vehicle, model Toyota Saloon, parked in the vicinity of Shagalaha Village. Upon arrival at the scene, JISA personnel managed to conduct a thorough search of the vehicle and managed to find an IED which was left inside the vehicle underneath the rear passenger seat. The said IED was safely removed from inside the vehicle. Security forces are reported to be conducting an investigation to establish the motive behind the reported incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 22 July. Jubaland forces carried out a security operation against al Shabaab insurgents in Badhaadhe. Authorities claimed to have killed 6 insurgents including a senior commander Shurem Adan Ali.
22 July. Approximately 70 NISA officers protested near Villa Somalia after they were fired on orders of FGS due to equipment issues.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 22 July. Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based in Jazeera Beach neighbourhood in Wadajir district. The clash was initiated with an RPG followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Two NISA soldiers were killed while two others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

22 July. An SNA soldier, in military uniform, shot and killed a civilian minibus driver at Suuqa Kaaran neighbourhood in Kaaran district. Two civilian passengers were injured. The driver was killed after he refused to pay 5000 Somali shillings to the soldier. District police arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator managed to escape.
23 July. Al-Shabaab grenade attack on SNAF checkpoint. Casualties unknown.

23 July. Gaaljecel militias abducted a civilian from Jajeele clan as part of a dispute over 4 missing camels which is under discussion between the 2 sides. Influential clan elders from Galjecel clan attempted to free the abducted man.

23 July. Al Shabaab attacked Sanguuni Forward Operating Base (FOB). Two VBIED approached the check point in front of the FOB but was repulsed by soldiers and exploded. A third VBIED destroyed the checkpoint. Causalities not listed.

23 July. Al Shabaab attacks a military base in Bar-sanguni, leading to a battle lasting over an hour. Causalities on both sides - VOA report, later in the week, per a military source: ""We have lost six fighters; our forces were successful in defeating al-Shabab in this operation, and we have killed 87 militants."" Later reports indicate that government forces captured a number of al-Shabaab controlled villages, including Arare.
23 July. Gunmen assassinated Isma'il Iriri the former Head of NISA in the Waaberi district. Gunmen fled.

23 July. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier and injured another at Macmacaanka village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

23 July. An armed SNA soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a male driver of a rickshaw at Mac-Macanka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The district police attended to the scene of the incident where the perpetrator was shot and killed. The motive behind the incident was a dispute over extortion money.
23 July. Government forces captured a number of al-Shabaab controlled villages in Kismayo, including Arare, following a heavy AS attack on a military base in Bar Sanguini.

23 July. Al Shabaab attacks and overtake a Somali military base at Baarka (coordinates approx), 50km of Kismayo. Al Shabaab claims 27 SNG fatalities. The remaining soldiers retreated and fled toward Bulogudud.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 July. Militias from the al-Shabab group tried to attack bases belonging to Somali National Army command in Middle Shabelle Region, particularly in Qalimow area, between Jowhar and Bal'ad Districts but were repelled by the army. ""Heavy casualties"" were inflicted on the militants. In a conflicting report, it was asserted that al Shabaab took over the area without resistance. After remaining al Shabaab fighters attempted to flee, air forces from unknown origin (likely US) struck the retreat position, killing ""many"" and destroying two vehicles.

24 July. Kenyan defence forces were reported to have destroyed a communication mast in Samaroole, about 18 kilometres away from the border town of El-Wak, reason unknown. Two of the mast's security guards were killed in the attack.
24 July. Unidentified gunmen fired on an SNAF convoy escorting General Anod as it passed an SNAF checkpoint. At least 1 soldier was killed in the clash.

24 July. Militias from the al-Shabab group tried to attack bases belonging to Somali National Army command in Middle Shabelle Region, particularly in Qalimow area, between Jowhar and Bal'ad Districts but were repelled by the army. ""Heavy casualties"" were inflicted on the militants. In a conflicting report, it was asserted that al Shabaab took over the area without resistance. After remaining al Shabaab fighters attempted to flee, air forces from unknown origin (likely US) struck the retreat position, killing ""many"" and destroying two vehicles.

24 July. Reports from the Sanaag region say that fighting between Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis occurred in the Ceerpitey district (coordinates approx), 70km south of Erigavo. clan-based militia that caused death and injury - numbers not known.
25 July. An IED targets a military vehicle at Ceelasha Biyaha. Islamic State later claimed responsibility.

25 July. An RCIED, targeting an SNA technical vehicle travelling in the Warabale area, exploded outside of Wanleweyn district. At least five soldiers were killed and five others were injured. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility of this attack.

25 July. It was reported that al Shabaab fighters placed six magnetic IEDs on Solar Electric poles in Hawlwadaag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne town. According to SPF EOD team, all six IEDs exploded. There were no reports of casualties but all six electric poles were destroyed.
25 July. An al Shabaaab IED targets a Somali military truck travelling between Afgooye and Wanlaweyne. 10 deaths reported.
25 July. Two soldiers were killed in clashes with an unknown actor near Tarabunka junction in Mogadishu.
Weapons seizure: 25 July. The Somali army intercepted a vehicle carrying a large number of al Shabaab heavy weapons and confiscated its contents in Baardheere.
25 July. Government forces carry out an anti-al Shabaab operation in Diinsoor. Two al Shabaab captured, one soldier wounded.
26 July. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a solider and two police officers between the Dabka junction and Bakara Market, specifically in the Barmudo neighbourhood in Hodan District, Banaadir Region.
On 26 July, a man specified as being from the Ali Saleeban sub-clan was shot and seriously wounded in a mosque near Netco area of Bossaso. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the shooting.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 26 July. Unidentified gunmen assassinated Puntland Police Colonel Abdirashid Hassan Hashi 'Gabi Gabi' after Isha prayers.
On 26 July, Kenyan Soldiers (KDF) reportedly raped 5 women who were living near the Belet Xawo town located near the Kenya/Somalia border. All 5 were later hospitalized in Kenya.

On 26 July, unidentified armed men shot and killed a former legislator at his house in the Al-Hindi village, Hawl Wadaag district. The attackers reportedly escaped. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 26 July, a cameraman working for a media company was reportedly shot and killed by an armed government soldier in Suuqa Beerta vicinity, Waberi district. According to the report, the shooting came after a dispute over road access. The soldier fled the scene after the incident.

On 26 July, one soldier was killed and two others injured when an argument broke out between a group of SNAF (Somali National Armed Forces) soldiers near Jayga - Kawo Godey village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district in Mogadisho. According to the source, a heated argument broke out over khat, and later escalated to gunfire.

On 26 July, suspected Al-Shabaab militants shot and killed two local policemen in Barmuuda village, Howlwadag. It is unclear if the police officers were on-duty at the time, however, the source did clarify that they were both armed. A later attack targeted military personnel at Bar-Ubah junction road.

On 26 July, unidentified armed men believed to be linked to Al-Shabaab reportedly shot dead two SNA soldiers at the Bar-Ubah junction road in Hawl-wadaag district. It is believed that the soldiers were on-duty at the time of the attack. An earlier attack had targeted police personnel in Barmuuda village of Howlwadag.
26 July. A man identified as a Spouse to a Somalia MP has been assassinated in Hawlwadag district of Mogadishu. Perpetrators and their motive not known.
26 July. A driver was gunned down in Mogadishu's Wabere district by Somali soldier, over dispute unknown reason, the criminal escaped the scene.
26 July. Unidentified gunmen in the Showriyada neighbourhood of Dharkenley District severely wounded a [former] electorate college delegate from the Southwest State.

26 July. Armed al-Shabaab fighters shot and wounded an official working for the Puntland administration in Bosaso town, Bari Region. A separate source later specified that the incident occurred in the Tuurjale area located south east of Bossaso; and specified that the official was a customs officer from the Ministry of Finance.
26 July. An unidentified gunman assassinated a journalist in Xamar Jaabjab. Dalsan Radio report the perpetrators were government soldiers.

column9: Former Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 27 July, a former QRF commander and deputy police commissioner of Puntland was shot and killed by men armed with pistols in front of the Dulqarney Mosque in Israac Village, North Galkayo region in Mudug. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the shooting.

On 27 July, South West Police Forces (Military force of Somalia) reportedly attacked an Al-Shabaab position near Lafaale village (located 37 KM south-west of Wajid). Two Al-Shabaab fighters were killed in the resulting firefight, after which the remaining Al-Shabaab fighters fled.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 27 July, two remotely detonated explosive devices reportedly targeted an AMISOM (unidentified country of origin) convoy at the Ilbaq settlement near Gololey village in Balcad district. Gunfire reportedly followed the the explosions. Al-Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack. No casualties were reported.
27 July. Somali soldiers killed six al-Shabab militants and injured several others during an operation near Wajid, at Lafale location.

On 27 July, two groups of SNAF soldiers, divided along clan lines, reportedly clashed at Hanta Dheer, 77 area in Dayniile district over a land dispute. Three people were injured, including two SNAF soldiers. Some other source have reported 5 deaths in the incident, 4 of them soldiers, and at least 7 civilians wounded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 28 July, Al Shabaab militants reportedly conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM Burundian troops based at Arbacow (15 KM west of Moghadishu) in Afgoye district. RPG, mortar, and gunfire lasted for around 30 minutes after which Al-Shabaab militiamen withdrew. No injuries or fatalities were reported by the source.
27 July. Al Shabaab carried out an attack on an SNAF checkpoint. After a brief exchange of fire the insurgents withdrew.

On 28 July, two groups of SNAF soldiers reportedly clashed over khat related matters near the Jazeera road, Wadajir district, Moghadishu. One civilian was killed in the exchange of gunfire by stray bullets.

On 29 July, Al Shabaab militants reportedly attacked an SNA defence base located at the main bridge in Afgoye district. Heavy gunfire lasted for around 20 minutes, after which the militants withdrew. Two SNA soldiers and a civilian bystander were injured.

On 29 July, two SNA soldiers were reportedly injured by suspected Al-Shabaab militants during an exchange of gunfire near a checkpoint in the Lafoole village neighborhood, Afgoye. Two soldiers were reportedly injured in the attack.

On 29 July, armed men reportedly linked to Al-Shabaab attacked a checkpoint manned by Somali National Army soldiers at the Milk Factory village area in Hodan district, Mogadishu. The militants withdrew after a 20-minute gunfight. Casualties are unknown.

On 29 July, suspected Al-Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer at the Bakara Market Qudaarta section in Hodan district, Moghadishu. The police officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.

On 29 July, an IED attached to a private vehicle detonated at the Galmudug village, Wadajir district. The driver of the car was killed (presumably a civilian) and three SNA soldiers were injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: Non-violent activity: On 29 July, the National Intelligence and Security Agency operating largely in Mogadishu was dissolved and merged with the regular police force.

On 29 July, Islamic State gunmen claim to have shot dead a financial officer in the Bakara market, Moghadishu. Al-Shabaab gunmen reportedly killed a police officer in the same area, on the same day (event coded separately).
On 29 July, a man was reportedly executed by Al-Shabaab militants in Sakow town, after confessing to having poisoned a boy and his father using rat poison.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 29 July, armed fighters with links to Al-Shabaab reportedly raided an AMISOM military base in Arba'ow area near Elasha Biyaha village, just outside of Mogadishu. No info on casualties.

On 29 July, Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have seized the town of Saateelow in Gedo Region. According to the source, Al-Shabaab-linked militants launched an attack on Somali national Army forces' barracks before sweeping to take control of the town. The source did not provide any information on casualties.

On 30 July, a Somali National Army soldier reportedly shot and killed a minibus driver at the Alamada checkpoint, near the Elasha settlemnt in Afgoye district. According to the report, the soldier shot the driver after he (the driver) refused to pay 10,000 shillings to the soldier.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: On 30 July, a number of Al-Shabaab (AS) fighters reportedly launched an night attack on Bula Haji village, around 90 km south west of Kismayo town (approx coordinates used). Clashes involving AS and Joint Somali forces were reported in the village, followed by a tactical withdraw of AS fighters. No information on casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 30 July. Somaliland and Puntland forces exchanged heavy and light artillery fire that lasted for a couple of hours. The mortar shells caused no casualties

On 30 July, a grenade was thrown at Somali National Army defensive base near the Jaale Siyad military academy in Hodan district of Mogadishu. One soldier was injured. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 30 July, unidentified gunmen armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed an unidentified civilian in the Kaawo-Goday village, Dharkenley district. No arrests were made and the perpetrator escaped.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 30 July 2018, a Burundian army officer on a peacekeeping mission in Somalia was found dead in Gersaale, near Joar. The official statement of the AMISOM Burundi contingent mentions that he committed suicide, but his colleagues say that he was executed.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 30 July, Al Shabaab forces reportedly fired at least 6 mortar rounds at an AMISOM/SNA military base in Embareeso village located 5 km north of Barawe. A UN source claimed that at least 2 AMISOM soldiers were injured in the shelling. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and claimed to have killed 3 soldiers. Other local sources have reported only one fatality, claiming that the event took place at the Barawe airport shortly after a helicopter landed, specifying that the deceased was a Somali soldier. Fatalities coded as 1.

On 30 July, a Kenyan military warplane reportedly conducted an airstrike on known Al-Shabaab locations near Kibis village (approx 25 km West of Garbaharrey town - approx coordinates used). According to the report, the airstrike killed 17 Al-Shabaab militants and two civilians.

On 31 July, a junior police officer was shot and killed by two gunmen with suspected links to Al-Shabaab in Karaan neighborgood of Mogadishu. According to the report, the police officer returned fire before being fatally wounded, killing one of the assailants. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 31 July, two Somali National Army soldiers were reportedly killed while two others injured in an explosion that targeted their vehicle as they passed near Maslax village, Heliwa district of Mogadisho. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 31 July, suspected Al-Shabaab linked gunmen shot dead a police officer from the pro-government militia ""Abd Ali"" in Yaqshid district, Mogadishu.

On 31 July, Al Shabaab militiamen reportedly attacked the African Village building in Hodan district, Mogadishu. According to the report, Somali federal government officials were present in the area as Somali National Army soldiers and AS militiamen clashed near the gate. No info on casualties.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: On 31 July, suspected Al-Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack on Somali NISA soldiers based in the Dayniile airstrip neighborhood in Dayniile district, Mogadishu. Two NISA soldiers were reportedly killed while two others were injured during the gunfire. Some other sources have reported three deaths in the incident. Fatalities coded as 2.

On 1 August, a suspected Al-Shabaab militant hurled a hand-grenade at the District Commissioner's office in Garashbaley village, Garabaley district, Dayniile district neighborhood in Mogadisho. Somali National Army soldiers reacted with gunfire and a suspect was eventually captured and arrested. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On 1 August, a child was reportedly abducted by unidentified gunmen in the Arafat village, Yaqhshid district. According to the source, the 12 year old girl was abducted by unidentified gunmen who then demanded ransom from her parents. No further info.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: On 1 August, two Djiboutian soldiers serving under the African Union mission in Somalia were reportedly killed by a roadside bomb set by Al-Shabaab militants in the town of Bulobarde, Hiiraan.

column9: Government of Somalia (2017-); HI: Hizbul Islam
column17: On 1 August, two people were killed plus the suicide bomber and 4 others injured in a suicide attack undertaken by Al-Shabaab linked militants in Bohodle town, Toghdeer region. A former senior advisor to the Somali PM office, Abdifatha Mohamed, and former Khaatumo regional interior minister were identified as the dead, while 4 civilians were wounded. Note: AbdiFatha Mohamed was also known as the finance chief of the former Hizbul Islam party - an Islamic militia that merged with Al-Shabaab in December of 2010.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 1 August, Jubbaland Somali forces have reportedly clashed with Al-Shabaab militiamen in Bula Hajji town, located around 80 km west of Kismayo port city (approx. coordinates used). At least 2 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed, while an unknown number were wounded. According to the report, Jubbaland forces were able to take control of the Al-Shabaab base in the town following the clashes. Note, clashes were reported in the same town several days ago, instigated by Al-Shabaab militiamen. These clashes were reported in a separate event.

2 August 2018: Al-Shabaab linked militants reportedly shot dead a police officer driving his car through Eylasha Biyaha area of Afgooye district. According to the report, the attackers stole the dead policeman's car and pistol and escaped the scene.

02 August. Al Shabaab militants have amputated a 15 year old girl for playing football. Hasina Ali an orphan from Anole village was spotted by the militants playing with her brothers. Her leg was cut in front of locals in the village square.
2 August 2018: A woman was killed and a second wounded when police opened fire near the main market in Galkayo town. The motive behind the shooting is unknown.
On 2 August, Al-Shabaab militants reportedly shot and killed a police officer in Dharkenley district of Mogadishu.

2 August 2018: Two Al-Shabaab-linked gunmen reportedly shot dead a municipal police officer collecting tax revenue in Hodan district of the capital, Mogadishu. It is unclear if the police officer was armed or not.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 2 August 2018: A bomb attached to the vehicle of a NISA officer exploded near the Wehliye Hotel neighbourhood, in Waberi District, Mogadishu. No injuries were reported (the officer was not in the vehicle at the time of the explosion).

On 2 August, a Tanzanian-Somali entrepreneur was reportedly shot dead by unidentified gunmen in the Banadir junction (Hodan dist.) of Mogadishu.He was the judge of a popular Somali TV show and the founder of the ""Start up Grind Mogadishu"". His death sparked protests across the capital (protests coded under a separate data line).
On 2 August, Islamic State gunmen claim to have killed three Somali National Army soldiers in the Elasha Biyaha area, Mogadishu. No further details.
On 2 August, Al-Shabaab militants reportedly fired four mortar rounds at the Bal'ad (Balcad Af Som.) town, missing their target and wounding two civilians (an elderly man and a small child).
3 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants threw a grenade at Somali National Forces in the Baraawe town, near the Baraawe DC office. One soldier was injured in the attack.

3 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants threw a grenade at Somali National Forces in the Dharkenly area of the capital, Mogadishu. Soldiers reacted with gunfire. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On 3 August, two people with suspected links to Al-Shabaab were killed by local Somali security teams in the Sai Peino suburb (Wardhigley district) of Mogadishu. According to the source, the killed were in a car when security forces fired on the vehicle. A third person managed to escape.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
column17: On 3 August, Somali and Djiboutian AMISOM forces engaged in clashes with Al-Shabaab militants who had attacked the town of Jalaqsi overnight. The brief exchange of gunfire resulted in the death of at least one local militiaman who was fighting alongside the Somali troops.

On 3 August, according to pro-Al-Shabaab media, an Al-Shabaab affiliate hurled a bomb at a gathering of Somali soldiers in Yaaqshiid district of the capital, Mogadisho, resulting in an unknown number of deaths and injuries. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

On 3 August, according to a report issued by the Swedish-based Somali website, Somaliweyn, Al-Shabaab militants forcefully abducted a 6 year old girl with albinoism from her home in Harbole town, Gedo region. No further info.

On 3 August, hundreds of Somali youth reportedly protested in the main streets of Mogadishu against the deteriorating security situation in the country. The protests were reportedly prompted by the murder of Tanzanian-Somali entrepreneur Mohamed Sheikh Ali the evening before (event coded separately).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 3 August, Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed a convoy of Kenyan troops traveling from Garilley area to Fahfadhun, Gedo Region. According to the report, the ambush began with landmine explosions after which fighters began firing weapons at the troops. The source did not provide any information on casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 3 August, a U.S. drone strike on Balad Ul-Amin village, Lower Shabelle region, reportedly killed 4 Al-Shabaab linked militants.

column9: WHO: World Health Organization; Women (Somalia); Health Workers (Somalia)
column17: 4 August 2018: A regional Polio Officer working for the WHO was reportedly shot by two unidentified gunmen as she was standing in front of her home in Lasanod, Sool Region. The officer was immediately rushed to the hospital.

4 August 2018: Unidentified attackers reportedly hurled a grenade at Somali National Army forces in Yaaqshiid district, near the Lanta Towfiq branch office. Sources claim that the attackers were pursued and arrested, although their identity/affiliation remains unknown. No injuries or fatalities.

4 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Somali National Army soldier as he returned from praying at a mosque in El-Gaabta village neighbourhood, in Hamarjajab District. According to the source, the soldier was armed at the time, and claimed that the attackers stole the soldier's gun after killing him.
4 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols reportedly shot dead a clan elder as he exited a mosque near Fagah junction road, in Yaqshid District of the capital Mogadishu.
04 August 2018: unidentified gunmen shot and killed soldier serving under Somali police force in the Irdodko area of Xamar Wayne (Mogadisho, Banaadir).

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 04 August. Al Shabaab attacked HirShabelle and AMISOM forces on the edge of Jalalaqsi. A HirShabelle soldier was killed before attackers withdrew.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 4 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a convoy of AMISOM troops (nationality unknown) headed from Lanta Buuro to KM50, firing an RPG at the convoy that had stopped near the Wareegow village located 13km North-East of Merka District. The two sides reportedly traded gunfire for about 30 minutes until Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
4 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a Somali National Army checkpoint in Afgooye town, sparking clashes that lasted around 50 minutes. No info on casualties.

4 August 2018: A man was shot and killed, and a second man wounded by unidentified armed assailants in Xabaal Rer area, 75 km SE of Qardho (Bari Region - approx. coordinates used). The motive for the attack is unknown.

On the 5th August, 2018, a suicide bomber reportedly detonated a car bomb at a checkpoint in Afgooye, killing 4 civilians and wounding several others. According to the source, the bomber had aimed at a military vehicle but missed the target, killing the civilians. Two soldiers were also wounded in the attack. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility. *The al-Shabaab media outlet claimed that 15 soldiers were killed in the attack, fatalities coded at their lowest point for conservative estimates (includes the suicide bomber)

5 August 2018: Shabelle Media Network reported that Al-Shabaab gunmen had executed 4 people, three of whom were Jubbaland soldiers, in the town of Jilib, Middle Juba region. The 4th person executed was accused of murder.

5 August 2018: Shabelle Media Network reported that Al-Shabaab gunmen had executed 4 people, three of whom were Jubbaland soldiers, in the town of Jilib, Middle Juba region. The 4th person executed was accused of murder.

On the 5th August, 2018, armed men with suspected links to Al-Shabaab reportedly shot dead an elderly man, Hussein Hilowle, in Mogadishu's Karan district. Al Shabaab claimed he was a member of NISA, but this was not clear.

On the 5th August, 2018, Al-Shabaab linked militants have reportedly shot dead a Somali policeman in the Afar Irdodka area of Hamar Waye area, Mogadishu. According to the source, the policeman was killed by armed men with pistols shortly after exiting a mosque. *Seperate sources have reported the event taking place in Xamar Jabjab district.

5 August 2018: 5 Somali national soldiers were injured in an IED blast targeting Somali National Army Second Division commander, Ali Arif. According to the source, the bomb was attached by unidentified militants to the car of the commander, and it detonated once the vehicle reached the inside the old textiles factory in Balcad district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On the 5th of August, Radio Dalsan reported that Al-Shabaab militants had shelled an AMISOM base in Bal'ad town, causing injuries. According to the source, the shelling hit the base located in Hawa-Tako neighbourhood of the town. AMISOM responded by firing back mortars. No casualties were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 5 August 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked militants have reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Ugandan) in the vicinity of the town of Arbacow, Afgooye district. According to the report, artillery, RPG, and gun fire were all used during the attack. No info on casualties. *note: Relief-web identifies the Arbacow base as being in or near Ceelasha Biyaha area.

On August 5th, 2018, at least 4 people were killed and 7 others injured in a suicide car-bomb explosion during a traffic jam on Mogadishu's Makkah Al Mukaramah Road. According to the source, those killed were in cars and sitting in the Bar Italia (Hawl-Wadag district). *fatality count includes the suicide bomber. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack, claiming to have targeted Somali SNAF/NISA soldiers.

5 August 2018: An IED of unknown origins reportedly exploded, apparently targeting government soldiers drinking tea in a shot in Ceel Wayn neighborhood of Wajid town. A single civilian was reportedly injured in the attack.

5 August 2018: Men with suspected links to Al-Shabaab have reportedly opened fire from their car on Somali National Army soldiers in their vehicle near Banadir junction road, in Hodan District of the capital Mogadishu. 2 men in the car were killed, as well as a civilian bystander. 2 government soldiers were also reportedly injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: August 6, 2018: A landmine explosion targeting an Ethiopian military convoy as it left Baidoa town and headed toward Bardale reportedly killed and injured an unspecified number of soldiers. Al-Shabaab officials speaking to Radio Andalus confirmed the event. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

On the 6th of August, suspected to be al-Shabab fighters armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a Somali soldier in a western neighborhood of Jalaqsi town, Hiiraan region. The source specified that the soldier was armed at the time of the attack.

6 August 2018: Al-Shabaab linked gunmen reportedly attacked a Somali National Army base located in Bulo Burto town, Hiiran region. According to the source, Al-Shabaab militiamen fired on the base with small arms for a short time before retreating. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

6 August 2018: A crowd gathered at the scene of a fire in Jayga village neighbourhood, in Wadajir district of the capital, Mogadishu, and began throwing stones at fire fighting vehicles for arriving late. Somali National Army forces arrived to the scene and opened fire, injuring two rioters.

6 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a Somali National Army checkpoint in Siinka Dheer village vicinity, in Dayniile District of the capital Mogadishu. After a brief exchange of gunfire AS militiamen retreated. No information on casualties.

7 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen reportedly shot dead a police officer (identified as an instructor at the Police academy) in Ansaloti village, Hamarjajab District. The attackers managed to escape and could not be identified, but were suspected to be Al Shabaab. Another source reported the victim as a civilian

Abdullahi Ali Omar, Golis Telecommunication Company assistant manager, was reportedly killed in Bosaso town of Bari region on the evening of the 7th of August by unidentified gunmen. Al-Shabaab leaders have denied being connected to the shooting.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 7 August 2018: Fighters linked to Al-Shabaab launched an attack on a Djiboutian base in Bulo Burto town, Hiiran district. According to the report, clashes were fought throughout the night, and an explosion at the airport during the fighting killed and wounded Djiboutian soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
7 August 2018: Majeerteen and Owramale clansmen clashed over a land dispute in Dalsan village 20 KM SE of Kismayo town (approx. Coordinates used). Two Majeerteen clansmen were reportedly injured.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 7 August 2018: Clashes between Somali National Army troops backed by AMISOM forces on one side and Al-Shabaab militiamen on the other were reportedly fought in Gaaywarow, Qoryooley district. 7 civilians and a single AMISOM soldier were wounded during the clashes, while 5 AS militiamen were killed and 5 injured.

7 August 2018: Unidentified armed militants reportedly shot and killed a police officer using pistols in the Beerta Jaadka, Seypiano area of Wadajir district, Mogadishu. The language of the report suggested that the police officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack. Another policeman was targeted on the same day in Mogadishu.

On or around 8 August 2018, the bodies of two Oromo (Ethiopian) men were found in Bosaso town. This comes with a context of heightened tensions between Oromo and Somali communities in eastern Ethiopia, where fighting between the two ethnic groups has been going on for months. A second source confirmed the event, adding that the dead had been stabbed by a knife.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: Somali special forces (Danab) backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly taken control of Bulo-Konto, Dangiga Balow, Basro (also known as Walamoy) and Garas-weyne villages after clashing with Al-Shabaab militiamen in the area. The source did not provide any details on casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: Somali special forces (Danab) backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly taken control of Bulo-Konto, Dangiga Balow, Basro (also known as Walamoy) and Garas-weyne villages after clashing with Al-Shabaab militiamen in the area. The source did not provide any details on casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 8 August 2018: A Kenyan military plane reportedly conducted airstrikes in Gadon Dabo town of Balad Hawo district, in Gedo region. Local residents being quoted by a pro-Al-Shabaab source say that the airstrikes killed a local herdsman (civilian).

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: Joint Somali National Amry troops and Amisom forces reportedly took control of Gaywirow village, Qoryooley district in Lower Shabelle Region after clashing with militants linked to Al-Shabaab. No info on casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: Somali special forces (Danab) backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly taken control of Bulo-Konto, Dangiga Balow, Basro (also known as Walamoy) and Garas-weyne villages after clashing with Al-Shabaab militiamen in the area. The source did not provide any details on casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: Somali special forces (Danab) backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly taken control of Bulo-Konto, Dangiga Balow, Basro (also known as Walamoy) and Garas-weyne villages after clashing with Al-Shabaab militiamen in the area. The source did not provide any details on casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: Following an IED blast targeting their convoy in Heliwa district of the capital Mogadishu, AMISOM troops (nationality unspecified) opened fire on civilian bystanders, killing 3-5 people, including one woman.

8 August 2018: Battles continue for a second day; Majeerteen and Owramale clansman clashed over a land dispute in Dalsan village 20 KM SE of Kismayo town. Two family members from Majeerteen clan were reported dead following the gunbattles.

8 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers clashed with one another after one soldier accused the other's brother of being loyal to Al-Shabaab. The argument escalated into a gunfight, during which a soldier was killed along with two women bystanders. The soldier who killed the other was arrested and taken into custody.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: AMISOM troops reportedly attacked AS positions in Awgoye (located 10 km north of Afgoye). After a brief exchange of gunfire both parties withdrew from the area. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 8 August 2018: Suspected Kenyan air-force planes launched airstrikes on known Al-Shabaab held territory near Tuulan-qurac town (location unknown, however the source has pointed that it is near El Wak town) in Gedo region. Confirmed report suggested there were casualties, however no exact numbers were reported and unclear if fatalities among them.
08 August. Unidentified gunmen attacked a security checkpoint in Dharkenley. The soldiers returned fire. No causalities reported.
8 August 2018: Unidentified armed men reportedly shot and killed a Somali National Army soldier in the Suuqweynaha market, Karan district (Mogadishu). The attackers escaped.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 8 August 2018: Two remotely triggered IED bombs went off as a convoy of AMISOM troops was driving through Heliwa district, Mogadish. According to the source, the first IED went off, damaging the first vehicle in the convoy and then the second exploded when AMISOM troops stopped to assess the damage. No injuries or fatalities were reported in the blasts.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: August 9 2018: 7 Ugandan soldiers were reportedly killed in an ambush set by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the outskirts of Qoryoley town, Qoryoley District, Lower Shabelle region.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 9 August 2018: Somali national forces backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly engaged Al-Shabaab militants in clashes in Awqoy village, located 30 km from Afgoye town (direction/location unknown). No info on casualties.

09 August. One person was killed after two armed groups (Madhiban and Arab Salah clans) clashed over a clan retaliation issue at Kalabayr Village (c. 20 km West of Bursalah Village). Puntland Police responded and quelled the fighting investigations are ongoing.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Somalia)
column17: 9 August 2018, 5 members of the Somali Red Crescent Society were reportedly kidnapped by suspected Al-Shabaab militiamen in Busle village located on the outskirts of Baidoa.

9 August 2018: According to a pro-Al-Shabaab media source and local residents, Al-Shabaab fighters have taken control of the town of Gedweyn, located just outside Dolow district in Gedo region. According to the source, AS militiamen took control of the village without firing a shot or meeting resistance from Jubbaland troops who had previously controlled the area.

Gunmen linked to the Al-Shabaab group have reportedly attacked Somali government soldiers stationed at a checkpoint in Yaqshid district of the capital Somalia. According to the Pro-Al-Shabaab source, Calamada, gunmen attacked the checkpoint on the 10 August, killing and wounding an unknown number. Unknown fatalities coded as 10
10 August. Al Shabaab kidnapped 18 Gaaljecel clan civilians in Ceel Cali.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 10 August, 2018: According to pro-Al-Shabaab media, Ethiopian soldiers going to chew Qat were hit by an IED bomb set by Al-Shabaab militiamen, causing injuries or fatalities. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

11 August 2018; An unidentified military warplane reportedly conducted airstrikes in Lego area of Lower Shabelle region, apparently targeting Al-Shabaab bases in the area. No info on casualties. *note, the location given by the source may have been incorrect, Leego town is located in Bay region.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 11 August 2018: Three Ugandan soldiers and two Somali government soldiers were reportedly wounded by a landmine that hit their personnel carrier near Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle. Al Shabaab was allegedly responsible for the attack.

On the 11 August 2018, Somali national soldiers reportedly conducted a military operation in Qoryooley, Lower Shebelle, targeting Al-Shabaab commanders. According to the report, multiple (exact number is unknown) commanders linked to the Al-Shabaab group were killed during the clashes. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

11 August 2018: Inter-clan clashes between the Awramale and Majeerteen clan militiamen reportedly sparked again, resulting in a gunbattle that killed 9 people. According to the report, clan elders have instituted a ceasefire.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 11 August 2018: At least 4 civilians were killed by a Kenyan warplane that launched missiles at Laan Quru village, located between El Waq and Beled Hawo in Gedo Regio (approx. coordinates used). According to the source, the killed included a mother and two children as well as an elderly person (the source did not specify who the 4th person was).

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On or near 11 August 2018, Somali soldiers accompanied by US soldiers reportedly killed 4 civilians (two men, a mother and her son) in the Leego town, Bay region. No further details were given by the pro-Al Shabaab source.

Clashes were reported on or around the 11 of August, 2018, involving Somali National Soldiers and Al-Shabaab fighters in the number 50 village (Bushka area) in Lower Shabelle region. According to the report, the fighting lead to ""deaths and injuries"". Unknown fatalities coded as 10
11 August. Unidentified gunmen attacked a civilian vehicle travelling between Galinsoor and Adaado. 1 passenger was killed in the attack.
""Two female health workers employed by a local NGO were abducted by an AOG. Local community members negotiated for their release. The staff members were held for approximately 36 hours.""
12 August. SWSPF officer shot and killed a civilian man at the livestock market after an argument over tax payment between the police officer and the victim. The perpetrator was arrested.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 August 2018: US drones reportedly launched missiles at unknown targets in the Ceel-Mukayle settlement, Afgoye district. Residents confirmed explosions and Al-Shabaab fighters cordoned off the area. No info on casualties is available.

Arrests: On the 13 August 2018, Somali police in Galmudug reportedly arrested 10 senior officials from the Ogaden National Liberation Front (ONLF) who crossed the border with Ethiopia, allegedly into Balanbale town. This comes at a time of significant tension in Jijiiga town (of Ethiopia's Somali regional state).

13 August 2018: At least 9 people were killed and several others wounded after clashes involving Al-Shabaab militiamen and local fighters in Jilib town, middle Jubba region. According to the report, AS fighters arrested several farmers, after which locals took up arms and began clashing with Al-Shabaab forces stationed in the area. The fatality counts include 3 Al-Shabaab militiamen and 6 local clan fighters.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 13 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Djiboutian) west of Bulo Burte district, Hiran region. After a short exchange of gunfire AS forces retreated back into the bush. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

13 August 2018: A group of Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked the Buulo Fuley (Buulo Folyo) checkpoint in Afgoy district, sparking clashes that lasted for around 20 minutes. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

13 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen on a Bajaj reportedly opened fire on a soldier at the Balcad junction neighborhoood, Heliwa district. The officer responded with gunfire. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

13 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen reportedly attacked a checkpoint manned by Somali National Army soldiers in the Calamaad (Calamadaha) area, Afgoye district. Soldiers responded with gunfire. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

14 August 2018: Somali security forces have reportedly thwarted an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab militiamen on the Alamada village, located just outside of the capital city of Mogadishu. According to the report, of the 5 Al-Shabaab linked gunmen involved in the attack one was injured in the firefight. No fatalities were reported.

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 14 August 2018: Somali security forces backed by soldiers from the United States Army reportedly clashed with Al-Shabaab forces in the Basra settlement area near Balcad district town. US helicopters backed the forces, striking Al-Shabaab fighters with missiles. According to the report, 10 Al-Shabaab forces were arrested following the clashes. No info on casualties.

14 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen riding on a auto-rickshaw (Bajaj) reportedly attacked a security checkpoint manned by Somali National Army soldiers in the Bal'ad area north of the capital. Several people were reportedly wounded during the gunbattle, which lasted just over an hour.
14 August: Unidentified gunmen injured the driver of a Tuk-tuk near the Marwaas Mosque. The gunmen fled the scene on foot.

August, 2018: Inter-clan violence in the Galguduud region reportedly resulted in the death of at least 5 clansmen in or near the month of August, 2018. No further info. This event is linked to the arrest of around 60 elders in early September by the Al-Shabaab-linked administration.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: August, month of. US forces launch an air strike against an al Shabaab location 74 miles NW of Mogadishu, killing 4.

15 August. An unidentified gunman opened fire indiscriminately at night. Motive is unclear but police believe gunmen aimed to sow discord in local community. Gunman escaped but no casualties reported.

15 August 2018: Pro-Al Shabaab media have reported that militants loyal to the group planted an IED in Hiliwa district of Mogadishu targeting a Bajaj carrying police officers. One police officer was reportedly killed in the blast, with a second injured. A second blast targeted police responders, resulting in additional injuries. *A second source has reported the person killed was a civilian and not a police officer.

15 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers reportedly killed 11 al-Shabab militants including four commanders during clashes in Muse Haji and Arare areas of Jubbaland state. At least one of the dead held Kenyan citizenship. *The source specified that the areas specified are located ""near Bu'aale"".

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 16 August 2018: Pro-Al-Shabaab media has reported an explosion targeting a convoy of AMISOM troops in Bulo Mareer, Lower Shabeele. According to the report, the AMISOM troops suffered losses that included ""injuries and death"". Unknown fatalities coded as 10

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 17 August 2018: Puntland security forces reportedly attacked a military base housing Al-Shabaab fighters in the Galgala mountains. According to the report, at least 5 al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the resulting clashes.

17 August 2018: According to a pro-Al-Shabaab media source, pro-Al-Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a police officer in the Heliwa area of the capital, Mogadishu. The officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.
17 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly destroyed a water tanker belonging to the Somali National Army with an IED planted earlier in Muri town. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

17 August 2018: The former head of operations of the Somali National Army was reportedly targeted by a bomb that exploded as his convoy passed on the Mogadishu-Marka road between Shalaambood and KM 60 village, Shabelle region. No injuries were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 17 August 2018: Puntland security forces have taken control of Af Urur village in the Galgala highlands after Al-Shabaab forces abandoned the area and allowed the forces to move in.
17 August 2018: An IED device was reportedly planted in a tree in Hodan district, Mogadishu. One person was reportedly injured (presumed to be a civilian) in the blast.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 17 August 2018: A group of Al-Shabaab militiamen reportedly ambushed a convoy of AMISOM soldiers (Ugandan) travelling through the Gandawe settlement, Marka district. According to the report, AS militiamen first targeted the lead vehicle with an IED blast, then fired machine gun and small arms fire at the AMISOM troops. Three soldiers were reported injured as a result of the attack.
17 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly hurled a hand grenade at and exchanged gunfire with guards at a hotel in Baraawe where local S/W officials were meeting. No casualties were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 17 August 2018: A remotely detonated IED exploded at the Gololey village, Balcad district, as an AMISOM convoy was headed to Mogadishu from Jowhar town. The lead vehicle was allegedly damaged. Three Burundian soldiers were injured. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

17 August 2018: A Somali National Army (SNA) convoy traveling between between Ceel-Wareegow and Buushka settlements, Marka district, was reportedly targeted by an IED bomb. According to the report, four SNA soldiers were killed in the explosion while three others were injured. No party has claimed responsibility for the blast.
17 August. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian in Daynile.

18 August 2018: Fighters from the pro-Al-Shabaab group have reportedly executed two captured soldiers from the Somali National Army. According to the report, the soldiers were captured after fleeing Baidoa town, Bakool region and were captured somewhere near Hudur town, Xudur region.

18 August 2018: an explosion targeted Somali government and army officials in Mogadishu's Hodan district as they passed through the Taleh junction area, causing an unspecified number of fatalities. Al-Shabaab media claimed that militants loyal to the group were responsible for the attack. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

18 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have seized control of Lusiya, Obasibo, and El-Haji neighborhoods in the port town of Marka after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces in the area. No info on casualties.

18 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers based in Shalaambood reportedly fought intense clashes with Al-Shabaab militiamen on the road between Shalambad and Km50 village, resulting in 12 fatalities. This is separate from a bomb attack on a former commander that happened in the same area the day before.
18 August. Fighting between Mareham and Owramale militia broke out, causalities not known.

18 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have seized control of Lusiya, Obasibo, and El-Haji neighborhoods in the port town of Marka after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces in the area. No info on casualties.

19 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a position held by Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Daynuunay area on the outskirst of Baidoa district. According to the report, an unspecified number of soldiers were killed during the clashes, and a cache of weapons were seized by the attacking forces. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
19 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Bur Hakaba town, Bay region, killing one.

19 August 2018: Two armed militias from the Gaaljecal and Jajeele clans reportedly engaged in short clashes over a land dispute in the Gacanka area, Belet Weyne district. No injuries or fatalities were reported. According to the source, elders from both clans met to mediate the dispute.

19 August 2018: An unidentified assailant reportedly hurled a hand grenade at Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Marka town, Lower Shabelle. No injuries or fatalities were reported. Ealier in the day, SNA soldiers had engaged in clashes with Al-Shabaab forces in the town.

19 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a position held by Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in the KM 20 village area (Caliyaale), Balcad district, sparking an exchange of gunfire that lasted around an hour. Two SNA soldiers were killed.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 19 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers (SNA), backed by AMISOM troops, reportedly repelled an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab forces on newly-captured areas of Marka town, Lower Shabelle region. The source did not provide any info on casualties. SNA soldiers took new areas of Marka town during armed clashes on the 18 August 2018.

19 August 2018: Gunmen with suspected links to Al-Shabaab reportedly shot and killed a police officer in the Taleex village area, Hodan district of the capital Somalia. The source specified that the officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.
20 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen shot dead a Somali National Army (SNA) soldier in the Dabka junction (Hawl Wadaag junction), Mogadishu.
20 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen have reportedly shot and killed a barber shop owner in Waberi district of the Somali capital, Mogaidhu. The perpetrator of the killing escaped.

20 August 2018: Two civilians were reportedly shot dead by the governor of Sool's body guards in Lasanod town, Sool region. Local reports suggested that the body guards thought that the victims intended to attack the governor.
20 August. A UVIED detonated underneath a civilian vehicle in Arbiska. At least 2 were killed in the explosion with several other casualties reported. The motive for the attack is unknown.

20 August 2018: Unidentified armed men driving a motorcycle reportedly shot and killed a government soldier in the Nasteho village, Wadajir district in Mogadishu. According to the report, the soldier was armed and on duty at the time of the attack. The attackers grabbed the victim's gun and escaped.

20 August 2018: Unidentified armed men reportedly shot and killed a government soldier in the Tabellah Shiekh Ibrahim village, Dayanile district of Mogadishu. According to the source, the soldier was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.

20 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants shot and killed a government soldier near the Bakara market in Mogadishu. The perpetrators escaped from the scene after shooting the soldier. On the same day, Al-Shabaab militants hurled a grenade at government soldiers stationed in the market. No injuries were reported.

21 August 2018: An off-duty soldier and his civilian brother-in-law were killed in a landmine explosion that hit their vehicle as it traveled between Lafoole University and Arbiska area in Afgooye district, lower Shabelle.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 21 August 2018: United States drones reportedly carried out an airstrike targeting Al-Shabaab fighters 46 kilometers northeast of the port town of Kismayo, killing two Al-Shabaab linked men in the area. Local sources have suggested that the victims of the strike were part of Al-Shabaab's roadside bomb engineering team.

21 August 2018: Unidentified assailants reportedly hurled a hand grenade at a hotel occupied by the Baraawe district commissioner in Barawe town, Lower Shabeelle region. Security guards at the hotel opened fire after the explosion. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

21 August 2018: Private security guards clashed with youth at the Royal Palace hotel (AbdulAziz district) over entry into the hotel theatre, where a music concert was being held. The dispute escalated and the guards fired into the gathering crowd, injuring two.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 21 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants and Somali National Army troops backed by AMISOM forces in Marka traded gunfire for around 4 hours. Local sources stated that 7 civilians were injured in the incident.

22 August 2018: Forces loyal to Gen Abdullahi Ali Anod have reportedly clashed with Al-Shabaab militants in Marka town, with the soldiers taking control of a market place formerly controlled by the AS militias. No info on casualties.
22 August 2018: Unidentified armed men reportedly shot dead a civilian in the Bakaara market in Mogadishu. Police forces responded to the scene, prompting the perpetrators to flee.

22 August 2018: suspected Al-Shabaab militants reportedly shot dead two brothers in the Xoosh village, Dharkenley district. According to the source, one of the brothers was a member of the Somali National Army, although he was not on duty at the time of the attack. Police forces in the area have arrested several persons in connection to the incident.

23 August 2018: The convoy of deputy minister of defence, Abdullahi Olad Roble was reportedly targeted by an IED blast near the Somali Ministry of Defence. No injuries or fatalities were reported by the source.
23 August. Reports of demonstrations against the governing administration in Garbaharey town.
23 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen claim to have killed two soldiers and wounded three more after engaging in short clashes in Barsanguni area near Kismayo.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 24 August 2018: A roadside bomb explosion has killed a Djiboutian soldier and wounded two others in the town of Jalalaqsi. The source indicated that Al-Shabaab was responsible for the attack. Al-Shabaab later claimed to have killed 3 soldiers during the attack. Fatalities coded at the most conservative point.

23 August 2018: Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers reportedly shot dead a civilian riding in an ambulance at a checkpoint in Daynile district, Mogadishu. The reasoning behind the killing is unclear, however, the source did clarify that the killed person was part of a funeral procession.

23 August 2018: Clashes continued in the town of Marka between Somali National Army soldiers led by Abdullahi Ali Anod on one side and Al-Shabaab militants on the other. According to the source, 6 government soldiers and 4 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed. SNA soldiers claim to have arrested 27 Al-Shabaab militiamen during operations on the 24 August 2018.
23 August. Somaliland forces arrested Abdiqani Yasiin Mohammed the Secretary of Somalia's Deputy PM who was visiting family.
23 August 2018: Al Shabaab insurgents killed 2 civilians travelling between Ceel Barde and Xudur. The motive of the incident was not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 23 August 2018: A gunfight broke out between two groups of Jubaland soldiers in Kismayo city after the arrest of a senior officer. No info on casualties.
24 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly killed a Somali National Army government soldier in Biya'ada (Biyo Cadde), Middle Shabelle region.
24 August. Protests in Garbahaarey continue for a second day.
24 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated an Jubaland soldier near a mosque in Baardheere town. The gunmen escaped the scene before the security forces could respond.

24 August 2018: HirShabelle forces carried out an operation to remove checkpoints illegally established by Gaaljecel militias. After an exchange of gunfire the clan militia withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

24 August 2018: Al Shabaab insurgents fired on a convoy escorting the Deputy Governor of Lower Shabelle. The two groups briefly traded gunfire for about 20 minutes. The convoy that was heading to Marka town reached their destination. No casualties were reported.

24 August 2018: An Al-Shabaab gunmen stepped down from a public minibus at a checkpoint and fired on Somali National Army soldiers. The soldiers return fire killed 3 civilians and injured 1. The insurgent escaped the scene.

24 August 2018: Al Shabaab concealed IEDs in the bodies of 2 soldiers. Southwest forces detonated these devices as they retook the town of Daynuunay. 2 soldiers were killed, along with 1 insurgent killed and 2 injured.

24 August 2018: Unidentified armed men and police forces reportedly clashed exchanging gunfire at the Milk Market in Seybiano area, Hodan, Mogadishu. One person, alleged to be one of the armed men, was killed while another civilian bystander was killed in the confrontation.

25 August 2018: 4 Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers were reportedly killed when Al-Shabaab militiamen attacked the Daynuunay military base in Baidhabo district, Bay region. Two Al-Shabaab fighters were also killed in the attack, and several others injured. According to the report, Al-Shabaab forces managed to take control of the area for several minutes before being pushed out again.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 August 2018: Al-Shabab fighters in Lower Shabelle region reportedly attacked African Union forces travelling outside El Wareegow area near Marka town, sparking armed clashes. Injuries were reported but no fatalities were specified by the source.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 25 August 2018: A group of Puntland forces have reportedly attacked the bank in northern Galkaayo, demanding that salaries be paid. Protesting soldiers also blocked roads linking the bank to the rest of the town.

25 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers (SNA) have reportedly opened fire on a mini-bus full of civilians near Kulan Jarer village between Waajid and Xudur districts, killing at least 3 and injuring 7 others, and looting property in the vehicle. The source did not indicate why the soldiers opened fire.
25 August 2018: Somali National Soldiers engaged Al-Shabaab forces in the Burdhubo area in Gedo Region, resulting in the death of 7 AS militiamen and 2 Al-Shabaab leaders.
25 August 2018: Al Shabaab insurgents intercepted a convoy of 9 donkey carts carrying supplies to Waajid. They seized the carts and killed 4 drivers while 5 others fled.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 26 August 2018: US forces carried out an airstrike on Al Shabaab insurgents killing 3 in Gendershe town.
26 August 2018: Protests against government interference in Jubaland and Gedo region took place in Dhobley.
26 August 2018: Protests against the Somali Federal Government were held in Afmadow town.
26 August 2018: A Somali National Army soldier shot and killed a Tuk-tuk driver in Belet Weyne after a dispute at a checkpoint.
26 August 2018: Demonstrators gathered outside the Kooshin SNPF station took place after the killing of a Tuk-tuk driver. Main roads near the station were blocked.

26 August 2018: Al Shabaab (AS) fighters conducted a hit and run attack against a Somali National Army position in Hudur town. AS fighters shot, using small arms, towards the direction of the base. One SNA solder was injured in the attack.
26 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen killed a civilian male child in Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu.
26 August 2018: Islamic State gunmen claimed (via Amaq news) that they shot and killed a Somali National Police officer in Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
