column17: 26 August. Buried IED detonated as a NISA vehicle passed. 2 NISA soldiers were killed and 3 soldiers and 1 civilian injured.
26 August 2018: Al-Shabab fighters carried out a surprise attack on government forces in Bar Sanguni area on the outskirt of Kismayo in Lower Jubba Region. No info on casualties.
27 August 2018: Somali National Army Soldiers (SNA) have reportedly taken over Dhanaane town of Lower Shabelle after Al-Shabaab forces withdrew from the area.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 27 August 2018: Islamic State-linked gunmen have reportedly shot and killed a Somali intelligence officer in Wardhigley District, Mogadishu. The source did not provide additional details.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 27 August 2018: Joint Somali National Army and AMISOM forces conducted an operation against Al Shabaab insurgents in Marka town. During the fighting a Russian insurgent Abdi Nasir Asar-bajan was killed and 10 others captured.

27 August 2018: Protests by Hawadle sub-clan took place with civilians taking control of downtown Belet Weyne and blocking main roads. Negotiations between Hawadle and HiirShabelle took place to de-escalate the conflict.

27 August 2018: At least one woman (civilian) was confirmed injured when an explosive device fitted to a vehicle belonging to a security official exploded in Mogadisho. Al-Shabaab is suspected of carrying out the attack.

28 August 2018: Clan fighting was reported in the Qalanqale village on the outskirts of Dhusamareb town, Cadaado Gulguduud region, over a dispute involving grazing land. Injuries were reported but the clashes reportedly caused no fatalities. According to the source, local clan elders have now intervened and stopped the fighting.
28 August 2018: Al-Shabaab linked gunmen have reportedly attacked government forces in the Hilewa district of Mogadishu, prompting clashes. No info on casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 28 August 2018: According to pro- Al-Shabaab sources, fighters loyal to the group attacked an Ethiopian military base in Garbaharaay town, Gedo region, using gunfire and mortar rounds. Pro-Al-Shabaab forces claim to have killed ""all those aboard"" a military vehicle targeted by the mortar fire. Helicopters reportedly landed in near the base on the next morning to evacuate wounded soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly ambushed a convoy of Somali and African Union troops as they left Marka town for Mogadishu. According to the pro-al-Shabaab source, 4 soldiers were killed and several others wounded.

28 August 2018: An unidentified clan militia attacked a police station in Belet Weyne, seeking revenge for a Tuk-Tuk driver killed by a police officer a day before. At least 3 people were killed and two others injured in the clashes.
28 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated a prominent civilian Mowliid Adan in Belet Weyne Town. Gunmen fled before the security forces arrived.

28 August 2018: Somali National Army special forces have reportedly killed 10 Al-Shabaab fighters, including a commander, in Gandarshe area in Lower Shabelle region. No SNA soldiers were reportedly killed in the fighting. According to the source, the killed commander was identified as Sheikh Abdinasir Asarbajan, a Russian National fighting with Al-Shabaab.
29 August 2018: Al Shabaab militants attack on SNAF convoy passing through Bulalow village, Afgooye, using an IED bomb. 2 killed and 2 injured.
29 August 2018: A Somali National Police officer shot dead a tuk-tuk driver after a dispute in Shibis area of Mogadishu. The perpetrator fled the scene.
29 August 2018: Protesters blocked the streets in Karan, Mogadishu, denouncing the killing of a Tuk-tuk driver by a police officer earlier.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 29 August 2018: A US drone strike on an area located 40 km southwest of Mogadishu reportedly killed three Al-Shabaab fighters. The source specified that no civilians were killed or injured in the strike. Wanla Weyn given as an approximate location to the strike as per the description from the source.

29 August 2018: Al Shabaab fighters storm the residence of a Somali National Army officer in Xawaadley. The officer is injured following an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters retreat from the area after burning two military vehicles.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 29 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants set off an IED device targeting Burundi AMISOM troops as they passed through Sokolwa, Balcad district. One of the vehicle's screen's shattered, no other casualties reported.

29 August 2018: Two soldiers were killed and three others injured by an explosion that detonated as their vehicle passed in the Hodan district of the capital Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

30 August 2018: Al-Shabaab forces reportedly attacked a Somali National Army position in Afgoye town, near midnight. Three soldiers were killed and 7 injured during the fighting. According to the source, government troops were able to push the attackers back, ending the fighting. Among the dead was the son of the former state minister of the Somali Presidential Palace. State forces later issued a report, claiming to have killed four Al-Shabaab fighters during the gunfight.
30 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinate a civilian in Laascaanood town. No info on motive.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 30 August 2018: Unidentified fighter jets (US or Kenyan) fire four missiles towards unidentified al Shabaab positions in Jilib. No casualties were reported. SOMTEL and HORMUD telecommunications masts were damaged.
30 August 2018: Unidentified militants reportedly fired four mortar rounds, injuring 3 people (presumed to be civilians) near the presidential palace in Warta Nabada district, Mogadishu.

30 August 2018: Gunmen linked to the Al-Shabaab movement reportedly attacked a Somali National Army commander's house in Hawadley district, located around 22 km east of Balcad district, Middle Shabelle Region. Heavy gunfire rocked the town for some hours. The commander was reported to have been slightly injured in the attack.

30 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen and Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers clashed for around an hour in the town of Marka, Jilibka Marka area. The source did not publish information on casualties.

31 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly killed two civilian shop owners near the Maqayqa military base, Afgooye district. One of the shop owners was reportedly beheaded by the group. This follows heavy clashes the night before with Somali army soldiers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 31 August 2018: AMISOM troops posted in the Heliwa district of Mogadishu have reportedly shot dead a taxi driver after being targeted by an IED bomb in the area. The source did not provide additional information as to the source of the bomb.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 31 August 2018: Unidentified warplanes (US or Kenyan) carried out an airstrike on Al Shabaab positions near Bu'aale. Casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 31 August 2018: Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange mortar and artillery fire along the frontline near Qod Gaboobe. No casualties were reported.
31 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants hurl a grenade at the police headquarters in Waaberi district, Mogadishu. No casualties reported.
31 August 2018:Al Shabaab remote controlled IED exploded under the car carrying the Shabelle Deputy Governor in Dharkenley , injuring 2 soldiers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 31 August 2018: Al Shabaab IED attack on AMISOM (Djiboutian) forces near Bulo Burto. Insurgents claimed to have killed 3 soldiers.

31 August 2018: A Somali National Army vehicle was targeted with a landmine blast, near the outskirts of Afgooye town, Lower Shabelle region. According to a local witness, the blast occurred in Wanlaweyn area when it was hit by a blast. The driver (a soldier), and a woman (civilian) were killed, while two others were wounded. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
31 August 2018: A Somali National Army soldier reportedly shot and killed a rickshaw (Bajaj) driver in Mogadishu's Yaaqshid district. No further details were provided by the source.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 31 August 2018: AMISOM troops posted in the Heliwa district of Mogadishu have reportedly shot dead a taxi driver after being targeted by an IED bomb in the area.

Early September (likely), clashes between rival tribes were reported in Dumay area in Sool Region. According to the source, ""recent"" clashes resulted in the death of 10 people, and a regional MP in Sool accused the Somaliland administration of fueling the fighting.

1 September 2018: Jubaland and SNAF (43 Brigade) forces launch a hit-and-run assault on an al Shabaab position near Kobon town, Lower Jubba. Five IED cashes were discovered and subsequently destroyed. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: At least three soldiers were reportedly wounded in an explosion targeting Djiboutian troops in Buloburde town's bridge, Hiiraan region. Unknown attacker.

2 September 2018: At least three Somali soldiers and two children were killed and over ten others were injured after a car bomb exploded near a Quranic school in Hawlwadag district, Mogadishu. According to witnesses, a suicide bomber drove an explosive laden car into the district headquarters. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack. The fatality count includes the suicide bomber.

2 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen attacked a SWSPF convoy returning from an operation in Togerhoos. Four SWSPF soldiers were injured during the ambush. Further clashes saw Al Shabaab regain control of Togerhoos.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 2 September 2018: Multiple explosions reportedly targeted Ethiopian troops in Garbaharey town, Gedo region. According to the source, one of the blasts occurred as Ethiopian troops were trying to defuse a landmine, leading to ""fatalities and injuries"". Unknown fatalities coded as 10
2 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate an elder in Tarabela Sheikh Ibrahim, Daynile. The assailants escaped. The motives behind the incident are unknown.

2 September 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen reportedly assassinated two Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in the Hamar Jadiid area of Warta Nabada, Mogadishu. Both soldiers were armed at the time of the attack.
2 September 2018:Unidentified militants fitted a car used by the head of Sinka Dheer MECP with explosives. The explosive detonated as the cas passed through Daynile, Mogadishu, causing injuries.

2 September 2018: Police forces arrived to the scene of a violent interaction between a government tax collector and Al-Shabaab-linked gunmen in the Bakaara market of Mogadishu and opened fire, killing two civilians and wounding four others. The source did not specify why the police officers shot the civilians.
2 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked gunmen reportedly shot dead a government tax collector and his security body-guard in the Bakara market, Mogadishu.

3 September 2018: Hawadle and Habargidir clan militias clash over a land dispute near Banyaaley, Beledweyn in Hiiran. One Hawadle militiaman was killed and a second injured. Both clans are reportedly mobilizing for further conflict.
3 September 2018: Hiirshabelle forces attack an illegal checkpoint set by clan militiamen near Boorow, Jowhar district. One militiaman was killed.
3 September 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked gunmen assassinate a Clan elder in Hawl Wadaag, Mogadishu. Another civilian was injured during the attack.
3 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a former civil servant of the Hiirshabelle administration in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu. The assailants escaped the scene.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 3 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have attacked and killed three Ethiopian soldiers in the Diinsoor town area, Bay Region. An additional four soldiers were also wounded in the attack.
3 September 2018: Police forces opened fire on football fans after they threw stones at security forces. 1 person was killed.
3 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen conduct a drive-by shooting in Karan's Jamhuuriya neighborhood (Mogadishu). Four people, including two nearby SNPF officers, were killed. The assailants escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 4 September 2018: Armed clashes were reported between two groups of Puntland police forces. No further info. At least one officer was wounded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 4 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked AMISOM troops in Qoryoley town, located in the southern region of Lower Shabelle. According to the source, Al-Shabaab fighters were able to gain control of the town temporarily overnight, before pulling out the next morning. AMISOM troops later reported the event, claiming to have repelled the attack on their base and confirming to have killed two Al-Shabaab militiamen during the clashes.

Unidentified military airplanes reportedly fired up to 5 missiles at Al-Shabaab targets in Bu'ale town, Middle Juba region. According to the source, an unspecified number of Al-Shabaab fighters were killed in the strikes. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
5 September 2018: Suspected Al Shabaab gunmen attacked and killed four Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers and two civilians in Mogadishu's Karaan District.
5 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated an Somali National Army soldier who was travelling on a motorbike through Waaberi district, Mogadishu.
5 September 2018: A Habar-yonis/Sacad Yonis camel herder shot and killed a woman from Habar-Geeko/Biciide near Elaweyne town. No further info.
5 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab militants hurl a hand grenade inside General Gordon barracks in Hodan district. Two Somali National Army soldiers were injured. The assailants escaped.
5 September 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked militants reportedly detained 60 Elders from the Galguduud region after a dispute over blood money arose.

6 September 2018: The killing of a Baharsame clansman set off clashes between Dhulbahante/Qayaad and Baharsame sub clan militias in Dharkeyn-Genyo and Dhammay villages, Togdheer region. 11 militiamen were killed and 20 injured as a result of the outbreak of violence. Fatalities spread across two locations.

6 September 2018: The killing of a Baharsame clansman set off clashes between Dhulbahante/Qayaad and Baharsame sub clan militias in Dharkeyn-Genyo and Dhammay villages, Togdheer region. 11 militiamen were killed and 20 injured as a result of the outbreak of violence. Fatalities spread across two locations.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 6 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen reportedly shot and killed an intelligence officer in the capital, Mogadishu.

6 September 2018: Two local militias clash over control for a ship that mistakenly anchored near Gala Ood; south of Eyl in Nugaal region. The motives behind the anchoring and resulting casualty figures are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 7 September 2018: US forces and allied Somali specially trained soldiers conducted a raid on the house of Somalia's First President ""Aden Abdulle Osman Daar"" located near Janale Town, lower Shabelle region. Gunfire reportedly damaged the house during the clashes, although it is unclear exactly who the attacking forces were firing at. No injuries were reported, and the Somali government has since issued an apology for the attack.
7 September 2018: Armed clashes between Dhulbahante/Qayaad and Baharsame sub clan militias continued in Dhammay leaving 4 Barsame killed.

7 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards a group of Somali National Army soldiers in front of the Hormud building in Baidoa's Isha neighbourhood. One soldier was injured.

7 September 2018: Armed clashes between national security forces and unidentified militants were reported in the Huriwaa area of the capital, Mogadishu, after gunmen attacked a security point in the area. No info on casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 7 September 2018: An explosion reportedly targeted AMISOM troops camped in the Shalambod area of Marka district, Lower Shabelle. An unspecified number of African AMISOM troops were killed and injured when the TAW infantry vehicle they were riding was struck by the explosion. Unknown fatalities coded as 10

7 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attack a Somali National Army checkpoint located near Abdi Waceyl Cinema in Heliwa district. Media reports suggest three people including a soldier and two bystanders were killed.
8 September 2018: Unidentified warplanes (likey from an outside power) reportedly hit Al-Shabaab targets in Jilib area of Middle Jubba. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
8 September 2018: Three municipal council officers were reportedly injured by a blast that rocked the Warta Nabada district of the capital, Mogadishu. No further info.

8 September 2018: At least 5 Somali National Army soldiers (SNA) were reportedly killed during an attack by Al-Shabaab militants on their base in Baidoa town, Bay region. According to the source, attacking militants managed to temporarily overrun the base, seizing weapons before fleeing.
8 September 2018: Residents of Lasanod staged a demonstration demanding the cessation of clashes in the area.
8 September 2018: A government soldier shot and injured a civilian man in Buulo Makiino, Kulmis neighborhood of Jowhar town.
8 September 2018: A prominent businessman handling charcoal in Kismayo town was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Dalsan village, Kismayo.
8 September 2018: Armed Bahararsame Dhulbahante fired shot at a convoy carrying other Dhulbahante subclan elders traveling to Dhammay. No injuries were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 8 September 2018: Ugandan troops (AMISOM) fire several mortar rounds towards a group of al Shabaab militants located approximately 4km north-west of Arabiska, Afgooye. One UPDF soldier collapsed and died over undetermined motives.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 8 September 2018: Somaliland and Puntland forces exchanged heavy artillery for a couple of hours near God-Qaboobe village.
8 September 2018: Youth and women's groups in Garbaharay town protested against the Somali National Government's support of Ethiopian troops in the area.

8 September 2018: A convoy of security forces escorting the Burhakaba District commissioner was reportedly ambushed by Al-Shabaab militants as they traveled the road linking Burhakaba and Baido towns, Bay region. A government official (head finances for Burhakaba) was seriously wounded when an RPG shell also hit one of the vehicles in the convoy. No fatalities were reported.

8 September 2018: Troops travelling to assist Somali government soldiers under attack by Al-Shabaab fighters in Makudo checkpoint, Baidoa town, were hit by a roadside IED causing ""unknown casualties"".

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 8 September 2018: A bomb attack set by suspected Al-Shabaab militants reportedly detonated in Bulo Burte town, killing 2 Djiboutian soldiers and wounding two others, including one Somali National Army soldier. This comes on the same day as an armed attack on a Djiboutian base, which ended in injuries.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 8 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Djiboutian) in Bulo Burto town, Hiiran region. The source mentioned that a medical helicopter later landed at the base to remove soldiers that were presumably injured in the attack. No fatalities were mentioned by the source.
9 September 2018: An IED concealed in a wheelbarrow detonates on Sinai Market, Yaqshiid, Mogadishu. At least one civilian is injured by the blast.
9 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a base manned by Somali National Army (SNA) Soldiers between Mahaday and Jowhar towns, Middle Shabelle region, killing 2 soldiers.
9 September 2018: Somali National Army forces battled Al-Shabaab fighters on the road near Basra town. Casualties are unknown.

column9: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Prison Guards
column17: 9 September 2018: A prison officer and a woman were shot and seriously wounded by unknown assailants in Netco area of Bossaso. It is unclear if the prison officer was armed at the time of the attack - indications suggest he was not.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 9 September 2018: A government soldier shot and killed a NISA soldier in Afgoye town after an unknown dispute. The perpetrator was later apprehended by security forces.

9 September 2018: A charcoal seller was found dead at Goracdhere grazing area (c. 07 km north west of Bula Geduld Village and c. 30 km north east of Kismayo Town). No further info. Approximate coordinates used.

9 September 2018: Al Shabaab attacked an Police checkpoint in Heliwa's Suuq Xaloota before a patrol of Somali soldiers intervened, killing 1 and injuring 3 insurgents who were detained. 1 soldier was killed and 1 injured.
9 September 2018: An IED concealed in a wheelbarrow exploded in the Siinay vegetable market, Wardhigley district. 4 people, including municipal tax collecting officers, were wounded.
9 September 2018: An IED buried in the Biyo Dengaka neighborhood livestock market, Heliwa, exploded. Al-Shabaab fighters later claimed responsibility for the incident.
9 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated Ministry of Planning Official Hassan Omar Ganey near his home in Hodan, Mogadishu. Gunmen fled the scene.

9 September 2018: On the evening of the 9th of September, a group of Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a military base manned by Somali National Army soldiers in Hilawaa district of the capital, sparking armed clashes. According to the source the attackers were able to take control of the base following the exchange of gunfire. No info on casualties.
10 September 2018: A convoy escorting SouthWest state MP and top commander was targeted by a landmine blast at Hawo Abdi area. Casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 10 September 2018: Unidentified warplanes (US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike on suspected AS base near Jana Cabdalle, Afmadow district . Several missiles were fired which destroyed the suspected AS location. Casualties from the attack were unknown. A second source (late breaking) reported 18 deaths.
10 September 2018: An Omar Mohamud pastoralist was killed by Habargidir pastoralists in Ballibusle, Mudug, as part of a clan-related dispute.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 September 2018: AMISOM forces posted in Aw Dheegle fire artillery rounds towards an al Shabaab HVT meeting held in Bariire. Al-Shabaab commander Moalim Hashi Jinow was killed.
10 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attack a Somali National Army checkpoint in Hodan district. A civilian and one Al-Shabaab gunmen were injured in the clash.

Non-violent activity: 10 September 2018: The leaders of Somalia's of Galmudug, Hirshabelle, Jubbaland, Puntland and South West federal states have reportedly suspended relations with the Somali Central government. According to the source, the move comes after leaders of the respective states accused the central authority of failing to handle the country's security and governance challenges effectively. This marked the conclusion to a conference in Kismayo.
10 September 2018: An explosive-laden vehicle driven by an Al-Shabaab militant reportedly rammed into the Hodan district headquarters, killing 6 civilians and injuring 16 others.
10 September 2018: Amaq News Agency (Pro-IS) releases a video depicting the assassination of a Puntland Customs soldier by Islamic State gunmen in Bossaso.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 10 September 2018: US-backed ""Danab"" special forces have taken control of Basra and Baghdadi villages in Lower and Middle Shabelle, respectively. 7 people were killed, three AS fighters and four prisoners.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 10 September 2018: US-backed ""Danab"" special forces have taken control of Basra and Baghdadi villages in Lower and Middle Shabelle, respectively. According to the source, ""several"" Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the clashes that ended in their defeat. Fatalities coded as 10 and spread across two locations. *Note- Baghdadi is located near the Balcad town.

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 11 September 2018: According to a pro-Al-Shabaab website, militants loyal to the group clashed with Somali National Army (SNA) forces backed by US soldiers in the town of Basra, Afgooye district. No info on casualties. *note, Somali government soldiers claim to have captured the town the day before, while some al-Shabaab sources seem to indicate that they still hold the town.
11 September 2018: A senior Al-Shabaab operative named Abukar Hassan Adde, also known as Sayyid Abukar, was killed during a firefight with Somali police in the Heliwa area of Mogadishu.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 11 September 2018: A landmine explosion reportedly targeted a convoy of Djiboutian troops as they made their way through Beledweyne town, Hiiran region. According to the source, the explosion caused ""minimal damages"" and no injuries or fatalities were reported. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

11 September 2018: A landmine explosion reportedly targeted the convoy of the commander of Afgoye District police as it passed through Hawo Abdi village, Afgoye district. Several soldiers in the convoy were reportedly wounded but none were killed. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

11 September 2018: 5 coal merchants were reportedly shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Bulo-Gadud area of Lower Jubba region. Al-Shabaab has banned the trade of coal in the area, however, this attack could not be specifically linked to the group.

12 September 2018: Gunmen with suspected links to the Al-Shabaab group reportedly shot dead a civilian in the Bakaara market. Security forces later arrested several people with connections to the attack.
12 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked militants reportedly attacked Somali National Army forces in Marka town, sparking an exchange of gunfire. No info on casualties.

12 September 2018: A gunfight erupted as a Somali government tax minister and a group of soldiers attempted to enforce a tax on a quarry in El Ma'an village, Middle Shabelle region. According to the source, arguments escalated into gunfire between the soldiers accompanying the minister and armed guards at the quarry, leaving at 4 dead and 5 others injured.
12 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked gunmen reportedly shot dead a ministry official, Omar Hasan Ganey, in Hodan district of the capital Mogadishu.

12 September 2018: A pickup truck carrying a group of Somali National Army (SNA) Soldiers was reportedly hit by a roadside bomb as it traveled through Alamada town, killing and injuring an unknown number. Unknown fatalities coded as 10. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the bombing.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 12 September 2018: An al-Shabab figure was killed, while several others were wounded when clashes erupted between the militants and troops from the Somali National Intelligence Security Agency in the Mubarak area of Lower Shabelle Region. Al-Shabaab forces later claimed to have recovered the bodies of two soldiers who were also killed in the fighting.

13 September 2018: According to a pro-Al-Shabaab source, fighters from the group attacked two bases belonging to Somali National Army troops in the Suuq Holoha (livestock market) area of the capital, Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab forces claim to have killed ""several"" soldiers during the clashes, and stated that they had overrun the two bases and taken weapons. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
13 September 2018: Al-Shabaab forces have reportedly taken control of the Tayeeglow town, Bakool region, after Somali state forces withdrew. Exact date of the event is unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly shelled an AMISOM base located in the Busaar village, Ceel Waaq district of Gedo. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
13 September 2018: A police officer was killed and a second wounded after Al-Shabaab fighters attacked their position in Heliwa district, Mogadishu.
13 September 2018: Gunmen linked to the al-Shabaab group have reportedly shot dead two government employees who worked for the foreign and planning ministries in Hodan district, Mogadishu.
13 September 2018: Gunmen linked to the al-Shabaab group have reportedly shot dead a Somali military official in the Elaysha Biyaha area, just outside of the capital Mogadishu.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 September 2018: The United States Air forces reportedly conducted an airstrike against Al-Shabaab fighters who were pushing forward to attack US-backed Somali forces in the Mubarak area of Lower Shabelle, resulting in the death of two and the injury of a third. *Note fighting occurred between Al-Shabaab forces and US-backed forces in the same area the day before.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 14 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have killed and injured an unspecified number of AMISOM troops after targeting their vehicle with a land mine as it passed near the Jowhar airport, near Jowhar town. Unknown fatalities coded as 10
14 September 2018: A suspected Al-Shabaab member shot and killed a civilian as he exited the mosque in Baardheere town, Gedo region. No info on why the victim was targeted.

14 September 2018: The vehicle of a local government official was reportedly targeted by an IED bomb blast that had been attached to the vehicle in Aargada Madina, Wadajiir town, in Mogadishu. The owner of the vehicle reportedly survived the blast and no injuries were reported.
14 September 2018: An explosion detonated just outside of the Amal Bank area near the Bakaara market area, injuring one civilian. No further info.
15 September 2018: Three Somali National Army soldiers were reportedly killed by attacking Al-Shabaab fighters in Tihsile village in Afgoye district, Lower Shabelle region.

15 September 2018: Somali federal lawmaker Mohamed Mursal Borow was seriously injured and another person (the driver) killed when an explosion targeted their vehicle near the national theatre in Mogadishu. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

15 Sep, 2018: Two groups of SWSPF clashed in Berdale town over money collected from a command post they control. One civilian was reportedly killed and two others wounded during the exchange of gunfire.

15 September 2018: Protesters gathered outside of the Berbera Regional Police Headquarters after the death of the Police Commander of Abdaal district in a traffic accident. The protesters insisted that he had been assassinated.

15 September 2018: Members of the Boqolhore and Geeledle sub-clans clashed over a land dispute in Dhujo village (3 km north east of Tiyeeglow - approx. Coordinates used). One member from Boqolhore clan was killed.

15 September 2018: A group of fishermen reportedly protested in Lawya Caddo against foreign vessels fishing in the area. Local police arrived and reassured the protesters that the vessels would not be allowed to remain.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 September 2018: A Landmine reportedly destroyed an AU vehicle and injured two civilians on outskirts of Garbaharey District of Gedo region. No group has claimed responsibility.

15 September 2018: Members of the police force reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers at a checkpoint in Kahda district (Dharkenley), Mogadishu, killing 2 and wounding two others. Police forces took control of the checkpoint following the attack. According to the source, the reasoning behind the attack was that police forces accused the SNA soldiers of extorting money from sand trucks passing through the area.

15 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) troops in Bulo Foolyi area of Afgooye, sparking an exchange of gunfire that lasted for about 30 minutes. The attackers were pushed back.
15 September 2018: Unidentified armed men have reportedly shot dead two young college graduates in the town of Bosasso. It is unclear why they were targeted.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 15 September 2018: Ethiopian state TV (FANA) has reported that airstrikes conducted by its military killed 70 Al-Shabaab fighters that were reportedly about to attack on of their bases in Lowi-Erjeeg Village (c. 57 km to the South of Teiglow - approx coordinates used). Two vehicles packed with weapons were also reportedly destroyed.

16 September 2018: A police officer was shot and killed by an unidentified armed man in Tuurjale area located south east of Bossaso town. Islamic State-linked groups later claimed responsibility for the attack. A number of people have been arrested.

16 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed a mini bus travelling on a road between Afgoye and Wanleleyn district. Soldiers aboard the minibus shot at the attackers. One civilian female passenger was slightly injured in the event, and the attackers retreated.
16 September 2018: Men with suspected links to Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Marka town.

column9: Warsangeli Clan Group (Somalia); Dhulbahante Clan Group (Somalia)
column17: 16 September. Two men hailing Warsangeli and Dhulbahante sub-clans were shot and wounded by a police officer due to a personal dispute in Afar Irdood area of Bossaso.
16 September 2018: Government troops reportedly shot at a minibus in Marka town, killing the driver and injuring a passenger.

16 Sep 2018: A mentally ill woman was found dead in South Galkayo. Reports suggest that the woman was sexually assaulted before she was killed by the attackers. Three suspects have been arrested following the incident.

16 September 2018: Local protesters protested in Dharkenley district against the killing of two soldiers by police forces at a checkpoint the day before. They accused the soldiers of setting up an illegal checkpoint.
16 September 2018: Armed men shot and killed a civilian as he exited a mosque in Wardhigley district, Mogadishu. No info on motivation.

16 September 2018: Pro-Al-Shabaab sources claimed IED blast killed 7 Jubbaland regional state soldiers as they drew water in the village of Bulo Gadud. The blasts also destroyed two water tanker trucks belonging to the soldiers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 16 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militants have reportedly shelled Kenyan troops in a base in Buusaar in Elwak District, Gedo.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 16 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed Kenyan forces traveling from Tabta/Qoqani headed to Dhobley at Dalbio area (c. 50 km east of Dhobley town - approx. coordinates used). The group claim to have killed and injured 15 soldiers. Fatalities coded as 7. The attack began with a bomb attack which was followed by an exchange of gunfire.

17 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed a convoy of Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers heading to Mogadishu from Marka town. The ambush took place in Gendershe area of Marka town, and gunfire lasted for about an hour.

17 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly conducted a hit-and-run attack against joint Somali Police and National Army soldiers in the Buur Xakaba area of Bay region. No casualties were reported.
17 September 2018: Somaliland regional coordinator for the Somaliland Ministry of Public Works was stabbed to death by an unidentified attacker in Ainabo for unknown reasons.
17 September 2018: An armed Habar-Yonis/Sacad-Yonis man shot and killed a Habar-Jecho/Reer clanswoman in Elafweyn following a dispute over grazing land. The man was arrested and taken to prison.

17 September 2018: An IED planted by AS militants reportedly exploded in the Bulo Nagaad area in Marka district, killing two Somali National Army soldiers. A third soldier was also wounded in the blast.
17 September 2018: Unidentified armed men shot and injured a senior staff member in the Amal Bank in Bakara market, Mogadishu. The motives behind the attack are not clear.
17 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier reportedly shot and killed a rickshaw driver in Karan district, Mogadishu, after a dispute.

17 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Jubbaland security forces in Bohol village, Gedo, sparking clashes that resulted in the death of 7 Jubbaland soldiers and 5 AS fighters, and the wounding of 5 others. Al-Shabaab took control of the village following the clashes.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 17 September 2018: According to a a pro-Al-Shabaab source, militants belonging to the group set a bomb targeting Kenyan forces as they left Afmadow town, lower Jubba, killing 4 soldiers and wounding three others.
17 September 2018: At least one person was killed, and a second injured, when unknown armed men opened fire within a Qat market in Jalaqsi town, Hiiran District.

18 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers have taken control of Dhanaane, Jilib, Gendershe, and Ow Maki towns after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces. According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.
18 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier was killed and a second injured when Al-Shabaab fighters opened fire on them in Hawo Taako village, Beletweyne.

18 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers have taken control of Dhanaane, Jilib, Gendershe, and Ow Maki towns after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces. According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.

18 September 2018: An armed clansman from the Cabdalla sub clan of Hawadle clan was shot and killed by a man from the Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle, in Xaawa Taako village in Beletweyne. The motive behind the attack was reportedly clan revenge.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 18 September 2018: Armed men with suspected links to Al-Shabaab shot and killed a NISA soldier in the Bakaara market of Mogadishu using pistols.

18 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier shot his rifle into traffic in an attempt to keep the lines moving as cars backed up near the Ex-Cinema Nasri in Hodan district, Mogadishu . A nine-year-old girl was killed and three other children wounded. One of the wounded children later died in the hospital.
18 September 2018: A government soldier reportedly shot into a crowd in the Karan area of the capital, Mogadishu, resulting in a number of civilian injuries.

18 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers have taken control of Dhanaane, Jilib, Gendershe, and Ow Maki towns after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces. According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.

18 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers have taken control of Dhanaane, Jilib, Gendershe, and Ow Maki towns after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces. According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 18 September 2018: Jubaland Darwish troops have attacked an Al-Shabaab position in Belet Xaawo, sparking clashes that led to the death of 11 Al-Shabaab fighters and a reported 10 members of the Darwish troops. Darwish troops have now taken control of the area, which is located in an unspecified area south of Belet Xaawo.

18 September 2018: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jubbaland state military forces who were traveling through Abdi Birole village, located some 60 km west of Kismayo town. 10 soldiers were reportedly killed initially as their vehicle ran over a land mine planted by the Al-Shabaab militants.

column16: Radio Mogadishu; AFRICOM; Calamada; Shabelle Media Network; Undisclosed Source
column17: 18 September 2018: Foreign fighter jets have reportedly bombed areas of Middle Shabelle region destroying the former Sakow district health center and a second Al-Shabaab controlled building. Al-Shabaab sources claimed that three children were killed, and blamed the strikes on US-operated drones. The US air forces refuted the claim, stating that they had not conducted an airstrike since the 11 September. Radio Mogadishu, which supports the internationally recognized government, stated that the strike killed 12 Al-Shabaab fighters and leaders as they conducted a meeting. Fatalities coded at the most conservative point.
19 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters shot and killed a khat dealer in Taragente area (c. 35 km south of Beletweyne town (approx. Coordinates using a description from the source).

19 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier was killed and two others injured in an IED blast that hit their vehicle as it traveled through Kali-Cafimad located at KM 67 in Marka district. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.
19 September 2018: Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian in the Hawl Wadaag neighborhood, Mogadishu. No further details.Ãƒ'Ã‚Â¬aa'Â¬

19 September 2018: Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers claim to have killed 30 Al-Shabaab fighters during an operation in Doolow district, Gedo region. Al-Shabaab forces had ordered locals to bring livestock to a central location for taxation.
19 September 2018: A reporter was stabbed to death in Galkaco town, Mudug region, by an unidentified group of youth. The reason behind the stabbing is not clear.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 20 September 2018: An IED targeted an AMISOM (Kenyan) convoy traveling from Faafax Dhuun village to Giriley, killing two soldiers and wounding two others.

20 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali National Army soldiers in the livestock market area of Heliwa district, Mogadishu, sparking clashes that lasted around 20 minutes. One civilian was wounded.

20 September 2018: An explosion reportedly targeted Somali National Army (SNA) forces as they traveled through km 60 village on their way to km 50 base from Marka town. 4 soldiers were reportedly killed, and an unknown number injured in the explosion. Among the dead was Captain Ali Dhuh and Abdulle, a senior military official.

20 September 2018: Suleiman clan/Habargidir and Wagardhac clan/Marhan clashed at the Dacdeer district of Galmudug. 9 people were killed and 16 others injured. Reports issued by Goobjog suggest that the clashes erupted after Ethiopian-backed Liyu police left the area, leaving a vacuum in administration.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 20 September 2018: A Galmudug soldier was killed and two others wounded after their convoy was ambushed by armed clan militiamen on the main road of Bali-Higis neighborhood (around 10 km north of Adaado). The victims were members of the Habar Gidir clan.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 21 September 2018: US Africa Command reportedly conducted an airstrike defending US special forces and allied Somali troops in an area located 50 miles North-west of Kismayo, Lower Jubba region. 18 Al-Shabaab fighters were reported killed in the strike, with two others killed by small arms fire from forces on the ground.
21 September 2018: An elder of Warsangeli Adan Siciid sub clan was shot and killed by armed militias in an area between Baran and Hadaaftimo of Sanaag region.
21 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters established a checkpoint along the Mahaday-Ceel Baraf road, and shot at civilians who resisted attempts to extort money. No further info.
21 September 2018: A senior traditional leader, Sultan Hassan Ali Jibril was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Badhan town (Approx., 120km east of Erigavo of Sanaag region).
21 September 2018: A senior traditional leader was killed by unknown militiamen in Badhan town, Sanaag region while on his way to attend a launch ceremony.
21 September 2018: Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a senior police officer at Suuqa Beerta vicinity in Hamarjajab district.
21 September 2018: Government forces shot from a technical vehicle into a car driven by an official from Banadir regional administration in Hodan district. The owner of the vehicle was killed.

21 September 2018: Unidentified armed assailants using pistols shot and killed a female student as she was in class at the university of Somalia near Bar-Asha at Bar-Ubah neighbourhood in Wardhidgley district.

22 September 2018: Somaliland military forces clashed with a former Somali-land Army defecter, Gamaal Baaxad, of Habar Honis/Muse Ismail clan in the area of Haldhagan (located 37 km NE of Ceerigaabo). Some injuries among Baaxad.
23 September 2018: Unidentified armed men reportedly shot and killed a civilian in the Bakara market area, Mogadishu.

23 September 2018: After the assassination of a civilian by unidentified armed men in the Bakara market (event coded separately), police engaged the assailants. The armed men threw a grenade, injuring 5 people, including 3 policemen.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 23 September 2018: Puntland security forces have killed 12 Al-Shabaab fighters during clashes in the Af Madow mountain range.

23 September 2018: Two Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers were wounded when Al-Shabaab fighters attacked their position in of Qoryoley town, Lower Shabelle region. Al-Shabaab sources later claimed to have killed 4 soldiers (fatalities coded at the most conservative estimate).
23 September 2018: Unidentified militants reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) troops in Ambareeso town, Barawe district, setting off armed clashes. No injuries were reported.

23 September 2018: An IED explosion set by Al-Shabaab militants hit a military convoy of Somali government troops near Dhanaane settlement, coastal road, Marka town, killing four government soldiers and wounding three others.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 23 September 2018: Puntland and Somaliland forces in Tukaraq area of Sool region traded artillery shells for around 30 minutes. Two Puntland soldiers were injured.
23 September 2018: Government army forces attacked armed men attempting to extort money from residents constructing a house in Kahda area, Mogadishu. One man was killed during the ensuing gunfire.

24 September 2018: A total of 35 al-Shabab militants were killed and several others wounded after clashes in Qoriyole between Somali National Army troops and Al-Shabaab forces. At least one Somali soldier was killed as well during the gunfight.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 24 September 2018: Unidentified militants opened fire on the security convoy of President Abdiweli Mohamed Ali as it passed through Bossasso, leading to the death of one soldier and the wounding of two civilians. Brig Farah Galangoli, who was in charge of security in Nugal region was dismissed following the incident. Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack
24 September 2018: A ciilian man was reportedly shot and wounded by a police officer when he failed to obey instructions near the Masjidul Rahma, Bari region.

24 September 2018: Al-Shabaab shot dead  three truck drivers in Waro-rako grazing area (C. 25km south east of Hoosingo village, approx. coordinates used). 4 other truck drivers were injured by the militatants. Sources suggest that the drivers may have been involved in charcoal trade, which is currently banned by Al-Shabaab.
24 September 2018: Two police officers conducting route safety were shot dead by unidentified armed men near Gaaca area, a village in Bossasso. A passenger was also wounded.
24 September 2018: Unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle shot and killed two electoral delegates male and female at Ceel Qode and Daahisoy villages, in Afgoye town.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 24 September 2018: Somaliland forces clashed with an advance team of Puntland soldiers near Tuko Raq, setting off a second round of artillery fire in Godqaboobe, Sool (coded separately).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 24 September 2018: Somaliland forces clashed with an advance team of Puntland soldiers near Tuko Raq, setting off a second round of artillery fire in Godqaboobe, Sool (coded separately).
24 September 2018: A Somali National Army (SNA) soldier shot dead an armed thief who tried to rob him in Yaqshid district, Mogadishu.
24 September 2018: A vehicle rigged with explosives exploded in Afgoye, Dharkenley district. Unknown perpetrator at time of reporting.

25 September 2018: A report issue by Garawe online stated that a bomb attack hit a police checkpoint in Afgoye town, lower shabeelle, killing one police officer and wounding 2 others. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.
25 September 2018: 5 people including a woman, boy and one of five armed men were injured by security forces  after a gunfight erupted over a land dispute in Israac village in North Galkayo.

25 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed two donkey carts that were carrying food commodities and other materials near Walaq village, SW of Wajid town. Two people were killed and the food supplies were burned.

25 September 2018: An improvised explosive device targeting Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers exploded in Marka town. Al-Shabaab militants and the soldiers exchanged gunfire following the explosion. One soldier was killed and a second wounded. Al-Shabaab forces claim to have killed 5 soldiers in the event. Fatalities coded as lowest estimate.
25 September 2018: Government forces manning Bar-Smaâ€šÃ„Ã´il checkpoint opened fire on a vehicle carrying khat in Afgoye town. The driver was killed and a passenger wounded.
25 September 2018: Unidentified armed men shot and a killed Somtel Telecommunication company employee near Masjid Hareed neighbourhood, Howlwadag district.

26 September 2018: Police forces opened fire on a deaf civilian who failed to follow police commands in the central market of Bossaso town, Bari region. The victim was hospitalized following the event.
26 September 2018: Police forces shot and injured a man at the main roundabout in Garowe town.
26 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked militants ambushed a convoy carrying khat in Mooda Mooda village, Bay region. 2 Somali National Army soldiers who were escorting the convoy were wounded.

26 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters abducted 4 civilians near Baadcade village (approx. 10km NW of Baidoa, approximate coordinates used). The civilians had allegedly broken an Al-Shabaab imposed ban on cell phones and tobacco in the area.

27 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have killed 16 Al-Shabaab fighters in clashes with the militants in Jilib village, Marka. A foreign fighter from Afghanistan was among the dead.
27 September 2018: Two people were wounded during a conflict over land that was fought between two clan militias, Luwaay and Leysaan, in Towfiiq neighbourhood of Baidoa town.
27 September 2018: Three civilians were killed and 6 others wounded when an IED device exploded in a restaurant in Al-Waq town, Gedo. Al-Shabaab was blamed for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 27 September 2018: Prison security officers in Bossaso staged a protest over a lack of salary by blocking movement in and out of the prison. Puntland security forced responded with gunfire, sparking clashes. 1 prisoner and 2 civilians were killed by stray bullets, while 2 police officers and 2 more civilians were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 27 September 2018: Jubaland security forces belonging to Ogaden Sub Clan exchanged gunfire with fellow soldiers near Farjano village in Kismayo. No casualties reported.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 27 September 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab fighters shot and killed an off-duty NISA official near the Abdalla and Awareere Masjid areas of Wardhigley neighborhood in Mogadishu.
27 September 2018: An IED reportedly exploded near the AMISOM base in Hawl-wadaag village (Mogadishu), targeting a Somali National Army vehicle.
27 September 2018: Three police officers were wounded when an IED device they were disarming in the Bakara market detonated. No group has claimed responsibility.
28 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen shot dead a businessman on the outskirts of the Beledweyne town.
28 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen killed a university student in Mogadishu.
28 September 2018: An AS member killed three fellow AS fighters in Ceeel Dhuun Adeegow (c. 47 km north west of Baidoa) after a dispute over taxes collected from the local community.
28 September 2018: At least three AS militants were killed in an airstrike near Jilib village (Shabeellaha Hoose) conducted by anti-Al-Shabaab forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 28 September 2018: Galmudug security forces clashed with each other for unknown reasons in the town of Adaado.
29 September 2018: Police and gunmen identified as drug-gang members engaged in a shootout in Garowe, resulting in the death of a civilian bystander and the wounding of two police officers.
29 September 2018: AS fighters detained more than ten civilian residents of Bu'ale town including a former humanitarian personnel.
29 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters took control of Dhagahow, Yaaqle and Kooreebe settlements under Balcad district after government troops vacated from those settlements.
29 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters took control of Dhagahow, Yaaqle and Kooreebe settlements under Balcad district after government troops vacated from those settlements.
29 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters took control of Dhagahow, Yaaqle and Kooreebe settlements under Balcad district after government troops vacated from those settlements.
29 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters threw a hand grenade at soldiers in the Tadamun village in Afgoye town. Soldiers opened fire in response, but no one was injured.
29 September 2018: A South West State Police officer shot and wounded the driver of a minibus in Buur Xakaba following a dispute involving taxes.
29 September 2018: A group of fishermen gathered to protest a land dispute. Police forces dispersed the protest peacefully.
30 September 2018: Al-Shabab fighters killed a Somali soldier and injured two others in Bar-Sanguuni, just outside of Kismayo.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 September 2018: Joint Somali and Amisom clashed with Al-Shabaab fighters in Ber Hano (Beerxaano) and other villages on the outskirts of Belet Weyne. No info on casualties.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 September 2018: Joint Somali and Amisom clashed with Al-Shabaab fighters in Ber Hano (Beerxaano) and other villages on the outskirts of Belet Weyne. No info on casualties.

30 September 2018: Protesters took to the streets of Diinsor town in protest of Muqtar Robow's possible candidacy for the upcoming South West State presidential election. Muqtar Rabow is a former member of Al-Shabaab.

1 October 2018: Four Ethiopian migrants were killed by unknown armed men in the settlement of Sweeto in Bossaso. Islamic State later claimed responsibility for the shooting, identifying the victims as Christians.

1 October 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have killed 5 Al-Shabaab fighters during clashes in Jamaame district. Local commanders claim to have taken control of Bangini, Mana Mofo, and Kobon, all in the Jamaame district. Fatalities spread across two locations.

1 October 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have killed 5 Al-Shabaab fighters during clashes in Jamaame district. Local commanders claim to have taken control of Bangini, Mana Mofo, and Kobon, all in the Jamaame district. Fatalities spread across two locations.

1 October 2018: Local clan militia known as 'Macawiisley' and AS fighters clashed at Buur-Dacaar Village (c. 10 km north of Adale district in Middle Shabelle. Eight AS fighters and two militia men, including their commander, were killed while another clan militiaman was wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 1 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters launched 4 mortar shells at a Darawish base in Afurur. None of the shells hit the targets.

1 October 2018: The Police Commissioner of Deynile district attacked locals constructing a tarmac road in Garasbaley village in Deynile district. The group providing security at the construction site (identified as also a government police force) exchanged gunfire with officers of the Police Commissioner. One soldier was killed and a civilian was injured.
1 October 2018: Unidentified armed men shot and killed an armed watchman at a garage in Daynile district, Mogadishu.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 1 October 2018: A US airstrike reportedly killed 9 Al-Shabaab fighters 40 KM northeast of Kismayo. A 10th fighter was also wounded in the attack.

1 October 2018: A suicide bomber rammed an explosive-laden car against an Italian anti-Al-Shabaab military convoy near the Ministry of Defence in Deynile district.Two civilian bystanders were killed while five others university students were injured. Fatalities coded as 3 include the bomber.

1 October 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have killed 5 Al-Shabaab fighters during clashes in Jamaame district. Local commanders claim to have taken control of Bangini, Mana Mofo, and Kobon, all in the Jamaame district. Fatalities spread across the three locations.
1 October 2018: An explosion of unidentified origin targeted Somali National Army soldiers in Wanla wayn, killing 2 and wounding 2 others.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Maritime Police Force
column17: 02 October. Weapons and ammunition were seized, and held at the headquarters of the Puntland Maritime Police Force. SEMG documented four of the six boxes of ammunition manufactured in the Republic of Bulgaria in 2013, at the armoury of the Port Police in Bosaso.
2 October 2018: An IED device planted by unknown persons exploded as a government convoy passed in Wanleweyn district, injuring one soldier. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.
2 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted two people carrying khat near Ilbaq settlement under Balcad district.

2 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters took control of a Somali National Army base at Goof-gaduud Burey village (c. 30 km north west of Baidoa on the main road towards Wajid) without resistance from the SNA who retreated from the base the night before.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 2 October 2018: A Jubaland soldier stationed at a checkpoint in Aargo Junction, Kismayo, shot at a car as it traveled toward him at a high speed. A civilian was injured.
2 October 2018: Two groups of Somali National Army soldiers clashed in the Karan Main market for unknown reasons. 1 soldier was killed and 2 civilian bystanders injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 3 October 2018: AMISOM forces conducted a rocket-strike attack against AS militant gathering near Basra village neighbourhood in Balcad district. No info on casualties.
3 October 2018: An explosion targeted Somali National Army soldiers in Wanla Weyne. No info on casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 3 October 2018: A civilian driving a minivan was shot and injured by Special Protection Units in Bosasso for failing to obey their commands to stop the vehicle.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 3 October 2018: Joint Somali National Army forces and Amisom troops took control of a military base in Goof Guduud after Al-Shabaab fighters retreated.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 4 October 2018: Jubaland forces clashed with AS taxation group at Didi-ado grazing area (c. 13 km east of Kulbiyow). There was a brief heavy exchange of gunfire after which AS retreated from the area. Three AS fighters and one JSF soldier were killed while one JSF soldier sustained injuries.
3 October 2018: Al-Shabaab gunmen shot and injured a government soldier in Al-Baraka junction neighbourhood of Hodan, Mogadishu.
4 October 2018: Unidentified gunmen have shot dead a civilian, identified as Sa'id Mohamed, in Bosaso town.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 4 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a convoy of joint AMISOM and Somali National Army forces in Beerayabaal area (c. 20 km west of Halgan village). Gunfire ensued. No info on casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 4 October 2018: Two Ethiopian soldiers were killed and a third seriously injured by an explosion set by Al-Shabaab fighters in Halgan village

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 4 October 2018: Suspected Kenyan warplanes fired airstrike missiles at al-Shabaab targets in El Adde town, Gedo region, wounding 8 people including a known Al-Shabaab member's wife.

5 October 2018: Suspected AS militants ambushed a public minibus carrying khat from Jowhar to Jalalaqsi between Ceel-Baraf village and Jalalaqsi vicinity in Mahaday district. One passenger on board the minibus was killed while four others including the driver of the minibus were kidnapped by AS militants.
5 October 2018: An Al-Shabaab fighter was shot and killed with his own pistol after engaging in a fight with some youth in the Sagalaad village, Afgooye district. Approx location given.
5 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters killed three people between Ceel Baraf and Cali Foldhere and took cattle.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 5 October 2018: Troops supporting the newly nominated NISA Commander for Hirshabelle state clashed with forces supporting the former NISA commander when the former attempted to take control of the NISA base in Beletweyne.
5 October 2018: An IED device planted in the Bullo-Burte at Beerayabaal area (c. 20 km west of Halgan village) exploded, killing one SNA soldier and injuring three others.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 5 October 2018: A convoy of Burundi AMISOM troops were hit by two IEDs near Jawhar, causing minor damages and injuries.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 5 October 2018: An IED bomb set by Al-Shabaab fighters exploded as an AMISOM convoy passed in the Ex-Control Balcad neighbourhood in Heliwa district.

6 October 2018: AS militants ambushed an SNA convoy travelling from Mogadishu to Merka at Gendershe village vicinity in Merka district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. . One SNA senior officer was killed while three others were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 06 October. A soldier from Galmudug shot dead a civilian in Galkaacyo. The motive behind the killing is unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 06 October. AMISOM's UPDF patrol discovered a roadside IED planted between Shalamboot and Beled Aamin. The device was safely dismantled.
6 October 2018: AS fighters abducted a civilian man in Ceel Abay (c. 09 km north west of Qansaxdheere) for allegedly having close relationship with South-west State police forces.
6 October 2018: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police positioned at Black sea area in Hodan district.
07 October. A 14-year-old girl was hospitalized at Lasanod Hospital after being sexually assaulted. The perpetrator has not been caught.

7 October 2018: Unidentified armed men ambushed a civilian vehicle in Jilable village vicinity, Mudug, injuring 4 people. Other sources have claimed that the event ended in the death of 5 civilian passengers.

7 October 2018: A group of Al-Shabaab (AS) fighters attacked a checkpoint manned by Somali soldiers in Mukayga area of Afgoye town, Lower Shabelle region. The AS fighters retreated after a short exchange of gunfire.
7 October 2018: An IED planted near a checkpoint in Ambareeso area in Barawe town exploded, injuring one soldier.

7 October 2018: Unidentified armed assailants shot and killed two bus conductors at Bakara market intersection in Hodan district. Later reports suspected the perpetrators of having links to Islamic State.
7 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have killed 5 Somali National Army soldiers in an ambush carried out as the soldier's convoy travelled through the Jazeera area of Mogadishu.
8 October 2018: Unidentified armed men shot at a civilian vehicle in northern Galkayo town, injuring him severely. The victim later died in a hospital. Motivations are unknown.
8 October 2018: Two transport cooperatives shot at each other at Lowyacado in Adwal region over a business dispute. Police later intervened to break up the fight.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 8 October 2018: US-backed Special Forces shot and killed a former well-known Al-Shabaab member at Wanleweyn district.
8 October 2018: Somaliland forces and Dhulbahante clan militias, loyal to Puntland, exchanged gunfire near the Tukaraq base for around an hour. No info on casualties.
8 October 2018: Local security forces in Ceel Bard killed two Somali National Army soldiers who refused to surrender their weapons to them. Two other SNA soldiers were arrested.
9 October 2018: Residents of Wanla Weyne town protested the killing of a former Al-Shabaab member by military special forces. Protests were also held in Buur Weyne (coded separately).

9 October 2018: Police forces shot at demonstrators in the Burweyne village in Wanlaweyn district. Protesters were denouncing the killing of a well-known shiekh in the town by Somali security forces the day before. Two of the protesters were injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 9 October 2018: Burundian troops fighting as part of the AMISOM mission in Somalia were targeted by an IED device in Gololey village, damaging a single vehicle. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the bombing.

9 October 2018: Clan militiamen gathered to stand and protest a man who lost his job with a private security company providing services to the UN in North Gaalkaco. Local authorities later came to resolve the issue.
9 October 2018: Abgaal clan militiamen killed an unarmed civilian from Hawadle clan and injured two others, in Bulacle area. Clan rivalry has been going on for some time over a grazing dispute.

9 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Jubbaland security forces on the road between Bar Sanguni and Arrare, sparking armed clashes that resulted in the death of three AS fighters and two Jubbaland soldiers.
9 October 2018: Al-Shabaab executed four former fighters and one civilian in Jilib, all accused of providing intelligence to foreign intelligence agencies.

9 October 2018: Attackers believed to have links to Al-Shabaab threw a hand-grenade at Somali National Army soldiers in Shalambot town in Marka district. Troops reacted with gunfire. Three civilians were wounded by either the gunfire or the grenade (unclear).
09 October. Armed men belonging to the Sa'ad clan shot dead a civilian from the same clan over personal disputes in Gaalkacyo.
9 October 2018: Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike in Ceel Caade targeting an Al-Shabaab vehicle garage.
9 October 2018: Unidentified persons fired an RPG rocket into the house of a Somaliland army commander in Ceerigabo No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 9 October 2018: Somaliland soldiers clashed with Puntland state soldiers in Tako Raq base. 1 Somaliland soldier was killed.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 9 October 2018: Somali National Army (SNA) troops backed by Jubbaland security forces attacked Al-Shabaab positions in Jamaame, taking control of Kawan village. No info on casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 9 October 2018: US conducted an airstrike in Qunyo Barrow, killing one Al-Shabaab militant.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 10 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters conducted a late-night attack against Somali soldiers and allied AMISOM troops (Identified by the source as Ugandan) in Qoryooley District in Lower Shabelle. No further info.
10 October 2018: Somali National Army forces claim to have taken control of Gawaan village (BAY) after clashing with Al-Shabaab fighters in the area. No info on casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 10 October 2018: An explosive device set near the road exploded as a convoy of Djiboutian AMISOM soldiers traveled near Buur Weyn. At least one vehicle was damaged in the attack, with some injuries suspected. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 10 October 2018: An explosion (landmine) targeted Ethiopian troops as they moved from Jimbiley to Buurweyn village, destroying a troop transport vehicle. No info on casualties.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 October 2018: Somali National Army troops and allied AMISOM forces have taken control of Buurweyn, Dibileey, and Faahaale villages in Jalaqsi district after Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 October 2018: Somali National Army troops and allied AMISOM forces have taken control of Buurweyn, Dibileey, and Faahaale villages in Jalaqsi district after Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 October 2018: Somali National Army troops and allied AMISOM forces have taken control of Buurweyn, Dibileey, and Faahaale villages in Jalaqsi district after Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 10 October 2018: Two police officers were shot and killed by unidentified gunmen at at a police check-point in Armo (c. 100 km south of Bossaso).
10 October 2018: Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade near the front of the residence of the Regional Women's representatives in Baidoa town of Bay region, injuring two people.
10 October 2018: A car belonging to an official from Banadir Regional Administration exploded at Ex-Control Afgoye in Deynile district. One civilian bystander was injured in the explosion.

11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a Jubaland police post in Diff village (c. 65 km north of Dooley town), sparking armed clashes. The Al-Shabaab fighters managed to take control of the post after only a few minutes of fighting, withdrawing a few hours later. No info on casualties.

11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Somali national soldiers in the Mahaday district (c. 26 km from Jowhar town). Al-shabaab fighters took control of the town, only to withdraw several hours later. Two government soldiers were injured.
11 October 2018: A tax collections officer was shot and killed at Bossaso Main Market.
11 October 2018: Garwaale and Eelaay clans clashed in Maaranka (c. 07 km north west of Baidoa) over a land dispute. Five (05) people were killed. Approximate coordinates used.
11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab executed 5 people, including one 16 year old boy, in Sakow town, middle Juba. The victims were accused of providing information to the Somali army.
11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Somali National Army soldiers in Shalambod town, sparking an exchange of gunfire. No info on casualties.
11 October. Gunmen killed a pastoralist in Daaru-Salaam. Motive unknown.
11 October 2018: An unidentified warplane conducted an airstrike raids on Al-Shabaab/local meeting positions in Kibis village. No info on casualties.

11 October 2018: Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike raid against Al-Shabaab targets in Kukuma village (c. 30 km south of Ceel Waaq district, approx. Coordinates used). One civilian was injured in the strike. Approximate coordinates used.
11 October 2018: A remote controlled explosive device went off as a Somali National Army convoy passed through Garas-Baley area of Daynile, Mogadishu. One vehicle was damaged, no casualties reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM troop base near the KM60 village neighborhood, Afgooye. Troops clashed with the fighters for about 30 minutes after which the perpetrators withdrew.
12 October. Muktar Robow's militia ambushed Al Shabaab insurgents near Bana village. After the clash Robow's militia retreated to Xudur. Casualties unknown.
12 October 2018: A Somali National Army soldier shot and killed a civilian man near Digfeer Hospital in Hodan district

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 October 2018: The US Africa command announced an airstrike targeting Al-Shabaab militants in Hardere town that killed at least 60 militants.
13 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted 4 elders from Aad and El Abdi villages, Mudug region, for not paying Zakat taxes.
13 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted 4 elders from Aad and El Abdi villages, Mudug region, for not paying Zakat taxes.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 October 2018: US-backed special force troops and AMISOM forces attacked Al-Shabaab positions in Basra, near Bal'ad town.

13 October 2018: A suicide bomber detonated himself in a busy cafe in the town of Baidoa, resulting in the death of 23 people (24 with the bomber) and the injury of 70 or more. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On October 14, An AMISOM Uganda night patrol was ambushed by Al Shabaab in Marka town of Shabelle region. One soldier died and a civilian also lost life in the cross fire exchange. 11 militants were also reported to be killed. This event is believed to be distinct from earlier clashes in the town.

On October 14, an IED, targeting an SNA convoy, exploded near Basra Village, Middle Shabelle region. Two soldiers were killed while four others were injured. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.
On October 14, people from Baidoa staged a demonstration in support of the victims of the Al Shabaab suicide attack in the town the previous day.

On October 14, an RCIED, planted in a residence structure, exploded in Belethawa (Belet Xaawo) town. The target was believed to be Celi Dhere sub clan elders meeting inside the residence. There were no reports of causalities.
On October 14, a group of youth stoned the security forces manning the Zoobe junction, in Hodan district. The security forces fired warning shots to disperse the crowd and injured one civilian.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On October 14, Al Shabaab ambushed and killed six AMISOM Burundian soldiers outside of Marka town, Shabeellaha Hoose. The Burundian soldiers were sent as reinforcements to Somalian Forces during clashes with Al Shabaab in Marka town (coded in a separate event).
On October 14, fighting between Kenyan Military and Al-Shabab fighters was reported in El Wak (Ceel Waaq) district of Gedo Region.
A spike in violence and insecurity in Somalia in October has forced more than 21,000 people to flee their homes in the country, particularly from Lower Shabelle region.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 15 October. Local traders attacked 5 SLP officers at a teashop. The motive may relate to recent demolition of illegal structures in the town.

15 October. SLP in Hargeisa conducted a security operation targeting youngsters suspected of creating unrest in Mohammad Haybe district. An unspecified number of youth gangs were arrested by the police.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On October 15, an IED targeting an Ethiopian military convoy moving from Baidoa to Buur-Hakaba exploded at Mooda-Mooda village near Baidoa, Bay. There were no reports of casualties or damages.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
